original: oṃ śrīmahārājñī bhagavatyai namaḥ //
analyzed: om śrī mahā rājñī bhagavatyai namaḥ
translated: Om. Salutations to the glorious great queen, the blessed one!

original: oṃ śrīgaṇādhipataye namaḥ /
analyzed: om śrī gaṇādhipataye namaḥ
translated: Om. Salutations to the lord of the Ganas!

original: oṃ yadbījaṃ vedavṛkṣasya sampūrṇānantaśākhinaḥ / phalaṃ tasyaiva yatprāhustaṃ vande bhairavāgamam //
analyzed: om yat bījam veda vṛkṣasya sampūrṇa ananta śākhinaḥ phalam tasya eva yat prāhuḥ tam vande bhairava āgamam
translated: Om. I praise the Bhairava scriptures, which they say is the seed of the tree of the Vedas, with its infinite branches, and the fruit of that very tree.

original: atha vistare satyagnikāryapaddhatirlikhyate /
analyzed: atha vistare sati agni kārya paddhatiḥ likhyate
translated: Now, the method of the fire ritual is written in detail.

original: tatrādau pustakavāgīśvarīṃ pustake pūjayet //
analyzed: tatra ādau pustaka vāgīśvarīm pustake pūjayet
translated: There, first, one should worship the goddess of speech in the book in the book.

original: padmādhirūḍhāṃ susitāṃ trinetrāṃ śūlākṣamāle kamalaṃ ca khaḍgām //
analyzed: padma adhirūḍhām su sitām tri netrām śūla akṣa māle kamalam ca khaḍgām
translated: Riding on a lotus, fair-complexioned, having three eyes, holding a trident, rosary, lotus, and sword,

original: karaiścaturbhiḥ patito vahantīṃ sarasvatīṃ siddhikarīṃ namāmi //🔽śrīpustakavāgīśvaryai samālabhannaṃ gandho namaḥ //
analyzed: karaiḥ caturbhiḥ patitaḥ vahantīm sarasvatīm siddhi karīm namāmi  śrī pustaka vāgīśvaryai gandhaḥ namaḥ
translated: Bearing with her four hands, I bow to Saraswati, the bestower of accomplishments.🔽I offer incense to the goddess of speech who resides in the sacred book.

original: argho namaḥ // puṣpaṃ namaḥ // ai klīṃ sauḥ vada vāgvādini sarasvatyai namaḥ //
analyzed: arghaḥ namaḥ puṣpam namaḥ ai klīṃ sauḥ vada vāgvādini sarasvatyai namaḥ
translated: I offer arghya, flowers, and the mantra Om, Hrim, Shrim, Vada, Vada, Vadinye, Sarasvati, Namah.

original: oṃ hsauḥ aṃ āṃ ityādi laṃ haṃ kṣaḥ ityantaṃ hsauḥ sarasvatyai namaḥ //
analyzed: om hsauḥ aṃ āṃ ityādi laṃ haṃ   ityantam hsauḥ sarasvatyai namaḥ
translated: I offer the mantra Om, Hrim, Shrim, A, A, etc., up to Lam, Ham, Ksham, Hrim, Shrim, Sarasvati, Namah.

original: tatra prathamaṃ vighnopaśamanārthaṃ gaṇapati pūjā //
analyzed: tatra prathamam vighna upaśamana artham gaṇapati pūjā
translated: First, for the removal of obstacles, there is the worship of Ganesha.

original: maṇḍalādbahiḥ svadakṣe'ṣṭa /lapadmaṃ vilikhya karṇikāyāṃ phalādikaṃ saṃsthāpya // tatra pūjā //
analyzed: maṇḍalāt bahis vilikhya karṇikāyām phala ādikam saṃsthāpya tatra pūjā
translated: Outside the mandala, to the right, having drawn an eight-petaled lotus, having placed the fruit etc. on the pericarp, there is the worship there.

original: akṣasūtrāṅkuśau datte laḍupātraṃ gaṇeśvaraḥ // bhujaiścaturbhiḥ pāśaṃ ca dvidaṃṣṭraḥ siṃhavāhanaḥ
analyzed: akṣasūtra aṅkuśau datte laḍu pātram gaṇeśvaraḥ bhujaiḥ caturbhiḥ pāśam ca dvi daṃṣṭraḥ siṃhavāhanaḥ
translated: Ganesha, with four arms, gives a rosary and goad, a vessel of ladus, a noose, having two tusks, riding a lion.

original: ehyehi / gaṇapatinātha pūjāmimāṃ pratīccha // ityāvāhanam /
analyzed: ehi ehi gaṇapati nātha pūjām imām pratīccha iti āvāhanam
translated: Come, come, O Lord of the Chief of Ganas, accept this worship. This is the invocation.

original: oṃ gūṃ gaṇapataye namaḥ // oṃ vighnahartre namaḥ harasvatama / lava e hma rakṣamalavayaūṃ vittaṃ me dehi
analyzed: om gūṃ gaṇapataye namaḥ om vighna hartre namaḥ harasvatama lavaḥ hma vittam me dehi
translated: Om, Ghum, salutations to Ganapati. Om, salutations to the remover of obstacles. Remove the darkness, protect me, give me wealth.

original: svāhā // /
analyzed: svāhā
translated: Svaha.

original: atha kalaśārcanaṃ yathā //
analyzed: atha kalaśa arcanam yathā
translated: Now, the worship of the water pot is as follows.

original: tatra snātaḥ kṛtanityakṛtyo / dvādaśāṅguloṣṇīṣādyā bharaṇādyalaṅkṛtadehaḥ sāṅgulīyakakaraḥ
analyzed: tatra snātaḥ kṛta nityakṛtyaḥ dvādaśa aṅgula uṣṇīṣa ādyāḥ bharaṇa ādi alaṅkṛta dehaḥ sa aṅgulīyaka karaḥ
translated: There, having bathed and performed the daily duties, with a turban twelve fingers long, and with the body adorned with ornaments etc., with rings on the fingers,

original: saṃyata kuntalaḥ svastyakādyāsana pūrvaṃ pūrvaśiraskordhvalomādyajinādyāsanopaviṣṭaḥ
analyzed: saṃyata kuntalaḥ svastyaka ādi āsana pūrvam pūrva śiraska ūrdhva loma ādi ajina ādi āsana upaviṣṭaḥ
translated: with restrained hair, seated on an auspicious seat etc., with the head towards the east, with the hair upwards etc., with a loincloth etc.,

original: sugandhigandhaliptāṅgaḥ suprasanaḥ subhāvitaḥ sudhūpitaḥ sutāmbūlaścandanāguru carcitaḥ
analyzed: sugandhi gandha lipta aṅgaḥ su prasanaḥ su bhāvitaḥ su dhūpitaḥ su tāmbūlaḥ candana aguru carcitaḥ
translated: with the body anointed with fragrant scents, well pleased, well meditated, well fumigated, with good betel, anointed with sandalwood and aloe,

original: hārakaṭakakeyūrāṅkita vigrahaḥ // tatra //
analyzed: hāra kaṭaka keyūra aṅkita vigrahaḥ tatra
translated: with the body marked with necklaces, bracelets, and armlets. There,

original: sadyojātaṃ prapadyāmi sadyojātāya vai namaḥ / bhave bhave nābhi bhave bhajasvamāṃbhavodbhava //
analyzed: sadyojātam prapadyāmi sadyojātāya vai namaḥ bhave bhave nābhi bhave bhajasva mām bhava udbhava
translated: I take refuge in the one born in the beginning. Salutations to the one born in the beginning. O Bhava, Bhava, be manifest, worship me, O Bhava, O Bhava.

original: iti mantreṇa sugandhigandha liptāṅgaḥ mṛtyuñjayena sudhūpitaḥ svatāmbulaśca //
analyzed: iti mantreṇa sugandhi gandha lipta aṅgaḥ mṛtyuñjayena su dhūpitaḥ
translated: With this mantra, with the body anointed with fragrant scents, well fumigated with Mrityunjaya, and with good betel.

original: amṛteśvarabhairavamāṃ rakṣa //
analyzed: amṛta īśvara bhairava mām rakṣa
translated: Protect me, O Lord of Immortality and Bhairava.

original: iti mantreṇa hārakaṭakakeyūrāṅkitaḥ //
analyzed: iti mantreṇa hāra kaṭaka keyūra aṅkitaḥ
translated: With this mantra, marked with necklaces, bracelets, and armlets.

original: jānubhyāṃ dharaṇiṃ gatvā praṇamya pūjita śambhoriti vistāraḥ kriyate //
analyzed: jānubhyām dharaṇim gatvā praṇamya śambhoḥ iti vistāraḥ kriyate
translated: Having gone down on his knees, he bowed down and worshipped Shambhu. Thus the elaboration is done.

original: ṣaṭtriṃśadaṅgulāṃ kalaśavediṃ kṛtvā //
analyzed: ṣaṭtriṃśat aṅgulām kalaśa vedim kṛtvā
translated: Having made a Kalasha altar 36 fingers long,

original: tatra svavāme dvādaśāṅgule kalaśadvayasthāpanam // svadakṣe lokapālāstrābhyāvaraṇamaṇḍalaṃ kṛtvā //
analyzed: tatra sva vāme dvādaśa aṅgule kalaśa dvaya sthāpanam sva dakṣe lokapāla astra abhyāvaraṇa maṇḍalam kṛtvā
translated: there, on the left, the establishment of two Kalashas in 12 fingers, on the right, having made a protective circle with the Lokapalas and weapons,

original: tatra nairṛtye astrārghapātraṃ kṛtvā tena sarvadravya prokṣaṇam /
analyzed: tatra nairṛtye astra arghapātram kṛtvā tena sarva dravya prokṣaṇam
translated: there, in the southwest, having made the weapon Arghya vessel, with that, the sprinkling of all substances.

original: oṃ phaṭ sarvadravyopacāra śuddhirastu phaṭ svāhā // punaḥ svaiḥ svairmantraiḥ puṣpādi saṃskuryāt //
analyzed: om phaṭ sarva dravya upacāra śuddhiḥ astu phaṭ svāhā punar svaiḥ svaiḥ mantraiḥ puṣpa ādi saṃskuryāt
translated: Om phat, may the purification of all substances and services be accomplished, phat, svaha. Again, one should consecrate the flowers etc. with their own mantras.

original: āṃ dhūmra jīva saḥ sarvāsāṃ puṣpajātīnāṃ jīva āgaccha tu svāhā //
analyzed: ām dhūmra jīva saḥ sarvāsām puṣpa jātīnām jīvaḥ āgaccha tu svāhā
translated: Om, to the smoke, to the living, to the living of all flower species, may the living come, svaha.

original: iti puṣpamantraḥ //
analyzed: iti puṣpa mantraḥ
translated: Thus is the flower mantra.

original: oṃ kālāgnirudrāya jagaddhūpasugandhine sarvagandhavahāya namaḥ dhūpe //
analyzed: om kālāgni rudrāya jagat dhūpa sugandhine sarva gandha vahāya namaḥ dhūpe
translated: Om, salutations to Kalagni Rudra, to the fragrant incense of the world, to the bearer of all fragrances, in the incense.

original: jagajjyotīrūpāya dīpāya namaḥ dīpe //
analyzed: jagat jyotiḥ rūpāya dīpāya namaḥ dīpe
translated: To the light of the world, to the lamp, salutations, in the lamp.

original: gandhamādinigandha jīvāpaya tu svāhā candane //🔽p /
analyzed: gandhamādini gandha jīvāpaya tu svāhā candane  p
translated: To the fragrance of Gandhamadani, revive, svaha, in the sandalwood.

original: hrīṃ svāhā kuṅkume //
analyzed: hrīṃ svāhā kuṅkume
translated: Hrim, svaha, in the saffron.

original: oṃ lāṃ pṛthivyai dharitriśaktaye namaḥ arghe //
analyzed: om lāṃ pṛthivyai dhari tri śaktaye namaḥ arghe
translated: Om lam, salutations to the earth, to the power of the sustainer, in the Arghya.

original: oṃ vlīṃ varuṇa rājānakāya namaḥ // udake //
analyzed: om vlīṃ varuṇa rājānakāya namaḥ udake
translated: Om Vlim to King Varuna's body, salutations. In water.

original: iti dravyasaṃskāraḥ //
analyzed: iti dravya saṃskāraḥ
translated: Thus the purification of substances.🔽One should worship the messenger, who is gentle, has four arms, is well-known, proclaims mantras,

original: dūtīṃ saumyāṃ caturbāhuṃ sughoṣāṃ mantraghoṣiṇīm // akṣamālā pustakasragvarābhaya karāṃ yajet //
analyzed: dūtīm saumyām catur bāhum su ghoṣām mantra ghoṣiṇīm akṣamālā pustaka sraj vara abhaya karām yajet
translated: holds a rosary, book, garland, boon, and offers protection with her hands.

original: oṃ hūṃ śuddhavidyāyai mantramātre dūtyai namaḥ //
analyzed: om   śuddhavidyāyai mantra mātre dūtyai namaḥ
translated: Om Hum to the pure knowledge, to the mantra alone, to the messenger, salutations.

original: iti śāmbhava vyāptyā dūtīṃ pūjayet /
analyzed: iti śāmbhava vyāptyā dūtīm pūjayet
translated: Thus one should worship the messenger with the pervasion of Shambhava.

original: oṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ śivādūtyai namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrīṃ śrīṃ śivā dūtyai namaḥ
translated: Om Hrim Shrim to the messenger of Shiva, salutations.

original: iti śāktavyāptyādūtīṃ vādayet //
analyzed: iti śākta vyāptyā dūtīm vādayet
translated: Thus one should invoke the messenger with the pervasion of Shakti.

original: amṛteśāya vidmahe vyomadehāya dhīmahi tanno netraḥ pracodayāt // //
analyzed: amṛta īśāya vidmahe vyoma dehāya dhīmahi tat naḥ netraḥ pracodayāt
translated: We meditate on the Lord of Nectar, whose body is the sky. May that Neta inspire us.

original: tanmaheśāya vidmahe vāgviśuddhāyadhīmahi tannoḥ śivaḥ pracodayāt // //
analyzed: tat maheśāya vidmahe vāc viśuddhāya dhīmahi tat noḥ śivaḥ pracodayāt  /
translated: We meditate on the pure of speech, the great Lord. May that Shiva inspire us.

original: bahurūpāya vidmahe koṭarākṣāya dhīmahi tannoghoraḥ pracodayāt // //
analyzed: bahurūpāya vidmahe koṭarākṣāya dhīmahi tat naḥ ghoraḥ pracodayāt  /
translated: We meditate on the multi-formed, the one with the hollow eyes. May that Ghora inspire us.

original: grahamaṇḍalāgre //
analyzed: graha maṇḍala agre
translated: In front of the circle of planets.

original: prabhāmaṇḍalāya namaḥ // vṛṣabhāya namaḥ //
analyzed: prabhā maṇḍalāya namaḥ vṛṣabhāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the halo, salutations to the bull.

original: bhyaṅgeśāya namaḥ // diṅmātṛbhyo namaḥ // gaṃ gaṇeśāya namaḥ // kuṃkumārāya namaḥ // śrīṃ śriyai
analyzed: bhyaṅga īśāya namaḥ diṅmātṛbhyaḥ namaḥ gaṃ gaṇeśāya namaḥ kuṃ kumārāya namaḥ śrīṃ śriyai
translated: Salutations to the lord of the attendants, salutations to the directional mothers. Salutations to Ganapati. Salutations to Kumara. Salutations to Shri.

original: namaḥ // saṃ sarasvatyai namaḥ // oṃ viśvakarmaṇe namaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ sam sarasvatyai namaḥ om viśvakarmaṇe namaḥ
translated: Salutations. Salutations to Sarasvati. Om, salutations to Vishvakarma.

original: tataḥ prāṇāyāmaḥ // āvāhanaṃ grahamaṇḍalopari //
analyzed: tatas prāṇāyāmaḥ āvāhanam graha maṇḍala upari
translated: Then, pranayama. Invocation above the circle of planets.

original: puṣpāñjalipramāṇena saṃmukhaṃ bhāvayedvibhum //🔽vibho saparivārasya svāgatamityudīrayet //
analyzed: puṣpa añjali pramāṇena saṃmukham bhāvayet vibhum  vibho sa parivārasya svāgatam iti udīrayet
translated: One should visualize the all-pervading Lord facing oneself, with the measure of a handful of flowers.🔽One should utter Welcome to the Lord with his retinue.

original: svāgataṃ svasvāgataṃ śivasya sa parivārasya bhoḥ //
analyzed: svāgatam sva svāgatam śivasya sa parivārasya bhoḥ
translated: Welcome, welcome to Shiva with his retinue, O Lord.

original: tato grahamaṇḍalopari //🔽amṛteśvaramamṛtalakṣmīṃ niṣkalaṃ ca pūjayet // madhye kṣoṭe sūryaṃ tadbahi bhairavān svasvamantreṇa
analyzed: tatas graha maṇḍala upari  amṛteśvaram amṛta lakṣmīm niṣkalam ca pūjayet madhye kṣoṭe sūryam tad bahis bhairavān sva sva mantreṇa
translated: Then, above the circle of planets.

original: pūjayet //🔽p /
analyzed: pūjayet  p b
translated: One should worship Amritesha, Amritalakshmi, and the Formless in the middle, the Sun in the Kshora, and outside that, the Bhairavas with their respective mantras.

original: oṃ kṣamarayaūṃ kapāleśabhairavāya namaḥ // oṃ hrūṃ śikhivāhanabhairavāya namaḥ // oṃ kṣuṃ
analyzed: om kapāla īśa bhairavāya namaḥ om   śikhivāhana bhairavāya namaḥ om
translated: Om Kshamaraya Um. Salutations to Kapalesha Bhairava. Om Hrum. Salutations to Shikhivahana Bhairava. Om Kshum.

original: krodharājabhairavāya namaḥ // oṃ jhrūṃ vikarālabhairavāya namaḥ // oṃ hvūṃ manmathabhairavāya namaḥ // oṃ
analyzed: krodharāja bhairavāya namaḥ om jhrūṃ vikarāla bhairavāya namaḥ om hvūṃ manmathabhairavāya namaḥ om
translated: Salutations to Krodharaja Bhairava. Om Jhrum. Salutations to Vikarala Bhairava. Om Hvum. Salutations to Manmatha Bhairava. Om Hrum.

original: hryūṃ meghanādabhairavāya namaḥ // oṃ hūṃ somarājabhairavāya namaḥ // oṃ ṭhūṃ vidyārājabhairavāya namaḥ
analyzed: hryūṃ meghanāda bhairavāya namaḥ om hūm somarāja bhairavāya namaḥ om ṭhūm vidyārāja bhairavāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Megha Nada Bhairava. Om Hum. Salutations to Soma Raja Bhairava. Om Thum. Salutations to Vidyaraaja Bhairava.

original: tadbahirgrahāḥ //
analyzed: tad bahis grahāḥ
translated: Outside that, the planets.

original: ādau madhye sūryaḥ //
analyzed: ādau madhye sūryaḥ
translated: In the beginning and middle, Surya.

original: oṃ rūṃ agnaye namaḥ // oṃ hāṃ jhrīṃ saḥ vīreśvarabhairavāya namaḥ // oṃ hrāṃ jhrīṃ saḥ vīralakṣmyai
analyzed: om rūṃ agnaye namaḥ om hāṃ jhrīṃ saḥ vīreśvara bhairavāya namaḥ om hrāṃ jhrīṃ saḥ vīralakṣmyai
translated: Om, Rung, salutations to Agni. Om, Hang, Jhrum, Salutations to Viresvara Bhairava. Om, Hram, Jhrum, Salutations to Vaira Lakshmi.

original: namaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ
translated: Salutations.

original: tataḥ pūrvādi krameṇa //
analyzed: tatas pūrva ādi krameṇa
translated: Then in the east and other directions in order.

original: oṃ vlūṃ varuṇāya namaḥ // oṃ srūṃ candramase namaḥ // pūrve //
analyzed: om vlūṃ varuṇāya namaḥ om srūṃ candramase namaḥ pūrve
translated: Om, Vlum, salutations to Varuna. Om, Srum, salutations to Chandrama. In the east.

original: oṃ kuṃkumārāya namaḥ // oṃ raharaūṃ aṅgārakāya namaḥ // āgneye //
analyzed: om kuṃkumārāya namaḥ om raharaūm aṅgārakāya namaḥ āgneye
translated: Om, salutations to Kumara. Om, Raharuum, salutations to Angaraka. In the southeast.

original: oṃ hūṃ viṣṇave namaḥ // oṃ srūṃ budhāya namaḥ // dakṣe //
analyzed: om hūm viṣṇave namaḥ om srūm budhāya namaḥ dakṣe
translated: Om, Hrum, salutations to Vishnu. Om, Srum, salutations to Budha. In the south.

original: oṃ lūṃ indrāya namaḥ // oṃ rsūṃ jīvāya namaḥ // paścime //
analyzed: om lūṃ indrāya namaḥ om rsūṃ jīvāya namaḥ paścime
translated: Om, Lum, salutations to Indra. Om, Srum, salutations to Jiva. In the west.

original: aiṃ klīṃ sauḥ vada vāgvādini sarasvatyai namaḥ //
analyzed: aim klīṃ sauḥ vada vāgvādini sarasvatyai namaḥ
translated: Aim, Klim, Saum, speak, O you who speak words, salutations to Sarasvati.

original: amṛtīkaromi namaḥ // iti dvādaśāntapatitena śāktāmṛtajalena sa bāhyābhyantaraṃ tanumāplāvayāmi namaḥ //
analyzed: amṛtīkaromi namaḥ iti dvādaśānta patitena śākta amṛta jalena sa bāhya abhyantaram tanum āplāvayāmi namaḥ
translated: With the water of the nectar of Shakti that has fallen at the end of the twelve, I sprinkle my body externally and internally, salutations.

original: adhaḥ cchādanāya namaḥ // ūrdhvacchādanāya namaḥ // madhyacchādanāya namaḥ // oṃ satvāya namaḥ // rajase
analyzed: adhas chādanāya namaḥ ūrdhva chādanāya namaḥ madhya chādanāya namaḥ om sattvāya namaḥ rajase
translated: Salutations to Rajas!

original: namaḥ // tamase namaḥ // tatra karṇikāyāṃ devaṃ svadheti dhyānena parameśvaraṃ dhyātvā nyāsaṃ kuryāt //
analyzed: namaḥ tamase namaḥ tatra karṇikāyām devam svadhā iti dhyānena parameśvaram dhyātvā nyāsam kuryāt
translated: Salutations to Tamas! There, having meditated on the Supreme Lord with the meditation of the god in the pericarp with the word Svaha, one should perform the Nyasa.

original: oṃ śivatatvāya namaḥ karandhre // sadāśivatatvāya namaḥ / lalāṭe //
analyzed: om śiva tatvāya namaḥ karandhre sadāśiva tatvāya namaḥ lalāṭe
translated: Om, salutations to the Shiva principle in the Karandhra (cerebral aperture)! Salutations to the Sadashiva principle on the forehead!

original: īśvaratatvāya namaḥ bhrūmadhye // oṃ vidyātatvāya namaḥ tāluni //🔽māyātatvāya namaḥ kaṇṭhe //
analyzed: namaḥ bhrū madhye om vidyā tatvāya namaḥ tāluni  mā ayāta tvāya namaḥ kaṇṭhe
translated: Salutations to the Ishvara principle between the eyebrows! Om, salutations to the Vidya principle on the palate!🔽Salutations to the Maya principle in the throat!

original: kālatatvāya namaḥ hṛdi //
analyzed: namaḥ hṛdi
translated: Salutations to the Kala principle in the heart!

original: oṃ niyati tatvāya namaḥ nābhau //🔽puruṣatatvāya namaḥ meḍhre //
analyzed: om niyati tatvāya namaḥ nābhau  namaḥ meḍhre
translated: Om, salutations to the Niyati principle in the navel!🔽Salutations to the Purusha principle in the genitals!

original: prakṛtitatvāya namaḥ pādayoḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ pādayoḥ
translated: Salutations to the Prakriti principle in the feet!

original: atha tritatvanyāsaḥ //
analyzed: atha tri tatva nyāsaḥ
translated: Now, the Nyasa of the three principles:

original: saḥ śivatatvāya namaḥ karandhre //
analyzed: saḥ namaḥ karandhre
translated: Sa to the Shiva principle in the Karandhra (cerebral aperture)!

original: ṇuṃ vidyātatvāya namaḥ bhrūmadhye //
analyzed: ṇuṃ vidyā tatvāya namaḥ bhrū madhye
translated: Nu to the Vidya principle between the eyebrows!

original: oṃ ātmatatvāya namaḥ hṛdi //
analyzed: om namaḥ hṛdi
translated: Om to the Atma principle in the heart!

original: amṛtamūrtaye namaḥ sakala dehe //
analyzed: amṛta mūrtaye namaḥ sakala dehe
translated: Salutations to the form of nectar in the entire body!

original: tataḥ karanyāsamaṅganyāsamaṅgaṣaṭkena kuryāt //
analyzed: tatas kara nyāsam aṅga nyāsam aṅga ṣaṭkena kuryāt
translated: Then, one should perform the Nyasa of the hands and the Nyasa of the limbs with the six limbs.

original: punarmūlaṃ sakala dehe nyaset // oṃ mūrtyai namaḥ / śuddhadehāya namaḥ // mānasaiḥ pañcopacārairdevaṃ🔽pūjayet //🔽homaṃ ca // tato bāhyayāgaṃ kuryāt // yāgabhūmau svadakṣe'stra mantreṇāstraṃ sampūjya //
analyzed: punar mūlam sakala dehe nyaset om mūrtyai namaḥ śuddha dehāya namaḥ mānasaiḥ pañca upacāraiḥ devam  pūjayet  homam ca tatas bāhyayāgam kuryāt yāga bhūmau sva dakṣa istra mantreṇa astram sampūjya
translated: One should worship the god with the five outer offerings.

original: p / 🔽jvaladgrasantaṃ vighnaughaṃ mahāpāpakṣayāvaham // trinetraṃ dvibhujaṃ dhyāyedastraṃ devasya sammukham //
analyzed: p  jvalat grasantam vighna ogham mahā pāpa kṣaya āvaham trinetram dvi bhujam dhyāyet astram devasya sammukham
translated: And also the oblation. Then one should perform the external worship. On the sacrificial ground, to the right of oneself, having worshipped the weapon with the weapon mantra,🔽one should visualize the weapon of the god in front, blazing, devouring the multitude of obstacles, causing the destruction of great sins, three-eyed, two-armed.

original: tato darbhakāṇḍadvaya viṣṭareṇa dravyasaṃskāraḥ // tataḥ pātratrayamastreṇa samprokṣya varmaṇā veṣṭya
analyzed: tatas darbha kāṇḍa dvaya viṣṭareṇa dravya saṃskāraḥ tatas pātra trayam astreṇa samprokṣya varmaṇā veṣṭya
translated: Then, on a seat of two blades of darbha grass, the purification of the substances. Then, having sprinkled the three vessels with the weapon mantra, having covered them with the armor mantra,

original: kavacenāvaguṇṭhya praṇavena saṃpūjya /
analyzed: kavacena avaguṇṭhya praṇavena saṃpūjya
translated: having enveloped them with the protective mantra, having worshipped them with the praṇava mantra,

original: haṃ pātratrayamavaguṇṭhayāmi huṃ namaḥ ityavaguṇṭhya /
analyzed: haṃ pātra trayam avaguṇṭhayāmi hum namaḥ iti avaguṇṭhya
translated: having enveloped them with Ham, I envelop the three vessels, hum, salutations,🔽having worshipped with Salutations to the vessels of ritual, restraint, animal sacrifice, and oblation,

original: vidhi nirodhapaśvargha pātrebhyo namaḥ / iti sampūjya / aṣṭāṅgenārghyeṇa darbhakāṇḍadvaya viṣṭarasahitena🔽sampūjya //
analyzed: vidhi nirodha paśu argha pātrebhyaḥ namaḥ iti sampūjya aṣṭāṅgena arghyeṇa darbha kāṇḍa dvaya viṣṭara sahitena  sampūjya
translated: having worshipped with the eight-limbed arghya along with the seat of two blades of darbha grass,🔽the eight limbs of the arghya are: water, milk, tips of kuśa grass, ghee, curd, rice grains, barley, and white mustard seeds.

original: āpaḥ kṣīraṃ kuśāgrāṇi ghṛtaṃ ca dadhitaṇḍulāḥ // yavāḥ siddhārthakāśceti arghyoṣṭāṅgaḥ
analyzed: āpaḥ kṣīram kuśa agrāṇi ghṛtam ca dadhi taṇḍulāḥ yavāḥ siddhārthakāḥ ca iti arghya uṣṭa aṅgaḥ
translated: Water, milk, tips of kuśa grass, ghee, curd, rice grains, barley, and white mustard seeds - this is the eight-limbed arghya.

original: prakīrtitaḥ //
analyzed: prakīrtitaḥ
translated: is proclaimed.

original: lāṃ jagaddhātryai pṛthivyai namaḥ //
analyzed: lāṃ jagaddhātryai pṛthivyai namaḥ
translated: LAM - Salutations to the Earth, the mother of the universe.

original: iti taṇḍulān /
analyzed: iti taṇḍulān
translated: Thus with rice grains.

original: trijaṭobdha piṅgalāyarudrāya namaḥ //
analyzed: trijaṭā ubdha piṅgalāya rudrāya namaḥ
translated: TRIJATA - Salutations to Rudra, the three-braided, tawny-colored one.

original: sarṣapān //
analyzed: sarṣapān
translated: With mustard seeds.

original: oṃ brahmaṇe svaraṇyeṣṭāya namaḥ / yavān //
analyzed: om brahmaṇe su araṇya iṣṭāya namaḥ yavān
translated: OM - Salutations to Brahma, the self-luminous one, the beloved of the gods. With barley grains.

original: oṃ namo viṣṇave surapataye mahābalāya namaḥ puṣpāṇi //
analyzed: om namaḥ viṣṇave surapataye mahābalāya namaḥ puṣpāṇi
translated: OM - Salutations to Vishnu, the lord of the gods, the greatly powerful one. With flowers.

original: oṃ jrīṃ sāvitrīpāpabhakṣiṇi sāvitryai namaḥ hūṃ phaṭ darbhān //
analyzed: om jrīṃ sāvitrī pāpa bhakṣiṇi sāvitryai namaḥ   phaṭ darbhān
translated: OM JRI - To Savitri, the devourer of sins, salutations. With darbha grass.

original: oṃ svāṃ svāṃ svāṃ somāya namaḥ jalaṃ // oṃ tatsatpitṛbhyo namaḥ tilān //
analyzed: om svām svām svām somāya namaḥ jalam om tad sat pitṛbhyaḥ namaḥ tilān
translated: OM SVA - Salutations to Soma. With water. OM TAT SAT - Salutations to the ancestors. With sesame seeds.

original: oṃ hūṃ vāgīśvari vākprade sarasvatyai namaḥ kṣīraṃ //
analyzed: om   vāgīśvari vāc prade sarasvatyai namaḥ kṣīram
translated: OM HUM - To the goddess of speech, the giver of speech, to Sarasvati, salutations. With milk.

original: oṃ phaṭ astrā phaṭ ghṛtam //
analyzed: om phaṭ astrā phaṭ ghṛtam
translated: OM PHAT - To the weapon, PHAT. With ghee.

original: oṃ yāṃ rāṃ lāṃ vāṃ sarvottamadravyebhyo namaḥ sarvadravyān //🔽etāni pātreṣu kṣipet / ityaṣṭāṅgatvamarghya puryakārpaṇābhi prāyāt //
analyzed: om yāṃ rāṃ lāṃ vām sarva uttama dravyebhyaḥ namaḥ sarva dravyān  etāni pātreṣu kṣipet iti aṣṭa aṅga tvam arghya prāyāt
translated: OM YAM RAM LAM VAM - To all the excellent substances, salutations. With all the substances.🔽These should be placed in the vessels. Thus the Arghya becomes eight-limbed, consisting of the offerings of water, etc.

original: tatra paradṛṣṭā ādau vidyārghaṃ vibhoḥ pādyādi pūjārthaṃ kuryāt //
analyzed: tatra para dṛṣṭā ādau vidyā argham vibhoḥ pādya ādi pūjā artham kuryāt
translated: There, the Arghya for the deity should be prepared first, for the sake of worship with water for washing the feet, etc.

original: ātmavidyā śiva prakṛti / puruṣa / tatvapañcakena //
translated: With the five principles of the individual soul, primordial matter, and the five elements.

original: sūryasomavahnikalābhiḥ // tatrādau sūryakalāḥ //
analyzed: sūrya soma vahni kalābhiḥ tatra ādau sūrya kalāḥ
translated: With the energies of the sun, moon, and fire. Among them, first, the energies of the sun:

original: oṃ mārīcyai jvālinyai / dhūmrāyai / tapanyai / tāpinyai // pācinyai / havirvāhāyai / tejovatyai /
analyzed: om mārīcyai jvālinyai dhūmrāyai tapanyai tāpinyai pācinyai havirvāhāyai tejovatyai
translated: Om to Marichi, Jvalini, Dhumra, Tapani, Tapini, Pacini, Havi-vaha, Tejovati,

original: śatadhāmāyai / sudhāmāyai / padmagarbhāyai / tamopahāriṇyai iti sūryakalāḥ //
analyzed: śatadhāmāyai sudhāmāyai padmagarbhāyai tamopahāriṇyai iti sūrya kalāḥ
translated: Shatadhama, Sudhama, Padma-garbha, and Tamo-paharini - these are the energies of the sun.

original: atha somakalāḥ //
analyzed: atha soma kalāḥ
translated: Now, the energies of the moon:

original: oṃ pūṣāyai / yamasyai / sumanasyai / prītyai / prītikāryai / vṛtyai / vṛtikaryai / saumyāyai / marīcyai /🔽aṃśumālinyai / śaśinyai / hṛdgatāyai / lakṣmyai / chāyāyai / saṃpūrṇamaṇḍalāyai // amṛtāyai namaḥ //
analyzed: om pūṣāyai yamasyai sumanasyai prītyai prīti kāryai vṛtyai vṛti karyai saumyāyai marīcyai  aṃśumālinyai śaśinyai hṛd gatāyai lakṣmyai chāyāyai saṃpūrṇa maṇḍalāyai amṛtāyai namaḥ
translated: Om to Pushya, Yama, Sumanas, Priti, Priti-kari, Vritti, Vritti-kari, Saumya, Marichi,🔽Anshuma-lini, Shashini, Hri-gata, Lakshmi, Chhaya, and Sampurna-mandala - salutations to Amrita.

original: iti somakalāḥ // //
analyzed: iti soma kalāḥ
translated: These are the energies of the moon.

original: athāvahnikalāḥ //
analyzed: atha avahnikalāḥ
translated: Now, the energies of fire:

original: oṃ dhūmrāyai / nīlaraktāyai // kapilāyai / visphuliṅginyai / jvālāyai / tejovatyai // havivāhinyai //
analyzed: om dhūmrāyai nīla raktāyai kapilāyai visphuliṅginyai jvālāyai tejovatyai havi vāhinyai
translated: Om to Dhumra, Nila-rakta, Kapila, Visphulingini, Jvala, Tejovati, Havi-vaha,

original: kavivāhinyai raudryai / saṃhārakāriṇyai // iti vahnikalāḥ // //
analyzed: kavi vāhinyai raudryai saṃhāra kāriṇyai iti vahni kalāḥ
translated: Kavi-vaha, Raudri, and Samhara-kari - these are the energies of fire.

original: mūlena sāṅgapañcakenātmavidyā śivaprakṛti tatvapañcakasahitena svavāyau / iti vidyarghaṃ pūjayet // tatra
analyzed: mūlena sa aṅga pañcakena ātma vidyā śiva prakṛti tatva pañcaka sahitena sva vāyau iti vidi argham pūjayet tatra
translated: With the root mantra along with the five limbs, the self, knowledge, and the five principles of Shiva's nature, in one's own breath. Thus, one should worship the collection of vidyas. There

original: paradṛṣṭopakaraṇā valokanam //
analyzed: para dṛṣṭa upakaraṇā avalokanam
translated: The examination of the external implements.

original: yannirāvaraṇaṃ samyak satataṃ kalpanojhitam // tatparaṃ devi kathitaṃ sākāṣṭāsāparāgatiḥ //
analyzed: yat nirāvaraṇam samyak satatam kalpanā ujhitam tat param devi kathitam
translated: O Goddess, that which is unobstructed, perfectly, always, free from conceptualization, is said to be supreme, with the same essence and non-differentiation.

original: iti vidyarghapātrātsarvadravya prokṣaṇam // tato madhye kevalena mūlena nirodhārghaṃ pūjayet //
analyzed: iti vidi arghapātrāt sarva dravya prokṣaṇam tatas madhye kevalena mūlena nirodha argham pūjayet
translated: Thus, all substances are sprinkled with the collection of vidyas. Then, in the middle, one should worship the obstructing arghya with the root mantra alone.

original: tatra niṣṭhuramudrāṃ pradarśayet // tannikaṭe /
analyzed: tatra niṣṭhura mudrām pradarśayet tad nikaṭe
translated: There, one should display the Niṣṭhura mudrā. Near it,

original: oṃ hūṃ śivāya namaḥ // iti śivāmbukāryam //
analyzed: om   śivāya namaḥ iti śiva ambu kāryam
translated: Om Hūṃ, salutations to Shiva. Thus, the water for Shiva is prepared.

original: tannikaṭe svadakṣe / mūlena sāṅgena sa devīkena pāśupatāstreṇa pāśupatāstraṃ pūjayet //
analyzed: tad nikaṭe sva dakṣe mūlena sa aṅgena sa devīkena pāśupatāstreṇa pāśupatāstram pūjayet
translated: Near it, on one's right, with the root mantra along with the limbs, along with the goddess, one should worship the Pāśupata weapon with the Pāśupata weapon.

original: oṃ ślīṃ paśu hūṃ phaṭ pāśupatāstrāya phaṭ //
analyzed: om ślīṃ paśu   phaṭ pāśupatāstrāya phaṭ
translated: Om Ślīṃ, Pāśupata weapon to the animal, Phat.

original: oṃ hṛdayāya phaṭ namaḥ //
analyzed: om hṛdayāya phaṭ namaḥ
translated: Om, salutations to the heart, Phat.

original: ślīṃ śirase phaṭ svāhā // paśikhāyai vauṣaṭ // śukavacāya phaṭ hūṃ // hūṃ netrebhyo vaṣaṭ // phaṭ
analyzed: ślīṃ śirase phaṭ svāhā vauṣaṭ śukavacāya phaṭ hūm   netrebhyaḥ vaṣaṭ phaṭ
translated: Ślīṃ, Phat, to the head, Svāhā. To the tuft, Vauṣaṭ. To the weapon, Phat, Hūṃ. Hūṃ, to the eyes, Vaṣaṭ. Phat,

original: astrāya phaṭ phaṭ //
analyzed: astrāya phaṭ phaṭ
translated: To the weapon, Phat, Phat.

original: iti vidhinirodhapaśvargha pātratraya pūjanam //
analyzed: iti vidhi nirodha paśu argha pātra traya pūjanam
translated: Thus, the worship of the three vessels - the vessel for the rules, the vessel for the oblations, and the vessel for the animals.

original: teṣva'mṛtamudrayā'mṛtīkaraṇam //
analyzed: teṣu amṛta mudrayā amṛtīkaraṇam
translated: In them, the consecration with nectar using the nectar mudra.

original: mantrārghapātrādātmaprokṣaṇam // naumi śvetmeti //
analyzed: mantra arghapātrāt ātma prokṣaṇam naumi śvetma iti
translated: The self-consecration with the mantra vessel. I bow to the white one, etc.

original: saptadhā mūlena svātmapūjāṃ kṛtvā aiśānyādāgneyāntaṃ gurupūjāṃ kṛtvā //
analyzed: saptadhā mūlena sva ātma pūjām kṛtvā aiśānyāt āgneya antam guru pūjām kṛtvā
translated: Having performed one's own worship seven times with the root mantra, having performed the worship of the guru from the northeast to the southeast,

original: śivāmbhasā / astrāmbhasā / vidyāmbhasā ca / karatalamabhyukṣyāvaguṇṭhya //
analyzed: śiva ambhasā astra ambhasā vidyā ambhasā ca kara talam abhyukṣya avaguṇṭhya
translated: Having sprinkled and covered the palm with Shiva's water, with the water of the weapon, and with the water of knowledge,

original: prakṣālyagandhatoyena hastaṃ hastena kenacit // gandhadigdheyajeddevaṃ sāṅgamāsanavarjitam //
analyzed: prakṣālya gandha toyena hastam hastena kenacid  gandha digdhā iyajet devam sa aṅgam āsana varjitam
translated: Having washed the hand with fragrant water, one should worship the god with fragrances, etc., along with the limbs, but without the seat.

original: tathā ca //🔽vaktrapañcakasaṃyuktaḥ śivenādhiṣṭhitaḥ śivaḥ //
analyzed: tathā ca  vaktra pañcaka saṃyuktaḥ śivena adhiṣṭhitaḥ śivaḥ
translated: And so it is said:🔽Shiva, endowed with the five faces, is presided over by Shiva.

original: pāśacchedakaraḥ kṣemī śivahastaḥ prakīrtitaḥ //
translated: The one who cuts the bonds, the fortunate one, is proclaimed as the Shiva hand.

original: tadyathā //
analyzed: tat yathā
translated: As follows:🔽With saffron, aguru, musk, and sandalwood, with tagara, priyangu,

original: kuṅkumāgurukuraṅganābhijācandanena tagarapriyāṅgubhiḥ // gandhatoya vidhimevamabhyadhuḥ śaṅkarārcana vidha
analyzed: kuṅkuma aguru kuraṅga nābhijā candanena tagara priyā aṅgubhiḥ gandha toya vidhim evam abhyadhuḥ śaṅkara arcana vidha
translated: They have thus declared the method of fragrant water. The worship of Shankara is

original: vaḍu kramāt //
analyzed: vaḍu kramāt
translated: performed in order.

original: iti gandhodakaṃ kṛtvā hastau tena prakṣālya //
analyzed: iti gandha udakam kṛtvā hastau tena prakṣālya
translated: Having thus made fragrant water and washed the hands with it,

original: oṃ somamaṇḍalāya namaḥ // vāmakare // oṃ sūryamaṇḍalāya namaḥ // dakṣe // itthaṃ gandhairmaṇḍalakaṃ
analyzed: om soma maṇḍalāya namaḥ vāma kare om sūrya maṇḍalāya namaḥ dakṣe ittham gandhaiḥ maṇḍalakam
translated: Thus, with fragrances, the mandala

original: tatkara madhyamāṅguṣṭhābhyāmitarakarārpita kusumairanāsanaṃ sāṅgaṃ sa vaktraṃ mūlaṃ sampūjya //
analyzed: tad kara madhyamāṅguṣṭhābhyām itara kara arpita kusumaiḥ anāsanam sa aṅgam sa vaktram mūlam sampūjya
translated: With the middle and thumb fingers of that hand, with flowers offered by the other hand, without a seat, having worshipped the root mantra with limbs and faces,

original: mantrasandhānaṃ nāḍīsandhānaṃ paramīkaraṇaṃ cānyaprakāreṇa karasthi tasya vibhoḥ kuryāt // tadyathā //
analyzed: mantra sandhānam nāḍī sandhānam paramīkaraṇam ca anya prakāreṇa kara sthi tasya vibhoḥ kuryāt tat yathā
translated: The union of mantras, the union of channels, and the supreme consecration should be done by the method of being in the hand of the Lord. As follows:

original: hṛdayānmadhyadhāmni sauṣumṇa pathāmantramudīrayanbhrūmadhyasthaṃ binduṃ bhedayitvā sarvagranthi vidāraṇa
analyzed: hṛdayāt madhya dhāmni sauṣumṇa pathāmantram udīrayan bhrū madhya stham bindum bhedayitvā sarva granthi vidāraṇa
translated: Having uttered the mantra in the middle abode from the heart through the suṣumnā path, having pierced the bindu located between the eyebrows, having torn all the knots,

original: pūrvaṃ paramaṃ dhāmadvādaśāntamāviśya punardvādaśāntā davaruhya bhrūmadhyaṃ krameṇa
analyzed: pūrvam paramam dhāma dvādaśāntam āviśya punar dvādaśāntāḥ davaruhya bhrū madhyam krameṇa
translated: Having entered the supreme abode, the end of the twelve, having again ascended from the end of the twelve, through the middle of the eyebrows,

original: vāmanāsāpuṭamārgeṇa karasthamantravṛndaṃ jvaladbhāsvarākāraṃ gṛhītvā tena vāmanāsāpuṭamārgeṇa
analyzed: vāma nāsā puṭa mārgeṇa kara stha mantra vṛndam jvalat bhāsvara ākāram gṛhītvā tena vāma nāsā puṭa mārgeṇa
translated: Having taken the multitude of mantras in the hand in the form of blazing light through the path of the left nostril, having brought them to the middle of the eyebrows through the path of the left nostril,

original: bhrūmadhyaṃ prāpayya bhrūmadhyādapi sūcyagreṇaiva karandhraṃ bhitvā dvādaśāntaṃ prāpayet //
analyzed: bhrūmadhyam prāpayya bhrūmadhyāt api sūci agreṇa eva karandhram bhitvā dvādaśāntam prāpayet
translated: Having pierced the hole in the hand with the tip of a needle even from the middle of the eyebrows, one should reach the end of the twelve.

original: iti mantrasandhānam //
analyzed: iti mantra sandhānam
translated: This is the union of mantras.

original: punardvādaśāntādbhrūmadhyaṃ prāpayya bhrūmadhyāddakṣiṇanāsāpuṭamārgeṇa recakaṃ kṛtvā
analyzed: punar dvādaśāntāt bhrūmadhyam prāpayya bhrūmadhyāt dakṣiṇa nāsāpuṭa mārgeṇa recakam kṛtvā
translated: Again, having brought it from the end of the twelve to the middle of the eyebrows, having exhaled through the right nostril from the middle of the eyebrows,

original: karasthamantrarūpasya vibhorhṛdi praviśya tasya karasthasya vibhoḥ hṛdayamārgeṇa dvādaśāntaṃ prāpya tataḥ
analyzed: kara stha mantra rūpasya vibhoḥ hṛdi praviśya tasya kara sthasya vibhoḥ hṛdaya mārgeṇa dvādaśāntam prāpya tatas
translated: having entered into the heart of the Lord in the form of the mantra in the hand, having reached the end of the twelve through the path of the heart of that Lord in the hand, then,

original: pūrakaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇanāsāpuṭena svahṛdaye praviśediti nāḍīsandhānam //
analyzed: pūrakam kṛtvā dakṣiṇa nāsā puṭena sva hṛdaye praviśet iti nāḍī sandhānam
translated: having inhaled, one should enter one's own heart through the right nostril. This is the union of the channels.

original: tataḥ svahṛdayāddvādaśāntaṃ taddvādaśāntāttaddhṛdaye ca sarvatra cakracāpavatsvahṛdayātkarāntaṃ
analyzed: tatas sva hṛdayāt dvādaśāntam tad dvādaśāntāt tad hṛdaye ca sarvatra cakra cāpa vat sva hṛdayāt kara antam
translated: Then, from one's own heart to the end of the twelve, from that end of the twelve to one's own heart, and everywhere, like the arc of a circle, from one's own heart to the end of the hand,

original: niṣkala bhaṭṭārakaṃ dīptaṃ bhāvayet //
analyzed: niṣkala bhaṭṭārakam dīptam bhāvayet
translated: one should contemplate the radiant, partless Lord.

original: iti paramīkaraṇam //
analyzed: iti paramīkaraṇam
translated: This is the supreme consecration.

original: evaṃ jvalanmantragaṇaparipūrṇaṃ pāṇiṃ vibhāvyamūlamuccāryadakṣiṇaṃ hastaṃ hṛdi nyaset //
analyzed: evam jvalat mantra gaṇa paripūrṇam pāṇim vibhāvya mūlam uccārya dakṣiṇam hastam hṛdi nyaset
translated: Thus, having contemplated the hand filled with the blazing host of mantras, having uttered the root mantra, one should place the right hand on the heart.

original: vāmāddakṣiṇahaste puṣpaṃ datvā taṃ dakṣiṇaṃ hastaṃ svaśirasi sthāpayet //
analyzed: vāmāt dakṣiṇa haste puṣpam da tvā tam dakṣiṇam hastam sva śirasi sthāpayet
translated: Having placed the flower in the right hand from the left, one should place that right hand on one's own head.

original: iti śivahastavidhiḥ //
analyzed: iti śivahasta vidhiḥ
translated: This is the procedure for the Śiva hand.

original: atha pañcagavyavidhiḥ //
analyzed: atha pañcagavya vidhiḥ
translated: Now, the procedure for the five products of the cow.

original: maryādayāvāśālicūrṇena koṣṭhanavakaṃ kṛtvā pātranavakamānīya haimādimṛṇmayāntaṃ //🔽p / 🔽oṃ haḥ phaṭ pātrāṇi śodhayāmi haḥ phaṭ // iti saptavārābhimantrita saṭtriṃśaddarbhakṛte na
analyzed: maryādayā avāśāli cūrṇena koṣṭha navakam kṛtvā pātra navakam ānīya haima ādi mṛṇmaya antam  p  om haḥ phaṭ pātrāṇi śodhayāmi haḥ phaṭ iti sapta vāra abhimantrita saṭtriṃśat darbha kṛte na
translated: Having made nine compartments with the powder of the barley grain of the Maricaya plant, and having brought nine vessels made of gold etc. up to those made of clay,

original: jñānakhaḍgena pātrāṇya bhiṣiñcet / taṃ śivāmbhasā prokṣataṃ //
analyzed: jñāna khaḍgena pātrāṇi a bhiṣiñcet tam śiva ambhasā
translated: Om, Ha, Phat! I purify the vessels, Ha, Phat! Having enchanted with the seven-syllabled mantra, one should sprinkle the vessels with the sword of knowledge, which is made of thirty-two Darbha grass blades, and which is consecrated with the mantra. One should sprinkle that with Shiva's water.

original: oṃ haiṃ pātrāṇi veṣṭayāmi hum //
analyzed: om haiṃ pātrāṇi veṣṭayāmi hum
translated: Om, Ham! I cover the vessels, Hum!

original: iti kavacenāvaguṇṭhitaṃ / madhyamakoṣṭhādarabhya pūrvādi krameṇa / śiva / sadāśiva / īśvara / vidyā /
analyzed: iti kavacena avaguṇṭhitam madhyama koṣṭhāt ārabhya pūrva ādi krameṇa śiva sadāśiva īśvara vidyā
translated: Having thus covered with the armor, starting from the middle compartment, in the east etc. in order, one should worship the nine principles - Shiva, Sadashiva, Isvara, Vidyā,

original: māyā / kāla / niyati / puruṣa / prakṛti / rūpe tatvanavake nyaste / madhya pūrvadakṣiṇa paścimottareṣu /
analyzed: māyā kāla niyati puruṣa prakṛti rūpe tatva navake nyaste madhya pūrva dakṣiṇa paścima uttareṣu
translated: Māyā, Kāla, Niyati, Purusha, and Prakriti. In the middle, east, south, west, and north,

original: supratiṣṭhā / suśāntā /🔽tejo vada'mṛtākhya śukrodayāni pūjayet // gomayaṃ tu hṛdā paśce gomūttraṃ śirasottare //
analyzed: su pratiṣṭhā su śāntā  tejaḥ vat amṛta ākhya śukra udayāni pūjayet gomayam tu hṛdā paśce go mūttram śirasā uttare
translated: Supratistha, Sushasta,🔽Tejo, Vada, Amrita, Shukrodaya, one should worship. After that, cow dung with the heart mantra in the west, cow urine in the north with the head mantra,

original: dadhiprācyāṃ śikhāyāṃ tu madhye kṣīraṃ tu varmaṇā // dakṣiṇe ghṛtamastreṇa netre neśe kuśodakam //
analyzed: dadhi prācyām śikhāyām tu madhye kṣīram tu varmaṇā dakṣiṇe ghṛtam astreṇa netre na īśe kuśa udakam
translated: curds in the east with the tuft mantra, milk in the middle with the armor mantra, ghee in the south with the weapon mantra, and sacred water with the eye mantra in the northeast,

original: etadeva / gomayaṃ tu hṛdāpaśce / hāṃ hṛdayāya namaḥ / ekavāramuccārya / laṃ sadyojātamūrtaye namaḥ //
analyzed: etat eva gomayam tu hāṃ hṛdayāya namaḥ eka vāram uccārya laṃ sadyojāta mūrtaye namaḥ
translated: This alone. Cow dung and water with the heart mantra. Om Hrim Hrim, Salutations to the heart. Reciting once, Lam, salutations to the form of Sadyojata.🔽Thus cow dung, the head, and the thumb.

original: iti gomaya murdhāṅguṣṭhamiti paśce // gomūtraṃ śirasottare // hīṃ sirase svāhā // dvivāramabhimantrya // oṃ
analyzed: iti gomaya murdha aṅguṣṭham iti paśce go mūtram śirasā uttare hīṃ sirase svāhā dvi vāram abhimantrya om
translated: Cow's urine on the head and the north. Om Hrim, Salutations to the head. Reciting twice, Om.

original: vaṃ vāmadevāya namaḥ // uttare palamātraṃ gomūtraṃ kṣipet //
analyzed: vaṃ vāmadevāya namaḥ uttare pala mātram go mūtram kṣipet
translated: Om Vam, salutations to Vamadeva. In the north, one should pour a pala of cow's urine.

original: dadhiprācyāṃ śikhāyāṃ tu // hūṃ śikhāyai vauṣaṭ // trivāramabhimantrya //
analyzed: dadhi prācyām śikhāyām tu   śikhāyai vauṣaṭ tri vāram abhimantrya
translated: Yogurt in the east, on the tuft. Om Hrum, salutations to the tuft. Reciting thrice, Om.

original: oṃ aghora hṛdayāya namaḥ // prācyāṃ dadhi palamātraṃ / madhye kṣīraṃ tu varmaṇā // haiṃ kavacāya hūm //
analyzed: om aghora hṛdayāya namaḥ prācyām dadhi pala mātram madhye kṣīram tu varmaṇā   kavacāya
translated: Om, salutations to the heart of Aghora. In the east, a pala of yogurt. In the middle, milk with the armor mantra. Om Hrim, salutations to the armor.

original: caturvāramabhimantrya // yaṃ tatpuruṣavaktrāya namaḥ / madhye kṣīraṃ palamātraṃ //
analyzed: catur vāram abhimantrya yam tatpuruṣa vaktrāya namaḥ madhye kṣīram pala mātram
translated: Reciting four times, Om Yam, salutations to the face of Tatpurusha. In the middle, a pala of milk.

original: dakṣiṇe ghṛtamastreṇa // oṃ haḥ phaṭ astrāya phaṭ // pañcavāramabhimantrya //
analyzed: dakṣiṇe ghṛtam astreṇa om haḥ phaṭ astrāya phaṭ pañca vāram abhimantrya
translated: Ghee in the south with the weapon mantra. Om Hum Hrum, salutations to the weapon. Reciting five times, Om.

original: oṃ kṣaṃ īśāna mūrdhne namaḥ //🔽p / 🔽ghṛtamardhāṅguṣṭhamātraṃ dakṣe kṣipet //
analyzed: om kṣaṃ īśāna mūrdhne namaḥ  p  ghṛtam ardha aṅguṣṭha mātram dakṣe kṣipet
translated: Om Ksham, salutations to the head of Isha.🔽In the south, one should pour half an aṅgula of ghee.

original: netreṇeśe kuśodakam //
analyzed: netreṇa īśe kuśa udakam
translated: With the eye mantra, kusha water in the northeast.

original: oṃ hauṃ netrabhyo vaṣaṭ // oṃ śivāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om   netrabhyaḥ vaṣaṭ om śivāya namaḥ
translated: Om, Hraum, to the eyes, Vashat. Om, salutations to Shiva.

original: tanmaheśāya vidmahe vāgviddhāya dhīmahi tannaḥ śivaḥ pracodayāt // //
analyzed: tat maheśāya vidmahe vāc viddhāya dhīmahi tat naḥ śivaḥ pracodayāt  /
translated: We meditate on that Mahesha, may Shiva inspire us.

original: iti kuśodakaṃ palamātramīśāne kṣipet //
analyzed: iti kuśa udakam pala mātram īśāne kṣipet
translated: Thus, one should sprinkle the water with Kusha grass in the northeast, measuring one pala.

original: athavā //🔽ardhāṅguṣṭhaika dvitricatuṣpañcamitāyadivāgomaya ghṛte ardhāṅguṣṭhamite palepalamanyatsthāpayitve
analyzed: athavā  ghṛte ardha aṅguṣṭha mite
translated: Or,🔽if the cow dung and ghee are of half a thumb, one, two, three, four or five measures, and if the other is of half a thumb, one pala,

original: śadiśipalamātraṃ kuśāmbu ca //
analyzed: kuśa ambu ca
translated: one should place one pala of Kusha water in each direction.

original: yadvā //
analyzed: yat vā
translated: Or,🔽cow dung, cow's urine, ghee, curd and milk as the fifth,

original: gomayaṃ gojalaṃ sarpi dadhikṣīraṃ tu pañcamam // sadyojātena vāmena rūpiṇā puruṣeṇa ca //
analyzed: gomayam gojalam sarpi dadhi kṣīram tu pañcamam sadyojātena vāmena rūpiṇā puruṣeṇa ca
translated: one should consecrate the cow dung etc. with Sadyojata, Vama, Rupin, Purusha,

original: īśānena yathā saṅkhyaṃ gomayādyabhimantrayet // kuśodakaṃ tu gāyatryā dhāmnā saṃhitayāthaveti //
analyzed: īśānena yathā saṅkhyam gomaya ādi abhimantrayet kuśa udakam tu gāyatryā dhāmnā saṃhitayā athavā iti
translated: and Isha, respectively. The Kusha water should be consecrated with Gayatri, Dhamna, or Samhita.

original: sāṅgena dhāmnā kuśodakaṃ mantrayitvā // oṃ hāṃ hīṃ hūṃ haiṃ hauṃ haḥ kuśodakāya namaḥ //
analyzed: sa aṅgena dhāmnā kuśa udakam mantrayitvā om hāṃ hīṃ hūm haiṃ   haḥ kuśa udakāya namaḥ
translated: Having consecrated the Kusha water with the Dhamna mantra along with the limbs, Om, Ham, Him, Hum, Han, Haum, Has, salutations to the Kusha water.

original: tataḥ pūrvaṃ pūrvaṃ purataḥ kṛtvā saṃyojayet //
analyzed: tatas pūrvam pūrvam puratas kṛtvā saṃyojayet
translated: Then, placing the previous one in front, one should join them.

original: gomayaṃ gomūtre // gomūtraṃ dadhni // dadhikṣīre // kṣīraṃ ghṛte // ghṛtaṃ kuśodake sandadhyāt //
analyzed: gomayam go mūtre go mūtram dadhni dadhi kṣīre kṣīram ghṛte ghṛtam kuśa udake sandadhyāt
translated: Cow dung in cow's urine, cow's urine in curd, curd in milk, milk in ghee, and ghee should be mixed with water in which Kuśa grass is dipped.

original: āgneyasthamīśvara tatvaṃ nairṛtasthe māyā tatvaṃ // nairṛtasthaṃ māyātatvaṃ vāyusthe niyati tatve //
analyzed: āgneya stham īśvara tatvam nairṛta sthe māyā tatvam nairṛta stham māyā tatvam vāyu sthe niyati tatve
translated: The principle of Īśvara located in the southeast should be mixed with the principle of Māyā located in the southwest, the principle of Māyā located in the southwest should be mixed with the principle of Niyati located in the northwest,

original: vāyusthaṃ niyati tatvamīśānasthe prakṛtitatve kuśodake sandadhyāt //
analyzed: vāyu stham niyati tatvam īśāna sthe prakṛti tatve kuśa udake sandadhyāt
translated: and the principle of Niyati located in the northwest should be mixed with the principle of Prakṛti located in the northeast in water in which Kuśa grass is dipped.

original: tadapi sarvaṃ pṛthak kalaśamaṇḍalopari āgneyakoṇasthe pūrvalikhita padmopari pātre nyaset //
analyzed: tat api sarvam pṛthak kalaśa maṇḍala upari āgneya koṇa sthe pūrva likhita padma upari pātre nyaset
translated: All of that should be placed separately in a vessel placed on a lotus previously drawn in the southeast corner above the Maṇḍala of the jar.

original: punaraṅgaṣaṭke nāloḍyāmṛte samudrayā'mṛtī kṛtya pātrādhaḥ anantāya namaḥ /🔽p /
analyzed: punar aṅga ṣaṭke na āloḍya amṛte kṛtya pātra adhas anantāya namaḥ  p
translated: Again, after stirring the six limbs in the nectar, making it immortal by the ocean, below the vessel, salutations to Ananta.

original: pātropari vāme kheṭaketi aghoraṃ aghorīśvarīṃ / niṣkalaṃ sāṅgaṃ sa vaktraṃ sāvaraṇaṃ pūjayet //
analyzed: pātra upari vāme kheṭaka iti aghoram aghorīśvarīm niṣkalam sa aṅgam sa vaktram sa āvaraṇam pūjayet
translated: On the left of the vessel, in the skull, Aghora, Aghorīśvarī, Niṣkala, with limbs, with faces, with coverings, one should worship.

original: kavacenāvaguṇṭhya /
analyzed: kavacena avaguṇṭhya
translated: After covering with the armor.

original: tenātmānaṃ yāgabhūmiṃ ca samprokṣayet //
analyzed: tena ātmānam yāga bhūmim ca samprokṣayet
translated: With that, one should sprinkle oneself and the sacrificial ground.

original: iti pañcagavyavidhiḥ //
analyzed: iti pañcagavya vidhiḥ
translated: This is the procedure for the five products of the cow.

original: atha dakṣadiksthaḥ saumyāsyo yāgabhūmau ṣaṭtriṃśaddarbhaṃ kṛtaṃ jñānakhaḍgāṃ pūjayet //
analyzed: atha dakṣa diś sthaḥ saumya āsyaḥ yāga bhūmau ṣaṭtriṃśat darbham kṛtam jñāna khaḍgām pūjayet
translated: Then, facing north in the southeast, one should worship the sword of knowledge made of thirty-six Darbha grass on the sacrificial ground.

original: oṃ haḥ phaṭ ṣaṭtriṃśattatvarūpāya jñānakhaḍgāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om haḥ phaṭ ṣaṭtriṃśat tattva rūpāya jñānakhaḍgāya namaḥ
translated: Om, Hum, Phat. Salutations to the sword of knowledge, which is the form of the thirty-six principles.

original: tatastena pañcagavyena saptāstra japtasaptadarbhakṛta viṣṭareṇa vā jñānakhaḍgena bhūmi prokṣaṇam //
analyzed: tatas tena pañcagavyena sapta astra japta sapta darbha kṛta viṣṭareṇa vā jñāna khaḍgena bhūmi prokṣaṇam
translated: Then, with that five-product substance, on a seat made of seven Darbha grass blades enchanted seven times with the weapon mantra, or with the sword of knowledge, the ground should be sprinkled.

original: iti śalyaśuddhirbhūmiṃ muktā pūrṇāṃ dhyāyet //
analyzed: iti śalya śuddhiḥ bhūmim muktā pūrṇām dhyāyet
translated: Thus, the purification of the stake is done. The ground should be visualized as filled with pearls.

original: oṃ haḥ phaṭ ullekhanaṃ karomi phaṭ //
analyzed: om haḥ phaṭ ullekhanam karomi phaṭ
translated: Om, Hum, Phat. I perform the scraping, Phat.

original: evaṃ mṛtsnoddhāraṃ / śalyāpanayanaṃ //
analyzed: evam mṛtsnā uddhāram śalya apanayanam
translated: In the same way, the removal of clay, the removal of stakes,

original: vajrīkaraṇaṃ // mauktikā pūraṇaṃ // ākoṭanaṃ // secanaṃ // samīkaraṇaṃ // mārjanaṃ // ete
analyzed: vajrīkaraṇam mauktikā pūraṇam ākoṭanam secanam samīkaraṇam mārjanam ete
translated: the vajra-making, the filling with pearls, the beating, the sprinkling, the leveling, the sweeping, these

original: saṃskārāmanasā // iti bhūmiśuddhiḥ //
analyzed: iti bhūmi śuddhiḥ
translated: are the purifications mentally. Thus, the purification of the ground.

original: atha lepanaṃ pañcagavyagandhodakābhyām //
analyzed: atha lepanam pañcagavya gandha udakābhyām
translated: Now, the smearing with the five products and fragrant water.

original: oṃ haḥ phaṭ lepanaṃ karomi haḥ phaṭ // tato vikarakṣepaḥ //
analyzed: om haḥ phaṭ lepanam karomi haḥ phaṭ tatas vikara kṣepaḥ
translated: Om, Hum, Phat. I perform the smearing, Hum, Phat. Then, the throwing of the Vikara.

original: tilālājāya vāścaiva dūrvāḥ siddhārthakā śubhāḥ // kusumāni ca śuklāni sugandhī nicabhūriśaḥ //
analyzed: dūrvāḥ śubhāḥ kusumāni ca śuklāni sugandhī
translated: Sesamum, fried grain, Durva grass, white mustard seeds, and white fragrant flowers in abundance,

original: īṣaścandana paṅkena miśroyaṃ vikaraḥ śubhaḥ //
analyzed: īṣat candana paṅkena miśraḥ yam vikaraḥ śubhaḥ
translated: mixed with a little sandal paste, this Vikara is auspicious.

original: astreṇa vikarakṣepaḥ //
analyzed: astreṇa vikara kṣepaḥ
translated: The throwing of Vikara is done with the weapon mantra.

original: vikarāṃstu lokapālāstra rūpāndhyāyet //
analyzed: vikarān tu lokapāla astra rūpān dhyāyet
translated: The Vikaras should be visualized in the form of the guardians of the world and the weapon.

original: cāsareṇa kuśakūrcyā vā nairṛtādi īśānāntaṃ daukayet //
analyzed: cāsareṇa kuśa kūrcyā vā nairṛta ādi īśāna antam daukayet
translated: And with the mantra Om, Hrim, Shrim, I sprinkle with the water of the pot and with the Kusha grass, one should sprinkle from the south-west to the north-east.

original: oṃ haḥ phaṭ abhyukṣaṇo karomi phaṭ //
analyzed: om haḥ phaṭ abhyukṣaṇo karomi phaṭ
translated: Om, Hrim, Shrim, I sprinkle with the water of the pot and with the Kusha grass, one should sprinkle from the south-west to the north-east.

original: gandhāmbhaḥ pañcagavyābhyāṃ sthaṇḍilamabhyukṣya //
analyzed: gandha ambhaḥ pañcagavyābhyām sthaṇḍilam abhyukṣya
translated: Having sprinkled the altar with scented water and the five products of the cow,

original: vedimadhye paścimadiśi śrī pūjanam //
analyzed: vedi madhye paścima diśi śrī pūjanam
translated: in the middle of the altar, in the west, the worship of Shri.🔽Having invoked Shri with the Dhruba mantra, who has a lotus in her hand, whose eyes are her own,

original: dhrūveṇa śriyamāvāhya padmahastāṃ svalocanām // śuklapuṣpāṇi muñcantīṃ sarvalakṣṇasaṃyutām //
analyzed: dhrūveṇa śriyam āvāhya padma hastām sva locanām śukla puṣpāṇi muñcantīm sarva lakṣṇa saṃyutām
translated: who releases white flowers, endowed with all auspicious marks,🔽dark like the petals of a blue lotus, looking at the sacrificial mansion,

original: nīlotpaladalaśyāmāṃ yāgaharmyāvalokinīm // brahmasthānopaviṣṭāṃ ca dvārābhimukhabhadragām //
analyzed: nīlotpala dala śyāmām yāga harmya avalokinīm brahmasthāna upaviṣṭām ca dvāra abhimukha bhadra gām
translated: seated in the place of Brahma, moving towards the door with auspicious grace,

original: oṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ śriyai namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrīṃ śrīṃ śriyai namaḥ
translated: Om, Hrim, Shrim, salutations to Shri.

original: tataḥ svavāme gaṇapati pūjā //
analyzed: tatas sva vāme gaṇapati pūjā
translated: Then, on one's left, the worship of Ganesha.

original: vibhraddakṣiṇahasteti // mūlena sāṅgena pūjā // svadakṣe kṣekumāra pūjanam // ghaṇṭāṃ suvarṇaracitāṃ
analyzed: vibhrat dakṣiṇa hasta iti mūlena sa aṅgena pūjā sva dakṣe kṣekumāra pūjanam ghaṇṭām suvarṇa racitām
translated: Holding a modaka in the right hand, etc. Worship with the root mantra and its limbs. On one's right, the worship of Kshetrapala. A bell made of gold,

original: mūlena sāṅgena pūjā // tatordhvordhva krameṇa grahāpūjā // teṣāṃ vijñaptiḥ //
analyzed: mūlena sa aṅgena pūjā teṣām vijñaptiḥ
translated: worship with the root mantra and its limbs. Then, in the upward order, the worship of the planets. Their request:🔽O all planets and other subsidiary planets,

original: bhagavanto grahāḥ sarve yenyecopagrahā matāḥ // te sarve sannidhānaṃ me kurvantāṃ vighnaśāntaye //
analyzed: bhagavantaḥ grahāḥ sarve matāḥ te sarve sannidhānam me kurvantām vighna śāntaye
translated: may all of you be present for me for the sake of removing obstacles.

original: svavāme īśānāntaṃ gurupūjā //
analyzed: sva vāme īśāna antam guru pūjā
translated: On the left side, up to the end of Isha, is the worship of the Guru.

original: gaṇanāthāmbike svāmipāduke māṃ jagadgurum // yajantamanujānīhi yathā sampannakārakam //🔽tato mūlena sāṅgena yāgavedīṃ sampūjya //
analyzed: gaṇanātha ambike svāmi pāduke mām jagadgurum yajantam anujānīhi yathā sampanna kārakam  tatas mūlena sa aṅgena yāga vedīm sampūjya
translated: O Lord of the Ganas, O Mother, O Lord, I seek your permission to worship the preceptor of the world, so that I may perform the ritual perfectly.🔽Then, having worshipped the sacrificial altar with the root mantra and its limbs,

original: tata īśāne svastikamālikhya // tatsamīpaṃ padmamālikhya //
analyzed: tatas īśāne svastikam ālikhya tad samīpam padmam ālikhya
translated: In the northeast, having drawn a svastika, and nearby, a lotus,

original: tataḥ śivakalaśamānīya /
analyzed: tatas śiva kalaśam ānīya
translated: Then, having brought the Shiva kalasha,

original: śivāmbhasāstreṇa prokṣya sitavastreṇotpuṃsya gandhodakena saṃlikhya vastrapūtenā jalena sampūjya /🔽cutāśvarūpallavaiḥ sarṣapadūrvābhiḥ / ratnagarbhoṣadhībhiḥ sahadevyā śrīphalajātī phala
analyzed: śiva ambhasā astreṇa prokṣya sita vastreṇa utpuṃsya gandha udakena saṃlikhya vastra pūtena jalena sampūjya  cutā aśvarū pallavaiḥ sarṣapa dūrvābhiḥ ratna garbha oṣadhībhiḥ sahadevyā śrīphala jātī phala
translated: Having sprinkled it with Shiva water, having wiped it with a white cloth, having anointed it with fragrant water, having worshipped it with cloth-filtered water,🔽Having filled it with mango leaves, mustard, durva grass, gems, herbs, sahasravirya, bilva leaves, jasmine, camphor,

original: pūgaphalādibhiḥ sampūrya //
analyzed: pūga phala ādibhiḥ sampūrya
translated: And with the fruits of shreephala, jackfruit, and so on,

original: sugandhidravyenādhivāsitaṃ kṛtvā īśāne svastikopari pūjitāsane /
analyzed: sugandhi dravyena adhivāsitam kṛtvā īśāne svastika upari pūjita āsane
translated: Having infused it with fragrant substances, on the svastika in the northeast, on a worshipped seat,

original: amṛteśvararūpaṃ śivakalaśaṃ sthāpayet //
analyzed: amṛteśvara rūpam śiva kalaśam sthāpayet
translated: One should install the Shiva kalasha in the form of Lord Amrita.

original: mūlena sāṅgā pañcakena pūjayet //
analyzed: mūlena sa aṅgā pañcakena pūjayet
translated: One should worship it with the root mantra and its five limbs.

original: evameva vārdhānīmamṛtalakṣmīrūpāmastreṇa pūjayitvā padmopari sthāpayet //
analyzed: evam eva vārdhānīm amṛta lakṣmī rūpām astreṇa pūjayitvā padma upari sthāpayet
translated: In the same way, having worshipped the water pot in the form of Amrita Lakshmi with the weapon mantra, one should place it on a lotus.

original: tato jñānakhaḍgāṃ ṣaṭtriṃśaddarbhanirmitamuttarāgraṃ tayoruparisthāpayet //
analyzed: tatas jñāna khaḍgām ṣaṭtriṃśat darbha nirmitam uttara agram tayoḥ upari sthāpayet
translated: Then, on top of those two, he should place the sword of knowledge made of thirty-six darbha blades with the tips facing upwards.

original: tato bhagaliṅgīkaraṇam //
analyzed: tatas bhaga liṅgīkaraṇam
translated: Then, the consecration of the Bhaga Linga:

original: bhagasya hṛdayaṃ liṅgaṃ liṅgasya hṛdayaṃ bhagaḥ // tasmai te bhagaliṅgāya umārudrāya vai namaḥ //
analyzed: bhagasya hṛdayam liṅgam liṅgasya hṛdayam bhagaḥ tasmai te bhaga liṅgāya umā rudrāya vai namaḥ
translated: The heart of Bhaga is the Linga, the heart of the Linga is Bhaga. I offer salutations to you, the Bhaga Linga, to Umarudra.

original: iti mantreṇa saṃspṛśet //
analyzed: iti mantreṇa saṃspṛśet
translated: With this mantra, he should touch (the Bhaga Linga).

original: āvāhanasthāpanaṃ sannidhānapana sannirodhanā'mṛtīkaraṇāni kuryāt //
analyzed: āvāhana sthāpanam sannidhānapana sannirodhana amṛtīkaraṇāni kuryāt
translated: He should perform the invocation, installation, presence, stopping, and making immortal.

original: evaṃ mudrāḥ pradarśayet //
analyzed: evam mudrāḥ pradarśayet
translated: Thus, he should display the mudras.

original: mūlāṣṭottara śata japaḥ //
analyzed: mūla aṣṭottaraśata japaḥ
translated: He should recite the root mantra one hundred and eight times.

original: bhuktau guhyeti / muktau yadyadvai kurmahe karmasādāsukṛta duṣkṛtam //
analyzed: bhuktau guhyā iti muktau yat yat vai kurmahe duṣkṛtam
translated: At the time of eating, he should recite the mantra Guhya etc. Whatever good or bad deeds we perform for liberation,

original: tanme śivapadasthasya hūṃ haḥ kṣapayaśaṅkara //
analyzed: tat me śiva pada sthasya hūm haḥ kṣapaya śaṅkara
translated: May they be destroyed by the mantra Hum Hum O Shankara, for me who is established in the state of Shiva.

original: iti vidhipātrataḥ kalaśe puṣpaṃ kṣipet //
analyzed: iti vidhi pātrataḥ kalaśe puṣpam kṣipet
translated: Thus, he should throw a flower from the ritual vessel into the pot.

original: tato mantra kalaśaṃ gururgṛhītvā astrakalaśaṃ śiṣyahaste datvā / pūrvādi dikṣudhārāpātaṃ kuryāt //
analyzed: tatas mantra kalaśam guruḥ gṛhītvā astra kalaśam śiṣya haste da tvā pūrva ādi dikṣu dhārā pātam kuryāt
translated: Then, the Guru should take the mantra pot and give the weapon pot to the disciple's hand and make the flow fall in the directions starting from the east.

original: bhoḥ bhoḥ indra āgaccha santiṣṭha sanīdhatsva sannihito bhava saniruddho bhava bhagavannamaste //
analyzed: bhoḥ bhoḥ indra āgaccha santiṣṭha sanīdhatsva sannihitaḥ bhava sa niruddhaḥ bhava bhagavan namaḥ te
translated: O Indra, come, stand, sit, be present, be stopped, O Lord, I offer salutations to you.

original: evaṃ / agne / yama / nairṛta / varuṇa / vāyo / kubera / īśāna / brahman / viṣṇo / iti paṭhan / dhārāpātaṃ🔽kuryāt //
analyzed: evam agne yama nairṛta varuṇa vāyo kubera īśāna brahman viṣṇo iti paṭhan dhārāpātam  kuryāt
translated: Thus, reciting Agne, Yama, Nairṛta, Varuṇa, Vāyu, Kubera, Īśāna, Brahmā, Viṣṇu, he should perform the pouring of the stream.

original: tato gururbhairavaṃ japanpadmopari śivakalaśaṃ sthāpayet // astravārdhānīṃ japan / īśāne svastikopari🔽sthāpayet //
analyzed: tatas guruḥ bhairavam japan padma upari śiva kalaśam sthāpayet astra vārdhānīm japan īśāne svastika upari  sthāpayet
translated: Then the Guru, reciting Bhairava, should place the Śiva water pot on the lotus. Reciting the weapon mantra, he should place the weapon pot on the northeast, on a svastika.

original: tatraiśānyāmastramantreṇāstra kalaśaṃ sampūjya śivakumbhe viśeṣa pūjanaṃ kuryāt //
analyzed: tatra aiśānyām astramantreṇa astra kalaśam sampūjya śiva kumbhe viśeṣa pūjanam kuryāt
translated: There, in the northeast, having worshipped the weapon pot with the weapon mantra, he should perform the special worship in the Śiva pot.

original: aghoraṃ sāṅgaṃ sa vaktraṃ / aghoaghorīśvarīṃ ca sāṅgāṃ niṣkalaṃ ca sāṅgaṃ mṛtyuñjayaṃ sa devīkaṃ
analyzed: aghoram sa aṅgam sa vaktram ca sa aṅgām niṣkalam ca sa aṅgam mṛtyuñjayam sa devīkam
translated: The Aghora with limbs and faces, the Aghorīśvarī with limbs, the Niṣkala with limbs, the Mṛtyuñjaya with the goddess,

original: sāṅgaṃ bhairavāvaraṇaṃ vidyeyādyāvaraṇasaptakaṃ brahmyādi mātryaṣṭakaṃ kṣityādi mūrtyaṣṭakaṃ
analyzed: sa aṅgam bhairava āvaraṇam brahmī ādi mātrī aṣṭakam kṣiti ādi mūrti aṣṭakam
translated: The Bhairava Avarana with limbs, the seven Avaranas beginning with Vidyā, the group of eight Mātṛs beginning with Brahmī, the group of eight Mūrtis beginning with Kṣiti,

original: bhavādināmāṣṭakaṃ gaṇeśa sūryakumāra viṣṇu durgā kulavāgīśvarī mahātripurasundarī kubjikā śārikā🔽śāradā śrī mahārājñī jvālāmukhī siddhalakṣmyādīnmantrānsāṅgaṣaṭkānyathākālaṃ yathā śaktiḥ
analyzed: bhava ādi nāma aṣṭakam gaṇeśa sūrya kumāra viṣṇu durgā kula vāc īśvarī mahā tripurasundarī kubjikā śārikā  śāradā śrī mahārājñī jvālāmukhī siddhalakṣmī ādīn mantrān sa aṅga ṣaṭkān yathākālam yathā śaktiḥ
translated: The group of eight names beginning with Bhava, Gaṇeśa, Sūrya, Kumāra, Viṣṇu, Durgā, Kulavāgīśvarī, Mahātripurasundarī, Kubjikā, Śārikā,

original: pūjayet //
analyzed: pūjayet
translated: Śāradā, Śrī Mahārājñī, Jvālāmukhī, Siddhalakṣmī, and so on, he should worship the mantras with the six limbs as and when appropriate and to the best of his ability.

original: vāme kheṭaketi dhyānena kalaśasthaṃ devaṃ sāṅgaṃ saparivāraṃ smaret //
analyzed: vāme kheṭaka iti dhyānena kalaśa stham devam sa aṅgam sa parivāram smaret
translated: On the left, with the meditation of Kheṭaka, one should remember the deity in the pot along with the limbs and retinue.

original: oṃ mantrādhvane namaḥ // padādhvane namaḥ // varṇādhvane namaḥ // bhuvanādhvane namaḥ // tatvādhvane namaḥ //
analyzed: om mantra adhvane namaḥ pada adhvane namaḥ varṇa adhvane namaḥ bhuvana adhvane namaḥ tatva adhvane namaḥ
translated: Om, salutations to the path of mantras. Salutations to the path of words. Salutations to the path of letters. Salutations to the path of worlds. Salutations to the path of principles.

original: kalādhvane namaḥ // oṃ hāṃ nivṛttikalāyai namaḥ //
analyzed: kalādhvane namaḥ om hāṃ nivṛttikalāyai namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the path of kalas. Om Ham, salutations to the Nivritti Kala.

original: oṃ hāṃ nivṛttikalādhipataye brahmaṇe namaḥ //
analyzed: om hāṃ nivṛtti kalā adhipataye brahmaṇe namaḥ
translated: Om Ham, salutations to the lord of Nivritti Kala, Brahma.

original: oṃ hīṃ pratiṣṭhākalāyai namaḥ // oṃ hīṃ pratiṣṭhā kalādhipataye viṣṇave namaḥ // oṃ hūṃ vidyākalāyai
analyzed: om hīṃ pratiṣṭhā kalāyai namaḥ om hīṃ pratiṣṭhā kalā adhipataye viṣṇave namaḥ om hūm vidyākalāyai
translated: Om Him, salutations to the Prathishta Kala. Om Him, salutations to the lord of Prathishta Kala, Vishnu. Om Hum, salutations to the Vidy Kala.

original: namaḥ // oṃ hūṃ vidyā kalādhipataye rudrāya namaḥ // oṃ haiṃ śāntākalāyai namaḥ / oṃ haiṃ
analyzed: namaḥ om hūm vidyā kalā adhipataye rudrāya namaḥ om haiṃ śāntākalāyai namaḥ om haiṃ
translated: Salutations to the lord of Vidy Kala, Rudra. Om Hai, salutations to the Shanta Kala. Om Hai

original: śāntākalādhipataye īśvarāya namaḥ // oṃ hauṃ śāntyatītāyai namaḥ // oṃ hauṃ śāntyatītākalādhipataye
analyzed: śāntā kalā adhipataye īśvarāya namaḥ om hauṃ śānti atītāyai namaḥ om hauṃ śānti atītā kalā adhipataye
translated: Salutations to the lord of Shanta Kala, Ishvara. Om Hau, salutations to the Shantatita Kala. Om Hau, salutations to the lord of Shantatita Kala.

original: sadāśivāya namaḥ //
analyzed: sadāśivāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Sadashiva.

original: evaṃ śivakalaśaṃ saṃpūjya / astravārdhānīṃ ca pūjayet //
analyzed: evam śiva kalaśam saṃpūjya astra vārdhānīm ca pūjayet
translated: Having thus worshipped the Shiva Kalasha, one should worship the weapon and the water pot.

original: oṃ haḥ phaṭ anantaśaktaye astrāya phaṭ // oṃ namaste rudrarūpebhyo durbhedyāya pāśupatāstrāya phaṭ //
analyzed: om haḥ phaṭ anantaśaktaye astrāya phaṭ om namaḥ te rudra rūpebhyaḥ durbhedyāya pāśupatāstrāya phaṭ
translated: Om, Hum, Phat! To the endless power, to the weapon, Phat! Om, salutations to you, to the Rudra forms, to the invincible Pashupata weapon, Phat!

original: oṃ haḥ phaṭ astrāya phaṭ // oṃ phaṭ astrāya phaṭ //🔽p /
analyzed: om haḥ phaṭ astrāya phaṭ om phaṭ astrāya phaṭ  p
translated: Om, Hum, Phat! To the weapon, Phat! Om, Phat! To the weapon, Phat!

original: oṃ haḥ phaṭ jñānāstrāya haḥ phaṭ // evaṃ //
analyzed: om haḥ phaṭ jñānāstrāya haḥ phaṭ evam
translated: Om, Hum, Phat! To the knowledge weapon, Hum, Phat! Thus,

original: brahmāstrāya // brahmaśirostrāya // agnyāstrāya / lokapālāstrāya // pāśupatāstrāya // aghorāstrāya //
analyzed: brahmāstrāya brahmaśiraḥ ustrāya agnyāstrāya lokapāla astrāya pāśupatāstrāya aghora astrāya
translated: To the Brahma weapon, to the Brahma-shira weapon, to the Agni weapon, to the Lokapala weapon, to the Pashupata weapon, to the Aghora weapon,

original: divyāstrāya //
analyzed: divya astrāya
translated: To the divine weapon,

original: oṃ haḥ phaṭ sarvāstrāya haḥ phaṭ / oṃ khaḍgāya namaḥ // kheṭakāya // pāśāya // aṅkuśāya // śarāya //
analyzed: om haḥ phaṭ sarva astrāya haḥ phaṭ om khaḍgāya namaḥ kheṭakāya pāśāya aṅkuśāya śarāya
translated: Om, Hum, Phat! To all weapons, Hum, Phat! Om, salutations to the sword, to the club, to the noose, to the goad, to the arrow,

original: pinākāya // varāya // abhayāya // muṇḍāya // khaṭvāṅgāya // vīṇāyai // ḍamarave // ghaṇṭhāyai //
analyzed: pinākāya varāya abhayāya muṇḍāya khaṭvāṅgāya vīṇāyai ḍamarave ghaṇṭhāyai
translated: To the Pinaka, to the boon, to the protection, to the severed head, to the Khatvanga staff, to the veena, to the damaru drum, to the bell,

original: triśūlāya // vajrāya // daṇḍāya // paraśave // mudgarāya //
analyzed: triśūlāya vajrāya daṇḍāya paraśave mudgarāya
translated: To the trident, to the thunderbolt, to the staff, to the axe, to the mace,

original: vajrādilokapālāstrāṇi ca pūjayet //
analyzed: vajra ādi lokapāla astrāṇi ca pūjayet
translated: One should worship the weapons of the world guardians such as the thunderbolt and others.

original: tato nāḍīsandhānam / ātmano kandasthānādutthitāṃ śaktiṃ dhyātvā dvādaśāntaṃ yāvat prāptāṃ
analyzed: tatas nāḍīsandhānam kanda sthānāt utthitām śaktim dhyātvā dvādaśāntam yāvat prāptām
translated: Then, the joining of the channels. Having meditated on the power arising from the place of the bulb of one's self up to the end of the twelve, which has been attained,

original: jvālārūpāṃ dakṣiṇanāsāpuṭena nirīyadevasya vāmanāsāpuṭena praviśya / hṛdayaṃ prāpayya /
analyzed: jvālā rūpām dakṣiṇa nāsā puṭena vāma nāsā puṭena praviśya hṛdayam prāpayya
translated: The form of flame comes out from the right nostril of the deity and enters through the left nostril of the devotee, reaching the heart.

original: hṛdayātkaṇṭhatālubhrūmadhya krameṇa dvādaśāntaṃ prāpyā'mṛtaṃ gṛhītvā devasya dakṣiṇena nirīya /
analyzed: hṛdayāt kaṇṭha tālu bhrū madhya krameṇa dvādaśāntam prāpya amṛtam gṛhītvā devasya dakṣiṇena nirīya
translated: Having reached the end of the twelve psychic nerves through the heart, throat, palate, and the middle of the eyebrows, taking the nectar, it comes out from the right side of the deity.

original: evameva devī bhairavalokapālānāṃ praviśya nirgamanaṃ kṛtvā vāmena hṛdayaṃ praviśet //
analyzed: evam eva devī bhairava lokapālānām praviśya nirgamanam kṛtvā vāmena hṛdayam praviśet
translated: In the same way, the goddess enters the Bhairavas, Lokapalas, and comes out through the left side, entering the heart of the devotee.

original: iti nāḍīsandhānam //
analyzed: iti nāḍī sandhānam
translated: Thus is the union of the psychic nerves.

original: punarmantrasandhānam //
analyzed: punar mantra sandhānam
translated: Now, the union of the mantra.

original: ātmānaṃ viṣṇaulīnaṃ bhāvayet // viṣṇubrahmaṇi // brahmāṇamīśāne // taṃ kubere // taṃ vāyau // taṃ
analyzed: ātmānam viṣṇau līnam bhāvayet viṣṇu brahmaṇi brahmāṇam īśāne tam kubere tam vāyau tam
translated: One should contemplate oneself as dissolved in Vishnu, Vishnu in Brahma, Brahma in Ishana, that in Kubera, that in Vayu,

original: varuṇa / taṃ nairṛte // taṃ yame // taṃ indre // taṃ vidyāgaṇe // taṃ somarāje // taṃ meghanāde / taṃ
analyzed: varuṇa tam nairṛte tam yame tam indre tam vidyā gaṇe tam somarāje tam meghanāde tam
translated: that in Varuna, that in Nairrita, that in Yama, that in Indra, that in the group of Vidyas, that in Somakara, that in Meghnada,

original: manmathe // taṃ vikarāle // taṃ krodharāje // taṃ śikhivāhane // taṃ kapāleśe // tama'stre // taṃ netre //
analyzed: manmathe tam vikarāle tam krodharāje tam śikhivāhane tam kapāla īśe tam astre tam netre
translated: that in Manmatha, that in Vikarala, that in Krodharaja, that in Shikhivahana, that in Kapalesha, that in Astra, that in Netra,

original: taṃ kavace // taṃ śikhāyāṃ // tāṃ śirasi // tat hṛdi // taṃ devyāṃ // tāṃ parameśvare līnāṃ bhāvayet
analyzed: tam kavace tam śikhāyām tām śirasi tat hṛdi tam devyām tām parameśvare līnām bhāvayet
translated: that in Kavacha, that in Shikha, that in the head, that in the heart, that in the goddess, and that as dissolved in the Supreme Lord.

original: iti mantrasandhānam //
analyzed: iti mantra sandhānam
translated: Thus, the union of mantras.

original: atha paramīkaraṇam //
analyzed: atha paramīkaraṇam
translated: Now, the supreme consecration.

original: svahṛdayānmūlamantramuccārya / hṛtkaṇṭhatālubhrūmadhyalalāṭabrahmarandhra krameṇa akāra ukāra makāra
analyzed: sva hṛdayāt mūlamantram uccārya hṛd kaṇṭha tālu bhrū madhya lalāṭa brahmarandhra krameṇa akāra ukāra makāra
translated: Reciting the root mantra from one's heart, placing it in the heart, throat, palate, between the eyebrows, forehead, and the aperture of Brahma in sequence, with the letters A, U, and M,

original: bindvardhacandra nirodhinādanādāntaśaktivyāpinī samanā unmanāntaṃ sthāpya / dvādaśānta viśrāntimanubhūya
analyzed: bindu ardhacandra nirodhi nāda nāda anta śakti vyāpinī samanā unmanā antam sthāpya dvādaśānta viśrāntim anubhūya

translated: Upward. Salutations to Damara. Downward. Salutations to Hatakeshvara.

analyzed: vijñāpayet vibhum

translated: Om, I bow to the self-luminous one. I bow to the lord of the universe. Thus is the mouth-bath.

original: prāṇāpānau cakṣuśrotre ghrāṇaṃ manāḥ śirohastau prākṛtāvapi yadupātuṃ tatte devaḥ śivaḥ pātu //

translated: May the Lord Shiva protect you, who protects the two vital airs, the eyes, the ears, the nose, the mind, the head, and the hands, even the natural ones.

original: pāpaharaste bhagavāñcivo śubhaṃ haratu //🔽sarvabhūtagaṇā śāntyai bhavantu yatnāddhṛdayaṃ nārāyaṇaḥ pātu // svātmane śivasvarūpāya samalabhanaṃ
analyzed: pāpa haraḥ te bhagavān civo śubham haratu  sarva bhūta gaṇā śāntyai bhavantu yatnāt hṛdayam nārāyaṇaḥ pātu svātmane śiva svarūpāya
translated: May the Lord Shiva, the remover of sins, bestow auspiciousness upon you.🔽May all the hosts of beings be peaceful. May Narayana protect your heart with care.

analyzed: gandhaḥ namaḥ arghaḥ namaḥ puṣpam namaḥ
translated: To the form of Shiva, to the self, the offering of fragrance, salutations. The offering of water, salutations. The offering of flowers, salutations.

translated: For the removal of the great delusion in the forest of worldly existence, accept this nectar-like eye, this lamp, O Shiva.

original: kālāgnirudrarūpaṃ taṃ sarvāghavinisūdanam // sarvasaubhāgya jananaṃ dhūpoyaṃ śiva gṛhyatām //
analyzed: kālāgni rudra rūpam tam sarva agha vinisūdanam sarva saubhāgya jananam dhūpaḥ yam śiva gṛhyatām

original: tejo bimbasya madhyasthaṃ vartulaṃ raktavāsasam // ādityame dṛśaṃ dhyāyed bhuktimuktiphalapradam //

original: ātmanaḥ sveṣṭadevatā santoṣaṇārthaṃ dhūpadīpa saṅkalpāt siddhirastu dhūpo namaḥ dīpaṃ namaḥ //

original: gāyatryai namaḥ //
analyzed: gāyatryai namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Gayatri.

translated: Om. We meditate on the excellent light of that Savita, the impeller of our thoughts, for the attainment of our goals.
