analyzed: āvāhayāmi aham devam kṣettrapālam mahā prabhum
translated: I invoke the god, the great lord of the field.

original: kramīkīṭapataṅgeṣu vasantaṃ sarvadehinām // gṛhakṣetravanakṣettra yakṣabhūtapiśācakam //
analyzed: kramī kīṭa pataṅgeṣu vasantam sarva dehinām gṛha kṣetra vana kṣettra yakṣa bhūta piśācakam
translated: One should worship the Yakshas, Bhutas, and Pisachas,🔽The Ganas, Gandharvas, Devas, and the Lokapalas.

original: gaṇagandharva devāśca lokapālāṃśca pūjayet // baliṃ puṣpaṃ caruṃ caiva dhūpoyaṃ pratigṛhyatām //
analyzed: gaṇa gandharva devāḥ ca lokapālān ca pūjayet balim puṣpam carum ca eva dhūpaḥ yam pratigṛhyatām
translated: Accept this offering, flowers, and oblations, and this incense.🔽I invoke the one who shines with the directions, wears the sky as his garment, has three eyes, and holds a trident in his hand,

original: āvāhayāmi bhujagaistu virājamānasāśāmbaraṃ trinayanaṃ ca triśūlahastam // śyāmānanaṃ duritaduḥkhaharaṃ
analyzed: āvāhayāmi bhujagaiḥ tu virājamāna sa āśā ambaram trinayanam ca triśūla hastam śyāma ānanam durita duḥkha haram
translated: The dark-faced one, the remover of sins and sorrows,

original: svarve /śaṃkṣetreśamadbhūtataraṃ makharakṣaṇārtham //
analyzed: svarveśam kṣetreśam adbhūtataram makha rakṣaṇa artham
translated: The lord of the universe, the most auspicious, for the protection of the sacrifice.🔽I invoke Lord Shiva, the consort of Parvati,

original: āvāhayāmyahaṃ devamīśvaraṃ pārvatīpatim // vṛṣabhāsanamārūḍhaṃ nāgābharaṇabhūṣitam //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi aham devam īśvaram pārvatīpatim  vṛṣabha āsanam ārūḍham nāga ābharaṇa bhūṣitam
translated: Who is seated on a bull, adorned with serpent ornaments,

original: śuklavarṇo mahātejāḥ śuklasragdhāmabhūṣitam // baliṃ puṣpaṃ caruṃ caiva dhūpoyaṃ pratigṛhyatām //
analyzed: śukla varṇaḥ mahā tejāḥ śukla sraj dhāma bhūṣitam balim puṣpam carum ca eva dhūpaḥ yam pratigṛhyatām
translated: White in color, of great splendor, adorned with a white garland and radiance,🔽Accept this offering, flowers, and oblations, and this incense.

original: āvāhayāmyahaṃ devaṃ viṣṇuṃ vai viśvarūpiṇam // atasī puṣpasaṅkāśaṃ pītavāsasamacyutam //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi aham devam viṣṇum vai viśva rūpiṇam atasī puṣpa saṅkāśam pītavāsasam acyutam
translated: I invoke Lord Vishnu, the one who has the form of the universe,🔽Who is like the Atasi flower, wears yellow garments, and is imperishable,

original: yena masyanti govindaṃ na teṣāṃ vidyate bhayam // baliṃ //
analyzed: yena masyanti govindam na teṣām vidyate bhayam balim
translated: By whom those who meditate on Govinda have no fear.🔽Accept this offering, flowers, and oblations, and this incense.

original: āvāhayāmi surarājamahaṃ gajasthaṃ dakṣekṣavajradharamarcitacandraśubham //🔽p /
analyzed: āvāhayāmi surarājam aham gaja stham dakṣa ikṣa vajra dharam arcita candra śubham  p
translated: I invoke the king of gods, seated on an elephant, holding a sugarcane bow and a thunderbolt in his right hand, worshipped by the moon and auspicious,

original: hartraṃ ca śaktisahitaṃ paridhārayantaṃ vāme trinetraṃ mamalaṃ makharakṣaṇārtham //
analyzed: hartram ca śakti sahitam paridhārayantam vāme trinetram mamalam makha rakṣaṇa artham
translated: The destroyer, accompanied by Shakti, holding a rosary, for the protection of the sacrifice, with three eyes on the left, and a garland.

original: āvāhayāmi dahanaṃ dhṛtavedamudrāsākṣasrajaṃ śukavaraṃ nijadakṣahaste //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi dahanam dhṛta veda mudrā sa akṣa srajam śuka varam nija dakṣa haste
translated: I invoke Agni, holding a rosary and a garland in his right hand, with a parrot on his head,

original: āmegni kuṇḍasahitaṃ ca tathaiva daṇḍaṃ trikṣaṃ trilocanaparaṃ makharakṣaṇārtham //
analyzed: kuṇḍa sahitam ca tathā eva daṇḍam trikṣam trilocana param makha rakṣaṇa artham
translated: With a sacrificial pit on his left, and a staff, for the protection of the sacrifice, with three eyes and three heads.

original: āvāhayāmi yamamīśaparaṃ triśūlavajrāṅkitaṃ mahiṣapṛṣṭhagataṃ trinetram //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi yamam īśa param triśūla vajra aṅkitam mahiṣa pṛṣṭha gatam trinetram
translated: I invoke Yama, the supreme lord, marked with a trident and a thunderbolt, with three eyes, riding on a buffalo,

original: vīṇāṃ ca daṇḍa sahitāṃ paridhārayantaṃ vāme caturbhujayutaṃ makharakṣaṇārtham //
analyzed: vīṇām ca daṇḍa sahitām paridhārayantam vāme catur bhuja yutam makha rakṣaṇa artham
translated: Holding a veena with a staff in his left hand, with four arms, for the protection of the sacrifice.

original: āvāhayāmi nivṛtiṃ śaśikhaṇḍamaulipūjāparaṃ ca sṛṇi khaḍgādharaṃ svadakṣe //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi nivṛtim śaśi khaṇḍa mauli pūjā param ca sṛṇi khaḍga adharam sva dakṣe
translated: I invoke Nivriti, with a crown of the crescent moon, devoted to worship, holding a sword and a shield in his right hand,

original: vāme sa kheṭaka sa pāśa samanvitaṃ taṃ vṛṣyāsana sthitamahaṃmakharakṣaṇārtham //
analyzed: vāme tam vṛṣya āsana sthita maham makha rakṣaṇa artham
translated: With a club and a noose in his left hand, seated on a bull, for the protection of the sacrifice.

original: āvāhayāmi varuṇaṃ śaśikhaṇḍamauli pūjāparaṃ ca sṛṇikhaḍgādharaṃ svadakṣe //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi varuṇam śaśi khaṇḍa mauli pūjā param ca sṛṇi khaḍga adharam sva dakṣe
translated: I invoke Varuna, with a crown of the crescent moon, devoted to worship, holding a sword and a shield in his right hand,

original: vāme sa kheṭaka sa pāśasamanvitaṃ taṃ nakrāsanasthitamahaṃ makharakṣaṇārtham //
analyzed: vāme sa kheṭaka sa pāśa samanvitam tam nakra āsana sthitam aham makha rakṣaṇa artham
translated: On the left, holding a khaṭvāṅga and a noose, seated on a crocodile, I pay homage to him for the protection of sacrifices.🔽

original: āvāhayāmi dhṛtavāyupuṭaṃ svahasta yugmena dīkṣitamīśaparaṃ ca vāyum //🔽vāme tathākṣa sahitaṃ ca kamaṇḍaluṃ ca cañcanmṛgāsanagataṃ makharakṣaṇārtham //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi dhṛta vāyupuṭam sva hasta yugmena dīkṣitam īśa param ca vāyum  vāme tathā akṣa sahitam ca kamaṇḍalum ca cañcat mṛgāsana gatam makha rakṣaṇa artham
translated: On the left, holding a khaṭvāṅga and a noose, seated on a crocodile, I invoke the supreme wind god for the protection of the sacrifice.🔽With both hands holding a vāyupuṭa, initiated, and the supreme lord of wind,🔽On the left, holding an akṣa and a water pot, moving on a deer, I invoke the giver of wealth for the protection of the sacrifice, seated on a human vehicle,🔽Holding a wish-fulfilling gem in his hand, and a rosary,

original: āvāhayāmi dhanadaṃ naravāhanasthaṃ cintāmaṇiṃ nijakareṇa tathākṣasūttram // siṃhadhvajena sahitaṃ
analyzed: āvāhayāmi dhanadam naravāhana stham cintāmaṇim nija kareṇa tathā akṣasūttram siṃhadhvajena sahitam
translated: Along with a lion banner,

original: śaśipustakaṃ ca vibhrantamīśvara paraṃ makharakṣaṇārtham //🔽āvāhayāmi śaśikhaṇḍa kirīṭamīśaṃmakṣaṃ triśūlamapi dakṣabhuje vahantam //
analyzed: śaśi pustakam ca vibhrantam īśvara param makha rakṣaṇa artham  āvāhayāmi śaśi khaṇḍa kirīṭam īśam makṣam triśūlam api dakṣa bhuje vahantam
translated: Holding a moon and a book, I invoke the supreme lord for the protection of the sacrifice.🔽I invoke the lord with a crest of the moon's digit, holding a rosary and a trident in his right hand,

original: vā liṅgadarpaṇa karaṃ ca tathaiva vāme go vāhanaṃ trinayanaṃ makharakṣaṇārtham //
analyzed: vā liṅga darpaṇa karam ca tathā eva vāme go vāhanam tri nayanam makha rakṣaṇa artham
translated: And a liṅga and a mirror in his left hand, riding a bull, with three eyes, for the protection of the sacrifice.

original: āvāhayāmi kamalāsanasaṃsthitaṃ taṃ mudrāṃ śrūteḥ parivahantamathākṣasūttram //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi kamalāsana saṃsthitam tam mudrām śrūteḥ parivahantam atha akṣasūttram
translated: I invoke him seated on a lotus, holding the mudrā of the Vedas, and a rosary,

original: daṇḍaṃ kamaṇḍalumatho satataṃ vahantaṃ brahmāṇamīśvaraparaṃ makharakṣaṇārtham //
analyzed: daṇḍam kamaṇḍalum atho satatam vahantam brahmāṇam īśvara param makha rakṣaṇa artham
translated: Constantly carrying a staff and a water pot, Brahmā, the supreme lord, for the protection of the sacrifice.

original: āvāhayāmi satataṃ nijadakṣabhāge vibhrantamakṣasahitaṃ ca phalaṃ ca viṣṇum //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi satatam nija dakṣa bhāge vibhrantam akṣa sahitam ca phalam ca viṣṇum
translated: I constantly invoke Vishnu, holding the rosary in his right hand and the fruit in his left, on my right side, for the protection of the sacrifice.

original: vā liṅgasaṃyutamatho musulaṃ ca vāme kurmāsanaṃ śivāparaṃ makharakṣaṇārtham //
analyzed: vā liṅga saṃyutam atho musulam ca vāme kurma āsanam śiva aparam makha rakṣaṇa artham
translated: And on the left, I place the ploughshare along with the Linga and the Musula, for the protection of the sacrifice, with the tortoise as the seat and Shiva as the other deity.

original: āvāhanamatho kuryādgrahāṇāmanu pūrvaśaḥ // āvāhitāgrahāssarve hyādityādyāśśatena va //
analyzed: āvāhanam atho kuryāt grahāṇām anu pūrvaśas āvāhitā grahāḥ sarve hi āditya ādyāḥ śatena
translated: Then one should invoke the planets in the proper order. All the planets beginning with the Sun, when invoked, are present.

original: āvāhayāmi dinanāthamahaṃ vahantaṃ dakṣekṣasūttramatha dhūmrapadaṃ dhvajaṃ ca //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi dinanātham aham vahantam dakṣa ikṣa sūttram atha dhūmrapadam dhvajam ca
translated: I invoke the Sun, holding the rosary in his right hand, and the Dhūmra pada and the flag.

original: saptāśugaṃ karayugena ca rasmipuñjaṃ tryakṣaṃ trinetraśaraṇaṃ makharakṣaṇārtham //
analyzed: sapta āśu gam kara yugena ca rasmi puñjam tryakṣam trinetra śaraṇam makha rakṣaṇa artham
translated: With his two hands, he holds the seven arrows and a mass of rays. I seek refuge in the three-eyed one for the protection of the sacrifice.

original: āvāhayāmi śaśinaṃ paridhārayantaṃ dakṣekṣasūtramathadhūmrapadaṃ dhvajaṃ ca //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi śaśinam paridhārayantam dakṣa ikṣa sūtra matha dhūmra padam dhvajam ca
translated: I invoke the Moon, holding the rosary in his right hand, and the Dhūmra pada and the flag.

original: lagnaṃ mṛge karayugena ca raśmipuñjatryakṣaṃ trinetraśaraṇaṃ makharakṣaṇārtham //
analyzed: lagnam mṛge kara yugena ca raśmi puñja tryakṣam trinetra śaraṇam makha rakṣaṇa artham
translated: With his two hands, he holds a mass of rays. I seek refuge in the three-eyed one for the protection of the sacrifice.

original: āvāhayāmi dharaṇī tanayaṃ vahantaṃ dakṣekṣasūttra valayaṃ śikhivāhanastham //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi dharaṇī tanayam vahantam dakṣa ikṣa sūttra valayam śikhi vāhana stham
translated: I invoke the son of Earth, holding the rosary in his right hand, seated on a peacock, with a bracelet.

original: vāmekamaṇḍaludharaṃ dhṛtaraktavarṇaṃ tryakṣaṃ trinetraśaraṇaṃ makharakṣaṇārtham //
analyzed: vāma eka maṇḍalu dharam dhṛta rakta varṇam tryakṣam trinetra śaraṇam makha rakṣaṇa artham
translated: Holding a water pot in one hand, with a red complexion, three eyes, a refuge for the three eyes, for the protection of the sacrifice.

original: āvāhayāmi sitamātu kirīṭahāraṃ dakṣekṣasūtravalayaṃ garuḍāsanastham //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi sita mātu kirīṭa hāram dakṣa ikṣa sūtra valayam garuḍa āsana stham
translated: I invoke the white mother, wearing a crown and necklace, holding a rosary and bracelet in the right hand, seated on Garuda.

original: vāme kamaṇḍaludharaṃ sitavarṇaramyaṃ tryakṣaṃ trinetraśaraṇaṃ makharakṣaṇārtham //
analyzed: vāme kamaṇḍalu dharam sita varṇa ramyam tryakṣam trinetra śaraṇam makha rakṣaṇa artham
translated: Holding a water pot in the left hand, beautiful with a white complexion, three eyes, a refuge for the three eyes, for the protection of the sacrifice.

original: āvāhayāmi dhṛtameva guruṃ surāṇāṃ dakṣekṣasūttravalayaṃ gajavāhanastham //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi dhṛtam eva gurum surāṇām dakṣa ikṣa sūttra valayam gaja vāhana stham
translated: I invoke the guru of the gods, holding a rosary and bracelet in the right hand, seated on an elephant.

original: vāmekamaṇḍaludharaṃ dhṛtapītavarṇaṃ tryakṣaṃ trinetraśaraṇaṃ makharakṣaṇārtham //
analyzed: vāma eka maṇḍalu dharam dhṛta pīta varṇam tryakṣam trinetra śaraṇam makha rakṣaṇa artham
translated: Holding a water pot in the left hand, holding a yellow color, three eyes, a refuge for the three eyes, for the protection of the sacrifice.

original: āvāhayāmi kavimeśśvararūpamugraṃ dakṣekṣasūttravalayaṃ kapivāhanastham //🔽p /
analyzed: āvāhayāmi kavi meśūvara rūpam ugram dakṣa ikṣa sūttra valayam kapi vāhana stham  p
translated: I invoke the form of the fierce lord of poets, holding a rosary and bracelet in the right hand, seated on a monkey.

original: vāme kamaṇḍaludharaṃ dhṛtaśuklavarṇaṃ tryakṣaṃ trinetraśaraṇaṃ makharakṣaṇārtham //
analyzed: vāme kamaṇḍalu dharam dhṛta śukla varṇam tryakṣam trinetra śaraṇam makha rakṣaṇa artham
translated: Holding a water pot in the left hand, holding a white color, three eyes, a refuge for the three eyes, for the protection of the sacrifice.

original: āvāhayāmi śanimantakarūpamugraṃ dakṣekṣa sūtravalayaṃ naravāhanastham //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi śanimantaka rūpam ugram dakṣa ikṣa sūtra valayam naravāhana stham
translated: I invoke the fierce form of Saturn, holding a rosary and bracelet in the right hand, seated on a human vehicle.

original: vāme tathaiva kalaśaṃ paridhārayantaṃ tryakṣatrinetraśaraṇaṃ makharakṣaṇārtham //
analyzed: vāme tathā eva kalaśam paridhārayantam tryakṣa trinetra śaraṇam makha rakṣaṇa artham
translated: And on the left, holding a pot in the same way, with three eyes and three eyes, for the protection of the sacrifice.

original: āvāhayāmi dhṛtakuṇḍalamālikaṃ taṃ śīrṣākṛtiṃ kṛtasvadhāharaṇaṃ ca rāhum //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi dhṛta kuṇḍala mālikam tam śīrṣa ākṛtim kṛta svadhā haraṇam ca rāhum
translated: I invoke Rahu, who wears earrings and garlands, who has the shape of a head, and who has taken his own food.

original: siṃhāsanasthita satīvakarālavaktraṃ tryakṣaṃ trinetraśaraṇaṃ makharakṣaṇārtham //
analyzed: siṃhāsana sthita satīva karāla vaktram tryakṣam trinetra śaraṇam makha rakṣaṇa artham
translated: Sitting on a lion throne, with a face terrible like a sati, with three eyes and three eyes, for the protection of the sacrifice.

original: āvāhayāmi bhujagairdaśabhissametaṃ dakṣekṣasaṃhitamathokalaśaṃ ca vāme //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi bhujagaiḥ daśabhiḥ sametam dakṣa ikṣa saṃhitam atha u kalaśam ca vāme
translated: I invoke him, who is accompanied by ten serpents, with the sun on the right and the pot on the left.

original: ketuṃ tamonikarakṛṣṇatanuṃ sudīrghaṃ tryakṣaṃ trinetraśaraṇaṃ makharakṣaṇārtam //
analyzed: ketum tamaḥ nikara kṛṣṇa tanum su dīrgham tryakṣam trinetra śaraṇam makha rakṣaṇa ārtam
translated: The banner, whose body is dark like a mass of darkness, who is very tall, with three eyes and three eyes, for the protection of the sacrifice.

original: āvāhayāmyahaṃ brahmarūpaṃ cotthānapādikam // dhrūvaṃ pakṣaśarīrasthaṃ raktāṅgamacalaṃ prabhum //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi aham brahma rūpam ca utthāna pādikam  dhrūvam pakṣa śarīra stham rakta aṅgam acalam prabhum
translated: I invoke the Brahman form, which is the feet of creation, the firm one, situated in the body of the wings, with red limbs, immovable, the lord.

original: āvāhayāmyahaṃ devamagastyaṃ deva sevitam // viṣṇurūpadharaṃ nityamugrarūpadharaṃ prabhum //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi aham devam agastyam deva sevitam viṣṇu rūpa dharam nityam ugra rūpa dharam prabhum
translated: I invoke the god Agastya, who is served by the gods, who always bears the form of Vishnu, the lord who bears a fierce form.

original: āvāhayā śaśikhaṇḍakirīṭamīśaṃ śrīsatkapālinamupātu kapālamālamālam //
analyzed: āvāhaya śaśi khaṇḍa kirīṭam īśam śrī sat kapālinam upātu kapāla mālam ālam
translated: I invoke the lord, who is adorned with a crest of the moon's digit, who wears an auspicious skull, and who is protected by a garland of skulls.

original: pañcānanaṃ trinayanaṃ daśabāhuramyaṃ candrārdhacūḍaśaraṇaṃ makharakṣaṇārtham //
analyzed: pañca ānanam tri nayanam daśa bāhu ramyam candra ardhacūḍa śaraṇam makha rakṣaṇa artham
translated: The five-faced, three-eyed, ten-armed beautiful one, with the crescent moon on the head, for the protection of the sacrifice,

original: āvāhayāmi śikhivāhana bhairavaṃ taṃ rakta prabhaṃ lalitabāla kapālamālam // pañcānanaṃ trinayanaṃ //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi śikhivāhana bhairavam tam rakta prabham lalita bāla kapāla mālam pañcānanam trinayanam
translated: I invoke that Bhairava, red in color, with a garland of skulls, the beautiful young one, the five-faced, three-eyed one, for the sake of the sacrifice.

original: āvāhayāmi navameghanibhaṃ prabhābhistaṃ krodharājamamalaṃ sakapālamālam //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi nava megha nibham prabhābhiḥ tam krodharājam amalam sa kapāla mālam
translated: I invoke the stainless Krodharaja, resembling fresh clouds, with garlands of skulls,

original: pañcānanaṃ //
analyzed: pañca ānanam
translated: the five-faced one.

original: āvāhayāmi vikarālamatheśa mūrtiṃ vahniprabhaṃ lalitabālakapālamālam // pañcānanaṃ //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi vikarālam atha īśa mūrtim vahni prabham lalita bāla kapāla mālam pañcānanam
translated: I invoke the form of Atesa, very terrible, with the brilliance of fire, with a garland of skulls, the beautiful young one, the five-faced one.

original: āvāhayāmi bhagavantamatheśa mūrtiṃ taṃ manmathaṃ lalitabālakapālamālam // pañcānanaṃ //🔽āvāhayāmi dhṛtadhūmraśarīrakāntiṃ taṃ meghanādamamalaṃ sakapālamālam // pañcānanaṃ //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi bhagavantam atha īśa mūrtim tam manmatham lalita bāla kapāla mālam pañcānanam  āvāhayāmi dhṛta dhūmra śarīra kāntim tam meghanādam amalam sa kapāla mālam pañcānanam
translated: I invoke the revered form of Atesa, Manmatha, with a garland of skulls, the beautiful young one, the five-faced one.🔽I invoke the one who holds the beauty of a smoky body, the stainless Megha nada, with a garland of skulls, the five-faced one.

original: āvāhayā dhṛtasomanibhaṃ prabhābhistaṃ somarājamamalaṃ sakapālamālam // pañcānanaṃ //
analyzed: āvāhaya dhṛta soma nibham prabhābhiḥ tam somarājam amalam sa kapāla mālam pañcānanam
translated: I invoke the one who holds the brilliance of the moon, the stainless So maraja, with a garland of skulls, the five-faced one.

original: āvāhayāmi sitaratna nibhaṃ ca vidyārājaṃ virājita sirastha kapālamālam // pañcānanaṃ //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi sitaratna nibham ca vidyārājam virājita sirastha kapāla mālam pañcānanam
translated: I invoke the knowledge king resembling white jewels, shining with a garland of skulls on the head, the five-faced one.

original: āvāhayāmi vasucandrabhujaṃ maheśaṃ svacchandamacchamaṇiśubhraparātmarūpam //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi vasu candra bhujam maheśam svacchandam accha maṇi śubhra parātma rūpam
translated: I invoke Mahesha, the arm of Vasuchandra, the form of the pure, self-willed, beautiful gem, the supreme self.

original: rudrāsanaṃ trinayanaṃ śaśikhaṇḍajūṭaṃ pañcānanaṃ paramakāraṇamaprameyam //
analyzed: rudrāsanam trinayanam śaśi khaṇḍa jūṭam pañcānanam parama kāraṇam aprameyam
translated: The seat of Rudra, with three eyes, a crown of the crescent moon, five faces, the supreme cause, immeasurable.

original: tripañcanayanaṃ devamiti bhairavīṃ vismite kṣaṇāntaṃ yāvat //
analyzed: tri pañca nayanam devam iti bhairavīm vismite kṣaṇa antam yāvat
translated: The god with three or five eyes, thus the astonished Bhairavi, for a moment.

original: viśvaikarūpaviśvātmanviśvasargādikāraṇam // paraprakāśavapuṣaṃ stumaḥ svacchandabhairavam //
translated: The form of the universe, the soul of the universe, the cause of the creation etc. of the universe, we praise the self-willed Bhairava, whose body is the supreme light.

original: viśvātītaṃ viśvamayaṃ bhairavāṣṭakasaṃyutam // svaśāntaṃ niṣkalaṃ śuddhaṃ sarvavyāpi nirañjanam //
translated: Beyond the universe, full of the universe, accompanied by the group of eight Bhairavas, self-pacified, partless, pure, all-pervading, free from impurities.

original: cidboddhānandagahanaṃ tejaḥ sarvāśrayaṃ bhaje // namastasmai hyaghorāya ghoraghoratarātmane //
analyzed: cit boddhā ānanda gahanam tejaḥ sarva āśrayam bhaje namaḥ tasmai hi aghorāya ghora ghoratara ātmane
translated: I worship the essence of consciousness, knowledge and bliss, the light, the support of all. Salutations to that Aghora, whose nature is more terrible than the terrible.

original: utpattisthiti saṃhāralayānu grahahetave // āvāhayāmyahaṃ devi durge cāsura pūjite //
analyzed: utpatti sthiti saṃhāra laya anu graha hetave āvāhayāmi aham devi durge ca asura pūjite
translated: To the cause of the perception of creation, sustenance, dissolution and merger, O Goddess, I invoke you, Durga, worshipped by the demons.

original: varāṅganāvaraṃ dehi dharmakāmārtha siddhaye // śaṅkhacakragadākhaḍgā pāśāṅkuśadhanuśśarān //
analyzed: vara aṅganā varam dehi dharma kāma artha siddhaye śaṅkha cakra gadā khaḍgā pāśa aṅkuśa dhanuḥ śarān
translated: Grant me the boon of the best of women for the accomplishment of dharma, kama and artha. The conch, discus, mace, sword, noose, goad, bow and arrows,

original: kramādaṣṭabhujāṃ devīṃ durgāṃ durgati nāśinīm // idamarghyaṃ ca pādyaṃ ca dhūpoyaṃ pratigṛhyatām //
analyzed: kramāt aṣṭa bhujām devīm durgām durgati nāśinīm idam arghyam ca pādyam ca dhūpaḥ yam pratigṛhyatām
translated: The Goddess Durga, the destroyer of all difficulties, with eight arms, in due order.🔽Please accept this Arghya, water for washing the feet, and this incense.

original: āvāhayāmyahaṃ durgāṃ śūlacakrāsisāyakān //🔽p / 🔽vibhratīṃ ca dhanuḥ śaṅkhakheṭatarjanikā makhe // āvāhayāmyahaṃ devīṃ pārvatīṃ varadāmumām //
analyzed: āvāhayāmi aham durgām śūla cakra asi sāyakān  p  vibhratīm ca dhanuḥ śaṅkha kheṭa tarjanikāḥ makhe  āvāhayāmi aham devīm pārvatīm vara dām umām
translated: I invoke the Goddess Durga, holding a spear, discus, sword, arrow,🔽bow, conch, club, and threatening mudra in the sacrifice.🔽I invoke the Goddess Parvati, the bestower of boons, Uma,🔽the beloved wife of Shiva, with a beautiful body, and the enhancer of prosperity.

original: harasya dayitāṃ bhāryāṃ cārvāṅgīṃ bhūtivardhinīm // ehi devi jagannāthe mīnā hṛdayanandini //
analyzed: harasya dayitām bhāryām cāru aṅgīm bhūti vardhinīm  ehi devi jagannāthe mīnā hṛdaya nandini
translated: Come, O Goddess, the Lord of the universe, the delighter of the heart of the fish.

original: pārvati varade saumye nityaṃ bhaktajanapriye //
analyzed: pārvati vara de saumye nityam bhakta jana priye
translated: O Parvati, the bestower of boons, the gentle one, always dear to devotees.

original: idamarghyaṃ ca pādyaṃ ca dhūpoyaṃ pratigṛhyatām // āvāhayāmyahaṃ devīṃ śārikāṃ parameśvarīm //
analyzed: idam arghyam ca pādyam ca dhūpaḥ yam pratigṛhyatām  āvāhayāmi aham devīm śārikām parameśvarīm
translated: Please accept this Arghya, water for washing the feet, and this incense. I invoke the Goddess Sharika, the Supreme Goddess,

original: kārikāṃ sarvasiddhīnāmasminyajñe manohare // āvāhayāmyahaṃ devīṃ śāradāṃ varadāṃ makhe //
analyzed: kārikām sarva siddhīnām asmin yajñe manohare  āvāhayāmi aham devīm śāradām vara dām makhe
translated: the bestower of all accomplishments in this delightful sacrifice. I invoke the Goddess Sharada, the bestower of boons, in the sacrifice,

original: śāṇḍile nārcitāṃ nityaṃ śrīśailasthāṃ ca ṣaḍbhujām // āvāhayāmyahaṃ devīṃ rājñīṃ
analyzed: śāṇḍile na arcitām nityam śrīśaila sthām ca ṣaḍbhujām āvāhayāmi aham devīm rājñīm
translated: always worshipped by the Shandila clan, residing on Mount Shree, with six arms. I invoke the Goddess Rajni,

original: rājyapradāyinīm //
analyzed: rājya pradāyinīm
translated: the bestower of kingdoms.

original: bhūteśvarārdha dehasthāṃ siṃhāsana kṛtasthitim // āvāhayāmyahaṃ devī mahātripurasundarīm //
analyzed: bhūteśvara ardha deha sthām siṃhāsana kṛta sthitim āvāhayāmi aham devī mahā tripurasundarīm
translated: I invoke the Goddess Mahātripurasundarī, who resides in half the body of the Lord of Beings, seated on the lion throne.

original: asminneva mahāyajñe kāmeśvarasamanvitām // āvāhayāmyahaṃ devīṃ bhītāṃ bhagavatīṃ makhe //
analyzed: asmin eva mahā yajñe kāmeśvara samanvitām āvāhayāmi aham devīm bhītām bhagavatīm makhe
translated: In this great sacrifice, I invoke the Goddess, the fearful Bhagavatī, accompanied by Kāmeśvara, in the sacrificial arena.

original: śīdhupātrakarāṃ hāra bhūṣaṇāṃ haṃsarūpiṇīm // āvāhayāmyahaṃ devīṃ lakṣmīṃ sarvasamṛddhidām //
analyzed: śīdhu pātra karām hāra bhūṣaṇām haṃsa rūpiṇīm āvāhayāmi aham devīm lakṣmīm sarva samṛddhi dām
translated: I invoke the Goddess Lakṣmī, the bestower of all prosperity, who holds a wine cup in her hand, is adorned with necklaces, and has the form of a swan.

original: padmāsanāṃ padmanābhavakṣasthalasamāśrayām // āvāhayāmyahaṃ devīṃ bhadrakālīṃ maheśvarīm //
analyzed: padma āsanām padmanābha vakṣa sthala samāśrayām āvāhayāmi aham devīm bhadrakālīm maheśvarīm
translated: I invoke the Goddess Maheśvarī Bhadrakālī, who is seated on a lotus, and resides on the chest of the lotus-born one (Brahmā).

original: bhadraṅkarī matrayajñe meghatulya prabhānvitām // āvāhayāmyahaṃ devīṃ dakṣiṇāṃ kālikā parām //
analyzed: bhadraṅkarī matra yajñe megha tulya prabhā anvitām āvāhayāmi aham devīm dakṣiṇām kālikā parām
translated: In the sacrificial rite, I invoke the Goddess Dakṣiṇā Kālikā, who is like a cloud in radiance and brings about auspiciousness.

original: mahāmegha prabhāṃ ghorāṃ mahākālasamanvitām //
analyzed: mahā megha prabhām ghorām mahākāla samanvitām
translated: I invoke the terrible Goddess Mahākālī, who has the radiance of a great cloud and is accompanied by Mahākāla.

original: tripañcanetraṃ śaravaktramābhyaṃ sampūrṇacandrārdhadharūpamīśam //
analyzed: tri pañca netram śara vaktram ābhyam sampūrṇa candra ardha dha rūpam īśam
translated: The Lord has three or five eyes, a face like a deer, a form with the crescent moon,🔽Holding the crescent moon on his head, with his left hands he holds a beautiful bell, the boon, and a pestle,

original: candrārdhamauliṃ dadhataṃ tu vāmairbhujaiḥ sughaṇṭābhayamudgarāṃśca // pāśaṃśaraṃ sanmahatīṃ ca
analyzed: candra ardha maulim dadhatam tu vāmaiḥ bhujaiḥ su ghaṇṭā abhaya mudgarān ca pāśam śaram sat mahatīm ca
translated: A noose, an arrow, and a great

original: daṇḍakhaṭvāṅgavīṇāḍamarūṃśca tadvat //🔽p /
analyzed: daṇḍa khaṭvāṅga vīṇā ḍamarūn ca tadvat  p
translated: The staff, the skull-topped staff, the lute, and the small drum, likewise.

original: khaḍgāṃvaraṃ cāṅkuśavajramastraṃ muṇḍaṃ tathā kheṭakadhāriṇaṃ ca // savyaiḥ kuṭhāraṃ ca
analyzed: khaḍgān varam ca aṅkuśa vajram astram muṇḍam tathā kheṭaka dhāriṇam ca savyaiḥ kuṭhāram ca
translated: The sword, the goad, the thunderbolt weapon, the severed head, and the club-bearer,

original: dhanustriśūlaṃ sūryaprabhākoṭi jitaprakāśam //🔽tathābhayaṃ vāma gayā ca devyā yuktaṃ mahāvṛścikahārabhūṣiṇam // rudrāsanasthaṃ kamalasya madhye
analyzed: dhanuḥ triśūlam sūrya prabhā koṭi jita prakāśam  tathā abhayam vāma gayā ca devyā yuktam mahā vṛścika hāra bhūṣiṇam rudra āsana stham kamalasya madhye
translated: With the right, the axe, the bow, and the trident, surpassing the radiance of a crore of suns.🔽Likewise, the boon-granting gesture, the rosary, and the goddess, adorned with a necklace of great scorpions,

original: devādhidevaṃ khalu cintayāmi //
analyzed: deva adhidevam khalu cintayāmi
translated: I contemplate the lord of gods, seated on Rudra's seat, in the middle of the lotus.

original: etā devatā āvāhayiṣyāmi oṃ āvāhaya //
analyzed: etāḥ devatāḥ āvāhayiṣyāmi om āvāhaya
translated: I shall invoke these deities. Om, invoke!

original: apasarpantu te bhūtā ityādi // oṃ recakaṃ oṃ pūrakaṃ oṃ kumbhakaṃ / śanaiśśanairūdhvarecakaṃ
analyzed: apasarpantu te bhūtāḥ ityādi om recakam om pūrakam om kumbhakam śanais śanais ūdhva recakam
translated: Let the spirits depart, etc. Om, exhalation, Om, inhalation, Om, retention. Slowly, slowly, upward exhalation,

original: kuryāt //
analyzed: kuryāt
translated: one should perform.

original: tatostramantreṇa pādyapātraṃ //
analyzed: tatas ustra mantreṇa pādya pātram
translated: Then, with the weapon mantra, the water for washing the feet vessel.🔽With saffron, aguru, musk, sandalwood, tagara, and priyangu,

original: kuṅkumāgurukuraṅganābhijācandanena tagarapriyaṅgubhiḥ // gandhatoya vidhimevamabhyudhvaḥ saṅkarārcana
analyzed: kuṅkuma aguru kuraṅga nābhijā candanena tagara priyaṅgubhiḥ gandha toya vidhim evam abhyudhvaḥ saṅkara arcana
translated: having thus bathed with fragrant water, in the rite of worshipping Sankara,

original: vidhāvanu kramāt // mahāgaṇapataye kumārāyetyādibhyaḥ pādyaṃ namaḥ //
analyzed: vidhau anu kramāt mahāgaṇapataye kumārāya ityādibhyaḥ pādyam namaḥ
translated: in due order, to Mahāgaṇapati, Kumāra, and others, water for washing the feet, salutations.

original: pādyaśeṣaṃ nivārayet // punaḥ phaḍastrāya phaṭ // āpaḥ kṣīraṃ kuśāgrāṇi ghṛtaṃ ca dadhitaṇḍulāḥ
analyzed: pādya śeṣam nivārayet punar phaṭ astrāya phaṭ āpaḥ kṣīram kuśa agrāṇi ghṛtam ca dadhi taṇḍulāḥ
translated: One should stop the remaining water for washing the feet. Again, Phaṭ to the weapon, Phaṭ. Water, milk, tips of kuśa grass, ghee, curd, rice grains,

original: yavāssiddhārthakāśceti hyarghoṣṭāṅgaḥ prakīrtitaḥ //
analyzed: yavāḥ siddhārthakāḥ ca iti hi arghoṣṭāṅgaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: Yava grains, and white mustard seeds - this is declared to be the eight-constituent Arghya.

original: svāṃ svāṃ somāya namaḥ jalaṃ //
analyzed: svāṃ svāṃ somāya namaḥ jalam
translated: One's own to Soma, salutations. Water.

original: oṃ hūṃ vāgīśvari vākprade sarasvatyai namaḥ kṣīraṃ / oṃ jrīṃ sāvitri pāpabhakṣiṇi sāvitryai namaḥ
analyzed: om   vāgīśvari vāc prade sarasvatyai namaḥ kṣīram om jrīṃ sāvitri pāpa bhakṣiṇi sāvitryai namaḥ
translated: Om Hūṃ to Vāgīśvarī, the giver of speech, salutations to Sarasvatī. Milk. Om Jṛṃ to Sāvitrī, the devourer of sins, salutations to Sāvitrī.

original: darbhān // aiṃ trijaṭordhvapiṅgalāya rudrāya namaḥ sarṣapān //
analyzed: darbhān aim trijaṭā ūrdhva piṅgalāya rudrāya namaḥ sarṣapān
translated: Darbha grass. Aiṃ to the three-braided, upward-streaming, tawny-colored Rudra, salutations. White mustard seeds.

original: oṃ tatsadyo pitṛbhyo namaḥ tilān //
analyzed: om tat sadyas pitṛbhyaḥ namaḥ tilān
translated: Om Tat Sadyaḥ Pitṛbhyaḥ, salutations. Sesame seeds.

original: oṃ namo viṣṇave surapataye mahābalāya namaḥ puṣpaṃ // yaṃ raṃ laṃ vaṃ sarvottamadravebhyo namaḥ
analyzed: om namaḥ viṣṇave surapataye mahābalāya namaḥ puṣpam yaṃ raṃ laṃ vaṃ sarva uttama dravebhyaḥ namaḥ
translated: Om salutations to Viṣṇu, the lord of gods, to the greatly powerful one, salutations. Flowers. Yaṃ Raṃ Laṃ Vaṃ to all the best liquids, salutations.

original: sarvadravyān //
analyzed: sarva dravyān
translated: All the substances.

original: bhagavantaḥ arghyaṃ // mahāgaṇapate kumāra ityādayaḥ //🔽p /
analyzed: bhagavantaḥ arghyam mahāgaṇapate kumāraḥ ityādayaḥ  p
translated: O venerable ones, the Arghya. To Mahāgaṇapati, Kumāra, and others.

original: idaṃ vorghyaṃ namaḥ //
analyzed: idam vaḥ ūrghyam namaḥ
translated: This Arghya, salutations.

original: mahāgaṇapataye kumārāya ityādityaḥ samālabhavaṃ gandho namaḥ // mahāgaṇapataye kumārāya ityādityaḥ argho
analyzed: mahāgaṇapataye kumārāya iti ādityaḥ gandhaḥ namaḥ mahāgaṇapataye kumārāya iti ādityaḥ arghaḥ
translated: To Mahāgaṇapati, Kumāra, and others, I apply the Āditya (sun) ointment, salutations. To Mahāgaṇapati, Kumāra, and others, the Arghya.

original: namaḥ puṣpaṃ namaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ puṣpam namaḥ
translated: Salutations. Flowers, salutations.

original: etābhyo devatābhyaḥ dhūpo namaḥ dīpaṃ namaḥ //
analyzed: etābhyaḥ devatābhyaḥ dhūpaḥ namaḥ dīpam namaḥ
translated: To these deities, salutations to incense. Salutations to the lamp.

original: etābhyo devatābhyaḥ vāso namaḥ /
analyzed: etābhyaḥ devatābhyaḥ vāsaḥ namaḥ
translated: To these deities, salutations to the garment.

original: etāsāṃ devatānāmarghyadānādyarcanavidhiḥ sarvaḥ paripūrṇostu //
analyzed: etāsām devatānām arghya dāna ādi arcana vidhiḥ sarvaḥ
translated: May all the worship of these deities, including the offering of arghya, be fully accomplished.

original: phaṭ astrāya phaṭ //
analyzed: phaṭ astrāya phaṭ
translated: Phaṭ to the weapon, phaṭ.

original: etābhyo devatābhya apośānaṃ namaḥ // ācamanīyaṃ namaḥ //
analyzed: etābhyaḥ devatābhyaḥ apośānam namaḥ ācamanīyam namaḥ
translated: To these deities, salutations to the water for rinsing the mouth. Salutations to the water for sipping.

original: etābhyo devatābhyo dakṣiṇāyai tilahiraṇyarajata niṣkaraṇaṃ ca dāni / etā devatāḥ sa dakṣiṇānena
analyzed: etābhyaḥ devatābhyaḥ dakṣiṇāyai tila hiraṇya rajata niṣkaraṇam ca etāḥ devatāḥ sa dakṣiṇā anena
translated: To these deities, the dakṣiṇā of sesamum seeds, gold, and silver coins is given. May these deities, along with the dakṣiṇā,

original: prīyantāṃ prītāsantu //
analyzed: prīyantām prītāḥ asantu
translated: be pleased. May they be pleased.

original: apasavyena tilāmbhasā śivagotra pūrvaṃ pitṛṇāṃ śivapadaprāptyai śivaḥ prītostu //🔽vitāna ghaṇṭhādhvajacchatra cāmarādarśanṛttagītādi ratnadīpādikaṃ datvā //
analyzed: apasavyena tila ambhasā śiva gotra pūrvam pitṛṇām śiva pada prāptyai śivaḥ prītostu  vitāna ghaṇṭhā dhvaja chatra cāmara ādarśa nṛtta gīta ādi ratna dīpa ādikam
translated: With the right hand, with sesamum seeds and water, first for the ancestors, for attaining Śiva's abode, may Śiva be pleased.🔽Having given the canopy, bell, flag, umbrella, chowries, and the like, dance, singing, and so on, jewels, lamps, and so on,

original: saindhavavaṭikādibhiḥ pūrṇapātraṃ sthāpayitvā vijñaptiṃ kuryāt //
analyzed: saindhava vaṭikā ādibhiḥ pūrṇapātram sthāpayitvā vijñaptim kuryāt
translated: having placed the full vessel with rock salt, betel nut, and so on, one should make a request.

original: yathā //🔽bhoḥ bhoḥ gaṇeśvarasthānaṃ nirvighnaṃ kuru sāmpratam //
analyzed: yathā  bhoḥ bhoḥ gaṇeśvara sthānam nirvighnam kuru sāmpratam
translated: As follows:🔽O, O lord of the Gaṇas, make this place free from obstacles now.

original: harārcanaṃ kariṣyāmi paratratrāṇa hetave //
analyzed: hara arcanam kariṣyāmi paratra trāṇa hetave
translated: I shall perform the worship of Śiva for the sake of protection in this world and the next.

original: bhagavanto grahāḥ sarve yenye copa grahāmatāḥ // te sarve sannidhānaṃ me kurvantāṃ vighnaśāntaye //
analyzed: bhagavantaḥ grahāḥ sarve yena ye ca upa te sarve sannidhānam me kurvantām vighna śāntaye
translated: may all of you be present for me to remove obstacles.🔽 O Indra, by you in this direction, for the sake of removing obstacles,

original: bhoḥ bhoḥ indratvayāsvasyāṃ diśi vighnopaśāntaye // sāvadhānena karmāntaṃ bhavitavyaṃ śivājñayā //
analyzed: bhoḥ bhoḥ indra tvayā svasyām diśi vighna upaśāntaye sa avadhānena karma antam bhavitavyam śiva ājñayā
translated: with full attention, the end of the ritual should be accomplished by the command of Shiva.

original: bhoḥ bhoḥ āgne // bhoḥ bhoryama // bhoḥ nairṛte // bhoḥ varuṇa // bhoḥ bhoḥ vāyo // bhoḥ kuvīra // bhoḥ
analyzed: bhoḥ bhoḥ āgne bhoḥ bhoḥ yamaiḥ bhoḥ nairṛte bhoḥ varuṇa bhoḥ bhoḥ vāyo bhoḥ kuvīra bhoḥ
translated: O Agni, O Yama, O Nairrita, O Varuna, O Vayu, O Kubera,

original: īśāna // bhoḥ bhoḥ brahman // bhoḥ ananta // ityādi lokapālāḥ śivājñāṃ saṃśrāvya nirodhārghaṃ
analyzed: īśāna bhoḥ bhoḥ brahman bhoḥ ananta ityādi lokapālāḥ śiva ājñām saṃśrāvya nirodha argham
translated: O Ishana, O Brahma, O Ananta, and so on, the Lokapalas, having proclaimed Shiva's command,

original: datvāgni samīpaṃ yāyāt //
analyzed: da tvā agni samīpam yāyāt
translated: having given the obstruction-offering,🔽should go near the fire.

original: namostu sarvayogibhyaḥ siddhebhyaśca namo namaḥ // mūrtāmūrteśvara grāhinnamaḥ śaktigaṇāyate //
analyzed: namaḥ astu sarva yogibhyaḥ siddhebhyaḥ ca namaḥ namaḥ mūrta amūrta īśvara grāhin namaḥ śaktigaṇāyate
translated: Salutations to all yogis and to the accomplished ones, again and again. Salutations to the group of Shaktis, the holder of the embodied and disembodied lord.

original: ityardha pradakṣiṇaṃ datvā sannidadhvaṃ iti nirodhārghyaṃ datvāgni samīpaṃ yāyāt //
analyzed: iti ardha pradakṣiṇam da tvā sannidadhvam iti nirodha arghyam da tvā agni samīpam yāyāt
translated: Having given half a circumambulation, having given the obstruction-offering with the words Be present, one should go near the fire.

original: oṃ namaḥ svacchandabhairavāya //
analyzed: om namaḥ svacchanda bhairavāya
translated: Om, salutations to Svacchandabhairava.

original: oṃ kuṇḍasamīpaṃ gatvā āsanaśodhanaṃ kuryāt // asya śrī āsanaśodhanamantrasya merupṛṣṭa ṛṣiḥ sutalaṃ
analyzed: om kuṇḍa samīpam gatvā āsana śodhanam kuryāt asya śrī āsana śodhana mantrasya meru pṛṣṭaḥ ṛṣiḥ sutalam
translated: Om. Having gone near the pit, one should perform the purification of the seat. For this revered seat purification mantra, the sage is Meruprishtha, the meter is Sutalam,

original: cchandaḥ kūrmo devatā āsanaśodhane viniyogaḥ / prīṃ pṛthvi tvayā vṛtālokādevitvaṃ viṣṇunādhṛtā //
analyzed: chandaḥ kūrmaḥ devatā āsana śodhane viniyogaḥ prīṃ pṛthvi tvayā vṛta ālokā devi tvam viṣṇunā ādhṛtā
translated: the deity is Kūrma, and the application is in the purification of the seat. Preeṃ. Earth, you are covered by the world, you are held by Vishnu,

original: tvaṃ ca dhārayamāṃ devi pavitraṃ kurucāsanam //🔽āsanāya namaḥ // ādhāraśaktyai namaḥ // kūrmāya namaḥ // anantāya namaḥ // āsane upaviśya astramantreṇa
analyzed: tvam ca dhārayamām devi pavitram kuru ca āsanam  āsanāya namaḥ ādhāra śaktyai namaḥ kūrmāya namaḥ anantāya namaḥ āsane upaviśya astramantreṇa
translated: and you, O Goddess, hold me. Make the seat pure.

original: digbandhanam //
analyzed: digbandhanam
translated: Salutations to the seat. Salutations to the supporting power. Salutations to Kūrma. Salutations to Ananta. Having sat on the seat, one should bind the directions with the weapon mantra.

original: ṣaṭtriṃśattatvarūpāya jñānakhaḍgāya namaḥ //
analyzed: ṣaṭtriṃśat tatva rūpāya jñāna khaḍgāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the sword of knowledge, which is the form of the thirty-six principles.

original: ityupayāmaṃ vidhāya svadakṣe'stra kalaśaṃ sampūjya /
analyzed: iti upayāmam vidhāya sva dakṣeḥ tra kalaśam sampūjya
translated: Having thus made the upāṃśu offering, one should worship the weapon pot on one's right.

original: prāṇāyāmaśoṣaṇa dahanādi kṛtvā vidhinirodhapaśvarghapātratraya pūjanam / tena secanaṃ karomi phaṭ /
translated: Having performed the drying, burning, etc. of prāṇāyāma, and the worship of the three argha vessels of the rules, animals, and oblations, one should sprinkle with that. Phaṭ.

original: mūlena kuṇḍaṃ paśyet //
analyzed: mūlena kuṇḍam paśyet
translated: One should see the pit with the root mantra.

original: astrāya phaḍiti kuṇḍaṃ prokṣayet / astrāya phaḍiti kuṇḍaṃ tāḍayet / huṃ iti kuṇamabhyukṣet //
analyzed: astrāya phaṭ iti kuṇḍam prokṣayet astrāya phaṭ iti kuṇḍam tāḍayet huṃ iti kuṇam abhyukṣet
translated: One should sprinkle the pit with Aṣṭrāya phaṭ. One should strike the pit with Aṣṭrāya phaṭ. One should sprinkle the pit with Huṃ.

original: iti saṃskāra catuṣṭayaṃ //
analyzed: iti saṃskāra catuṣṭayam
translated: Thus, the four purifications.

original: khananaṃ mārjanaṃ // mṛtsnoddhāraṃ kuṭṭanaṃ śodhanaṃ prokṣaṇaṃ karomi phaṭ //
analyzed: khananam mārjanam mṛtsnā uddhāram kuṭṭanam śodhanam prokṣaṇam karomi phaṭ
translated: I perform the removal of mud, cutting, purification, and sprinkling with the mantra phat.

original: evaṃ kriyāśaktyātmane kuṇḍāya namaḥ // iti pūjā //
analyzed: evam kriyā śakti ātmane kuṇḍāya namaḥ iti pūjā
translated: Thus, salutations to the sacrificial pit, which is the embodiment of the power of action. This is the worship.

original: astreṇa vajrīkaraṇaṃ // phaṭ vajrīkaraṇaṃ karomi phaṭ //
analyzed: astreṇa vajrīkaraṇam phaṭ vajrīkaraṇam karomi phaṭ
translated: With the weapon mantra, the consecration with the thunderbolt is done. With the mantra phat, I perform the consecration with the thunderbolt.

original: yathā //
analyzed: yathā
translated: As follows:

original: p /
analyzed: p

original: vajrīkaraṇamastreṇa rekhāḥ pūrvāḥ parāstrayaḥ // yāmyasaumyamukhīcaikā vajrametat prakīrtitam //
analyzed: vajrīkaraṇam astreṇa rekhāḥ pūrvāḥ parāḥ trayaḥ vajram etat prakīrtitam
translated: The consecration with the thunderbolt is done with the weapon mantra. The first three lines are in the east, and one line faces south and north. This is declared to be the thunderbolt.

original: astreṇa prāṅmukhairdabhaiḥ kuṇḍācchādanam //
analyzed: astreṇa prāc mukhaiḥ dabhaiḥ kuṇḍa ācchādanam
translated: With the weapon mantra, the sacrificial pit is covered with darbha grass facing east.

original: trivṛtta trikoṇaṃ tadupari ṣaṭkoṇaṃ tadupari vṛttaṃ likhitvā yatropari viṣṭaraḥ //
analyzed: trikoṇam tad upari ṣaṣ koṇam tad upari vṛttam likhitvā yatra upari viṣṭaraḥ
translated: Having drawn a triangle with three concentric circles, and above it a hexagon, and above it a circle, where the seat is placed.

original: mukundāya namaḥ // īśānāya namaḥ // purandarāya namaḥ // brahmaṇe namaḥ // svadhāsāgarāya namaḥ //
analyzed: mukundāya namaḥ īśānāya namaḥ purandarāya namaḥ brahmaṇe namaḥ svadhā sāgarāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Mukunda, salutations to Isha, salutations to Purandara, salutations to Brahma, salutations to the ocean of the sacrificial pap.

original: ratnadvīpāya namaḥ // kalpavṛkṣāya namaḥ // indhave namaḥ // iti saṃpūjya // arghajalena saṃprokṣya //
analyzed: ratnadvīpāya namaḥ kalpavṛkṣāya namaḥ indhave namaḥ iti saṃpūjya argha jalena saṃprokṣya
translated: Salutations to the Jewel Island, salutations to the Wish-fulfilling Tree, salutations to the Fuel. Having worshipped thus, having sprinkled with the water of the sacrificial vessel,

original: tadupari pīṭhānarcayet //
analyzed: tad upari pīṭhān arcayet
translated: one should worship the seats above it.

original: ādhāraśaktyai namaḥ // kūrmāya namaḥ // anantāya namaḥ // pṛthivyai namaḥ // sudhāsāgarāya namaḥ //🔽ratnadvipāya namaḥ // kalpavṛkṣāya namaḥ // ratnavedikāyai namaḥ // cintāmaṇi gṛharājāya namaḥ //
analyzed: ādhāra śaktyai namaḥ kūrmāya namaḥ anantāya namaḥ pṛthivyai namaḥ sudhā sāgarāya namaḥ  ratna dvipāya namaḥ kalpavṛkṣāya namaḥ ratna vedikāyai namaḥ cintāmaṇi gṛha rājāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the supporting power. Salutations to the tortoise. Salutations to Ananta. Salutations to the earth. Salutations to the nectar ocean.🔽Salutations to the jewel elephant. Salutations to the wish-fulfilling tree. Salutations to the jewel altar. Salutations to the wish-fulfilling gem palace.

original: ratnasiṃhāsanāya namaḥ // ānandakandāya namaḥ // saṃvinnālāya namaḥ // tatvātmaka padmāya namaḥ //
analyzed: ratna siṃhāsanāya namaḥ ānanda kandāya namaḥ saṃvid nālāya namaḥ tattva ātmaka padmāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the jewel lion throne. Salutations to the bliss-filled stem. Salutations to the consciousness-filled stalk. Salutations to the lotus with the essence of reality.

original: prakṛtimaya pattrebhyo namaḥ // vikāramaya kesarebhyo namaḥ // pañcāśadbījādya karṇikāyai namaḥ // dharmāya
analyzed: prakṛti maya pattrebhyaḥ namaḥ vikāra maya kesarebhyaḥ namaḥ pañcāśat bīja ādya karṇikāyai namaḥ dharmāya
translated: Salutations to the leaves made of primordial matter. Salutations to the filaments made of modifications. Salutations to the pericarp with fifty seeds. Salutations to Dharma

original: adharmāya // amukadevatāyai namaḥ // iti sampūjya //
analyzed: adharmāya amuka devatāyai namaḥ iti sampūjya
translated: to Adharma. Salutations to such-and-such deity. Having worshipped thus,

original: kuṇḍadakṣe catuṣpañcāśati darbhairviṣṭaraṃ kṛtvā gomaya golakamadhye saṃsthāpya pūjayet //
analyzed: kuṇḍa dakṣe catuṣpañcāśati darbhaiḥ viṣṭaram kṛtvā gomaya golaka madhye saṃsthāpya pūjayet
translated: in the east of the pit, having made a seat with forty-nine darbha grass, having placed it in the middle of a ball of cow dung, one should worship.

original: brahmāsanāya namaḥ // brahmannāgacchetyāvāhya / santiṣṭha sannidhatsva bhoḥ avaguṇṭhayāmi namaḥ //
analyzed: brahmāsanāya namaḥ brahman āgaccha iti āvāhya santiṣṭha sannidhatsva bhoḥ avaguṇṭhayāmi namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the seat of Brahma. Having invoked, O Brahma, come, Stay, be present, O Lord, I cover with salutations.

original: āṃ brahmaṇe sarvalokādhipataye namaḥ // pādyādinā pūjayet //
analyzed: āṃ brahmaṇe sarva loka adhipataye namaḥ pādya ādinā pūjayet
translated: Om, salutations to Brahma, the lord of all worlds. One should worship with water for washing the feet, etc.

original: tadanu kuṇḍamadhye astrenaikaṃ pūrvamukhaṃ darbhaṃ saṃsthāpya catuṣpathaṃ kuryāt //
analyzed: tadanu kuṇḍa madhye astrena ekam pūrva mukham darbham saṃsthāpya catuṣpatham kuryāt
translated: Then, in the middle of the pit, having placed a darbha blade facing east with the weapon mantra, one should make the four paths.

original: astrāya phaḍiti kuṇḍaṃ vajratvena cintayet // vajrīkaraṇaṃ // nama iti mantreṇa kuśaiḥ kuṇḍāntare
analyzed: astrāya phaṭ iti kuṇḍam vajra tvena cintayet vajrīkaraṇam namaḥ iti mantreṇa kuśaiḥ kuṇḍa antare
translated: One should think of the pit as having the nature of a thunderbolt with the mantra Om, let the pit be transformed into a thunderbolt with the weapon mantra.

original: catuśraṃ kuryāt //
analyzed: catuśram kuryāt
translated: With the mantra Namah. One should make the pit square with kusha grass.

original: madhye āvamadhyabhāgaḥ // pacche āvanīyabhāgaḥ // uttare annāhāryaḥ // dakṣiṇe gārhaspatyaḥ //
analyzed: madhye āvamadhya bhāgaḥ pacche āvanīya bhāgaḥ uttare annāhāryaḥ dakṣiṇe gārhaspatyaḥ
translated: In the middle, the part for the sacrificial fire. In the west, the part for the sacrificial fire. In the north, the part for the oblations. In the south, the part for the sacrificial fire.

original: iti tuṣpathīkaraṇam //
analyzed: iti tuṣpathīkaraṇam
translated: This is the making of the four paths.

original: tatpṛṣṭha viṣṭaraḥ / tatra vāgīśvarīṃ kalpayet //
analyzed: tad pṛṣṭha viṣṭaraḥ tatra vāgīśvarīm kalpayet
translated: On its back, the seat. There, one should imagine Vāgīśvarī.

original: vāgīśvarī mṛtu snātāṃ nīlīndevarasannibhām // vāgīśvareṇa saṃyuktāmupacāraiḥ prapūjayet //
analyzed: vāgīśvarī snātām nīlīn devara sannibhām vāgīśvareṇa saṃyuktām upacāraiḥ prapūjayet
translated: One should worship with offerings the goddess Vāgīśvarī, who has bathed after menstruation, who resembles a blue lotus, and who is united with Vāgīśvara.

original: nīlotpaladalaśyāmā mṛttamaścārulocanām // sarvalakṣaṇasampūrṇāṃ sarvābharaṇabhūṣitām //
analyzed: nīlotpala dala śyāmā mṛttamaḥ cāru locanām sarva lakṣaṇa sampūrṇām sarva ābharaṇa bhūṣitām
translated: One should meditate on the goddess who is dark like the petals of a blue lotus, who has beautiful eyes, who is endowed with all characteristics, and who is adorned with all ornaments.

original: dhyātvā caivaṃ vidhāṃ devīṃ sthāpayetkuṇḍamadhyataḥ // brahmasthānopaviṣṭāṃ ca dvārābhimukhabhadragām
analyzed: dhyātvā ca evam vidhām devīm sthāpayet kuṇḍa madhyatas brahmasthāna upaviṣṭām ca dvāra abhimukha bhadra gām
translated: Having meditated on the goddess of this kind, one should install her in the middle of the pit, seated in the place of Brahmā, facing the door, and bestowing auspiciousness.

original: devyādhyāna manusmṛtya dhūpadīpādibhissaha //
analyzed: devyā ādhyāna manusmṛtya dhūpa dīpa ādibhiḥ saha
translated: Having remembered the meditation on the goddess, along with incense, lamps, and so on,

original: viṣṭaropari //
analyzed: viṣṭara upari
translated: on the seat.

original: oṃ vāgīśyāsanāya namaḥ // ityāsanapūjāṃ kṛtvā //
analyzed: om vāgīśyā āsanāya namaḥ iti āsana pūjām kṛtvā
translated: Om, salutations to the seat of Vāgīśī. Having thus worshipped the seat.

original: hāṃ vāgīśvari āgaccha āvāhanādi pūrvaṃ // oṃ hūṃ vāgīśvaryai namaḥ // iti pādyādinā sampūjya //
analyzed: hāṃ vāgīśvari āgaccha āvāhana ādi pūrvam om   vāgīśvaryai namaḥ iti pādya ādinā sampūjya
translated: Hām, O Vāgīśvarī, come. Having invoked and so on, Om, Hūm, salutations to Vāgīśvarī. Having thus worshipped with water for washing the feet and so on.

original: īśaśirasamuttānā mṛtumatīṃ bhāvayitvā sannidhānāya yoni mudrāṃ pradarśayet //
analyzed: īśa śirasam uttānā mṛtumatīm bhāvayitvā sannidhānāya yoni mudrām pradarśayet
translated: Having visualized the menstruating woman lying with her head towards the north, one should display the yoni mudrā for her presence.🔽From the sun-crystal or from the house of the stream,

original: sūryakāntādaraṇitaḥ srottriyāgāratopi vā // pātreṇa pihite pātre vahnimānāya yettaḥ //
analyzed: vā pātreṇa pihite pātre vahni mānāya
translated: having brought the fire with a covered vessel.

original: jvalantaṃ pātrasthamagnimānīya //
analyzed: jvalantam pātra stham agnim ānīya
translated: Having brought the blazing fire in the vessel,

original: oṃ phaṭ agneḥ prokṣaṇaṃ karomi phaṭ // evaṃ // nirīkṣaṇaṃ // avaguṇṭhanaṃ //
analyzed: om phaṭ agneḥ prokṣaṇam karomi phaṭ evam nirīkṣaṇam avaguṇṭhanam
translated: Om, Phaṭ, I sprinkle the fire, Phaṭ. Thus, the examination,

original: p /
analyzed: p
translated: the covering.

original: oṃ hūṃ agnimavaguṇṭhayāmi hūṃ // kavacenāvaguṇṭhanaṃ / oṃ raṃ agnaye namaḥ / oṃ jñānaśaktyātmane'gnaye
analyzed: om   agnim avaguṇṭhayāmi   kavacena avaguṇṭhanam om raṃ agnaye namaḥ om jñāna śakti ātmane agnaye
translated: Om, Hūm, I cover the fire, Hūm. The covering with the armor. Om, Raṃ, salutations to Agni. Om, to the fire of the power of knowledge,

original: namaḥ // iti pūjanam //
analyzed: namaḥ iti pūjanam
translated: salutations. Thus, the worship.

original: oṃ phaṭ kravyādaṃ niṣkarṣayāmi phaṭ //
analyzed: om phaṭ kravyādam niṣkarṣayāmi phaṭ
translated: Om, Phaṭ, I extract the flesh-eater, Phaṭ.

original: iti darbhakāṇḍaṃ prajvālya nairṛte kṣipet //
analyzed: iti darbha kāṇḍam prajvālya nairṛte kṣipet
translated: Thus, having ignited a blade of darbha grass, one should throw it in the southwest.

original: agneḥ kravyādaśuddhirastu svāhā // tilena āpa //
analyzed: agneḥ kravyāda śuddhiḥ astu svāhā tilena āpa
translated: May the fire be purified of the flesh-eater, Svāhā. With sesamum, water,

original: tato mūlamuccāryagni pātraṃ hastadvaye gṛhītvā nāsāgreṇa ghrātvā'gneścaitanya tayājvālāgraṃ mūlena
analyzed: tatas mūlam uccārya agni pātram hasta dvaye gṛhītvā nāsā agreṇa ghrātvā agneḥ caitanya tayā jvālā agram mūlena
translated: Then, having recited the root mantra, holding the fire vessel in both hands, having inhaled through the tip of the nose, having taken the flame of the fire with one's own consciousness, with the root mantra,

original: gṛhītvā vāmanāsāpuṭena pūrakenā'gniṃ hṛdi praviśya svacaitanyānalenaikī kṛtya
analyzed: gṛhītvā vāma nāsā puṭena pūrakena agnim hṛdi praviśya sva caitanya analena ekī kṛtya
translated: having entered the fire into the heart through the left nostril with inhalation, having unified it with one's own consciousness fire,

original: bahirdakṣiṇanāsāpuṭena recakena mūlamuccārya pātre kṣipet //
analyzed: bahis dakṣiṇa nāsā puṭena recakena mūlam uccārya pātre kṣipet
translated: having recited the root mantra with exhalation through the right nostril outside, one should throw it into the vessel.

original: oṃ raṃ agnaye namaḥ // aṅgaṣaṭkena pūjanam // mūlenāmṛtīkaraṇaṃ // svayameva śivaḥ iti dārḍhyena
analyzed: om raṃ agnaye namaḥ aṅga ṣaṭkena pūjanam mūlena amṛtīkaraṇam svayam eva śivaḥ iti dārḍhyena
translated: Om Ram, salutations to Agni. Worship with the six limbs. Making it immortal with the root mantra. Thinking I am Shiva myself with firmness,

original: śivābhimānaṃ gṛhītvā vahniṃ śukrarūpaṃ dhyātvā māyāṃ vāgīśvarīṃ parikalyyavahniṃ yonau
analyzed: śiva abhimānam gṛhītvā vahnim śukra rūpam dhyātvā māyām vāgīśvarīm parikalyya vahnim yonau
translated: having taken up the pride of Shiva, having meditated on the fire in the form of semen, having invoked Maya, the goddess of speech, one should rotate the fire in the womb.

original: bhrāmayāmi namaḥ //
analyzed: bhrāmayāmi namaḥ
translated: I rotate, salutations.

original: iti triḥ paribhrāmya // tasyāṃ yonau // oṃ hūṃ yojayāmi namaḥ // nairṛtyādiśi kṣipet //🔽tato vahniṃ mūlena vīkṣyāstrāya phaḍiti /
analyzed: iti tris paribhrāmya tasyām yonau om   yojayāmi namaḥ nairṛtyā diśi kṣipet  tatas vahnim mūlena vīkṣya astrāya phaṭ iti
translated: Having rotated three times in that womb, Om Hum, I unite, salutations. One should throw it in the southwest direction.🔽Then, having seen the fire with the root mantra, To the weapon, Phat.

original: arghajalenāgniṃ proktyāstrāya phaḍiti darbhaiḥ santāḍya huṃ ityargha jalenavahnimabhyukṣya tasminnagnau /
analyzed: argha jalena agnim proktya astrāya phaṭ iti darbhaiḥ santāḍya huṃ iti argha jalena vahnim abhyukṣya tasmin agnau
translated: Having sprinkled the fire with the water of the argha, having struck with darbha grass, To the weapon, Phat. Having sprinkled the fire with the water of the argha with Hum, in that fire,

original: rāṃ jaṭharāgnaye namaḥ // rīṃ vaindhavāgnaye namaḥ // rūṃ bhaumāgnaye namaḥ // iti sampūjya //
analyzed: rāṃ jaṭhara agnaye namaḥ rīṃ vaindhava agnaye namaḥ rūṃ bhauma agnaye namaḥ iti sampūjya
translated: Raṃ to the gastric fire, salutations. Rīṃ to the intestinal fire, salutations. Rūṃ to the earth fire, salutations. Having worshipped thus,

original: jaṭhara vaindavabhaumāgnīnāmaikyaṃ vibhāvya / raṃ iti pāvaka caitanyaṃ tasmin saṃyojya🔽praṇavenāgnimabhimantrya vaṃ iti dhenumudrayā'mṛtīkṛtyāstrāya phaḍiti vahnimabhyukṣya //
analyzed: jaṭhara vaindava bhauma agnīnām aikyam vibhāvya raṃ iti pāvaka caitanyam tasmin saṃyojya  praṇavena agnim abhimantrya vaṃ iti dhenumudrayā amṛtīkṛtya astrāya phaṭ iti vahnim abhyukṣya
translated: Contemplating the oneness of the gastric, intestinal and earth fires, and uniting the consciousness of the fire with Raṃ in it,🔽Having invoked the fire with Praṇava, having made it nectar with the syllable Vaṃ and the gesture of a cow, having sprinkled the fire with Phaṭ to the weapon,

original: hūṃ ityavaguṇṭhya vahniṃ mūlena sampūjya vahniṃ karābhyāṃ gṛhītattolya jānuspṛṣṭamahītalaḥ
analyzed: hūm iti avaguṇṭhya vahnim mūlena sampūjya vahnim karābhyām jānu spṛṣṭa mahī talaḥ
translated: Having covered the fire with Hūṃ, having worshipped the fire with the root mantra, having taken the fire in the hands, having touched the ground with the knees,

original: kuṇḍopari triparibhrāmyātmanobhimukhaṃ vahniṃ praṇavamuccaran parama śivajīvabuddhyāsohamiti
analyzed: kuṇḍa upari tri paribhrāmya ātmanaḥ abhimukham vahnim praṇavam uccaran iti
translated: Having circumambulated above the pit three times, having placed the fire facing oneself, uttering Praṇava, with the thought of the supreme Śiva and the individual soul, saying I am that,

original: jīvabuddhyāvāgīśvaryā yonau kṣipet //
analyzed: jīva buddhyā vāgīśvaryā yonau kṣipet
translated: With the thought of the individual soul, one should place it in the womb of Vāgīśvarī.

original: tato vāgīśvarī vāgīśvarābhyāṃ namaḥ // iti sampūjya /
analyzed: tatas vāc īśvarī vāc īśvarābhyām namaḥ iti sampūjya
translated: Then, having worshipped with Salutations to Vāgīśvarī and Vāgīśvara,

translated: Cit, Pingala, burn, consume, cook, O omniscient one, make known, svāhā. Having thus ignited the fire, with folded hands,🔽 I pay homage to the ignited fire, the gold-hued sacrificial fire,

original: agniṃ prajvālitaṃ vande jātarūpaṃ hutāśanam // suvarṇavarṇamamalaṃ samṛddhaṃ viśvato mukham //🔽p /

analyzed: upasthāpayet tatas tilaiḥ om juṃ agneḥ garbhādhānam karomi svāhā

original: evaṃ // oṃ juṃ agnergarbhādhānaṃ sampadyatāṃ svāhā // ā // vyoṃ agne pumānbhava namaḥ // iti

translated: Vyon, O Agni, become a male, salutations.

original: vidhyarghataḥ darbhāgreṇa jalaṃ kṣipet //
analyzed: vidhi arghataḥ darbha agreṇa jalam kṣipet
translated: With the tip of a darbha grass, one should sprinkle water.🔽Om vyon salutations to Agni, the male. Thus is the worship. Om vyon may the puṃsavana (sex-determination) of Agni be accomplished, svāhā.

original: oṃ vyoṃ agnaye puṃse namaḥ iti pūjanaṃ // oṃ vyoṃ agneḥ puṃsavanaṃ saṃpadyatāṃ svāhā // ā // oṃ īṃ
analyzed: om vyoṃ agnaye puṃse namaḥ iti pūjanam om vyoṃ agneḥ puṃsavanam saṃpadyatām svāhā    om īṃ
translated: Om īṃ🔽O Agni, may your limbs be distinct, salutations.

original: agne vibhaktāvayavo bhava namaḥ // iti darbhāgreṇa samagramagniśarīramālikhya //
analyzed: agne vibhakta avayavaḥ bhava namaḥ iti darbha agreṇa samagram agni śarīram ālikhya
translated: Having thus drawn the entire body of the fire with the tip of a darbha grass,

analyzed: om īṃ agni ākārāya namaḥ iti pūjā
translated: Om īṃ salutations to the form of Agni.🔽 Thus is the worship.🔽Om hūṃ I perform the face-contemplation of Agni, svāhā.

original: oṃ hūṃ agne vaktrakalpanāṃ karomi svāhā // ā // sampadyatāṃ // //

analyzed: om agne netratraya kalpanām karomi svāhā ā saṃ
translated: Om, I perform the imagination of the three eyes of Agni, svāhā, saṃ.

original: oṃ hūṃ saḥ īṃ agneḥ śivatatvamukhaṃ karomi svāhā ā // saṃ // oṃ juṃ īṃ agne vidyātatva hṛdayaṃ

translated: Om, hūṃ, saḥ, īṃ, I make the face of the Śiva principle of Agni, svāhā, saṃ. Om, juṃ, īṃ, I make the heart of the Vidyā principle of Agni,

translated: svāhā, saṃ. Om, oṃ, īṃ, I imagine the feet of the Ātman principle of Agni, svāhā, saṃ. Om, īṃ, I revive the head,

translated: hips, and feet, and all the limbs of Agni, svāhā, saṃ. Om, īṃ, I perform the imagination of the boundary of Agni,

original: svāhā saṃ // oṃ īṃ agneḥ sīmanto nayanaṃ karomi svāhā saṃ // oṃ phaṭ agniṃ bījaṃ bījayāmi /
analyzed: svāhā saṃ om īm agneḥ sīmantaḥ nayanam karomi svāhā saṃ om phaṭ agnim bījam bījayāmi
translated: svāhā, saṃ. Om, īṃ, I perform the parting of the hair on the head of Agni, svāhā, saṃ. Om, phaṭ, I consecrate the seed of Agni.

original: svāhā oṃ phaṭ agnaye namaḥ //
analyzed: svāhā om phaṭ agnaye namaḥ
translated: Svāhā, om, phaṭ, salutations to Agni.

original: iti pūjanam //
analyzed: iti pūjanam
translated: Thus is the worship.

original: oṃ phaṭ agneḥ prasavābhimukho bhava namaḥ // iti vijñapyāñjaliṃ baddhvā vāgīśyā agniḥ saṃjātaḥ iti
analyzed: om phaṭ agneḥ prasava abhimukhaḥ bhava namaḥ iti vijñapya añjalim baddhvā vāgīśyā agniḥ saṃjātaḥ iti
translated: Om, phaṭ, O Agni, become inclined towards creation, salutations. Having thus informed, joining the palms, and imagining that Agni has arisen from Vāgīśī,

original: vibhāvya //🔽oṃ phaṭ jñānaśaktyātmane agnaye namaḥ / iti pūjanam //🔽oṃ hūṃ agnerjātakarmakaromi svāhā saṃ //
analyzed: vibhāvya  om phaṭ jñāna śakti ātmane agnaye namaḥ iti pūjanam  om   agneḥ jātakarma karomi svāhā saṃ
translated: one should contemplate.🔽Om, phaṭ, salutations to Agni, the embodiment of the power of knowledge. Thus is the worship.

original: p /
analyzed: p
translated: Om, hūṃ, I perform the birth rite of Agni, svāhā, saṃ.

original: oṃ phaṭ astrāya phaṭ agneḥ sūtaka śuddhirastu svāhā saṃ //
analyzed: om phaṭ astrāya phaṭ agneḥ sūtaka śuddhiḥ astu svāhā saṃ
translated: Om phat to the weapon, phat. May the impurity of the fire be purified, svāhā, sam.

analyzed: astreṇa kuṇḍāt sūtaka śuddhiḥ
translated: Purification of the impurity of the fire pit with the weapon.

translated: Om phat, I open the mouth of the fire, svāhā, sam. Om phat, I besprinkle the face of the fire, svāhā, sam. Om
