analyzed: phaṭ astrāya phaṭ agnim evam paryukṣyāmi pariṣiñcāmi tatas tara paridhi viṣṭara nyāsaḥ
translated: phat to the weapon, phat. I collect the fire. Thus I shall sprinkle. I shall pour around. Then the arrangement of the enclosing sticks and the seat.

original: phaṭ agnimāstṛṇāmi phaṭ // pūrve darbhakāṇḍatrayaṃ // dakṣiṇe pañca // uttare pañca // paścime trīn
analyzed: phaṭ agnim āstṛṇāmi phaṭ pūrve darbha kāṇḍa trayam dakṣiṇe pañca uttare pañca paścime trīn
translated: Om phat, I strew the fire, om phat. Three bundles of darbha grass in the east, five in the south, five in the north, three in the west.

original: tato hastamātrasamidho darbhadvaya sahitāḥ uttarāgrāḥ pūrve //
analyzed: tatas hasta mātra samidhaḥ darbha dvaya sahitāḥ uttara agrāḥ pūrve
translated: Then the enclosing sticks, one cubit long, together with two darbha blades, with their tips in the north, in the east.

original: pūrvāgrādakṣiṇe // pūrvāgrā uttare // uttarāgrāḥ paścime // iti paridhi nyāsaḥ // tato viṣṭara
analyzed: pūrva agrā dakṣiṇe pūrva agrāḥ uttare uttara agrāḥ paścime  iti paridhi nyāsaḥ tatas viṣṭara
translated: With their tips in the east, in the south. With their tips in the east, in the north. With their tips in the north, in the west. This is the arrangement of the enclosing sticks. Then the seat.

original: catuṣṭayaṃ dikṣasthāpayet // pūrve brahmaṇe namaḥ // dakṣiṇe rudrāya namaḥ / paścime viṣṇave namaḥ //
analyzed: catuṣṭayam pūrve brahmaṇe namaḥ dakṣiṇe rudrāya namaḥ paścime viṣṇave namaḥ
translated: One should place the four in the directions. In the east, salutations to Brahmā. In the south, salutations to Rudra. In the west, salutations to Viṣṇu.

original: uttare sadāśivāya namaḥ // tato jvālāliṅgopari mūlena sāṅgena śāntikalaśaṃ pūjayet // tadyathā //
analyzed: uttare sadāśivāya namaḥ tatas jvālā liṅga upari mūlena sa aṅgena śānti kalaśam pūjayet tat yathā
translated: In the north, salutations to Sadashiva. Then, on the flaming linga, one should worship the peace-giving pot with the root mantra along with its limbs. As follows:

original: tatrādau jvālāliṅgau parisajalakalaśe saptadarbha piñjarakṛta viṣṭarasahitaṃ vibhuṃ yajet // tasya
analyzed: tatra ādau jvālā liṅgau viṣṭara sahitam vibhum yajet tasya
translated: There, first, one should worship the all-pervading Lord along with the flaming linga, the water pot, and a seat made of seven darbha blades.

original: dhyānamāha //
analyzed: dhyānam āha
translated: He describes the meditation on it:

original: devaṃ caturbhujaṃ dhyāyecchrīkaṇṭhaṃ nīlakaṇṭhakam // caturvaktraṃ śūlapāṇimakṣasūttrakarārpitam //
analyzed: devam caturbhujam dhyāyet śrīkaṇṭham nīlakaṇṭhakam  caturvaktram śūlapāṇim akṣa sūttra kara arpitam
translated: One should meditate on the Lord, Shankara, the blue-throated one, with four arms, four faces, holding a trident and a rosary in his hands,

original: vṛṣabhārūḍhamatyugraṃ pṛthakchaktyā / samanvitam //
analyzed: vṛṣabha ārūḍham ati ugram samanvitam
translated: mounted on a bull, very fierce, endowed with separate Shakti.

original: tadutsaṅge tu hemābhāṃ sākṣamālāṃ kamaṇḍalum // devīṃ varābhaya karāṃ jyotīrūpāṃ tu cintayet //
analyzed: tad utsaṅge tu hema ābhām sa akṣamālām kamaṇḍalum devīm vara abhaya karām jyotīrūpām tu cintayet
translated: On his lap, one should think of the Goddess, golden-hued, holding a rosary and a water pot, with gestures of boon and protection, and having the form of light.

original: oṃ hūṃ jvālārūpāya jvālāliṅgasthāya bhairavāya namaḥ // iti śāntikalaśapūjāṃ //🔽p /
analyzed: om   jvālā rūpāya jvālā liṅga sthāya bhairavāya namaḥ iti śānti kalaśa pūjām  p
translated: Om, Hum, salutations to Bhairava, in the form of flames, residing in the flaming linga. Thus, the worship of the peace-giving pot.

original: mūlenasāṅgena śāntikalaśaṃ pūjayet // tato daśasudikṣu lokapāladaśakaṃ pūjayet // tadyathā //
analyzed: mūlena sa aṅgena śānti kalaśam pūjayet tatas daśasu dikṣu lokapāla daśakam pūjayet tat yathā
translated: One should worship the peace-giving pot with the root mantra along with its limbs. Then, one should worship the group of ten Lokapalas in the ten directions. As follows:

original: airāvanasamārūḍhaṃ sahasranayanaṃ harim //
analyzed: airāvana samārūḍham sahasranayanam harim
translated: Vishnu, mounted on Airavata, with a thousand eyes,

original: vajrahastaṃ śacīyuktaṃ homakāle tu cintayet // oṃ lūṃ indrāya vajrahastāya namaḥ // pūrve //
analyzed: vajra hastam śacī yuktam homa kāle tu cintayet om lūṃ indrāya vajrahastāya namaḥ pūrve
translated: Om Luṃ, salutations to Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, in the east.

original: pañcavaktraṃ viśālākṣaṃ svāhayā sahitaṃ sadā // śukārūḍhaṃ śaktihastaṃ navajihvaṃ vicintayet //
analyzed: pañcavaktram viśāla akṣam svāhayā sahitam sadā śuka ārūḍham śakti hastam nava jihvam vicintayet
translated: One should always contemplate on Agni, having five faces, large eyes, united with Svāhā, riding on a cock, with a spear in hand, and having nine tongues.

original: oṃ rūṃ agnaye śaktihastāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om rūṃ agnaye śakti hastāya namaḥ
translated: Om Ruṃ, salutations to Agni, the wielder of the spear.

original: pretārūḍhaṃ daṇḍahastaṃ nīlajīmutasannibham // yāmīyuktaṃ sadādhyāye dantakaṃ mahiṣāsanam //
analyzed: preta ārūḍham daṇḍa hastam nīla jīmuta sannibham yāmī yuktam sadā adhyāye dantakam mahiṣa āsanam
translated: One should always meditate on Yama, mounted on a ghost, with a staff in hand, resembling dark collyrium, united with Yamī, having three eyes, and seated on a buffalo.

original: oṃ ṭūṃ yamāya daṇḍahastāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om ṭūm yamāya daṇḍa hastāya namaḥ
translated: Om Tuṃ, salutations to Yama, the wielder of the staff.

original: devīṃ yuktaṃ mahābāhuṃ khaḍgāhastaṃ trilocanam // nirṛtiṃ caiva lokeśaṃ homakāle tu cintayet //🔽oṃ kṣūṃ nairṛte khaḍgāhastāya namaḥ // paścimasthaṃ sa devīkaṃ nirmalaṃ makarāsanam //
analyzed: devīm yuktam mahā bāhum khaḍgāhastam trilocanam nirṛtim ca eva lokeśam homa kāle tu cintayet  om   nairṛte khaḍgāhastāya namaḥ paścima stham sa devīkam nirmalam makarāsanam
translated: At the time of Homa, one should contemplate on Nirṛti, the lord of the world, united with his consort, having long arms, a sword in hand, and three eyes.🔽Om Kṣūṃ, salutations to Nirṛti, the wielder of the sword.🔽One should always meditate on Varuṇa, seated in the west, along with his consort, pure, seated on a crocodile, with a noose in hand, for the peace of obstacles during Homa.

original: pāśahastaṃ sadādhyāye home vighnaughaśāntaye // oṃ vūṃ varuṇāya pāśahastāya namaḥ //
analyzed: pāśa hastam sadā adhyāye home vighna ogha śāntaye om vūm varuṇāya pāśa hastāya namaḥ
translated: Om Vūṃ, salutations to Varuṇa, the wielder of the noose.

original: mṛgārūḍhaṃ javayutaṃ dhvajahastaṃ samīraṇam // śaktiyuktaṃ vahniśāyaṃ homakāle tu cintayet //
analyzed: mṛga ārūḍham java yutam dhvaja hastam samīraṇam śakti yuktam vahni śāyam homa kāle tu cintayet
translated: One should contemplate on Vayu, mounted on a deer, endowed with speed, holding a flag in his hand, at the time of Homa, along with Shakti, lying in the fire.

original: oṃ yūṃ vāyave dhvajahastāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om yūm vāyave dhvaja hastāya namaḥ
translated: Om YUM to Vayu, to the one with a flag in hand, salutations.

original: kuberaṃ tryambakamakhaṃ nidhīśaṃ sarvasiddhidam // yakṣarājaṃ gadāhastaṃ cintayedvighnaśāntaye //
analyzed: kuberam tryambaka makham nidhi īśam sarva siddhi dam yakṣarājam gadā hastam cintayet vighna śāntaye
translated: For the pacification of obstacles, one should contemplate on Kubera, the lord of wealth, the bestower of all accomplishments, the king of Yakshas, holding a mace.

original: oṃ kuṃ kuberāya gadāhastāya namaḥ //🔽vṛṣārūḍhaṃ maheśānaṃ svacchasphaṭikanirmalam //
analyzed: om kuṃ kuberāya gadā hastāya namaḥ  vṛṣa ārūḍham maheśānam svaccha sphaṭika nirmalam
translated: Om KUM to Kubera, to the one with a mace in hand, salutations.🔽One should always meditate on Mahesana, mounted on a bull, pure like crystal,

original: śūlahastaṃ sadādhyāyed devyā sārdhaṃ trilocanam //
analyzed: śūla hastam sadā adhyāyet devyā sārdham trilocanam
translated: with a trident in hand, along with the Goddess, the three-eyed one.

original: oṃ mūṃ īśānāya triśūlahastāya namaḥ //🔽brahmāṇaṃ kamalārūḍhaṃ padmahastaṃ caturmukham //
analyzed: om mūṃ īśānāya triśūla hastāya namaḥ  brahmāṇam kamala ārūḍham padma hastam caturmukham
translated: Om MUM to Isana, to the one with a trident in hand, salutations.

original: p /
analyzed: p
translated: One should meditate on Brahma, seated on a lotus, with a lotus in his hand, with four faces,

original: gāyatrī sahitaṃ dhyāyeddhome vedanidhiṃ param //🔽oṃ āṃ vrāṃ vraṃ brahmaṇe padmahastāya namaḥ // śaṅkhacakragadāpadmairbhūṣitaṃ ca carbhujam //
analyzed: gāyatrī sahitam dhyāyet home veda nidhim param  om ām vrāṃ vraṃ brahmaṇe padma hastāya namaḥ śaṅkha cakra gadā padmaiḥ bhūṣitam ca carbhujam
translated: along with Gayatri, the great treasure of the Vedas, at the time of Homa.🔽Om AUM to Brahma, to the one with a lotus in hand, salutations. The wise one should contemplate on Vishnu, adorned with four arms, a conch, a discus, a mace, and a lotus,

original: śriyā yuktaṃ pītavastraṃ viṣṇuṃ vicintayedbudhaḥ //
analyzed: śriyā yuktam pīta vastram viṣṇum vicintayet budhaḥ
translated: united with Shri, wearing yellow garments.

original: oṃ hlāṃ viṣṇave cakrahastāya namaḥ // oṃ jyaṃ agnerniṣkrāmaṇaṃ karomi svāhā // // sampadyatāṃ // //
analyzed: om hlāṃ viṣṇave cakra hastāya namaḥ om jyaṃ agneḥ niṣkrāmaṇam karomi svāhā
translated: Om Hlam to Vishnu, to the one with a discus in hand, salutations. Om Jyam I perform the exit of Agni, Svāhā. Let it be accomplished.

original: oṃ jyoṃ agnerādityadarśanaṃ karomi svāhā // saṃpadyatāṃ //
analyzed: om jyoṃ agneḥ āditya darśanam karomi svāhā saṃpadyatām
translated: Om Jyon I make the vision of the sun from Agni, Svāhā. Let it be accomplished.

original: agne śivāgnirbhava namaḥ // śivāgnaye namaḥ // iti pūjā //
analyzed: agne śiva agniḥ bhava namaḥ śiva agnaye namaḥ iti pūjā
translated: O Agni, be the auspicious fire, salutations. Salutations to the auspicious fire. Thus the worship.

original: agneḥ śivāgniriti nāmakaraṇaṃ karomi svāhā // saṃ // vāgīśyā kaṅkaṇamokṣaṃ karomi svāhā ā //🔽saṃ //
analyzed: agneḥ śiva agniḥ iti nāmakaraṇam karomi svāhā sam vāgīśyā kaṅkaṇa mokṣam karomi svāhā ā  sam
translated: I perform the naming of Agni as the auspicious fire, Svāhā. Let it be accomplished. I release the bracelet of Vāgīśī, Svāhā. Let it be accomplished.

original: vāgīśyāviṣṭararūpaṃ kaṅkaṇaṃ vimucya // brahmaṇe namaḥ // pūjā //
analyzed: vāgīśyā viṣṭara rūpam kaṅkaṇam vimucya brahmaṇe namaḥ pūjā
translated: Having released the bracelet in the form of the seat of Vāgīśī, salutations to Brahmā. Worship.

original: brahmaṇe svāhā // brahmankṣamyatāṃ / pūrvaviṣṭaraṃ vimocayet //
analyzed: brahmaṇe svāhā brahman kṣamyatām pūrva viṣṭaram vimocayet
translated: To Brahmā, Svāhā. O Brahmā, be forgiven. One should release the previous seat.

original: oṃ evaṃ rudrāya namaḥ // rudrāya svāhā // rudrakṣamyatām // dakṣiṇa viṣṭaraṃ vimocayet //🔽oṃ viṣṇave namaḥ // oṃ viṣṇave svāhā // viṣṇokṣamyatām // paścimaviṣṭaraṃ vimocayet // oṃ sadāśivāya
analyzed: om evam rudrāya namaḥ rudrāya svāhā rudra kṣamyatām dakṣiṇa viṣṭaram vimocayet  om viṣṇave namaḥ om viṣṇave svāhā  paścima viṣṭaram vimocayet om sadāśivāya
translated: Om thus salutations to Rudra. To Rudra, Svāhā. O Rudra, be forgiven. One should release the southern seat.🔽Om salutations to Vishnu. Om to Vishnu, Svāhā. O Vishnu, be forgiven. One should release the western seat. Om to Sadāśiva

original: namaḥ // oṃ sadāśivāya svāhā // sadāśivakṣamyatām // uttara viṣṭaraṃ vimocayet //
analyzed: namaḥ om sadāśivāya svāhā sadāśiva kṣamyatām
translated: Salutations. Om to Sadāśiva, Svāhā. O Sadāśiva, be forgiven. One should release the northern seat.

original: oṃ juṃ vāgīśvaryai namaḥ // pūjā // juṃ vāgīśvaryai svāhā // vāgīśvari kṣamyatām //🔽sṛṣṭisthitilaye dakṣe bhogamokṣaprade śive // vāgīśvari namastestu gaccha devi suviṣṭapam //
analyzed: om juṃ vāgīśvaryai namaḥ pūjā juṃ vāgīśvaryai svāhā vāgīśvari kṣamyatām  sṛṣṭi sthiti laye dakṣe bhoga mokṣa prade śive vāgīśvari namaḥ te tu gaccha devi suviṣṭapam
translated: O Vāgīśvarī, be pleased.🔽O Dakṣa (Skilled One) in creation, sustenance, and dissolution, O auspicious one who grants enjoyment and liberation,

original: p /
analyzed: p
translated: salutations to you, O Vāgīśvarī (Goddess of Speech). Go, O Goddess, to the excellent abode.

original: tato hasta mātrā idhmāhomaḥ // // mūlena // śivāṃgniṃ tarpayāmi svāhā //
analyzed: tatas hasta mātrā idhmāhomaḥ   mūlena śiva agnim tarpayāmi svāhā
translated: Then the Homa with fuel the size of a hand, with the root mantra: I offer libation to the Śiva fire, svāhā.

original: oṃ atha sragsruvasaṃskāraḥ //
analyzed: om atha sraj sruva saṃskāraḥ
translated: Om, now the purification of the garland and ladle.

original: oṃ phaṭ prokṣaṇaṃ karomi phaṭ // avaguṇṭhanaṃ // śivāmbhasā prokṣaṇam // evaṃ // tāpanaṃ // bhrāmaṇaṃ
analyzed: om phaṭ prokṣaṇam karomi phaṭ avaguṇṭhanam śiva ambhasā prokṣaṇam evam tāpanam bhrāmaṇam
translated: Om, I sprinkle with Phaṭ, Phaṭ. The covering, the sprinkling with Śiva water, likewise, the heating, the whirling,

original: punaḥ prokṣaṇam // agreṇa tadagrasparśaḥ // punaḥ prokṣaṇabhrāmaṇa tāpanāni // tanmadhyena
analyzed: punar prokṣaṇam agreṇa tad agra sparśaḥ punar prokṣaṇa bhrāmaṇa tāpanāni tad madhyena
translated: the sprinkling again, the touching of their tips with the front, the heating, whirling, and sprinkling again,

original: tanmadhyasparśaḥ // punaḥ tāpayāmi namaḥ // bhrāmayāmi // prokṣayāmi // mūlena tanmūlasparśaḥ // tato
analyzed: tad madhya sparśaḥ punar tāpayāmi namaḥ bhrāmayāmi prokṣayāmi mūlena tad mūla sparśaḥ
translated: the touching of their middle with the middle, again, I heat, salutations. I whirl, I sprinkle, with the root mantra, the touching of their roots, then,

original: nābhā'vadho mukhau saṃsthāpya // śivaśaktibhyāṃ samālabhanaṃ gandho namaḥ // argho namaḥ // puṣpaṃ namaḥ
analyzed: nābhau adhas mukhau saṃsthāpya śiva śaktibhyām samālabhanam gandhaḥ namaḥ arghaḥ namaḥ puṣpam namaḥ
translated: placing them with the mouths facing down up to the navel, the anointing with Śiva and Śakti, fragrance, salutations. Arghya, salutations. Flowers, salutations.

original: ūrdhvamukhau kṛtvā // śivāya namaḥ // śaktaye namaḥ //
analyzed: ūrdhva mukhau kṛtvā śivāya namaḥ śaktaye namaḥ
translated: Having raised them upwards, Om, salutations to Shiva. Om, salutations to Shakti.

original: tata ājyasaṃskāraḥ //
analyzed: tatas ājya saṃskāraḥ
translated: Then, the purification of ghee:

original: ājya pātramānīya / astrāya phaḍiti prakṣālya / mūlenā'jyaṃ vīkṣya / astrāya phaḍiti prokṣya / astrāya
analyzed: ājya pātram ānīya astrāya phaṭ iti prakṣālya mūlena ājyam vīkṣya astrāya phaṭ iti prokṣya astrāya
translated: Having brought the ghee vessel, having washed with Astraya Phaṭ, having seen the ghee with the root mantra, having sprinkled with Astraya Phaṭ,

original: phaḍiti darbhairghṛtaṃ santāḍya / huṃ ityarghajalenā'bhyukṣya / iti saṃskāra catuṣṭayaṃ
analyzed: phaṭ iti darbhaiḥ ghṛtam santāḍya hum iti argha jalena abhyukṣya iti saṃskāra catuṣṭayam
translated: having struck the ghee with darbha grass with Astraya Phaṭ, having sprinkled with the water of the argha with Hum, having performed the four purifications,

original: kṛtvā'jyapātraṃ vāyu koṇe saṃsthāpya / namaḥ iti mantreṇājya sthālīṃ sthāpayet //
analyzed: kṛtvā ājyapātram vāyu koṇe saṃsthāpya namaḥ iti mantreṇa ājya sthālīm sthāpayet
translated: having placed the ghee vessel in the air corner, one should place the ghee vessel with the mantra Salutations.

original: idaṃ tāpanaṃ //
analyzed: idam tāpanam
translated: This is the heating.

original: tato darbhayugalaṃ prajvālyājye nikṣipya dagdhaśeṣaṃ nama iti mantreṇāgnau kṣipet //
analyzed: tatas darbha yugalam prajvālya ājye nikṣipya dagdha śeṣam namaḥ iti mantreṇa agnau kṣipet
translated: Then, having ignited a pair of darbha grass, having placed it in the ghee, one should throw the remaining burnt portion into the fire with the mantra Salutations.

original: idaṃ pavitrī karaṇaṃ //
analyzed: idam pavitrī karaṇam
translated: This is the sanctification.

original: punaḥ prajvālitena darbha yugalena humiti mantramuccaran // ghṛtaṃ nīrājya agnau kṣipet //
analyzed: punar prajvālitena darbha yugalena hum iti mantram uccaran ghṛtam nīrājya agnau kṣipet
translated: Again, having ignited the pair of darbha grass, having waved the ghee with the mantra Hum, one should throw it into the fire.

original: ityabhidyotanaṃ //
analyzed: iti abhidyotanam
translated: This is the illumination.

original: tataḥ prajvālita kuśamuṣṭiṃ gṛhītvāstrāya phaḍiti mantramuccaran //
analyzed: tatas prajvālita kuśa muṣṭim gṛhītvā astrāya phaṭ iti mantram uccaran
translated: Then, having taken a fistful of ignited kusha grass, reciting the mantra Astraya Phaṭ,

original: ghṛte prajvālitāndarbhānpradarśyāgnau kṣipet //
analyzed: ghṛte prajvālitān darbhān pradarśya agnau kṣipet
translated: having shown the ignited darbha grass in the ghee, one should throw it into the fire.

original: ityuddyotanaṃ //
analyzed: iti uddyotanam
translated: This is the illumination.

original: tata uttānayorhastayoraṅguṣṭhakaniṣṭhikābhyāṃ pavitraṃ pṛthakpṛthagvṛtvā'strāya phaḍiti mantramuccaran
analyzed: tatas uttānayoḥ hastayoḥ aṅguṣṭha kaniṣṭhikābhyām pavitram pṛthak pṛthak vṛtvā astrāya phaṭ iti mantram uccaran
translated: Then, with the thumbs and little fingers of the outstretched hands, having taken up the pavitra separately, reciting the mantra Aṣṭrāya phaṭ,

original: prāṅmukhaṃ ghṛtamutplavanamātmanobhimukhaṃ saṃplavanaṃ ca kṛtvā mūlenasāṅgenājyaṃ pūjayet / te
analyzed: prāc mukham ghṛtam utplavanam ātmanaḥ abhimukham saṃplavanam ca kṛtvā mūlena sa aṅgena ājyam pūjayet te
translated: Facing east, having caused the ghee to float towards oneself, and having caused it to float towards oneself, one should worship the ghee with the root mantra along with the limbs.

original: naivāmṛtīkaraṇaṃ // ājyaṃ mūlenārcayet //
analyzed: na eva amṛtīkaraṇam ājyam mūlena arcayet
translated: This is the immortalization. One should worship the ghee with the root mantra.

original: ityājyasaṃskāraḥ //
analyzed: iti ājya saṃskāraḥ
translated: This is the purification of ghee.

original: laṃ sadyojātavaktreṇa raṃ aghoravaktramanusandadhe svāhā // //
analyzed: laṃ sadyojāta vaktreṇa raṃ aghora vaktram anusandadhe svāhā
translated: Laṃ with the face of Sadyojāta, Raṃ I consecrate with the face of Aghora, svāhā.🔽 Raṃ with the face of Aghora, Yaṃ I consecrate with the face of Tatpuruṣa, svāhā.

original: raṃ aghoravaktreṇa yaṃ tatpuruṣa vaktramanusandadhe svāhā // // yaṃ tat puruṣavaktreṇa kṣaṃ īśāna🔽vaktramanusandadhe svāhā // // oṃ hūṃ nāḍitraya kalpanāṃ karomi namaḥ / ityāji pātre pūrvāgraṃ
analyzed: raṃ aghora vaktreṇa yam tatpuruṣa vaktram anusandadhe svāhā yam tat puruṣa vaktreṇa kṣaṃ īśāna  vaktram anusandadhe svāhā    om   nāḍi traya kalpanām karomi namaḥ iti āji pātre pūrva agram
translated: Yaṃ with the face of Tatpuruṣa, Kṣaṃ I consecrate with the face of Īśāna, svāhā.

original: darbhadvayaṃ sthāpayet // tatra madhye //🔽oṃ hāṃ icchāśaktaye namaḥ // oṃ vahnidhāmne suṣumṇāyai namaḥ // svavāme //
analyzed: darbha dvayam sthāpayet tatra madhye  om hāṃ icchā śaktaye namaḥ om vahni dhāmne suṣumṇāyai namaḥ sva vāme
translated: Om huṃ I perform the conception of the three nāḍīs, salutations. Thus, in the ghee vessel, one should place two darbha blades with the tips facing east. In the middle of them,🔽 Om hāṃ salutations to the power of will. Om salutations to the Susumnā, the abode of fire. On one's left,

original: oṃ hrīṃ kriyāśaktaye namaḥ // oṃ saḥ somadhāmne iḍāyai namaḥ // svadakṣe //
analyzed: om   kriyā śaktaye namaḥ om saḥ soma dhāmne iḍāyai namaḥ sva dakṣe
translated: Om hrīṃ salutations to the power of action. Om salutations to the Iḍā, the abode of Soma. On one's right,

original: oṃ hūṃ jñānaśaktaye namaḥ // oṃ juṃ sūryadhāmne piṅgalāya namaḥ // athāgneḥ //
analyzed: om hūm jñāna śaktaye namaḥ om juṃ sūrya dhāmne piṅgalāya namaḥ atha agneḥ
translated: Om Hrum salutations to the power of knowledge. Om Jum salutations to the sun-dwelling Pingala. Now for Agni:

original: oṃ śivāgnerbhāgatrayakalpanāṃ karomi namaḥ //
analyzed: om śiva agneḥ bhāga traya kalpanām karomi namaḥ
translated: Om I perform the division of the auspicious fire into three parts, salutations.

original: ityurdhvamukhaṃ prādeśamātraṃ samidhādvayaṃ dadyāt //
analyzed: iti ūrdhva mukham prādeśa mātram samidhā dvayam dadyāt
translated: Thus, one should offer two samidh sticks upwards facing, measuring a span.

original: oṃ oṃ piṅgalāsraya sūryāya namaḥ // iti svavāme vahnidakṣe pūjanam //🔽oṃ juṃ suṣumṇāśrayāyāgnaye namaḥ / iti madhye // oṃ saḥ iḍāśrayāya somāya namaḥ // iti svadakṣe
analyzed: om om sūryāya namaḥ iti sva vāme vahni dakṣe pūjanam  om juṃ suṣumṇā āśrayāya agnaye namaḥ iti madhye om saḥ iḍā āśrayāya somāya namaḥ iti sva dakṣe
translated: Om Om salutations to the sun residing in Pingala. Thus, worship in the right of the fire in one's left.🔽Om Jum salutations to the fire residing in Suṣumnā. Thus, in the middle. Om Sah salutations to Soma residing in Iḍā. Thus, in one's right.

original: vahnivāme // oṃ juṃ saḥ agnaye svāhā // ityājya dakṣabhāgādvahni dakṣabhāge // mūlena somāya svāhā //
analyzed: vahni vāme om juṃ saḥ agnaye svāhā iti ājya dakṣa bhāgāt vahni dakṣa bhāge mūlena somāya svāhā
translated: In the left of the fire. Om Jum Sah Svāhā to Agni. Thus, from the right part of the clarified butter, in the right part of the fire. With the basic mantra, Svāhā to Soma.

original: ityājya vāmabhāgādvahnivāmabhāge //
analyzed: iti ājya vāma bhāgāt vahni vāma bhāge
translated: Thus, from the left part of the clarified butter, in the left part of the fire.

original: p / 🔽vāmabhāgādvahnivāmabhāge //
analyzed: p  vāma bhāgāt vahni vāma bhāge
translated: In the middle of the fire.🔽From the left part, in the left part of the fire.

original: oṃ juṃ saḥ agnīṣomābhyāṃ svāhā ityājya madhyabhāgādvahni madhyabhāge //
analyzed: om juṃ saḥ agnīṣomābhyām svāhā iti ājya madhya bhāgāt vahni madhya bhāge
translated: Om Jum Sah Svāhā to Agni and Soma. Thus, from the middle part of the clarified butter, in the middle part of the fire.

original: iti śuklapakṣe //
analyzed: iti śuklapakṣe
translated: Thus, in the bright fortnight.

original: oṃ juṃ saḥ agnaye svāhā // ityājya dakṣabhāgādvahnidakṣabhāge // oṃ juṃ saḥ sūryāya svāhā // ityājya
analyzed: om juṃ saḥ agnaye svāhā iti ājya dakṣa bhāgāt vahni dakṣa bhāge om juṃ saḥ sūryāya svāhā iti ājya
translated: Om Jum Sah Svāhā to Agni. Thus, from the right part of the clarified butter, in the right part of the fire. Om Jum Sah Svāhā to Surya. Thus, from the left part of the clarified butter,

original: vāmabhāgādagni vāmabhāge // oṃ juṃ saḥ agni sūryābhyāṃ svāhā // ityājya madhyabhāgādvahni madhyabhāge
analyzed: vāma bhāgāt agni vāma bhāge om juṃ saḥ agni sūryābhyām svāhā iti ājya madhya bhāgāt vahni madhya bhāge
translated: From the left part, Agni in the left part. Om Jum Sah, to Agni and Surya, Svāhā. Thus, from the middle part of the clarified butter, in the middle part of the fire.

original: iti kṛṣṇapakṣe //
analyzed: iti kṛṣṇapakṣe
translated: Thus, in the dark fortnight.

original: oṃ juṃ saḥ śivāgneḥ prāśanaṃ karomi svāhā // // saṃpadyatāṃ // tato yajamānasya saparivārasya
analyzed: om juṃ saḥ śiva agneḥ prāśanam karomi svāhā
translated: Om Jum Sah, I perform the oblation of the auspicious fire, Svāhā. Let it be accomplished. Then, to the householder and his attendants,

original: tilakaṃ puṣpamāśīrvādaṃ ca datvābandhāmi kaṅkaṇaṃ te baddhamatirbhavabhayocchityai //
analyzed: tilakam puṣpam āśīrvādam ca da tvā ābandhāmi kaṅkaṇam te baddha matiḥ bhava bhaya ucchityai
translated: having given the tilaka, flowers, and blessings, I bind this bracelet for you, to free your mind from the fear of worldly existence.

original: bhaja nipuṇamamalamabhayāya śāśvataṃ sthānam // prāṇāpānau cakṣuśśrottre ghrāṇaṃ manaḥ śiro hastau
analyzed: bhaja nipuṇam amalam abhayāya śāśvatam sthānam prāṇa apānau cakṣuḥ śrottre ghrāṇam manaḥ śiraḥ hastau
translated: Worship the skillful, pure, and eternal abode for fearlessness. The life-breath, the eyes, the ears, the nose, the mind, the head, the hands,

original: prākṛtāvapi yadupātuṃ tat te devaḥ śivaḥ pātu //
analyzed: prākṛtau api tat te devaḥ śivaḥ pātu
translated: and whatever else is to be protected, may that Lord Śiva protect you.

original: oṃ pāpaharaste bhagavāñśivo'śubhaṃ haratu sarvabhūtagaṇāḥ śāntyai bhavantu yatnāddhṛdayaṃ nārāyaṇaḥ🔽pātu //
analyzed: om pāpa haraḥ te haratu sarva bhūta gaṇāḥ śāntyai bhavantu yatnāt hṛdayam nārāyaṇaḥ  pātu
translated: Om, may the Lord Śiva, the remover of sins, remove all inauspiciousness. May all the groups of beings be peaceful. May Lord Nārāyaṇa protect your heart with care.

original: iti kaṅkaṇamantraḥ // athājya darśanam //
analyzed: iti kaṅkaṇa mantraḥ atha ājya darśanam
translated: Thus is the mantra for the bracelet. Now, the vision of clarified butter.

original: ājyaṃ tejaḥ samuddiṣṭamājyaṃ pāpaharaṃ param // ājyaṃ svarāṇāmāhāra ājye lokā pratiṣṭhitāḥ //
analyzed: ājyam tejaḥ samuddiṣṭam ājyam pāpa haram param ājyam svarāṇām āhāraḥ ājye lokāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: Clarified butter is declared to be the light. Clarified butter is the supreme remover of sins. Clarified butter is the food of the vowels. The worlds are established in clarified butter.

original: divyāntarikṣabhaumādyairyatte kilviṣamāgatam / tatsarvamājya sparśena vināśamupagacchatu //
analyzed: divya āntarikṣa bhauma ādyaiḥ yat te kilviṣam āgatam tat sarvam ājya sparśena vināśam upagacchatu
translated: Whatever sin has befallen you from the divine, atmospheric, earthly, etc., may all that be destroyed by the touch of the clarified butter.

original: ātmano vāṅmanaḥ kāyopārjitapāpa nivāraṇārthamaśeṣa pāpakṣayārthaṃ sveṣṭadevatā prītyarthaṃ
analyzed: ātmanaḥ vāc manaḥ kāya upārjita pāpa nivāraṇa artham aśeṣa pāpa kṣaya artham sva iṣṭadevatā prīti artham
translated: For the sake of warding off the sins accumulated by the body, speech and mind, for the sake of destroying all sins, for the delight of one's chosen deity,

original: śivāgnaye idamājyamarpayāmi namaḥ // ityājya darśanam //
analyzed: śiva agnaye idam ājyam arpayāmi namaḥ iti ājya darśanam
translated: I offer this clarified butter to the auspicious fire. Salutations. Thus is the visualization of clarified butter.🔽The god Agni, full of flames, adorned in many ways,

original: agniṃ jvālāmayaṃ devaṃ bhūṣayantamanekaśaḥ // jvālāmaṇḍitamākāśaṃ sākṣasūtrakamaṇḍalum //
analyzed: agnim jvālā mayam devam bhūṣayantam anekaśas jvālā maṇḍitam ākāśam sa akṣasūtra kamaṇḍalum
translated: the sky adorned with flames, with a rosary and water pot,🔽granting boons and protection, of white color, the fire god,

original: varadābhayahastaṃ ca śvetavarṇaṃ hutāśanam // śukapṛṣṭhagataṃ devaṃ śaktihastaṃ caturbhujam //
analyzed: vara da abhaya hastam ca śveta varṇam hutāśanam śuka pṛṣṭha gatam devam śakti hastam catur bhujam
translated: seated on a parrot's back, the god with a spear in his hand, with four arms,

original: mṛgājinena sannaddhaṃ yajamānavarapradam //
analyzed: mṛga ajinena sannaddham yajamāna vara pradam
translated: clad in a deerskin, bestowing boons to the sacrificer,

analyzed: trinetram pañcavaktram ca homa kāle tu cintayet evam dhyātvā bhagavantam sarva siddhi pradāyakam
translated: one should contemplate at the time of the homa a three-eyed, five-faced one. Having thus meditated on the Lord, the bestower of all accomplishments,

original: svarṇāśvarūvinirmitaṃ hutavahaṃ sindūra puñjaprabhaṃ jvālābhi nicitāṅgaroma hṛdayaṃ kāntyājaganmohanam
analyzed: hutavaham sindūra puñja prabham jvālā abhi nicita aṅga roma hṛdayam kāntyā jagat mohanam
translated: the fire god, created from the form of a golden horse, with a radiance like a mass of vermilion, the heart of the body filled with flames, captivating the world with its beauty,

original: aśvākāramanarghyaratnavilasadbhūṣānamatkandharaṃ ratnairindriya nirgatairvasumatīmācchādayantaṃ smaret //
analyzed: aśva ākāram anarghya ratna vilasat bhūṣā namat kandharam ratnaiḥ indriya nirgataiḥ vasumatīm ācchādayantam smaret
translated: One should remember him as having the form of a horse, with his neck bent down with ornaments shining with priceless jewels, covering the earth with the jewels that have come out of his senses.

original: śaktiṃ vahneḥ srūgsrūvau dakṣahastairvāmairhastaistomaraṃ tāla vṛttam // sarpiḥ pūrṇaṃ taptasau
analyzed: śaktim vahneḥ srūk srūvau dakṣa hastaiḥ vāmaiḥ hastaiḥ tomaram tāla vṛttam sarpiḥ pūrṇam
translated: The Shakti of Agni, the Sruva and Sruva, with the right hands, with the left hands, the spear, the palm,

original: varṇavarṇaṃ pātraṃ śaśvatsaptajihvāṃ dadhānām //
analyzed: varṇa varṇam pātram śaśvat sapta jihvām dadhānām
translated: The vessel filled with ghee, always having the seven tongues, having the color of heated gold.

original: oṃ juṃ saḥ śivāgneccuḍādyāḥ saṃskārābālyādi saṃsthitā brahmacāri vratāntāśca sarve saṃskārāḥ
analyzed: om juṃ saḥ śiva agni id cuḍa ādyāḥ saṃskārāḥ bālya ādi saṃsthitāḥ brahmacāri vrata antāḥ ca sarve saṃskārāḥ
translated: Om Jum Sah, the consecrations beginning with the topknot of Shiva Agni, established from childhood, the vows of a celibate student and all the consecrations,

original: sampūrṇāssantu vauṣaṭ // iti pūrṇā //
analyzed: sampūrṇāḥ santu vauṣaṭ iti pūrṇā
translated: May they be complete, Vaushat. Thus is the Purnna.

original: tataḥ svadakṣe ca mase viṣṇuṃ pūjayet // puṣpākṣatatilairyuktaṃ pavitraṃ tatra kalpayet //
analyzed: tatas sva dakṣe ca mase viṣṇum pūjayet puṣpa akṣata tilaiḥ yuktam pavitram tatra kalpayet
translated: Then, in his own right hand, one should worship Vishnu. There, one should consecrate the sacred thread along with flowers, unbroken rice and sesame seeds.

original: svanāmapadasaṃyuktaṃ svādhyāyena namontagam // śaṅkhacakragadāpadmairbhūṣitaṃ ca caturbhujaṃ //
analyzed: sva nāma pada saṃyuktam svādhyāyena namaḥ nta gam śaṅkha cakra gadā padmaiḥ bhūṣitam ca caturbhujam
translated: Conjoined with one's own name, ending with salutations in one's own study, adorned with the conch, discus, mace and lotus, having four arms,

analyzed: śrīvatsa kaustubha uraskam vanamālā vibhūṣitam dhyāye devam vidham devam ca mase viṣṇum avyayam
translated: With the Srivatsa and Kaustubha on the chest, adorned with a garland of forest flowers, one should meditate on the god Vishnu, the imperishable god, in the right hand.

original: viṣṇupīṭhāya vidmahe viṣṇudhyānāya dhīmahi tanno viṣṇupracodayāt // //
analyzed: viṣṇu pīṭhāya vidmahe viṣṇu dhyānāya dhīmahi tat naḥ viṣṇu pracodayāt
translated: We meditate on the seat of Vishnu, may Vishnu inspire us with wisdom.

original: oṃ bhūpuruṣamāvāhayāmi namaḥ // oṃ hūṃ bhuvaḥ puruṣamāvāhayāmi namaḥ //🔽p /
analyzed: om bhūpuruṣam āvāhayāmi namaḥ om   bhuvaḥ puruṣam āvāhayāmi namaḥ  p
translated: Om, I invoke the Purusha of the earth, salutations. Om, Hraum, I invoke the Purusha of the Bhuvarloka, salutations.

original: oṃ hrīṃ svaḥ puruṣamāvāhayāmi namaḥ // oṃ hūṃ hrīṃ bhūrbhuvassvaḥ puruṣamāvāhayāmi namaḥ //

translated: Om, Hraum, I invoke the Purusha of the Svarloka, salutations. Om, Hraum, Hraum, I invoke the Purusha of the Bhu, Bhuvar, and Svarloka, salutations.

original: bhagavanviṣṇo āgaccha bhagavanviṣṇo svāgataṃ bhoḥ santiṣṭha sannidhatsva haṃ haṃ haṃ bhagavanpādyaṃ🔽gṛhāṇa namaḥ //
analyzed: bhagavan viṣṇo āgaccha bhagavan viṣṇo svāgatam bhoḥ santiṣṭha sannidhatsva haṃ haṃ haṃ bhagavan pādyam  gṛhāṇa namaḥ
translated: O Lord Vishnu, come. O Lord Vishnu, welcome. Please stay, be present. Ham, ham, ham, O Lord, accept the water for washing the feet. Salutations.

original: oṃ haṃ haṃ haṃ viṣṇo ācamanīyaṃ gṛhāṇa svadhā // oṃ haṃ haṃ haṃ viṣṇo arghyaṃ gṛhāṇa svadhā //
analyzed: om haṃ haṃ haṃ viṣṇo ācamanīyam gṛhāṇa svadhā om haṃ haṃ haṃ viṣṇo arghyam gṛhāṇa svadhā
translated: Om, ham, ham, ham, O Vishnu, accept the water for sipping. Svadha. Om, ham, ham, ham, O Vishnu, accept the Arghya. Svadha.

original: evaṃ samālabhannamādhatsva // evamakṣatapuṣpāṇi vauṣaṭ // evaṃ pañcopacārapūjāṃ gṛhṇa vauṣaṭ / oṃ
analyzed: evam samālabhan amādhatsva evam akṣata puṣpāṇi vauṣaṭ evam pañca upacāra pūjām gṛhṇa vauṣaṭ om
translated: Thus, having anointed, please accept. Thus, the unbroken rice and flowers, Vaushat. Thus, accept the worship with five offerings, Vaushat. Om

original: hūṃ viṣṇave namaḥ //
analyzed: hūm viṣṇave namaḥ
translated: Hraum, salutations to Vishnu.

original: iti camasapātra pūjanam //
analyzed: iti camasapātra pūjanam
translated: Thus, the worship of the sacrificial ladle.

original: tasmādājñāṃ grāhayet //
analyzed: tasmāt ājñām grāhayet
translated: Therefore, one should receive the command.

original: paśvarthaṃ yajña ārabdha ātmārthaṃ vāpi sādhakaiḥ // bhagavaṃstutprasādena yāge nicchidratāstunaḥ //
analyzed: paśu artham yajñaḥ ārabdhaḥ ātma artham vā api sādhakaiḥ bhagavan tud prasādena yāge nicchidra tā stunaḥ
translated: But by the grace of the praise of the Lord, may our sacrifice be free from defects.

original: atha carusaṃskāraḥ //
analyzed: atha caru saṃskāraḥ
translated: Now, the purification of the cooked rice.

original: carusādhanārthaṃ kuṇḍadagnimānīya carusādhanaṃ kuryāt //
analyzed: caru sādhana artham kuṇḍadagnim ānīya caru sādhanam kuryāt
translated: For the purpose of cooking the rice, one should bring the sacrificial pit and fire and perform the cooking of the rice.

original: athavā yadi dīkṣāparastvayaṃ viśeṣaḥ carvarthamagnimudyatya kavacenāvaguṇṭhitaṃ surakṣitaṃ sthāpayet //
analyzed: athavā yadi dīkṣā paraḥ tu ayam viśeṣaḥ caru artham agnim udyatya kavacena avaguṇṭhitam su rakṣitam sthāpayet
translated: Or, if one is devoted to initiation, this is the special procedure: having kindled the fire for the sake of the rice, one should install it, covered with the protective armor, and well-protected.

original: yadi laukikāgneḥ siddhaṃ carumānītaṃ tadāyaṃ saṃskāraḥ //
analyzed: yadi laukika agneḥ siddham carum ānītam tadā ayam saṃskāraḥ
translated: If the cooked rice is brought from a worldly fire, then this is the purification.

original: atha svavāmegni dakṣe maryādayāmaṇḍalaṃ kṛtvā pūrvāgrāndarbhānāstīrya / tatra ādhāraśaktyai namaḥ //
analyzed: atha sva vāme agni dakṣe maryādayā maṇḍalam kṛtvā pūrva agrān darbhān āstīrya tatra ādhāra śaktyai namaḥ

original: ityāsanapakṣaṃ saṃpūjya / tadupari caruṃsaṃsthāpya / tatra mūlena sāṅgena caruṃ sampūjya
analyzed: iti āsana pakṣam saṃpūjya tad upari carum saṃsthāpya tatra mūlena sa aṅgena carum sampūjya
translated: Having thus worshipped the seat, one should place the cooked rice upon it, and having worshipped the cooked rice with the root mantra along with its limbs,

analyzed: amṛteśa mudrayā amṛtīkṛtya darbha kāṇḍam prajvālya phaṭ nīrājanam karomi phaṭ
translated: one should make it nectar-like with the Amritesha mudra, light a darbha blade, and perform the waving of lights with phat, I offer the waving of lights with phat.

original: iti carūpari trinbhrāmya agnau kṣipet / śivāmbhasā prokṣya / astreṇa darbhaviṣṭaramadhye prajvālyā'grataḥ
analyzed: iti caru upari tris bhrāmya agnau kṣipet śiva ambhasā prokṣya astreṇa darbha viṣṭara madhye prajvālya agratas
translated: Thus, having rotated three times over the fire, one should throw it into the fire. Having sprinkled with Shiva's water, having ignited the darbha seat with the weapon in front,

original: viṣṭarasahitaṃ me kṣaṇaṃ sthāpyasandīpyā'rghapātrāmbunā'laṅkṛtya aṅgaistriḥ kuryāt //
analyzed: viṣṭara sahitam me kṣaṇam sthāpya sandīpya arghapātra ambunā alaṅkṛtya aṅgaiḥ tris kuryāt
translated: having placed it with the seat for a moment, having ignited it, having adorned it with the water of the argha vessel, one should perform it three times with the limbs.

original: oṃ juṃ saḥ svatapto bhavastvā ityagnau hā iti carau // oṃ juṃ santuṣṭo bhava svā ityagnau hā iti carau //
analyzed: om juṃ saḥ sva taptaḥ bhavaḥ tvā iti agnau hā iti carau  om juṃ santuṣṭaḥ bhava svā iti agnau hā iti carau
translated: Om, Jum, Sah, become self-heated, in the fire, and Ha, in the charu. Om, Jum, Sah, become satisfied, in the fire, and Ha, in the charu.

original: evaṃ vyoṃ īṃ hūṃ juṃ phaṭ / agnāvadhiśritya // tato bhūmau svadakṣe āsanāya namaḥ iti darbhānāstīrya
analyzed: evam vyoṃ īṃ   juṃ phaṭ agnau adhiśritya tatas bhūmau sva dakṣe āsanāya namaḥ iti darbhān āstīrya
translated: Thus, Vyo, Im, Hum, Jum, Phat, having placed it in the fire, then on the ground, to the right, having spread the darbha grass with Salutations to the seat,

original: carumavatārayet //
analyzed: carum avatārayet
translated: one should bring down the charu.

original: śītābhighāraḥ somavyāptyānisvinnatā doṣopaśamanāya mūlena sāṅgaṣaṭkena vauṣaḍ jāti yutena //
analyzed: śīta abhighāraḥ soma vyāptyā anisvinna tā doṣa upaśamanāya mūlena sa aṅga ṣaṭkena vauṣaṭ jāti yutena
translated: The cooling sprinkling, the moistening with Soma, and the non-boiling are for the removal of faults. With the root mantra along with the six limbs, along with the syllable Vaushat, and the jati.

original: svaśīto bhava vauṣaṭ svā iti carau // hā ityagnau //
analyzed: sva śītaḥ bhava vauṣaṭ svā iti carau hā iti agnau
translated: Become cool, Vaushat, Sva, in the charu. Ha, in the fire.

original: evaṃ juṃ suśīto bhava vauṣaṭ svā iti carau // hā ityagnau //
analyzed: evam jum su śītaḥ bhava vauṣaṭ svā iti carau hā iti agnau
translated: Thus, Jum, become very cool, Vaushat, Sva, in the charu. Ha, in the fire.

original: evaṃ vyoṃ īṃ huṃ juṃ phaṭ // punaḥ somavatyai namaḥ pūjanam //
analyzed: evam vyom īm hum jum phaṭ punar somavatyai namaḥ pūjanam
translated: Thus, Vyo, Im, Hum, Jum, Phat. Again, salutations to Somavati, worship.

original: oṃ syūṃ jagadāpyāyakartre somāya namaḥ iti // tataḥ saṃpāta homaḥ // tatastaṃ carumastreṇa //
analyzed: om syūm jagat āpyāya kartre somāya namaḥ iti tatas saṃpāta homaḥ tatas tam carum astreṇa
translated: Om Syum to Soma, the nourisher of the world, salutations. Then the Sampata Homa. Then that Caru with the weapon.

original: oṃ phaṭ carumācchādayāmi namaḥ // iti darbhairācchādya / oṃ hūṃ caruṃ saṃrakṣayāmi namaḥ //
analyzed: om phaṭ carum ācchādayāmi namaḥ iti darbhaiḥ ācchādya om   carum saṃrakṣayāmi namaḥ
translated: Om Phat I cover the Caru with salutations. Having covered with Darbha grass, Om Hum I protect the Caru with salutations.

original: ityuparipuṣpaṃ dadyāt //
analyzed: iti upari puṣpam dadyāt
translated: Thus one should offer flowers on top.

original: tato navajihvā jvālāliṅgopari kalpayet pūjayeśca // tadyathā //
analyzed: tatas navajihvāḥ jvālā liṅga upari kalpayet pūjayeḥ ca  tat yathā
translated: Then one should imagine the nine tongues on top of the flame of the Linga and worship them. As follows:

original: oṃ prabhāyai namaḥ // oṃ dīptyai namaḥ // oṃ prakāśāya namaḥ // evamarcā // marīcyai // sthāpinyai // rucyai
analyzed: om prabhāyai namaḥ  om dīptyai namaḥ om prakāśāya namaḥ evam arcā marīcyai sthāpinyai rucyai
translated: Om salutations to Prabha. Om salutations to Dipti. Om salutations to Prakasa. Thus the worship of Marichi, Sthapini, Ruci,

original: karālyai // līlihāyai //
analyzed: karālyai līlihāyai
translated: Karali, and Liliha.

analyzed: iti jvālā liṅga upari jihvā rūpāḥ cintayet pūjayeḥ ca  atha kuṇḍa madhye navajihvā pūjanam yathā
translated: Thus one should imagine the tongues in the form of flames on top of the Linga and worship them. Now the worship of the nine tongues in the middle of the pit is as follows:

original: rājyārthadāyai namaḥ pūrve // dāhajananyai namaḥ āgneye // oṃ mṛtyudāyai namaḥ dakṣiṇe // oṃ
analyzed: rājya artha dāyai namaḥ pūrve dāha jananyai namaḥ āgneye om mṛtyu dāyai namaḥ dakṣiṇe om
translated: Salutations to Rajyarthadaya in the east. Salutations to Dahajananis in the southeast. Om salutations to Mrityudaya in the south.

original: śattruhāriṇyai namaḥ nairṛte //
analyzed: śattruhāriṇyai namaḥ nairṛte
translated: Salutations to Shatruharini in the southwest.

original: p /
analyzed: p

original: oṃ vaśīkartryai namaḥ paścime // oṃ uccāṭinyai namaḥ vāyau // arthadāyai namaḥ uttare // oṃ muktidāyai namaḥ
analyzed: om vaśīkartryai namaḥ paścime  om uccāṭinyai namaḥ vāyau arthadāyai namaḥ uttare om muktidāyai namaḥ
translated: Om, salutations to Muktida in the northeast.

original: īśāne // oṃ sarvasiddhipradāyai namaḥ madhye //
analyzed: īśāne om sarva siddhi pradāyai namaḥ madhye
translated: Om, salutations to Sarvasiddhiprada in the middle.

analyzed: evam sampūjya svāhā antaḥ homaḥ tata pūrṇā dvāra īśa iti
translated: Having worshipped thus, the oblation is offered with Svāhā. Then the Pūrṇāhuti. The doorkeepers are as follows.

analyzed: om juṃ saḥ śiva agneḥ jihvā kalpayāmi svāhā vauṣaṭ
translated: Om, Jum, salutations to the tongue of the Śiva fire. I consecrate with Svāhā and Vaṣaṭ.

original: atha dvitīyā // //
analyzed: atha dvitīyā
translated: Now the second.

original: śivāgnerjihvā sannidhirastu svāhā vauṣaṭ // atha vahniṃ caitanya tayā kalpitaṃ jvālāgraṃ vibhāvya //
analyzed: śiva agneḥ jihvā sannidhiḥ astu svāhā vauṣaṭ atha vahnim caitanya tayā kalpitam jvālā agram vibhāvya
translated: May the tongue of the Śiva fire be present with Svāhā and Vaṣaṭ. Then, visualizing the flame consecrated by the consciousness of the fire,

analyzed: raktam jaṭā dharam vahnim cintayet rakta vāsasam  svāham dvi bhujam tu tri locanam śuka pṛṣṭha āsanam devam jvālā śmaśrū vibhūṣitam
translated: One should contemplate the fire, red, wearing matted locks, and clad in red garments.🔽Svāhā, seated on the left, two-armed, three-eyed, the god seated on a parrot's back, adorned with flaming beard and eyebrows.

original: īdṛśaṃ cintayeddevaṃ havyakavye ca pāvakam // śukārūḍhāya svāhā sahitāya śaktihastāyāgnaye namaḥ //
analyzed: īdṛśam cintayet devam havya kavye ca pāvakam  śuka ārūḍhāya svāhā sahitāya śakti hastāya agnaye namaḥ
translated: One should contemplate the god in this way, the fire for oblations and offerings. Salutations to the fire mounted on a parrot, accompanied by Svāhā, with a spear in hand.

original: iti pūjanam //
analyzed: iti pūjanam
translated: This is the worship.

original: tato vahni jvālāgraṃ jumiti gṛhītvā vahni caitanyaṃ vibhāvya //
analyzed: tatas vahni jvālā agram jum iti gṛhītvā vahni caitanyam vibhāvya
translated: Then, taking the flame of the fire with the syllable Jūm, visualizing the consciousness of the fire,

analyzed: maṅkha abhidhatta taṣka rājānakāya maṅgalya rājānakāya ānanda rājānakāya sātīra ajānakāya
translated: To the king named Mangala, to the king named Mangalya, to the king named Ananda, to the king named Satirana,

analyzed: dhānya rājānakāya rudra rājānakāya pañcāla rājānakāya śītalanāthāya sapta āvaraṇa devatābhyaḥ

analyzed: tatas pūjā tatas tarpaṇam

original: iti sa siddhomaḥ // atha paśumantraḥ //
analyzed: iti sa siddhomaḥ atha paśu mantraḥ
translated: Thus it is accomplished. Now the mantra for the animal.

analyzed: sarva lakṣaṇa saṃpūrṇam paśum sva snāpyā vārāhī yamunā gaṅgā karatas yā sarasvatī
translated: The animal complete with all characteristics, having bathed, the Varahi, Yamuna, Ganga, Saraswati who goes to the hand,

analyzed: kāberī candrabhāgā ca sindhuḥ bhairava sā gataḥ paśu sthāne samāyāntu ye ca anyenada saṃjñakāḥ  vācam te svadhāmi prāṇam te svadhāmi nābhim te svadhāmi cakṣuḥ te svadhāmi śrottram te  svadhāmi vāc te āpyāyatām ghrāṇam te āpyāyatām śrottram te āpyāyatām nābhiḥ te
translated: And the Kaveri, Chandrabhaga, Sindhu, having gone to Bhairava, those with other river names come to the place of the animal.🔽I offer your speech to my own abode. I offer your life force to my own abode. I offer your navel to my own abode. I offer your eye to my own abode. I offer your ear to my own abode.🔽May your speech be nourished. May your nose be nourished. May your ear be nourished. May your navel be nourished.

original: āpyāyatāṃ // cakṣuste āpyāyatāṃ // śrottraṃ te āpyāyatāṃ //
analyzed: āpyāyatām cakṣuḥ te āpyāyatām śrottram te āpyāyatām
translated: May your eye be nourished. May your ear be nourished.

original: paśupāśavināśāya hemakuṭa sthitāya ca // parāparāya paramakāraṇāyāja rūpiṇe //
analyzed: paśu pāśa vināśāya hemakuṭa sthitāya ca parāparāya parama kāraṇāya aja rūpiṇe
translated: To the supreme, to the highest cause, to the one of unmanifest form,

original: padme padme mahāpadme padmāvati māye svāhā //
analyzed: padme padme mahāpadme padmāvati māye svāhā
translated: In the lotus, in the lotus, in the great lotus, in the lotus-clad, in the illusion, hail!

original: iti paśu prokṣaṇam // mūlena ca prokṣayet // pheṃ pheṃ paśūn hana hūṃ phaṭ ityabhyukṣya // tato
analyzed: iti paśu prokṣaṇam mūlena ca prokṣayet pheṃ pheṃ paśūn hana hūm phaṭ iti abhyukṣya tatas
translated: Thus is the sprinkling of the animal. And one should sprinkle with the root mantra, Fhen fhen, slay the animals, hum phat. Having sprinkled thus,

original: rajumādāyamastake paśuṃ bandhayet //
analyzed: rajum ādāya mastake paśum bandhayet
translated: Then taking the rope, one should bind the animal on the head.

original: oṃ hrīṃ phaṭ paśuṃ bandhaya // tato devyagre sthāpya //
analyzed: om   phaṭ paśum bandhaya tatas devī agre sthāpya
translated: Om hrim phat, bind the animal. Then having placed it in front of the Goddess,

original: mūlena prokṣiṇī pātrajalena prokṣya kavacenāvaguṇṭhya / dhenumudrayā'mṛtī kṛtya paramapaśurūpiṇe namaḥ
analyzed: mūlena prokṣiṇī pātra jalena prokṣya kavacena avaguṇṭhya dhenu mudrayā amṛtī kṛtya parama paśu rūpiṇe namaḥ
translated: Having sprinkled with the water of the sprinkling vessel with the root mantra, having covered with the protective mantra, having made it nectar with the dhenu mudra, one should offer water for washing the feet etc. with the mantra Salutations to the one in the form of the supreme animal,

original: iti mantreṇa pādyādikaṃ datvā punaḥ puṣpaiḥ pūjayet //
analyzed: iti mantreṇa pādya ādikam da tvā punar puṣpaiḥ pūjayet
translated: And again one should worship with flowers.

original: oṃ rudhiravadanāyai namaḥ śirasi // aiṃ caṇḍikāyai namaḥ kapole // sarasvatyai namaḥ mukhe // śraddhāyai
analyzed: om rudhiravadanāyai namaḥ śirasi aim caṇḍikāyai namaḥ kapole sarasvatyai namaḥ mukhe śraddhāyai
translated: Om, salutations to the one with blood for a face, on the head. Aim, salutations to Chandika, on the cheek. Sar, salutations to Sarasvati, in the mouth. Shraddha,

original: namaḥ / medhāyai namaḥ cakṣuṣoḥ // bṛhaspataye namaḥ prāṇadāyai namaḥ candrādibhyāṃ namaḥ // nāsikayoḥ
analyzed: namaḥ medhāyai namaḥ cakṣuṣoḥ bṛhaspataye namaḥ prāṇadāyai namaḥ candra ādibhyām namaḥ nāsikayoḥ
translated: Salutations. Medha, salutations to the eyes. Brihaspati, salutations to the life-giver. Salutations to the moon and others. Salutations to the nostrils.

original: līṃ hrīṃ bahurūpāyai namaḥ pracaṇḍarūpāyai namaḥ // ugranāsāyai namaḥ iti karṇayoḥ // vaiṣṇavyai
analyzed: līṃ   bahurūpāyai namaḥ pracaṇḍa rūpāyai namaḥ ugranāsāyai namaḥ iti karṇayoḥ vaiṣṇavyai
translated: Salutations to Vaiṣṇavī - in the tongue.🔽Salutations to Padma-nābha - in the belly. ,Salutations to Viṣṇu - in the navel.

original: namaḥ jihvāyāṃ // padmanābhāya namaḥ udare // viṣṇave namaḥ nābhau // śriyai namaḥ guhye // rudhirottamāya
analyzed: namaḥ jihvāyām padmanābhāya namaḥ udare viṣṇave namaḥ nābhau śriyai namaḥ guhye rudhirottamāya
translated: Salutations to Śrī - in the secret place. ,Salutations to Rudhira-uttamā.

translated: Salutations to Bhairavī - in the feet. ,Consign this animal, so-and-so, to the good path, show him liberation. Om hrīm

analyzed: candra maṇḍala dhiṣṭhita vighna hāyai ramum paśum arpayāmi svāhā
translated: I offer this animal to the obstacle-removing goddess residing in the lunar orb, svāhā.

original: caṇḍī vidhāne //
analyzed: caṇḍī vidhāne
translated: In the method of Caṇḍī.

original: oṃ hili bahurūpadharāyai caṃḍaṃ durgāyai imaṃ paśuṃ svārthaṃ niyojaya muktiṃ pradarśaya oṃ hrīṃ
analyzed: om hili bahu rūpa dharāyai caṇḍam durgāyai imam paśum sva artham niyojaya muktim pradarśaya om
translated: Om hilīṃ to the bearer of many forms, to the fierce Durgā, consign this animal to your own purpose, show him liberation, Om hrīm

original: śrīṃ candramaṇḍalādhiṣṭhita vighnāyai imaṃ paśumarpayāmi svāhā // oṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ sarvadevatā rūpiṇe
analyzed: śrīṃ candra maṇḍala adhiṣṭhita vighnāyai imam paśum arpayāmi svāhā om hrīṃ śrīṃ sarva devatā rūpiṇe
translated: I offer this animal to the obstacle-removing goddess residing in the lunar orb, svāhā. Om hrīm śrīṃ to the one who embodies all deities,

analyzed: bali rūpāya amuka paśave gandham arpayāmi namaḥ
translated: I offer incense to the animal so-and-so in the form of an offering, salutations.

original: akṣatapuṣpāṇi vauṣaṭ //
analyzed: akṣata puṣpāṇi vauṣaṭ
translated: Unhusked rice and flowers, vauṣaṭ.

original: paśo dakṣiṇe karṇe paśu gāyatrīṃ tripaṭhedyathā // paśupāśāya vidmahe viśvagarbhāya dhīmahi tanno
analyzed: paśu dakṣiṇe karṇe paśu gāyatrīm tri paṭhet yathā paśu pāśāya vidmahe viśva garbhāya dhīmahi tat naḥ

analyzed: jīvaḥ pracodayāt
translated: Jīva inspire us.

original: oṃ hrīṃ hūṃ phaṭ śivarūpaṃ gacchatu svāhā // oṃ juṃ saḥ hasarakṣamalavayaūṃ śivarūpaṃ gacchatu🔽svāhā // //

translated: Om Hrim Hum Phat - May the form of Śiva go forth, Svāhā. Om Jum Sah - May the form of Śiva go forth, Svāhā.

original: karṇamūle japet //
analyzed: karṇa mūle japet
translated: One should recite this at the root of the ear.

analyzed: etat devi mahā mantram durlabham ca svaraiḥ api karṇa mūle japet yaḥ tu sapta vāram varānane
translated: O Goddess, this great mantra is difficult to obtain even by the gods. O beautiful-faced one, he who recites this seven times at the root of the ear,

original: taṃ ca mokṣapade prāpya śivatatvaṃ labhet paśuḥ //🔽p /
analyzed: tam ca mokṣapade prāpya labhet paśuḥ  p
translated: Having attained the state of liberation, the animal obtains the truth of Śiva.

original: etadyo vai na jānāti nārakī paśughātakaḥ //
analyzed: etat yaḥ vai na jānāti nārakī paśu ghātakaḥ
translated: He who does not know this, is a hell-bound animal killer.

analyzed: tatas mūlam uccārya adya tāvat amuka śarmā amuka gotraḥ dīrgha āyuḥ astu
translated: Then, having offered incense, unbroken rice, water, etc., and recited the Mūlamantra, Today, so-and-so, of such-and-such a Gotra, may he live long.

analyzed: devī
translated: May he attain the state of supreme bliss, the fruit of a horse sacrifice, and ride in the best of aerial chariots, which are adorned with garlands of flags, and which were previously given by the Goddess.

original: lokagamanottara śāśvata samādhi cinmayā khaṇḍavijayakāmaḥ śrīmadamukadevatāyai imaṃ paśuṃ
analyzed: loka gamana uttara śāśvata khaṇḍa vijaya kāmaḥ śrīmat amuka devatāyai imam paśum
translated: The eternal samadhi of going to the world, full of consciousness, desiring victory over the parts, to the glorious deity such-and-such, this animal,

original: tubhyamarpayāmi namaḥ prasanno bhavet yuktvā puṣpākṣata jalādikaṃ paśośśirasi kṣipet // tata amṛmastu
analyzed: tubhyam arpayāmi namaḥ prasannaḥ bhavet yuktvā puṣpa akṣata jala ādikam paśoḥ śirasi kṣipet tata
translated: The Samadhi of the Supreme Path of the World, the eternal, the mind-made, desiring the victory of the parts, to the glorious deity such-and-such, I offer this animal to you. Salutations, be pleased. Having added flowers, unbroken rice, water, etc., one should throw them on the head of the animal. Then, the Amritam Stuti

original: naivedyaṃ nivedya //
analyzed: naivedyam nivedya
translated: is offered as Naivedya.

original: tataḥ paśoḥ śiro dhṛtvā imaṃ mantraṃ paṭhet // yajñārthaṃ paśavaḥ sṛṣṭhā yajñārthaṃ paśughātanam

translated: Then, holding the head of the animal, one should recite this mantra: Animals were created for the purpose of sacrifice, animals are to be killed for the purpose of sacrifice.

original: atastvāṃ ghātayiṣyāmi tasmād yajñavidhau vadhaḥ // śivāya tu mimaṃ piṇḍaṃ mattastvaṃ śivatāṃ gataḥ //
analyzed: atas tvām ghātayiṣyāmi tasmāt yajña vidhau vadhaḥ śivāya tu piṇḍam mattaḥ tvam śiva tām gataḥ
translated: Therefore, I will kill you. Thus, killing in the ritual of sacrifice, I offer this lump to Shiva. You have attained the state of Shiva from me.

original: tadbuddhya svapaśotvaṃ hi nā śivastvaṃ śivosi hi // paśurutpādito devairyajñārthaṃ ca vidhānataḥ //🔽idānīṃ tu mahotsāhe cchettavyosi mayā nagha // ajosi tvaṃ paśutvena yajñārthaṃ nirmitaḥ purā //
analyzed: tad buddhya sva paśo tvam hi nā śivaḥ tvam śivaḥ asi hi paśuḥ utpāditaḥ devaiḥ yajña artham ca vidhānataḥ  idānīm tu mahā utsāhe chettavyaḥ usi mayā nagha ajaḥ asi tvam paśu tvena yajña artham nirmitaḥ purā
translated: Knowing that, you are indeed an animal. You are not Shiva, you are Shiva. The animal was created by the gods for the purpose of sacrifice according to the rules.🔽Now, O sinless one, you are to be killed by me in this great festival. You are indeed a goat, created for the purpose of sacrifice in the past.

original: tvanmāṃsa balidānena hīṣṭapūjāṃ karomyaham // paśumenaṃ mayādattamapaśutvaṃ prade hi me //
analyzed: tvad māṃsa bali dānena hi iṣṭa pūjām karomi aham paśum enam mayā adattam apaśu tvam prade hi me
translated: By offering the oblation of your flesh, I perform the worship of the gods. Give me the state of non-animal, having given this animal to me.

original: upayogyastvayā kāryo yajña madhye sadaiva hi // devatā balidānena māṃsena rudhireṇa ca //
analyzed: upayogyaḥ tvayā kāryaḥ yajña madhye sadā eva hi devatāḥ bali dānena māṃsena rudhireṇa ca
translated: By offering oblations to the gods with meat and blood,

original: dāturā padvināśāya paśurūpa namostute // lokānāmupakārārthaṃ paśu sṛṣṭo mayā dhvanā //
analyzed: dātuḥ ā pad vināśāya paśu rūpa namaḥ stute  lokānām upakāra artham sṛṣṭaḥ mayā dhvanā
translated: For the destruction of the giver, in the form of an animal, salutations to you. The animal was created by me for the benefit of the people.

original: prokṣito devatā prītyai mamātmānaṃ ca tāraya //🔽p /
analyzed: prokṣitaḥ devatā prītyai mama ātmānam ca tāraya  p
translated: Consecrated for the satisfaction of the gods, deliver yourself and me.

original: rakṣārthaṃ bandhane sitvaṃ muktayedhikṛto mayā //
analyzed: rakṣā artham bandhane muktayedhi kṛtaḥ mayā
translated: For the sake of protection, you are bound and appointed by me for liberation.

original: devyāḥ prītiṃ samumutpādya svargaṃ gaccha paśūttama // iti taṃ paśuṃ bodhayitvā tatra khaḍgāṃ pūjayet //
analyzed: devyāḥ prītim samum utpādya svargam gaccha paśu uttama iti tam paśum bodhayitvā tatra khaḍgām pūjayet
translated: Having generated great satisfaction in the goddess, go to heaven, O best of animals. Having thus instructed the animal, one should worship the sword there.

original: mūlavidyayā khaḍgāṃ niṣkṛṣyā puratasaṃsthāpya / hrīṃ kali vajreśvari lohadaṇḍāyai namaḥ //
analyzed: mūlavidyayā khaḍgām niṣkṛṣya ā puratas saṃsthāpya hrīṃ kali vajreśvari lohadaṇḍāyai namaḥ
translated: Having extracted the sword with the root mantra and placed it in front, Hriṃ Kali Vajreśvari Lohadandāya Namaha.

original: iti gandhākṣata jalaiḥ prokṣayet //
analyzed: iti gandhākṣata jalaiḥ prokṣayet
translated: Thus one should sprinkle it with fragrant unbroken rice and water.

original: tatra gandhākṣatajalaiḥ sampūjya // ādau muṣṭi deśe // / vāgī brahmābhyāṃ namaḥ // madhye sāvitrī
analyzed: tatra gandha akṣata jalaiḥ sampūjya ādau muṣṭi deśe vāgī brahmābhyām namaḥ madhye sāvitrī
translated: Having worshipped it with fragrant unbroken rice and water, first at the place of the fist, Vāgīśe Brahmabhyāṃ Namaḥ, in the middle, Sāvitrī

original: viṣṇubhyāṃ namaḥ // agre umāmaheśvarābhyāṃ namaḥ // iti sampūjya //
analyzed: viṣṇubhyām namaḥ agre umā maheśvarābhyām namaḥ iti sampūjya
translated: Viṣṇubhyāṃ Namaḥ, in front, Umāmaheśvarebhyāṃ Namaḥ. Having thus worshipped,

original: taṃ dhṛtvābhimantrayet //
analyzed: tam dhṛtvā abhimantrayet
translated: one should hold it and invoke it with the following mantra:

original: khaḍgadhāyāsuranāśāya devakāryārtha tatpara // paśuḥ cchedyastvayāśīghraṃ khaḍganātha namostute //
analyzed: khaḍgadhāya asura nāśāya deva kārya artha tatpara paśuḥ chedyaḥ tvayā aśīghram khaḍganātha namaḥ stu te
translated: For the destruction of the demon Khaḍgadāsa, for the sake of the work of the gods, you are intent on that. The animal is to be quickly cut by you, O Lord of the Sword, salutations to you.

original: iti mantreṇa khaḍgāmabhimantrya // punarapi pūjayet //
analyzed: iti mantreṇa khaḍgām abhimantrya punar api pūjayet
translated: Having thus enchanted the sword with this mantra, one should again worship it.

original: khaḍgāya namaḥ khaḍgābījāya namaḥ //
analyzed: khaḍgāya namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the sword, salutations to the seed of the sword.

original: vyāsavyālitasvarāṅka sevita hrīṃ bījātmane namaḥ // asirvibhinna daityeśastīkṣṇadāro durāsadaḥ //
analyzed: vyāsa vyālita svara aṅka sevita hrīṃ bīja ātmane namaḥ asiḥ vibhinna daitya īśaḥ tīkṣṇa dāraḥ durāsadaḥ
translated: Salutations to the one whose nature is the seed HRIH, served by the hissing sound of the serpent Vyāsa, the sword that has split the lord of demons, with a sharp edge, difficult to approach,

original: śrīgarbhovijayaścaiva dharmapāla namostute //
analyzed: śrī garbhaḥ vijayaḥ ca eva dharmapāla namaḥ stu te
translated: the abode of prosperity, victorious, and the protector of dharma, salutations to you.

original: iti prāthya taṃ khaḍgamādāya //
analyzed: iti prāthya tam khaḍgam ādāya
translated: Having thus praised, one should take up that sword.

original: oṃ hrīṃ klīṃ caṇḍikāyai lohadaṇḍāyai namaḥ // oṃ hrīṃ klīṃ imamamuka paśuṃ tṛptiṃ kuru muru he
analyzed: om hrīṃ klīṃ caṇḍikāyai lohadaṇḍāyai namaḥ om hrīṃ klīṃ imam amuka paśum tṛptim kuru muru he
translated: Om Hrim Klim, salutations to the goddess Chandika, the one with the iron staff. Om Hrim Klim, O such-and-such animal, make it satisfied, crush it,

original: amuka devi gṛhāṇa svāhā // iti mantreṇa khaḍgena cchedayet //
analyzed: amuka devi gṛhāṇa svāhā iti mantreṇa khaḍgena chedayet
translated: O such-and-such goddess, accept it, svaha. With this mantra, one should cut with the sword.

analyzed: tatas svayam devī rūpaḥ bhūtvā nirvikalpaḥ san tam eka prahāreṇa chindyāt
translated: Then, becoming of the form of the goddess oneself, being free from conceptualization, one should cut it with a single blow.

analyzed: sa vikalpaḥ sādhakaḥ tu para hastena chedayet tasya rudhiram gṛhītvā sva puratas ānīya sva vāme bindu trikoṇa
translated: The practitioner with conceptualization should cut with the hand of another. Having taken its blood, bringing it in front of oneself, on one's left, in the bindu triangle,

original: vṛtta caturaśraṃ maṇḍalaṃ vilikhyāstra mantreṇa prokṣyādhāraśaktīḥ saṃpūjya tadupari rudhirabhāṇḍaṃ
analyzed: vṛtta caturaśram maṇḍalam vilikhya astra mantreṇa prokṣya ādhāra śaktīḥ saṃpūjya tad upari rudhira bhāṇḍam
translated: Having drawn a square or circular maṇḍala, consecrated it with the weapon mantra, worshipped the supporting śaktis, placed the blood vessel on it,

original: saṃsthāpya vāmāṅguṣṭhānāmikābhyāṃ spṛṣṭvā paṭhet //
analyzed: saṃsthāpya vāma aṅguṣṭha anāmikābhyām spṛṣṭvā paṭhet
translated: touched it with the thumb and ring finger of the left hand, and recited:

original: oṃ aiṃ divyakapālarudhiraraktavarṇāya vadanāya siddhāya siddhaghātāya namaḥ idaṃ kapālaṃ gṛhṇa svāhā
analyzed: om aim divya kapāla rudhira rakta varṇāya vadanāya siddhāya siddha ghātāya namaḥ idam kapālam gṛhṇa svāhā
translated: Om Aim, to the face that is red with the blood of the divine skull, to the accomplished one, to the slayer of the accomplished ones, salutations. Accept this skull, Svāhā.

original: tataḥ kṣettrapāleṣu kṣipet // śiro māṃsamānīya devyagre saṃsthāpya mūlena naivedyaṃ datvā //
analyzed: tatas kṣettrapāleṣu kṣipet śiraḥ māṃsam ānīya devī agre saṃsthāpya mūlena naivedyam da tvā
translated: Then, he should throw it into the Kṣetrapālas. Having brought the head meat and placed it in front of the Goddess, having offered the food offering with the root mantra,

original: iti balidānaṃ samāptam //
analyzed: iti bali dānam samāptam
translated: Thus, the offering of oblations is complete.

original: taduktaṃ śrī vṛddhasvacchande'ṣṭame paṭale //
analyzed: tat uktam śrī vṛddhasvacchande ṣṭame paṭale
translated: It is said in the eighth chapter of the venerable Vṛddhasvacchandatantra:

original: śrībhairavaḥ //
translated: The venerable Bhairava:

original: nivedayet pare brahme bhairavotsaṅga vṛṃhite // svadehotkartanaṃ kṛtvā juhuyāt satataṃ pare //
analyzed: nivedayet pare brahme bhairava utsaṅga vṛṃhite sva deha utkartanam kṛtvā juhuyāt satatam pare
translated: One should offer it in the supreme Brahman, which is expanded in the lap of Bhairava. Having cut off one's own body, one should always offer it into the supreme.

original: homayet tat samākhyātaṃ mantrasyā pyāyanaṃ mahat //
analyzed: homayet tat samākhyātam mantrasya ā pyāyanam mahat
translated: This is said to be the great nourishment of the mantra.

original: etadvai trividhaṃ karmamanaḥ kāyikavācikam // kṛtvā pūrvena ye paścān mahāpaśūpakārakam //
analyzed: etat vai trividham karma manaḥ kāyika vācikam kṛtvā pūrvena ye paścāt mahā paśu upakārakam
translated: Having performed this threefold action of mind, body, and speech, and having previously done the great service to the animal, one should offer it into the supreme.

original: satvāṅgalakṣaṇopetaṃ pratyagraṃ tu nareśvaram //🔽susnātaṃ susamānandaṃ baddhanetrapaṭaṃ śubham // udalāstu saśeṣaṃ vai ajaṃ vā mahiṣaṃ vṛṣam //
analyzed: satva aṅga lakṣaṇa upetam pratyagram tu nareśvaram  su snātam su sama ānandam baddha netra paṭam śubham sa śeṣam vai ajam vā mahiṣam vṛṣam
translated: The king should be fresh, endowed with the characteristics of a living being,🔽Well-bathed, well-pleased, with auspicious blindfolded eyes, with a goat, buffalo, bull,

original: mīnaṃ cāthavarārohe yatkiñcijjīvarūpiṇam // suśuṣkaṃ caiva susnātaṃ suromaṃ śṛṅgiṇaṃ śubham //
analyzed: mīnam ca atha varārohe yat kiñcid jīva rūpiṇam su śuṣkam ca eva su snātam su romam śṛṅgiṇam śubham
translated: Fish, or any other living form, O beautiful lady, well-dried, well-bathed, with good hair, with horns, auspicious,

original: sarvalakṣaṇasaṃpūrṇamakṣatāṅgamarogiṇam // oṃ hrīṃ kṣāṃ kṣaḥ tṛtīyena ākarṇāntāvalokayet //
analyzed: sarva lakṣaṇa saṃpūrṇam akṣata aṅgam arogiṇam om hrīṃ     tṛtīyena ā karṇa anta avalokayet
translated: Complete with all characteristics, with uninjured limbs, free from disease, with Om, Hrim, Ksham, Kshom, one should look from the ears to the end.

original: tato netra paṭādghāṭyā kulācarasamanvitaḥ // arghaiḥ puṣpāsavopītaiḥ śiraḥ pṛṣṭhe kaṭisthale //
analyzed: tatas netra paṭāt ghāṭyā kulācara samanvitaḥ arghaiḥ puṣpa āsava upītaiḥ śiraḥ pṛṣṭhe kaṭi sthale
translated: Then, removing the blindfold, endowed with the conduct of the Kula, with offerings, flowers, and wine, having sprinkled on the head, back, and waist,

original: prokṣayitvā pradānena divyanaivedya dhūpakaiḥ // yāvannacālayeddehaṃ paśuṃ tāvannapātayet //🔽p /
analyzed: prokṣayitvā pradānena divya naivedya dhūpakaiḥ yāvat na cālayet deham paśum tāvat na pātayet  p
translated: With gifts, divine offerings, and incense, one should not move the body until the animal is brought down.

original: hrīṃ hūṃ kṣaḥ tṛtīyena na vīrakarmasadā caret // kāma vibhūtidam //
translated: With Om, Hrim, Ksham, Kshom, one should not always perform the deed of a hero, which grants the prosperity of desire.

original: yadādau cālayedvaktraṃ paścāddehaṃ varānane // aśubhaṃ tat tu vijñeyaṃ duḥkhaśokāmaya pradam //
analyzed: yat ādau cālayet vaktram paścāt deham varānane aśubham tat tu vijñeyam duḥkha śoka āmaya pradam
translated: If one moves the face first and then the body, O beautiful lady, that should be known as inauspicious, giving rise to suffering, sorrow, and disease.

original: yadādau dhvanvate vaktraṃ paścāddehaṃ punaḥ śiraḥ // siddhi evaṃ valakṣaṇairjñatvā paśuṃ sarvāṅga🔽kampitam //
analyzed: yadā ādau dhvanvate vaktram paścāt deham punar śiraḥ evam paśum  kampitam
translated: having known the animal with all these characteristics, the accomplished one,

original: ghātayitvā tataḥ paścād raktenārghaṃ vikīryate // cchitvā tasyottamāṅgaṃ vai sarvakāraṇakāraṇam //
analyzed: ghātayitvā tatas paścāt raktena argham vikīryate  cchitvā tasya uttamāṅgam vai sarva kāraṇa kāraṇam
translated: having killed it, then afterwards the worship is scattered with blood, having cut off its head, the cause of all causes,🔽the imperishable lord of the animals, known as Śrī Kaṇṭha,

original: śrī kaṇṭheti savikhātaṃ paśūnāṃ patiravyayam // paśustratraivataṃ rūpaṃ nti mohitaḥ //
analyzed: śrī kaṇṭha iti sa vikhātam paśūnām patiḥ avyayam mohitaḥ
translated: the animal is deluded by the form of the three worlds.🔽His right hand, which is the abode of the beings in the west,

original: tasya yaddakṣiṇaṃ hastaṃ paścādbhūtasurālayam // yatrotpannaṃ punastasya paśu pañcakabhūṣitam //
analyzed: tasya yat dakṣiṇam hastam paścāt bhūta surālayam yatra utpannam punar tasya paśu pañcaka bhūṣitam
translated: where it arose again, adorned with the group of five animals,🔽those who know the hand in the mouth, the great destroyer Bhairavī,

original: ye jānanti mukhepāṇi mahāsaṃhārabhairavī // nāmnākaraṅkiṇī proktā bhuktimukti phalapradā //
analyzed: ye jānanti mahā saṃhārabhairavī nāmnā ākaraṅkiṇī proktā bhukti mukti phala pradā
translated: is said to be named Karaṅkiṇī, the giver of the fruits of enjoyment and liberation.🔽She grants accomplishments to the best of adepts, and this body gives liberation.

original: siddhidā sādakendrāṇāṃ supiṇḍedamamokṣadam // sakṛ rṣanāstasya devadevyo mahābalāḥ //
analyzed: siddhi dā sādaka indrāṇām su piṇḍā idam amokṣa dam  sakṛt      tasya deva devyaḥ mahā balāḥ
translated: The gods and goddesses of that one are very powerful.🔽All of them have invisible forms, are always content and full of joy,

original: adṛṣṭa vigrahāḥ sarvā nitya tṛptāmudānvitāḥ // dadanti vipulāṃ kāmāmadhamāmadhyamottamām //
analyzed: adṛṣṭa vigrahāḥ sarvāḥ nitya tṛptā mudā anvitāḥ dadanti vipulām kāmām adhamām adhyamottamām
translated: they grant great desires, the inferior, the middling, and the superior.

original: pūrvoktaṃ vividhākānnaivedyaṃ tatprakalpayet // dvaitādvaita samopetaṃ bhakṣabhojyānnapānakam //
analyzed: pūrva uktam naivedyam tat prakalpayet  dvaita advaita samopetam bhakṣa bhojya anna pānakam

translated: There itself, one should perform the rite of eating, being well-satisfied and full of joy. Whatever remains of the food offered to the deity should always be kept aside for the animals.

analyzed: samaiḥ vitta āgamam vindyāt visamam jñāna siddhi dam  purīṣam tu yadā muñcet gṛhītvā vīra vandite
translated: one should know that equal [amounts] bring gain of wealth, and unequal [amounts] bestow the attainment of knowledge. O Vīra-worshipped one, when one releases feces,

translated: [it should be mixed] with one's own family nectar, with honey, and with the pollen of bees.

translated: One should apply it to all the limbs, from the soles of the feet up to the head, with the forty-six terrible Kāla-kuṭa and other [mantras], in order.

analyzed: dikṣuḥ vā abhimukhaḥ bhūtvā yadā asau dhvanvate naghe
translated: When he howls, facing the directions, O sinless one,

translated: then one should know the arrival of the dice, the union with a divine woman, the gain of a position, and the body would become like a diamond.

translated: In the southeast, there is terrible fear, the generation of fire, famine, destruction of the kingdom, and the king perishes.🔽In the south, there is terrible death, and the doer obtains misfortune. In the middle of the house, there is excessive rain or drought.

original: śatrūhastādbhavenmṛtyurarthahānirviyogakam // kartāvandujanaiḥ sārdhaṃ duṣṭasattvabhayaṃ labhet //
analyzed: śatru hastāt bhavet mṛtyuḥ artha hāniḥ viyogakam  kartāvan du janaiḥ sārdham duṣṭa sattva bhayam labhet
translated: Death would be at the hands of enemies, loss of wealth, separation, and the doer would get fear from wicked people.

analyzed: subhikṣam vāruṇe bhāge sarva sattva su siddhi dam        sādhaka indrasya sarva bhūtāḥ cara acarāḥ

analyzed: vāyavyam vidyu sampātam vidveṣoḥ cāra māraṇam

translated: then, O lord of men, men rejoice in happiness. One becomes immortal, with a body like diamond, free from wrinkles and grey hair.

analyzed: om pūrayāmi svāhā ā  om juṃ saḥ amṛteśvaraiḥ bhairavam tarpaya svāhā

translated: Vā. Oṃ Jūṃ Saḥ, I offer oblations to Amṛtalakṣmī, Svāhā.

translated: Then, the Tarpaṇa (water offering) of the mantras of Gaṇeśa and others should be performed according to one's ability and as much as the food is extensive. Then, the Pūrṇā.

translated: May there be satisfaction of all mantras, Svāhā, Vaṣaṭ, the god, Svadhā, in the pot.

analyzed: aṃsa āsakta kara dvayam eka āsyam cintayet bhānum dvi bhujam rakta vāsasam agnau
translated: In the fire,

original: puṣpaṃ //
analyzed: puṣpam
translated: the flower.

original: āvāhanādi vidhyarghapātrātpādyādi //
analyzed: āvāhana ādi vidhi arghapātrāt pādya ādi
translated: The invocation and other rituals are from the offering water vessel to the water for washing the feet.

original: tatpuruṣāya vidmahe sūryajñānāya dhīmahi tannaḥ sūryaḥ pracodayāt //
analyzed: tatpuruṣāya vidmahe sūrya jñānāya dhīmahi tat naḥ sūryaḥ pracodayāt
translated: We meditate on Tatpurusha, the wise one, for the sake of the knowledge of the Sun. May the Sun inspire us.

original: oṃ hrāṃ hrīṃ saḥ sūryāya namaḥ svāhā / ā // aṃ hṛdayāya namaḥ svāhā / arkā sirase svāhā //
analyzed: om     saḥ sūryāya namaḥ svāhā ā aṃ hṛdayāya namaḥ svāhā  sirase svāhā
translated: Om Hraum Hreem Saḥ, salutations to Surya, Svāhā. Ā, Aṃ, salutations to the heart, Svāhā. Arka, salutations to the head, Svāhā.

original: bhūrbhuvassvaḥ jvālinyai śikhāyai vausaṭ huṃ kavacāya hūṃ // bhāṃ netrebhyo vaṣaṭ raḥ astrāya phaṭ
analyzed: bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar jvālinyai śikhāyai vausaṭ hum kavacāya hūm bhām netrebhyaḥ vaṣaṭ raḥ astrāya phaṭ
translated: Bhūḥ Bhuvaḥ Svaḥ to Jvālinī, to the tuft Vaṣaṭ, to the armour Huṃ. Bhāṃ to the eyes Vaṣaṭ, Raḥ to the weapon Phaṭ.

original: svāhā // tataḥ pūrṇā //
analyzed: svāhā tatas pūrṇā
translated: Svāhā. Then the full (oblation).

original: baddha padmāsano devaḥ prapannajanavatsalaḥ // saptāśvāsaptarajuśca dvibhujaḥ pātuno raviḥ // mūlena pūrṇā
analyzed: baddha padmāsanaḥ devaḥ prapanna jana vatsalaḥ dvi bhujaḥ raviḥ mūlena pūrṇā
translated: The god, seated in the padmāsana posture, affectionate towards the devotees, with seven horses and seven reins, with two arms, may the sun protect us. With the root mantra, the full (oblation).

analyzed: tarpaṇam nirodha arghaḥ sannidhatsva iti tatas visphurā tri netrām dvi bhujām devīm vara abhaya lasat karām
translated: The libation. The concluding offering. Remain present. Then, one should remember Goddess Viṣphurā, with three eyes and two arms, with hands holding the excellent boon and protection,

original: padmāsanāṃ hasadvaktrāṃ sūryāṅke visphurāṃ smare // agnau puṣpaṃ //
analyzed: padma āsanām hasat vaktrām sūrya aṅke visphurām smare agnau puṣpam
translated: seated on a lotus, with a smiling face, shining on the sun. In the fire, the flower.

original: asya śrīvisphurāmantrasya /
analyzed: asya śrī visphurā mantrasya
translated: Of this Śrī Viṣphura mantra,🔽the sage,

original: p /
analyzed: p
translated: the meter,🔽the deity,🔽the seed syllable,🔽the power,

original: haṃsa ṛṣiḥ // gāyatrī cchandaḥ // śrīvisphurā devatā rāṃ bījaṃ oṃ śaktiḥ namaḥ kīlakaṃ home
analyzed: haṃsaḥ ṛṣiḥ gāyatrī chandaḥ śrī visphurā devatā rāṃ bījam om śaktiḥ namaḥ kīlakam home
translated: the key phrase,🔽the application in the oblation,

analyzed: viniyogaḥ rāṃ ityādi om rāṃ visphurāyai namaḥ svāhā mūlena pūrṇā
translated: is Rāṃ and so on. Om Rāṃ salutations to Viṣphurā, Svāhā. With the root mantra, the full (oblation).

original: tatastarpaṇam //
analyzed: tatas tarpaṇam
translated: Then the libation.

original: tataḥ kumārasya //
analyzed: tatas kumārasya
translated: Then of Kumāra,

analyzed: kārtikeyam sura śreṣṭham saḍvaktram kukuṭa aṅkitam ghaṇṭhā śakti dharam śubhram akṣa mālā dharam tathā  dvi netram cātaka rūḍham bāla rūpam śaśi prabham
translated: Holding a bell and a Shakti, white, and holding a rosary of beads,🔽With two eyes, mounted on a peacock, in the form of a child, with the luster of the moon,🔽White like the Himalayas, with two arms, surrounded by serpents, seated on the back of a peacock,

original: himādri śvetaṃ dvibhujaṃ bhujaṅgairvṛtaṃ niviṣṭaṃ śikhinaśca pṛṣṭhe // nagendrakanyāpriyaputramādyaṃ
analyzed: himādri śvetam dvi bhujam bhujaṅgaiḥ vṛtam niviṣṭam śikhinaḥ ca pṛṣṭhe naga indra kanyā priya putram ādyam
translated: The first son of the beloved daughter of the king of mountains,

original: hṛdismarebhīṣṭapradaṃ kumāram //
analyzed: kumāram
translated: I remember in my heart Kumara, the giver of desired things.

original: agnaupuṣpaṃ // āvāhanādi pādyādi //
analyzed: āvāhana ādi pādya ādi

analyzed: kārtikeyāya vidmahe śīna adhipataye dhīmahi tat naḥ kumāraḥ pracodayāt  /
translated: For Kartikeya, we meditate. For the lord of the constellation Pushya, we are wise. May Kumara inspire us.🔽Om Klum. Salutations to Kumara.

original: oṃ klūṃ kāṃ kumārāya namaḥ // // kāṃ ityādi nyāsaḥ // tataḥ pūrṇā // ghaṇṭhāṃ svavarṇaracitāṃ
analyzed: om   kām kumārāya namaḥ    kāṃ ityādi nyāsaḥ tatas pūrṇā ghaṇṭhām sva varṇa racitām
translated: The assignment begins with Klum. Then the full (oblation). The bell is made of one's own color,

analyzed: rucirām patākām śaktim dadhānam api cāruśikhaṇḍi rājaḥ
translated: Beautiful, holding a flag and a Shakti, and also the king of the beautiful peacocks,

analyzed: bhūyāt sva danta vadanaḥ bhavatām vibhutyai baddha sthitiḥ vayasi bāla vayaḥ kumāraḥ mūlena pūrṇā tarpaṇam
translated: May the face of your own teeth be for your prosperity. Kumara, who is bound in the state of childhood in the age of childhood,🔽With the root, the full (oblation). The offering of libation.

original: nirodhārghaḥ //
analyzed: nirodha arghaḥ
translated: The Arghya of obstruction.

original: tato mṛtyuñjayasya //
analyzed: tatas mṛtyuñjayasya
translated: Then of Mrityunjaya (Shiva).

original: dhyāyedātmani deveśaṃ candrakoṭisamaprabham // svacchamuktāmaṇi prakhyaṃ sphāṭikādrisamaprabham //🔽kundendu gokṣīranibhaṃ himādrisadṛśaṃ vibhum // śubhrahārendu kāntādi sitabhūṣaṇabhūṣitam //
analyzed: dhyāyet ātmani deveśam candra koṭi sama prabham svaccha muktāmaṇi prakhyam sphāṭika adri sama prabham  kunda indu go kṣīra nibham himādri sadṛśam vibhum śubhra hāra indu kānta ādi sita bhūṣaṇa bhūṣitam
translated: Resembling a pure pearl, having the lustre of a crystal mountain,🔽The all-pervading Lord resembling a jasmine flower, the moon, cow's milk, or the Himalayas, adorned with white ornaments such as a necklace and moonstone,🔽Having limbs smeared with white sandalwood paste, gray with saffron powder,

original: sitacandanaliptāṅgaṃ karporakṣoda dhūsaram // sphuraścandrāmṛtasphāravahalormipariplutam //
analyzed: sita candana lipta aṅgam karpora kṣoda dhūsaram sphuraḥ candra amṛta sphāra vahala ūrmi pariplutam

original: somamaṇḍala madhyasthamekaṃ vaktraṃ trilocanam // sitapadmopaviṣṭaṃ ca baddhapadmāsana sthitam //🔽p /
analyzed: soma maṇḍala madhya stham ekam vaktram tri locanam sita padma upaviṣṭam ca baddha padmāsana sthitam  p
translated: Seated on a white lotus, abiding in the lotus posture,🔽Four-armed, large-eyed, with the gestures of boon granting and protection in the hands,

original: sarvaśvetopacāreṇa cārcitaṃ tamanusmaret // candrārkāgnivilocanaṃ smitamukhaṃ padmadvayānta sthitaṃ

translated: One should remember him as worshipped with all white offerings, with eyes like the moon, sun, and fire, with a smiling face, abiding between two lotuses,

analyzed: mudrā pāśa svadhā akṣa sūttra vara sat pāṇi himāṃśu prabham
translated: With the excellent hands holding a mudra, noose, svastika, and rosary, having the radiance of the moon,

original: koṭī candragalatsvadhāplutaṃ tanuṃ hārādibhūṣojjvalaṃ kāntyāviśvavimohanaṃ paśupatiṃ mṛtyuñjayaṃ

translated: Whose body is bathed in the nectar flowing from millions of moons, who is radiant with ornaments like necklaces, who captivates the entire world with his beauty, who is the lord of beings,

original: bhāvayet //
analyzed: bhāvayet
translated: One should meditate on Mṛtyuñjaya, the conqueror of death.

original: candrodbhāsita mūrdhajaṃ surapatiṃ pīyūṣapātraṃ tathā hastābjena svadhāṃśakoṭivimalaṃ hāsyasyapaṅke🔽ruham //
analyzed: mūrdhajam surapatim pīyūṣa pātram tathā hasta abjena svadhā aṃśa koṭi vimalam  ruham

analyzed: sūrya agni indu vilocanam kara talaiḥ pāśa akṣamālā aṅkuśān vibhrāṇam sa daśam śivam paśupatim mṛtyuñjayam
translated: Who has eyes like the sun, fire, and moon, who holds in his hands a noose, a rosary, and a goad, who is the tenth manifestation of Śiva, the lord of beings, the conqueror of death,

original: taṃ smare // agnau puṣpaṃ //🔽asya śrī mṛtyuñjaya mantrasya / mahācamasakaloha ṛṣiḥ // gāyatrī cchandaḥ // mṛtyuñjayo devatā // juṃ
analyzed: tam smare agnau puṣpam  asya śrī mṛtyuñjaya mantrasya mahācamasakaloha ṛṣiḥ gāyatrī chandaḥ mṛtyuñjayaḥ devatā juṃ

analyzed: bījam saḥ śaktiḥ om kīlakam home viniyogaḥ
translated: Of this Shri Mṛtyuñjaya mantra, the sage is Mahācāmaṣaka Lohita, the meter is Gāyatrī, the deity is Mṛtyuñjaya. The seed is JUM, the power is SAH, the nail is OUM. The application is in the oblation.

original: āvāhanādi pādyādi //
analyzed: āvāhana ādi pādya ādi
translated: The invocation etc., the water for washing the feet etc.

original: oṃ amṛteśāya vidmahe vyomadehāya dhīmahi tanno netraḥ pracodayāt // // oṃ juṃ saḥ haṃsaḥ māṃ pālaya
analyzed: om amṛta īśāya vidmahe vyoma dehāya dhīmahi tat naḥ netraḥ pracodayāt    om juṃ saḥ haṃsaḥ mām pālaya
translated: Om, we meditate on the Lord of Nectar, whose body is the sky. May he inspire our eyes. Om JUM SAH HAMSAH, protect me.

original: sohaṃsaḥ juṃ oṃ // // oṃ juṃ hṛdayāya namaḥ svāhā // oṃ vyoṃ śirase svāhā // oṃ īṃ śikhāyai
analyzed: sohaṃsaḥ juṃ om   om juṃ hṛdayāya namaḥ svāhā om vyoṃ śirase svāhā om īṃ śikhāyai
translated: SOHAM SAH JUM OM. Om JUM, salutations to the heart, SVĀHĀ. Om VYOM, salutations to the head, SVĀHĀ. Om IIM, salutations to the tuft, SVĀHĀ.

original: vauṣaṭ / oṃ huṃ kavacāya huṃ / oṃ jyoṃ netrābhyāṃ vaṣaṭ / oṃ phaṭ astrāya phaṭ svāhā // pūrṇā /
analyzed: vauṣaṭ om hum kavacāya hum om jyoṃ netrābhyām vaṣaṭ om phaṭ astrāya phaṭ svāhā pūrṇā
translated: Vauṣaṭ. Oṃ huṃ to the armor, huṃ. Oṃ jyoṃ to the eyes, vaṣaṭ. Oṃ phaṭ to the weapon, phaṭ svāhā. The full (oblation).
