analyzed: vāmadeva vaktrāya svāhā laṃ sadyojāta vaktrāya svāhā
translated: for the face of Vāmadeva, Svāhā. Lam for the face of Sadyojāta, Svāhā.

original: tato bhairavāvaraṇam // pūrvaṃ likhitam //
analyzed: tatas bhairava āvaraṇam pūrvam likhitam
translated: Then the Bhairava covering, written before.

original: athāyudhāvaraṇam // khaḍgāya // kheṭakāya // pāśāya // aṅkuśāya // śarāya // pinākāya // varāya //
analyzed: atha āyudha āvaraṇam khaḍgāya kheṭakāya pāśāya aṅkuśāya śarāya pinākāya varāya
translated: Now the weapon covering: For the sword, for the club, for the noose, for the goad, for the arrow, for the Pinaka, for the boon,

analyzed: abhayāya muṇḍāya khaṭvāṅgāya vīṇāyai ḍamarave ghaṇṭāyai triśūlāya vajrāya
translated: For Abhaya (fearlessness), for Mundari (shaven-headed), for Khatvangari (holder of a wooden staff), for Vina (lute), for Damaru (hand-drum), for Ghantari (bell), for Trisula (trident), for Vajra (thunderbolt),

analyzed: tatas pūrṇā
translated: Then the Pūrṇā (oblation):

original: amṛteśvare bhairavaṃ sa devīkaṃ sāvaraṇaṃ toṣayāmi svāhā //
analyzed: amṛteśvare bhairavam sa devīkam sa āvaraṇam toṣayāmi svāhā
translated: I propitiate Bhairava, the Lord of Immortality, along with the Goddess and the retinue, svāhā.

original: iti pūrṇā //
analyzed: iti pūrṇā
translated: Thus the Pūrṇā (oblation).

original: tata ājyena // oṃ hāṃ brahmaṇe svāhā // // oṃ vāstu puruṣāya svāhā // //
analyzed: tatas ājyena om hāṃ brahmaṇe svāhā    om vāstu puruṣāya svāhā
translated: Then with ghee: Om hāṃ to Brahmā, svāhā. Om to the Lord of the House, svāhā.

original: tata ṛtu tithi nakṣatra devatāśca yajeta //
analyzed: tatas ṛtu tithi nakṣatra devatāḥ ca yajeta
translated: Then one should worship the deities of the seasons, lunar days, and lunar mansions.

original: tatrādau ṛtavaḥ // agnaye svāhā / vasantāya / indrāya / grīṣmāya / marubhyaḥ / varṣābhyaḥ / viśvebhyo
analyzed: tatra ādau ṛtavaḥ agnaye svāhā vasantāya indrāya grīṣmāya marubhyaḥ varṣābhyaḥ viśvebhyaḥ
translated: There, first, the seasons: To Agni, svāhā. To Vasanta. To Indra. To Grīṣma. To the Maruts. To the rainy seasons. To the Viśvedevas.

original: devebhyaḥ śarade / mittrāya hemantāya / mittrāvaruṇābhyāṃ hemanta śiśirābhyāṃ //
analyzed: devebhyaḥ śarade mittrāya hemantāya mittrāvaruṇābhyām hemanta śiśirābhyām
translated: To Śaraṇa. To Mitra, to Hemanta. To Mitra-Varuṇa, to Hemanta-Śiśira.

original: tatastithayaḥ // brahmaṇe pratipade / tvāṣṭre dvitīyāyai // janāndanāya tṛtīyāyai // yamāya caturthyai //
analyzed: tatas tithayaḥ brahmaṇe pratipade tvāṣṭre dvitīyāyai janāndanāya tṛtīyāyai yamāya caturthyai
translated: Then the lunar days: to Brahma, to the first lunar day; to Tvastr, to the second lunar day; to the destroyer of people, to the third lunar day; to Yama, to the fourth lunar day;

original: somāya pañcamyai // kumārāya ṣaṣṭhyai munibhyaḥ saptamyai // vasubhyaḥ aṣṭamyai // piśācebhyaḥ navamyai //
analyzed: somāya pañcamyai kumārāya ṣaṣṭhyai munibhyaḥ saptamyai vasubhyaḥ aṣṭamyai piśācebhyaḥ navamyai
translated: to Soma, to the fifth lunar day; to Kumara, to the sixth lunar day; to the sages, to the seventh lunar day; to the Vasus, to the eighth lunar day; to the pisacas, to the ninth lunar day;

original: dharmāya daśamyai rudrebhyaḥ ekādaśyai // ravibhyaḥ dvādaśyai // kāmāya trayodaśyai // bhūtebhyaḥ
analyzed: dharmāya daśamyai rudrebhyaḥ ekādaśyai ravibhyaḥ dvādaśyai kāmāya trayodaśyai bhūtebhyaḥ
translated: to Dharma, to the tenth lunar day; to the Rudras, to the eleventh lunar day; to the suns, to the twelfth lunar day; to Kama, to the thirteenth lunar day; to the beings,

original: caturdaśyai // viśvabhyo devebhyaḥ pūrṇapañcadaśyai // pitṛbhyaḥ amāvasyāyai //
analyzed: caturdaśyai viśvabhyaḥ devebhyaḥ pūrṇa pañcadaśyai pitṛbhyaḥ amāvasyāyai
translated: to the fourteenth lunar day; to all the gods, to the full fifteenth lunar day; to the ancestors, to the new moon day.

original: atha nakṣatrāṇi //
analyzed: atha nakṣatrāṇi
translated: Now the lunar mansions:

original: aśvinyai śvinībhyāṃ // yamāyabharaṇībhyaḥ // agnaye kṛttikāyai // prajāpatirohiṇyai // somāyai
analyzed: aśvinyai śvinībhyām yamāya bharaṇībhyaḥ agnaye kṛttikāyai prajāpati rohiṇyai somāyai
translated: to the Ashvins, to the Ashvini; to Yama, to the Bharani; to Agni, to the Krittika; to Prajapati, to the Rohini; to Soma,

original: mṛgaśirase // rudrāya ārdrāyai // āditaye punarvasuve // bṛhaspataye tiṣyāya // sarpebhyaḥ aśleṣāyai //
analyzed: mṛgaśirase rudrāya ārdrāyai āditaye punarvasuve bṛhaspataye tiṣyāya sarpebhyaḥ aśleṣāyai
translated: to the Mrigashira; to Rudra, to the Ardra; to the sun, to the Punarvasu; to Brihaspati, to the Pushya; to the serpents, to the Ashlesha;

original: pitṛbhyaḥ maghāyai // bhagāya pūrvaphalguṇyai // aryamṇe uttaraphalguṇya / savitre hastāya tvāṣṭre
analyzed: pitṛbhyaḥ maghāyai bhagāya pūrvaphalguṇyai aryamṇe uttaraphalguṇya savitre hastāya tvāṣṭre
translated: to the ancestors, to the Magha; to Bhaga, to the Purva Phalguni; to Aryaman, to the Uttara Phalguni; to Savita, to the Hasta; to Tvastra,

original: cittrāyai // vāyave svātyai // indrāgnībhyāṃ viśākhāyai // mittrāya anūrādhāyai // indrāya jyeṣṭhāyai
analyzed: cittrāyai vāyave svātyai indra agnībhyām viśākhāyai mittrāya anūrādhāyai indrāya jyeṣṭhāyai
translated: To Citrā, to Vāyu, to Svāti, to Indra and Agni, to Viśākhā, to Mitra, to Anurādhā, to Indra, to Jyeṣṭhā,

original: nairṛtaye mūlāya // adbhyaḥ pūrvaṣāḍhāyai // viśvaibhyo devebhyaḥ uttaraṣāḍhāyai // brahmaṇe
analyzed: nairṛtaye mūlāya adbhyaḥ pūrvaṣāḍhāyai viśvebhyaḥ devebhyaḥ uttaraṣāḍhāyai brahmaṇe
translated: To Nairṛta, to Mūlā, to the waters, to Pūrvaṣāḍhā, to all the gods, to Uttarāṣāḍhā, to Brahman,

original: abhijite // viṣṇave śravaṇāya // vasubhyaḥ dhaniṣṭhāyai // varuṇāya śatabhiṣaje // ajaikapade
analyzed: abhijite viṣṇave śravaṇāya vasubhyaḥ dhaniṣṭhāyai varuṇāya śatabhiṣaje ajaikapade
translated: To Abhijit, to Viṣṇu, to Śravaṇa, to the Vasus, to Dhaniṣṭhā, to Varuṇa, to Śatabhiṣak, to Ajaikapāt,

original: pūrvabhadrapadāyai //
analyzed: pūrvabhadrapadāyai
translated: To Pūrvabhādrapadā,

original: p /
analyzed: p
translated: To Revatī,

original: ahirbadhnyāyai uttarabhadrapādāyai // pūṣṇyairevatyai //
analyzed: ahirbadhnyāyai uttarabhadra pādāyai pūṣṇi airevatyai
translated: To Ahirbudhnya, to Uttarābhādrapadā, to Pūrvaproṣṭhapadā, to Revatī,

original: oṃ śrīṃ hūṃ hrīṃ vilomaśāntirastu svāhā //
analyzed: om śrīṃ     vilomaśāntiḥ astu svāhā
translated: Om, Śrīm, Hūm, Hrīṃ, may there be peace through the reverse order, svāhā!

original: evaṃ vyutkramaśāntinyūnātirikta doṣaśāntirokṛtaduṣkṛtaśāntirastu svāhā //
analyzed: evam vyutkrama śānti nyūna atirikta doṣa śānti rokṛta duṣkṛta śāntiḥ astu svāhā
translated: Thus may the peace through the reverse order, the peace of the defects of deficiency and excess, and the peace of the evil deeds that have been performed, be accomplished, svāhā!

original: tata anyatognimānīya vaiśva devaṃ kṛtvā naivedyaṃ nivedya gurave śivāya samālabhanādi kṛtvā
analyzed: anyatas agnim ānīya vaiśva devam kṛtvā naivedyam nivedya gurave śivāya samālabhana ādi kṛtvā
translated: Then, having brought the fire from somewhere else, having performed the Vaiśvadeva rite, having offered food to the preceptor, to Śiva, having performed the anointing etc.,

original: bṛhatpūrṇāṃ dadyāt // hāramanoharavakṣasamāya cakṣuṣamahīśa kṛtabhūṣaṃ pañcavadanaṃ sitaruciruciraṃ
analyzed: bṛhat pūrṇām dadyāt hāra manohara vakṣa samāya cakṣuṣa mahī īśa kṛta bhūṣam pañcavadanam sita ruci ruciram
translated: One should give the Brhatpūrṇā - to the one whose chest is charming with a necklace, who is adorned with eyes like the lord of the earth, who has five faces, who is shining with white luster,

original: śaśikhaṇḍamaṇḍita śikhaṇḍam //
analyzed: śaśi khaṇḍa maṇḍita śikhaṇḍam
translated: Whose crest is adorned with a peacock feather.

original: udyamapāśaviśikhāsanavarakhaṭvāṅgavallakī ghaṇṭā / daṇḍadrūghanābhyāṃ sahavahantamiva /
analyzed: udyama pāśa viśikha āsana vara khaṭvāṅga vallakī ghaṇṭā daṇḍa drū ghanābhyām saha vahantam iva
translated: stick, and drūghaṇa, as if striking together.

original: vāmabāhunavakena //
analyzed: vāma bāhu navakena
translated: With the nine left arms,🔽Holding a sword, goad, arrow, fearful skull, ḍamaru, trident, paśupāśa, and axe,

original: khaḍgāṅkuśa viśikhā bhayakapāla ḍamaru triśūlapaviparaśūn // dakṣairdorbhirnavabhiḥ kalayantaṃ
analyzed: khaḍga aṅkuśa viśikhā bhaya kapāla ḍamaru triśūla pavi paraśūn dakṣaiḥ dorbhiḥ navabhiḥ kalayantam
translated: With the nine right arms,

original: cintayeśca bhagavantam //
analyzed: cintayeḥ ca bhagavantam
translated: Contemplate the Blessed Lord.

original: sitamuparitanuṃ vadanaṃ purataḥ pītaṃ camecakaṃ vṛkṣam // vāmamaruṇaṃ sitaruciruciraṃ devasya paścimaṃ🔽vaktram // //
analyzed: sitam upari tanum vadanam puratas pītam ca mecakam vṛkṣam vāmam aruṇam sita ruci ruciram devasya paścimam  vaktram
translated: The upper face is white, the front face is yellow, the left face is red, and the beautiful western face of the Lord is white.

original: evamudbhāsitā śeṣa bhagavadveśaśālinīm // cintayedasya cotsaṅgagāmaghoreśvarīmapi //
analyzed: evam udbhāsitā śeṣa bhagavat veśa śālinīm  cintayet asya ca utsaṅga gām aghora īśvarīm api
translated: Thus, the remaining one should contemplate the Goddess Ghorī, who is adorned with the garments of the Lord, seated in his lap.

original: oṃ juṃ saḥ amṛte amṛtodbhave sarvārtha sādhake sarvāsatvayaśī kartribhogamokṣaprade sarvaduḥkhanāśanodyate
analyzed: om juṃ saḥ amṛte amṛta udbhave sarva artha sādhake sarva duḥkha nāśana udyate
translated: Om Jum Sah, to Amṛta, Amṛtodbhava, the fulfiller of all purposes, the creator of all beings, the giver of worldly enjoyment and liberation, the destroyer of all sufferings,

original: sarvasamaya lopaghātini klīṃ vicce anulomavilomavyutkramanyūnātirikta doṣākṛta duṣkṛtaśāntirastu yathā
translated: the remover of all transgressions, Klim Vicce, may the faults of omission, repetition, deficiency, and excess be pacified, as well as the evil arising from mistakes.

original: kṛta karmaprāyaścitta nivṛtti vidhi pūraṇaṃ cāstu svāhā vauṣaṭ //
analyzed: kṛta karma prāyaścitta nivṛtti vidhi pūraṇam ca astu svāhā vauṣaṭ
translated: May the fulfillment of the injunctions for the cessation of actions already performed be accomplished, Svāhā Vaushat.

original: iti vṛhatpūrṇā // pūrṇāntegniṃ namaskuryāt // sarvataḥ pāṇi pādosi sarvatokṣaśiro mukhaḥ //
analyzed: iti vṛhat pūrṇā  pūrṇa ante agnim namaskuryāt sarvatas pāṇi pāda usi sarvatas ukṣa śiraḥ mukhaḥ
translated: Thus ends the Brihat Purana. At the end of the Pūrṇāhuti, one should offer salutations to the fire. You have hands and feet everywhere, eyes, heads and faces everywhere.

original: tataḥ pūrṇākāle / agne tvaṃ mṛdunāmāsi / mṛdunāmne agnaye namaḥ / iti pādyādibhiḥ saṃpūjya pūrṇāṃ
analyzed: tatas pūrṇā kāle agne tvam mṛdu nāmā asi mṛdu nāmne agnaye namaḥ iti pādya ādibhiḥ saṃpūjya pūrṇām
translated: Then, at the time of the Pūrṇāhuti, one should worship with water for washing the feet etc., saying You are Agni with the name Mṛdu (soft), salutations to Agni with the name Mṛdu.🔽And should offer the Pūrṇāhuti.

original: dadyāt // yathāgni purāṇam // mūdhānandena mantreṇa saṃsraveṇa ca dhārayā / mūrdhānaṃ divoratnaṃ
analyzed: dadyāt yathāgni purāṇam mūdhānandena mantreṇa saṃsraveṇa ca dhārayā mūrdhānam divoratnam
translated: As in the Agni Purana: With the mantra of Mūrधानन्द, and with the Dhāraṇā of Saṃsrava, the jewel on the head of heaven,

original: pṛthivyā vai śvānaramṛtamājātamagnim kavi gūṃ samrājamatithiṃ janānāsā sannāpātraṃ jayantu devāḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivyāḥ vai śvānaram ṛtam ājātam agnim kavi gūm samrājam atithim janānāsā sannāpātram jayantu devāḥ
translated: the immortal Agni born from earth and man, the wise one, the emperor, the guest of people, may the gods conquer the vessel that is filled.

original: dadyādutthāya pūrṇāṃ tu nopaviśya kadācaneti mūrdhvānandi veti yajuṣāṃ pūrṇa homaṃ ja /🔽vastranāri kela gnau daśa / /
analyzed: dadyāt utthāya pūrṇām tu na upaviśya kadācana iti mūrdhvānandi vā iti yajuṣām homam
translated: One should offer the Pūrṇāhuti while standing up, never while sitting. Thus ends the Pūrṇāhuti with the Yajus mantra of Mūrधानन्द.

original: p /
analyzed: p
translated: The Pūrṇāhuti is offered with the mantra Agnaye sviṣṭakṛte svāhā and the mantra Agnaye svāhā is repeated ten times.🔽The Pūrṇāhuti is offered with the mantra Agnaye sviṣṭakṛte svāhā and the mantra Agnaye svāhā is repeated ten times.

original: viśvarūpo mahānagniḥ praṇītaḥ sarvakarmasu // āyurārogyamaiśvaryaṃ dhṛti satvaṃ balaṃ yasaḥ //
analyzed: viśva rūpaḥ mahān agniḥ praṇītaḥ sarva karmasu āyuḥ ārogyam aiśvaryam dhṛti satvam balam yasaḥ
translated: The great fire of universal form, when invoked, bestows long life, good health, prosperity, courage, strength, fame,

original: tejovarcaḥ paśūnbījaṃ śauryasāmrājyameva ca // saubhāgyaṃ karmasiddhiṃ kula jyeṣṭhaṃ sukatṛtām //
analyzed: tejaḥ varcaḥ paśūn bījam śaurya sāmrājyam eva ca saubhāgyam karma siddhim kula jyeṣṭham su katṛ tām
translated: radiance, splendor, animals, seeds, heroism, sovereignty, good fortune, success in undertakings, a noble family, good deeds,

original: sarvametat sarvasākṣin praviṇo dorirīhinaḥ // agniṃ prajvālitaṃ vande jātavedaṃ hutāśanam //
analyzed: sarvam etat sarva sākṣin praviṇaḥ dorirīhinaḥ  agnim prajvālitam vande jātavedam hutāśanam
translated: O all-witnessing one, O skilled one, O remover of obstacles, I bow to the kindled fire, to the all-knowing one, to the one who consumes oblations.

original: suvarṇavarṇamamalaṃ susiddhaṃ sarvato mukham //
analyzed: suvarṇa varṇam amalam su siddham sarvatas mukham
translated: Golden-hued, pure, well-accomplished, facing all directions.

original: iti paṭhitvā namaskuryāt // tataḥ kṛtāñjaliḥ prārthayedanena //
analyzed: iti paṭhitvā namaskuryāt tatas kṛtāñjaliḥ prārthayet anena
translated: Having recited this, one should bow down. Then, with folded hands, one should pray with this:

original: ābrahmanbrahmaṇo brahmavarcasīti kṛtāñjaliragniṃ visṛjet //
analyzed: ā brahman brahmaṇaḥ brahmavarcasī iti kṛtāñjaliḥ agnim visṛjet
translated: With the thought May there be brahmic glory up to Brahman, one should release the fire with folded hands.

original: oṃ yajña yajñaṅgacchayajñapatiṃ gacchasvāṃ yoniṃ gaccha svāhā // eṣa te yajño yajñopate
analyzed: om yajña yajñaṃgaccha yajñapatim gacchasvām yonim gaccha svāhā eṣa te yajñaḥ yajñopate
translated: Om, O sacrifice, go to the sacrifice, go to the lord of sacrifice, go to your own abode, svāhā. This is your sacrifice, O lord of sacrifice.

original: mahāsūktavāksarva vīratvaṃ juṣasva svāhā // iti visarjanam //
analyzed: mahā sūkta vāc sarva vīra tvam juṣasva svāhā iti visarjanam
translated: Enjoy the speech of the great hymn, the state of being all-heroic, svāhā. This is the dismissal.

original: bhagavanbhagavanvahnetvaṃ surāṇāṃ mukhaṃ param // pratyakṣa devo bhūloke sarvakarma pratārakaḥ //
analyzed: bhagavan bhagavan vahne tvam surāṇām mukham param pratyakṣa devaḥ bhū loke sarva karma pratārakaḥ
translated: O Lord, O Lord of Fire, you are the supreme face of the gods, the manifest god in the mortal world, the guide of all actions.

original: antarbahiścalokānāṃ tvameva kṛta sannidhiḥ // tvayi tuṣṭe surā tuṣṭā ityāhusmanakādayaḥ //
analyzed: antar bahis ca lokānām tvam eva kṛta sannidhiḥ tvayi tuṣṭe surā tuṣṭā iti āhuḥ smanaka ādayaḥ
translated: You alone are present within and without the worlds. Those who know the Vedas say that when you are pleased, the gods are pleased.

original: kheditosi mayāvahne dīkṣākarmaṇi sāmpratam // dharmaṃdārasutāṃścaiva datvāyā hi svakaṃ padam // iti
analyzed: kheditaḥ asi mayā avahne dīkṣā karmaṇi sāmpratam  dharmaṃdāra sutān ca eva hi svakam padam iti
translated: O Fire, you have been fatigued by me in the initiation rite now. Having given Dharma and the sons of Daksha's daughter, go to your own abode. Thus

original: namaskuryāt //
analyzed: namaskuryāt
translated: One should bow down.

original: tatastarpaṇam //
analyzed: tatas tarpaṇam
translated: Then, the Tarpaṇa (water offering):

original: janmakoṭikṛtaṃ pāpaṃ parokṣaṃ prakaṭaṃ ca yat / tatsarvaṃ nāśamāyā tu tamaḥ sūryodaye yathā //🔽anena mṛtyujīdbhaṭṭārakoścārajena sarvasādhāraṇatvenānanteśādi parama śivāntāssarve bhuvaneśāḥ
analyzed: janma koṭi kṛtam pāpam parokṣam prakaṭam ca yat tat sarvam nāśa māyā tu tamaḥ sūrya udaye yathā  anena sarva sādhāraṇa tvena ananta īśa ādi parama śiva antāḥ sarve bhuvana īśāḥ
translated: The sin committed secretly or openly in crores of births, all that is destroyed by this, like darkness at sunrise.

original: saparivārāssānucarā santṛptāssantuṣṭā varadāḥ santu // iti tarpaṇam //🔽p / 🔽atha homa nivedanam guhyātiguhyagoptātvaṃ grahāṇāsmat kṛtaṃ japam // siddhirbhavatu me deva tvat prasādān
analyzed: sa parivārāḥ sa anucarā santṛptāḥ santuṣṭāḥ vara dāḥ santu  / p  atha homa nivedanam guhya ati guhya goptā tvam grahāṇa asmat kṛtam japam siddhiḥ bhavatu me deva tvat prasādān
translated: By this, may the Lord of Death, the Lord of the universe, Ananteśa and all others up to the Supreme Śiva, along with their retinues and followers, be satisfied and content, and may they bestow boons. This is the Tarpaṇa (water offering).

original: maheśvara //
analyzed: maheśvara
translated: Now, the offering of Homa: You are the protector of the most secret secrets. May the Japa performed by us of the planets be accomplished. O Lord, may there be success for me through your grace, O Maheśvara!

original: śivamastu yajamānasya cchidraṃ mābhūtkadācana // deva devyo prasādena rakṣarakṣāstu me bhyaśam //
analyzed: śivam astu yajamānasya chidram mā abhūt kadācana deva devyo prasādena rakṣa rakṣā astu me
translated: May there be well-being for the sacrificer. May there never be any deficiency. O Lord, by the grace of the gods and goddesses, may my fear be protected and guarded.

original: agniriti bhasma / vāyuriti bhasma / vyometi bhasma / sūlamiti bhasma / jalamiti bhasma / sarvaṃ havāmeti bhasmanā
analyzed: agniḥ iti bhasma vāyuḥ iti bhasma vyoma iti bhasma sūlam iti bhasma jalam iti bhasma sarvam havāma iti bhasmanā
translated: Agni (fire), Vāyu (wind), Vyoman (sky), Sūla (spear), Jala (water), and Sarvaṃ Havāmahe (we invoke all) - with these, the Bhasma (sacred ash).

original: etāni cakṣūṃṣi bhasmani / iti bhasmanā lalāṭamanulipya /
analyzed: etāni cakṣūṃṣi bhasmani iti bhasmanā lalāṭam anulipya
translated: These are the eyes, in the Bhasma. Thus, having applied the Bhasma on the forehead,

original: sapaśupāśa vimukto bhavati sarvatīrtha snānaphalaṃ bhavati / sarvakarmācchidraṃ bhavati //
analyzed: sa paśu pāśa vimuktaḥ bhavati sarva tīrtha snāna phalam bhavati sarva karma acchidram bhavati
translated: He becomes liberated from the fetters and the bound, he obtains the fruits of bathing in all the holy places, and all his actions become flawless.

analyzed: sarveṣām mantrāṇām melāpana vidyām paṭhet

original: oṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ saḥ saḥ sukhasaubhāgyadāyini haṃsavāgīśvari ehye hi hasa sannidhānaṃ kuru
analyzed: om   śrīṃ saḥ saḥ sukha saubhāgya dāyini haṃsa vāgīśvari ehi e hi hasa sannidhānam kuru
translated: Om Hrim Shrim Sah Sah, O Giver of Happiness and Good Fortune, O Goddess of Speech, come, come, make your presence with laughter.

original: sarvasampatpradāyini sarvaduṣṭanivāriṇi sarvajagadva'sīkartri vibhaktānāṃ mantrāṇāṃ melāpaṃ kuru prasādo
analyzed: sarva sampad pradāyini sarva duṣṭa nivāriṇi sarva jagat vasīkartri vibhaktānām mantrāṇām melāpam kuru
translated: O Giver of All Wealth, O Remover of All Evil, O Maker of All the World, make a union of the divided mantras, be gracious.

original: bhavatu prasanno bhava me hrīṃ śrīṃ saḥ saḥ hūṃ hūṃ // tataḥ śānti kalaśajalena caturdikṣudhārāpātaṃ🔽kuryāt //
analyzed: bhavatu prasannaḥ bhava me hrīṃ śrīṃ saḥ saḥ hūm hūm tatas śānti kalaśa jalena catur diś iṣu dhārā pātam  kuryāt
translated: Be pleased with me, Hrim Shrim Sah Sah Hum Hum. Then with the water of the peace jar, let the flow fall in the four directions.

original: oṃ phaṭ śivāgni vimuñcāmi phaṭ / nayāmi // dharmaṃ dehi dhanaṃ dehi putrapautrāṃśca dehi me //
analyzed: om phaṭ śiva agne vimuñcāmi phaṭ nayāmi dharmam dehi dhanam dehi putra pautrān ca dehi me
translated: Om Phat, I release the auspicious fire, Phat, I lead. Give me Dharma, give me wealth, give me sons and grandsons.

original: āyurāraogyaṃ me dehi dehi me havivāhana // havyaṃ vahasi vahnetvaṃ kaviṃ vahasi pāvaka //
analyzed: āyuḥ āraogyam me dehi dehi me havi vāhana havyam vahasi vahni tvam kavim vahasi pāvaka
translated: Give me long life and health, O bearer of oblations. You carry oblations, O fire, you carry the wise.

original: mahyaṃ dhanāyurārogyaṃ datvā gaccha hutāśana // hutāśana mukhe devādhārayantyakhilaṃ jagat //
analyzed: mahyam dhana āyuḥ ārogyam da tvā gaccha hutāśana hutāśana mukhe deva ādhārayanti akhilam jagat
translated: Having given me wealth, life, and health, go, O sacrificial fire. In the mouth of the sacrificial fire, the gods sustain the entire world.

original: havyaṃ prathamato yasmai tasmai te jātmune namaḥ // bhaktiṃ dehi śriyaṃ dehi sukhaṃ dehi sutantrataḥ //
analyzed: havyam prathamatas yasmai tasmai te namaḥ bhaktim dehi śriyam dehi sukham dehi su tantrataḥ
translated: To whom the oblation is first offered, to that sage, I offer salutations. Give me devotion, give me prosperity, give me happiness, give me independence.

original: dehi bhogaṃ ca mokṣaṃ ca manobhilaṣitaṃ mama // tarpitosi vibho bhaktyā homenā nalamadhyataḥ //
analyzed: dehi bhogam ca mokṣam ca manaḥ bhilaṣitam mama tarpitaḥ asi vibho bhaktyā homena ā nala madhyatas
translated: Grant me enjoyment, liberation, and whatever is desired by the mind. O Lord, you are satisfied with devotion, with the homa in the middle of the sacrificial ladle.

original: homadravyeṣu yadvīryaṃ tatsarvamātmasātkuru // saṃsāresminvibho mohātprāyaścittaṃ tu yadgatam //
analyzed: homa dravyeṣu yat vīryam tat sarvam ātmasāt kuru saṃsāre smin vibho mohāt prāyaścittam tu yat gatam
translated: Take to yourself all the power that is in the homa substances. O Lord, in this worldly existence, due to delusion, whatever expiation has been performed,

original: tatsarvaṃ nāśamāyā tu homādasmānmaheśvara // kṣamasvamantranāthāya nityānandadharāya ca //
analyzed: tat sarvam nāśa māyā tu homāt asmāt maheśvara kṣamasva amantranāthāya nitya ānanda dharāya ca
translated: may all that be destroyed by this homa, O Mahesvara. Forgive me, O Lord of Mantras, who always bears eternal bliss.

original: dharmārtha kāmamokṣāya punarāganāya ca //
analyzed: dharma artha kāma mokṣāya punarāganāya ca
translated: For the sake of Dharma, Artha, Kama, and Moksha, and for the return (of the deity).

translated: may all that be destroyed by this homa, O Mahesvara.

translated: You are the radiance, give me radiance. Then he should accomplish the sprinkling with the water pot.

analyzed: gāyatryai namaḥ om bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar tat savitu ityādi
translated: Salutations to Gayatri, Om, Bhurbhuva, Sva, Tat Savitur Varenyam, etc.

original: acchidramastu sampūrṇai evamastu // gandhodakaṃ saṃgṛhya guhyeti tarpaṇaṃ kṛtvāyavodakaṃ namaḥ
analyzed: acchidram astu evam astu gandha udakam saṃgṛhya guhya iti tarpaṇam kṛtvā yava udakam namaḥ
translated: May it be flawless and complete. Having collected fragrant water, having offered libation with guhya, having offered water with namaḥ,

original: udakatarpaṇaṃ namaḥ //
analyzed: udaka tarpaṇam namaḥ
translated: having offered water libation with namaḥ.

original: tato naivedyaṃ prārthayet //
analyzed: tatas naivedyam prārthayet
translated: Then one should request for the offering of eatables.

original: ājñāṃ me dīyatāṃ nātha naivedyasyāsya bhakṣaṇe //
analyzed: ājñām me dīyatām nātha naivedyasya asya bhakṣaṇe
translated: O Lord, may I be granted permission to eat this offering of eatables.

original: śarīrayātrā siddhyarthaṃ bhagavatkartu marhasi //
analyzed: śarīra yātrā siddhi artham bhagavat kartu m arhasi
translated: For the sake of accomplishing the journey of the body, O Blessed One, it behoves you to do so.

original: tataḥ kalaśe puṣpāṇi kṣipet //
analyzed: tatas kalaśe puṣpāṇi kṣipet
translated: Then one should throw flowers into the pot.

original: āpannosmiśaraṇyosi sarvāvasthosmi sarvadā //
analyzed: āpannaḥ asmi śaraṇyaḥ si sarva avasthaḥ asmi sarvadā
translated: I am in distress, you are the one to be sought for refuge, I am in every state, always.

analyzed: bhagavan stvām prapannaḥ asmi śaraṇa āgatam brahmahatyā ādi pāpāni ca
translated: O Blessed One, I have taken refuge in you, protect me who has come for refuge, the sins like Brahmin-slaughter, the forbidden acts,

translated: the drinking of liquor, theft, causing abortion, having intercourse with the Guru's wife, stealing gold and land, cruelty, killing one's father,

analyzed: mātṛ hā strī guru ghnaḥ ca pāpāni anyāni sarvasaḥ  anyā kṛtāni ghorāṇi trividhāni sahasraśas
translated: killing one's mother, killing a woman or a Guru, all other sins, the terrible ones committed in various ways thousands of times,

original: smaraṇādamṛteśasya bhasmasādyāntya saṃśayam // naśyanti śatajāpāśca yadisyātkena brahmahā //
analyzed: smaraṇāt amṛta īśasya saṃśayam  naśyanti śata jāpāḥ ca yadi syāt kena brahma hā
translated: by remembering the Lord of Immortality, they are reduced to ashes, there is no doubt. If one recites a hundred times, one becomes free from the sin of Brahmin-slaughter, by whom?

original: śatajāpāśca mantrāṇāṃ saptakoṭyāścayāḥ śive // japtābhavanti sarvāstāmantrasyāsya prabhāvataḥ //
analyzed: śata jāpāḥ ca mantrāṇām sapta koṭyāḥ cayāḥ śive japtāḥ abhavanti sarvāḥ tā mantrasya asya prabhāvataḥ
translated: By the power of this mantra, all the mantras repeated a hundred times and the seven crores of mantras become repeated.

original: caturvedeṣu yatpuṇyaṃ sarvayajñeṣu yatphalam // sarvatīrtheṣu māhātmyaṃ śatajāpāśca tadbhavet //🔽p /
analyzed: catur vedeṣu yat puṇyam sarva yajñeṣu yat phalam  sarva tīrtheṣu māhātmyam śata jāpāḥ ca tat bhavet  p
translated: The merit of the four Vedas, the fruits of all sacrifices, and the greatness of all holy places become obtained by repeating a hundred times.

original: śatajāpāśca deveśi śivasyāgre prapūjite // nirvāṇa phalabhuṅmartyo janmanaikena tadbhavet //
analyzed: śata jāpāḥ ca deveśi śivasya agre prapūjite nirvāṇa phala bhuj martyaḥ janmanā ekena tat bhavet
translated: O Goddess! By repeating a hundred times in front of Shiva, who is worshipped, a mortal becomes the enjoyer of the fruit of liberation in a single birth.

original: jape naikena tanvaṅgi nityayuktastu śuddhadhīḥ // aṣṭottaraśatānmantrī satsamo nātra saṃśayaḥ //
analyzed: jape na ekena tanvaṅgi nitya yuktaḥ tu śuddha dhīḥ aṣṭottaraśatāt mantrī sat samaḥ na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: O slender-bodied one! By repeating once, always engaged, with a pure mind, a mantra-reciting devotee becomes equal to a good person, there is no doubt about it.

original: yasyāyaṃ hṛdi santiṣṭhennitya yuktasya bhāmini // kulānyuddharate sopi daśa pūrvāndaśā parān //
analyzed: yasya ayam hṛdi santiṣṭhet nitya yuktasya bhāmini kulāni uddharate saḥ upi daśa pūrvān daśā parān
translated: O beautiful lady! He who always remains engaged in this in the heart, he also elevates ten generations before and after.

original: na tasya bādhate mṛtyuḥ kālagrastasya suvrate // trisandhyaṃ yaḥ smarennityaṃ yatra tatra sthitopi vā /
analyzed: na tasya bādhate mṛtyuḥ kāla grastasya suvrate trisandhyam yaḥ smaret nityam yatra tatra sthitaḥ api vā
translated: O one of good vows! Death does not afflict him who is seized by time, he who always remembers this at the three junctions, wherever he may be.

original: na mṛtyorvaśamāyāti na rogo na ca taskaraḥ // sakṛtpūjitamātreṇa naśyante hiṃsakādayaḥ //
analyzed: na mṛtyoḥ vaśam āyāti na rogaḥ na ca taskaraḥ sakṛt pūjita mātreṇa naśyante hiṃsaka ādayaḥ
translated: He does not come under the sway of death, nor of disease or thieves. By merely being worshipped once, the violent ones and others perish.

original: naṣṭādaśadiśo yānti siṃhasyeva yathāmṛgāḥ // satāṃ tābhyāsayogena dāridryaṃ naśyate kulāt //
analyzed: naṣṭa ādaśa diśaḥ yānti siṃhasya iva yathā mṛgāḥ satām tad abhyāsa yogena dāridryam naśyate kulāt
translated: By the practice of the virtuous, poverty is destroyed from the family.🔽In whatever country and time the mantra-knower always resides,

original: yasmin deśe ca kāle ca nivasenmantravitsadā // ītayo vyādhayaścaivāyārkhodātaskarā grahāḥ //
analyzed: yasmin deśe ca kāle ca nivaset mantra vid sadā  ītayaḥ vyādhayaḥ ca eva āya arkha udā taskarāḥ grahāḥ
translated: Misfortunes, diseases, untimely death, thieves, and evil planets,🔽Various shakini spirits, yakshas, pishachas, rakshasas, and evil planets,

original: śākinyo vividhā yakṣāpiśācārākṣasāgrahāḥ // bālagrahāśca visphoṭā vyantarāścāntarācaye //
analyzed: śākinyaḥ vividhāḥ yakṣa apiśāca arākṣasa agrahāḥ bālagrahāḥ ca visphoṭāḥ vyantarāḥ ca antara ācaye
translated: Child-grahas, boils, and ventalas,

original: sarvāṇi viṣajātāni durbhikṣaparipīḍanam // sarvaṃ na prabhavatyeva mantraṃ vitsannidhānataḥ //
analyzed: sarvāṇi viṣa jātāni durbhikṣa paripīḍanam sarvam na prabhavati eva mantram vid sannidhānataḥ
translated: All poisons, and the suffering of famine-all this does not prevail, due to the presence of the mantra-knower.🔽Having always worshipped all beings and the kings,

original: sampūjya sarvajantūnāṃ bhūpatīnāṃ ca sarvadā // dāna pūjana samāne rasamai pūjite yadi //
analyzed: sampūjya sarva jantūnām bhūpatīnām ca sarvadā dāna pūjana samāne pūjite yadi
translated: If the essence is worshipped equally with offerings and worship,

original: tena pūjitamātreṇa sarve mantrāstu pūjitāḥ // bhavanti sukhadā tatra tanmukhāṃstāṃstu pūjayet //
analyzed: tena pūjita mātreṇa sarve mantrāḥ tu pūjitāḥ bhavanti sukha dā tatra tad mukhān tān tu pūjayet
translated: By that mere worship, all mantras are worshipped. They become givers of happiness there. One should worship those facing that direction.

original: sarvatracchedakartāro grahā hiṃsanti sādhakam // tasmādgrahāṇāṃ dātavyaṃ sadaivodaka mocanam //
analyzed: sarvatra cheda kartāraḥ grahāḥ hiṃsanti sādhakam  tasmāt grahāṇām dātavyam sadā eva udaka mocanam
translated: Evil planets everywhere harm the practitioner who cuts. Therefore, the water offering should always be given to the planets.

original: iṣṭāgrahāḥ pratṛpyanti tṛptā na prabhavanti hi // alaṃvistareṇa kṣamā puṣpāṇi //
analyzed: iṣṭa āgrahāḥ pratṛpyanti tṛptāḥ na prabhavanti hi alaṃvistareṇa kṣamā puṣpāṇi
translated: The accepted desires are satisfied, and when satisfied, they do not become powerful.

original: atha bhairava samayā //
analyzed: atha bhairava samayā
translated: Now, the Bhairava Samaya.

original: asya mantrasya kahāla ṛṣiḥ // gāyatraṃ cchandaḥ mṛtyuñjayo devatā /🔽p /
analyzed: asya mantrasya kahālaḥ ṛṣiḥ gāyatram chandaḥ mṛtyuñjayaḥ devatā  p
translated: For this mantra, the sage is Kalha, the meter is Gayatri, and the deity is Mrityunjaya.

original: oṃ juṃ saḥ amṛta mūrtaye vyomavyāpine vyomaśarīrāya sarvasamayalopānnivāraya samayaṃ pūraya
analyzed: om juṃ saḥ amṛta mūrtaye vyoma vyāpine vyoma śarīrāya sarva samaya lopāt nivāraya samayam pūraya
translated: Om, Jum, Sah, to the embodiment of nectar, pervading the sky, having a sky-like body, remove all violations of the samaya, fulfill the samaya,

original: sarvasādhāraṇamantraśarīrāya
analyzed: sarva sādhāraṇa mantra śarīrāya
translated: to the embodiment of the mantra common to all,

original: amṛte parāmṛte nitye hrīṃ svāhā // kapāleśanamastubhyaṃ nityaṃ devendra pūjita //
analyzed: amṛte para amṛte nitye hrīṃ svāhā kapāla īśa namaḥ tubhyam nityam deva indra pūjita
translated: to the nectar, supreme nectar, eternal, Hrim, Svaha. Salutations to you, O Kapalesa, always worshipped by the lord of gods,

original: śivabhakta gṛhāṇārcāṃ rakṣamāṃ bhairavottama // //🔽bhairavendra namastubhyaṃ hutāśana prapūjita śivabhakta // //
analyzed: śiva bhakta gṛhāṇa arcām bhairava uttama  bhairava indra namaḥ tubhyam hutāśana prapūjita śiva bhakta
translated: O devotee of Shiva, accept this worship, protect me, O best of Bhairavas.🔽O lord of Bhairavas, salutations to you, worshipped by the sacrificial fire, O devotee of Shiva.

original: krodharāja namastubhyaṃ vaivasvata prapūjita // śivabhakta // //
analyzed: krodha rāja namaḥ tubhyam vaivasvata prapūjita śiva bhakta
translated: O King of Anger, salutations to you, worshipped by the son of Vivasvat, O devotee of Shiva.🔽O extremely terrible one, salutations to you, always worshipped by the lord of the south, O devotee of Shiva.

original: vikarāla namastubhyaṃ nityaṃ nairṛta pūjita // śivabhakta // // manmathāya namastubhyaṃ varuṇena prapūjita
analyzed: vikarāla namaḥ tubhyam nityam nairṛta pūjita śiva bhakta    manmathāya namaḥ tubhyam varuṇena prapūjita
translated: Salutations to you, O Manmatha, worshipped by Varuna,

original: śivabha // // meghanāda namastubhyaṃ prabhañjana prapūjita // śivabhakta // // somarāja namastubhyaṃ
analyzed: śivabha meghanāda namaḥ tubhyam prabhañjana prapūjita śiva bhakta     somarāja namaḥ tubhyam
translated: O Shiva's devotee, salutations to you, O Sovaraja,🔽always worshipped by the king of Yakshas.

original: nityaṃ yakṣendra pūjita // śivabhakta // // vidyārājanamastubhyaṃ nityaṃ rudra prapūjita // śivabhakta //
analyzed: nityam yakṣendra pūjita śiva bhakta    vidyā rājanamaḥ tubhyam nityam rudra prapūjita śiva bhakta
translated: O Shiva's devotee, salutations to you, O Vidyadhara king, always worshipped by Rudra.

original: viśvaikarūpaviśvātmanviśvasargādikāraṇam // puraprakāśa vapuṣaṃ stumaḥ svacchanda bhairavam //
analyzed: viśva eka rūpa viśvātman viśva sarga ādi kāraṇam pura prakāśa vapuṣam stumaḥ svacchanda bhairavam
translated: We praise the form of the universe, the soul of the universe, the cause of creation etc. of the universe, the one with a body of pure light, the self-willed Bhairava.

original: viśvātītaṃ viśvamayaṃ bhairavāṣṭakasaṃyutam // sakalaṃ niṣkalaṃ śāntaṃ stumaḥ svacchandabhairavam //
analyzed: viśva atītam viśva mayam bhairava aṣṭaka saṃyutam sakalam niṣkalam śāntam stumaḥ svacchandabhairavam
translated: We praise the self-willed Bhairava, who is beyond the universe, full of the universe, accompanied by the group of eight Bhairavas, with parts, without parts, and peaceful.

original: namastasmai hyaghorāya ghoraghoratarātmane //
analyzed: namaḥ tasmai hi aghorāya ghora ghoratara ātmane
translated: Salutations to that Aghora, whose nature is more terrible than the terrible.

original: utpatti sthiti saṃhāralayānugraha hetave // pañcabrahmātmakaṃ devaṃ sāṅgaṃ sānu caraṃ param //
analyzed: utpatti sthiti saṃhāra laya anugraha hetave pañca brahma ātmakam devam sa aṅgam sa anu caram param
translated: To the one who is the cause of creation, sustenance, dissolution, and grace, to the supreme god consisting of the five Brahmas, with limbs and retinue,

original: sāvṛttiṃ ca sa śaktīkaṃ kṣāmaye haṃ maheśvaram // dvādaśātmannamastubhyaṃ mārtāṇḍāya namo namaḥ //
analyzed: sa āvṛttim ca sa śaktīkam kṣāmaye ham maheśvaram dvādaśa ātman namaḥ tubhyam mārtāṇḍāya namaḥ namaḥ
translated: We confess the great Lord with his powers and their manifestations. Salutations to you, O twelve-formed one, to the sun, again and again.

original: vyādhipannagadaṣṭasya trāṇaṃ kuru divākara // //
analyzed: vyādhi pannaga daṣṭasya trāṇam kuru divākara
translated: O sun, be the protector of one afflicted by disease and bitten by a snake.

original: rātrī śvarakalaṅkāṅka namaste rohiṇī pate // saṃsāra viṣadagdhasya trāṇaṃ kuru niśākara // //
analyzed: rātrī śvara kalaṅka aṅka namaḥ te rohiṇī pate saṃsāra viṣa dagdhasya trāṇam kuru niśākara  /
translated: O Lord of Rohini, O remover of the stigma of the dark fortnight, salutations to you. O Moon, be the protector of one scorched by the poison of worldly existence.

original: aṅgāraraka namastestu sarvaduḥkhanivāraka // kṛpaṇaṇadaridrasya trāṇaṃ kuru dharāsuta // //
analyzed: aṅgāraraka namaḥ te tu sarva duḥkha nivāraka kṛpa ṇa daridrasya trāṇam kuru dharāsuta  /
translated: O Angaraka, may you be pleased. O remover of all miseries, O son of the Earth, be the protector of the miserly and the poor.

original: somātmaja namastubhyaṃ graharājāyate namaḥ //🔽p /
analyzed: soma ātmaja namaḥ tubhyam graharājāyate namaḥ  p
translated: O son of Soma, salutations to you. Salutations to the king of planets.

original: bhava paṅkanimagnasya dehi śaṃ rohiṇī suta // //
analyzed: bhava paṅka nimagnasya dehi śam rohiṇī suta
translated: O son of Rohini, grant peace to one sunk in the mud of worldly existence.

original: vācaspate surācārya namaste tvā mayā paha // pāpasya buddhihīnasya sadā sānugraho bhava // //
analyzed: vācaspate sura ācārya namaḥ te tvā mayā paha pāpasya buddhi hīnasya sadā sa anugrahaḥ bhava  /
translated: O lord of speech, preceptor of the gods, salutations to you, O Rahu. Be always gracious to me, the sinful and the foolish.

original: vibudhārigurokāvya namaste karuṇā para // daśāntargrahapīḍādīnyutvā pāhibhyagossuta // //
analyzed: vibudha ari guro kāvya namaḥ te karuṇā para
translated: O preceptor of the enemies of the gods, salutations to you, O compassionate one. Protect me, O son of Brihaspati, from the afflictions of the planets and other evils.

original: namaḥ kṛṣṇaśarīrāya sūryātmaja namostute // saṃsarabhayabhītasya trāṇaṃ kuru śanaiścara // //
analyzed: namaḥ kṛṣṇa śarīrāya sūrya ātmaja namaḥ stute  saṃsara bhaya bhītasya trāṇam kuru śanaiścara
translated: Salutations to you, O body of Krishna, O son of Surya, salutations to you. O Shani, be the protector of one frightened by the dangers of worldly existence.

original: saiṃhikeya namastubhyaṃ grahapīḍāṃ nivāraya // duḥkha pāvaka dagdhasya trāṇaṃ kuru vidhuntuda // //
analyzed: saiṃhikeya namaḥ tubhyam graha pīḍām nivāraya duḥkha pāvaka dagdhasya trāṇam kuru vidhuntuda  /
translated: O son of Simhika, salutations to you. Remove the affliction of the planets. O remover of obstacles, be the protector of one burnt by the fire of misery.

original: sūryādayaḥ ketu yutāḥ śivabhakti parāyaṇāḥ // rakṣantu yajamānasya dharmamāyussuhṛtsutān // //
analyzed: sūrya ādayaḥ ketu yutāḥ śivabhakti parāyaṇāḥ rakṣantu yajamānasya dharmam āyus suhṛd sutān
translated: May the sun and other planets, along with Ketu, devoted to the worship of Shiva, protect the patron's dharma, life, friends, and children.

original: atha lokapālakṣamā //🔽bhagavandevarājatvaṃ mayāsaṃkhedito makhe // pūjāṃ gṛhāṇa deveśa kṣamyatāṃ kṣamyatāṃ prabho // //
analyzed: atha lokapāla kṣamā  bhagavan devarāja tvam mayā asaṃkheditaḥ makhe pūjām gṛhāṇa deveśa kṣamyatām kṣamyatām prabho
translated: Now, the forgiveness of the Lokapalas (Guardians of the Quarters):🔽O Lord, O King of Gods, I have not troubled you in the sacrifice. Accept the worship, O Lord of Gods. May it be forgiven, O Lord.

original: bhagavanbhagavanvahnetvaṃ mayā khedito makhe // pūjāṃ gṛhāṇa deveśa kṣamyatāṃ kṣamyatāṃ prabhoḥ // //🔽bhagabandha parājatvaṃ mayāsaṃkhedito makhe // śivapūjāṃ gṛhāṇatvaṃ kṣamyatāṃ kṣamyatāṃ prabho // //
analyzed: bhagavan bhagavan vahne tvam mayā kheditaḥ makhe pūjām gṛhāṇa deveśa kṣamyatām kṣamyatām prabhoḥ    bhaga bandha mayā asaṃkheditaḥ makhe śiva pūjām gṛhāṇa tvam kṣamyatām kṣamyatām prabho
translated: O Lord, O God of Fire, I have not troubled you in the sacrifice. Accept the worship, O Lord of Gods. May it be forgiven, O Lord.🔽O Lord, O Lord of the Rakshasas, I have not troubled you in the sacrifice. Accept the worship of Shiva, O Lord. May it be forgiven, O Lord.

original: bhagavannirṛterakṣaḥ ghorātsaṃsārasāgarāt // saṃkheditosimamaye yāhi dhāmasvakaṃ prabho // //🔽bhagavanvaruṇādyatvaṃ yajñe śrī śivapūjite // kheditośi mayā deva yāmi svadhāma pāvanam // //
analyzed: bhagavan nirṛteḥ akṣaḥ ghorāt saṃsāra sāgarāt  yāhi dhāma svakam prabho  bhagavan varuṇa ādya tvam yajñe śrī śiva pūjite khedita ūśi mayā deva yāmi sva dhāma pāvanam
translated: O Lord, O Nirriti, O Rakshasa, I have not troubled you in the sacrifice. Accept the worship, O Lord of Gods. May it be forgiven, O Lord.🔽O Lord, O Varuna, I have not troubled you in the sacrifice. Accept the worship, O Lord of Gods. May it be forgiven, O Lord.

original: bhagavanbhavaganvāyo kheditaḥ śāmbhave makhe // tvaṃ mayārcāṃ gṛhītve māṃ yāhi dhāma svake cchayā // //
analyzed: bhagavan kheditaḥ śāmbhave makhe tvam mayā arcām gṛhītvā e mām yāhi dhāma svake cchayā  /
translated: O Lord, O Bhava, O Vayu, I have not troubled you in the Shambhava sacrifice. Accept the worship, O Lord of Gods. May it be forgiven, O Lord.

original: bhagabandha na dādyatvaṃ kheditaḥ śāṅkare kratau // gṛhītvārcāṃ mayā dattāṃ kṣamyatāṃ kṣamyatāṃ🔽prabho // //
analyzed: na kheditaḥ śāṅkare kratau gṛhītvā arcām mayā dattām kṣamyatām kṣamyatām  prabho
translated: Accepting the worship offered by me, please forgive, please forgive, O Lord.

original: bhagavandevadevetvaṃ mīśānārcāṃ svake makhe //🔽p /
analyzed: bhagavan devadevetvam mīśāna arcām svake makhe  p
translated: O Lord, you are the God of gods, the Lord of gods. In your own sacrifice,🔽you accepted the worship offered by me.

original: gṛhītvā dehi me sarva puruṣārthaṃ prayāhi ca // //
analyzed: gṛhītvā dehi me puruṣa artham prayāhi ca
translated: Taking it, give me all the goals of human life, and go.🔽O Lord, you are worshipped by the three worlds, the grandfather of all the worlds.

original: bhagavaṃstrijagatpūjya sarvalokapitāmaha // saive dhvare kṛtā rakṣā tvayātat kṣamyatāṃ prabho // //
analyzed: bhagavan trijagat pūjya sarva loka pitāmaha sā eve dhvare kṛtā rakṣā tvayā atat kṣamyatām prabho
translated: The protection was done by you in the sacrifice. O Lord, please forgive that.🔽O Lord, O Lord Vishnu, the destroyer of demons,

original: bhagavanbhagavanviṣṇo kṛta dānava nāśana // śaive dhvare kṛtārakṣā tvayā tatkṣamyatāṃ prabho // //
analyzed: bhagavan bhagavan viṣṇo kṛta dānava nāśana śaive dhvare kṛta ārakṣā tvayā tat kṣamyatām prabho
translated: the protection was done by you in the Shaiva sacrifice. O Lord, please forgive that.

original: bhagavanto grahāssarve yenye copagrahā matāḥ // gṛhṇantu pūjāṃ maddhattāṃ tuṣṭā yāntu svakaṃ padam //🔽kapāleśādya bhagavankheditaḥ cakra pūjitaḥ // śaive dhvare mayātyarthaṃ bhairavendra namostute // //
analyzed: bhagavantaḥ grahāḥ sarve yena ye ca upagrahāḥ matāḥ gṛhṇantu pūjām mat dhattām tuṣṭāḥ yāntu svakam padam  kapāla īśa ādya bhagavan kheditaḥ cakra pūjitaḥ śaive dhvare mayā atyartham bhairava indra namaḥ stute
translated: O Lords, all the planets and others considered as secondary planets,🔽accept the worship offered by me. Being satisfied, go to your own place.🔽O Lord, beginning with Kapaleshvara, worshipped with the Chakras, you were tired.🔽In the Shaiva sacrifice, O Bhairava, I offer salutations to you.

original: śāṅkaredyā mayā yajñe bhagavāñśikhivāhana // pūjitaḥ khedito sitvaṃ tuṣṭo yā hi svakaṃ padam // //
analyzed: mayā yajñe bhagavān śikhivāhana pūjitaḥ tuṣṭaḥ yā hi svakam padam
translated: O Lord, in the Shaiva sacrifice, the God with the peacock as his vehicle🔽was worshipped by me. Being tired, you went to your own place being satisfied.

original: bhagavankrodharājatvaṃ dharmā yajana pūjita // kṛtārakṣāmakhe śaive yā hi svaṃ vimalaṃ padam // //
analyzed: bhagavan krodha rāja tvam kṛta ārakṣā makhe śaive yā hi svam vimalam padam
translated: O Lord, you are the King of Wrath, worshipped in the Dharma sacrifice, who have protected your own pure state in the Shaiva sacrifice.

original: bhagavanvikarālatvaṃ sadānirṛti pūjita // śaivīṃ pūjāṃ gṛhāṇatvaṃ yā hi svaṃ vimalaṃ padam // //🔽bhagavanmanmatheśatvaṃ varuṇena kṛtārcana // kheditaḥ śivayajñedyakṣasyatāṃ kṣamyatāṃ prabho // //🔽bhagavanmeghanādatvaṃ vāyunā pūjitānagha // śaive yajñe kheditastvaṃ kṣamyatāṃ kṣamyatāṃ prabho // //
analyzed: bhagavan vikarāla tvam sadānirṛti pūjita śaivīm pūjām gṛhāṇa tvam yā hi svam vimalam padam  bhagavat manmatha īśa tvam varuṇena kṛta arcana kheditaḥ kṣamyatām prabho  bhagavat megha nāda tvam vāyunā pūjitā anagha śaive yajñe kheditaḥ tvam kṣamyatām kṣamyatām prabho
translated: O Lord, you are Vikarala, always worshipped by Nirriti, accept this Shaiva worship, which is your own pure state.🔽O Lord, you are Manmatheśa, worshipped by Varuna, you are afflicted in the Shaiva sacrifice, may the Lord be pleased.🔽O Lord, you are Megha nada, worshipped by Vayu, O sinless one, you are afflicted in the Shaiva sacrifice, may the Lord be pleased, may the Lord be pleased.

original: bhagavansomarājācya khedidhanadārcita // śaive dhvare kṛtārakṣā kṣamyatāṃ kṣamyatāṃ prabho // //
analyzed: bhagavan somarāja ācya khedi dhanada arcita śaive dhvare kṛta ārakṣā kṣamyatām kṣamyatām prabho
translated: O Lord, you are Soma raja, worshipped by Kubera, you have protected in the Shaiva sacrifice, may the Lord be pleased, may the Lord be pleased.

original: vidyārājādya bhagavañśaivesminmakha karmaṇi // āyāsitosi devatvaṃ kṣamyatāṃ kṣamyatāṃ prabho // //
analyzed: vidyārāja adya bhagavan śaiva ismin makha karmaṇi āyāsitaḥ asi deva tvam kṣamyatām kṣamyatām prabho
translated: O Lord, you are the King of Vidyas, in this Shaiva sacrificial rite, you are exhausted, O Lord, may the Lord be pleased, may the Lord be pleased.

original: saptāvaraṇake muṣminnanantādyāḥ sthitāścaye // te sarve pūjitā tuṣṭā yāntu śaivaṃ paraṃ padam //
analyzed: sapta āvaraṇake muṣmin ananta ādyāḥ sthitāḥ caye te sarve pūjitā tuṣṭāḥ yāntu śaivam param padam
translated: Those who are established in this seven-fold covering, beginning with Ananta, all of them are worshipped and satisfied, may they go to the supreme state of Shiva.

original: śambho śivajagannātha bhagavankhedito mayā //🔽p /
analyzed: śambho śiva jagannātha bhagavan kheditaḥ mayā  p
translated: O Shambhu, Shiva, Lord of the universe, O Blessed One, I have been afflicted by you.

original: tvaṃ devo devadevānāṃ tvamevaparamāgatiḥ //
analyzed: tvam devaḥ devadevānām tvam eva parama āgatiḥ
translated: O Lord, you are the god of gods, you alone are the supreme refuge.

original: tvaṃ bhuktimuktike dātā kāraṇānāṃ ca kāraṇam // tvayi tuṣṭhe surā tuṣṭāḥ sakalāḥ santu nityaśaḥ //
analyzed: tvam bhukti muktike dātā kāraṇānām ca kāraṇam tvayi tuṣṭhe surā tuṣṭāḥ sakalāḥ santu nityaśas
translated: You are the giver of enjoyment and liberation, the cause of causes, when you are pleased, may all the gods be always satisfied.

original: airāvaṇa samārūḍho hemavarṇo mahādyutiḥ // devendraḥ satataṃ tuṃṣṭaḥ parame śārcane rataḥ //
analyzed: airāvaṇa samārūḍhaḥ hema varṇaḥ mahā dyutiḥ deva indraḥ satatam tuṃṣṭaḥ parame śārcane rataḥ
translated: Airavata, the golden-hued one with great radiance, the lord of gods, always satisfied, engaged in the supreme worship,

original: śiva dhyānaika nirataḥ śivasadbhāvabhāvitaḥ // śivapraṇāmaparamaḥ karo tu mama śāntikam // //
analyzed: śiva dhyāna eka nirataḥ śiva sadbhāva bhāvitaḥ śiva praṇāma paramaḥ karo tu mama śāntikam
translated: Devoted solely to meditation on Shiva, imbued with the true nature of Shiva, devoted to salutations to Shiva, may he perform my peace rite.

original: bhūtikṛddehināṃ devo jvalanaḥ pāpanāśanaḥ // śivapūjājapodyuktaḥ śivasadbhāvabhāvitaḥ //
analyzed: bhūti kṛt dehinām devaḥ jvalanaḥ pāpa nāśanaḥ śiva pūjā japa udyuktaḥ śiva sadbhāva bhāvitaḥ
translated: The god Agni, the bestower of prosperity to beings, the destroyer of sins, engaged in the worship and japa of Shiva, imbued with the true nature of Shiva,

original: śāntiṃ karotu me devastathā pāpaparikṣayam // //🔽antakotha mahātejāśśivadhyānaparāyaṇaḥ // śivapūjā samāyuktaḥ kṣemārogyaṃ karo tu me // //
analyzed: śāntim karotu me devaḥ tathā pāpa parikṣayam  antakaḥ utha mahā tejāḥ śiva dhyāna parāyaṇaḥ śiva pūjā samāyuktaḥ kṣema ārogyam karo tu me  /
translated: May that god perform my peace rite and destroy my sins.🔽Antaka, the greatly radiant one, devoted to meditation on Shiva, engaged in the worship of Shiva, may he perform my peace rite and grant me well-being and health.

original: rakṣendro nirṛtinnityaṃ śiva pūjā parāyaṇaḥ // karo me mahāśāntiṃ śivabhakti samutsukaḥ // //
analyzed: rakṣa indraḥ nirṛtin nityam śiva pūjā parāyaṇaḥ karaḥ me mahāśāntim śivabhakti samutsukaḥ
translated: Rakshendra, Nirriti, always devoted to the worship of Shiva, eager for devotion to Shiva, may he perform my great peace rite.

original: varuṇaḥ parayābhaktyā śivaikagatamānasaḥ // rogaśokāgni santāpaṃ nirnāśaya tu me sadā // //
analyzed: varuṇaḥ parayā abhaktyā śiva eka gata mānasaḥ roga śoka agni santāpam nirnāśaya tu me sadā  /
translated: May Varuna, with supreme devotion, his mind solely focused on Shiva, always remove my disease, sorrow, and the torment of fire.

original: pavanaḥ paramo devaḥ parameśvara bhāvitaḥ // kṣemārogyabaliṃ śāntiṃ karo tu satataṃ mama // //
analyzed: pavanaḥ paramaḥ devaḥ parameśvara bhāvitaḥ kṣema ārogya balim śāntim karo tu satatam mama
translated: May Pavana, the supreme god, contemplated as the Supreme Lord, always bring me peace, well-being, health, strength, and tranquility.

original: kuvero varadaḥ śrīmānharapādārcane rataḥ // śāntiṃ karo tu me prītaḥ śāntaḥ śānte na tejasā // //
analyzed: kuveraḥ vara daḥ śrīmān hara pāda arcane rataḥ śāntim tu me prītaḥ śāntaḥ śānte na tejasā
translated: May Kubera, the prosperous bestower of boons, engaged in worshipping Shiva's feet, being peaceful and tranquil, always bring me peace with his splendor.

original: īśānaḥ paramo devaḥ sarvadevottamottamaḥ // sopi sarvātma bhāvena śāntimāśukarotu me // //
analyzed: īśānaḥ paramaḥ devaḥ sarva deva uttama uttamaḥ saḥ api sarva ātma bhāvena śāntim āśukarotu me  /
translated: May Isana, the supreme god, the most excellent of all gods, also bring me peace swiftly with the attitude of being the soul of all.

original: bhuloketha bhuvoloke svarloke vivasanti ye // devādivya prabhā yuktāḥ śāntiṃ kurvantu me sadā // //
analyzed: bhuvoloke svarloke vivasanti ye
translated: May those who dwell in the world of earth, the world of atmosphere, and the world of heaven, endowed with divine radiance, always bring me peace.

original: maholoke janoloke tapoloke vasanti ye // tepi pramuditā devāḥ śāntiṃ kurvantu me sadā // //🔽p /
analyzed: mahaḥ loke janoloke tapoloke vasanti ye te api pramuditāḥ devāḥ śāntim kurvantu me sadā  / p
translated: May those gods who dwell in the world of greatness, the world of people, and the world of austerities, being delighted, always bring me peace.

original: satyaloke ca ye devāḥ svaprabhojjvalavigrahāḥ // śivabhaktāḥ sumanaso bhayaṃ nirnāśayantu me // //
analyzed: satyaloke ca ye devāḥ sva prabhā ujjvala vigrahāḥ śiva bhaktāḥ sumanasaḥ bhayam nirnāśayantu me  /
translated: May those gods who dwell in the world of truth, their bodies shining with their own radiance, being devotees of Shiva and well-disposed, remove all fear from me.

original: karacaraṇa kṛtaṃ vākāyajaṃ karṇajaṃ vā śravaṇa nayanajaṃvāmā na saṃvāparādham //
analyzed: kara caraṇa kṛtam vā a kāya jam karṇa jam vā śravaṇa nayana jam vāmāḥ na
translated: Whether committed by hand, speech, body, ears, eyes, or mind, I have not committed any offense.

original: vidhitamavidhitaṃ vā sarvametatkṣmasva jayajaya karuṇābdhe śrīmahādevaśambho //
analyzed: vidhitam a vidhitam vā sarvam etat kṣmasva jaya jaya karuṇā abdhe śrī mahādeva śambho
translated: Whether prescribed or not, all this is forgiven by you, O ocean of compassion, glorious Mahadeva Shambhu.

original: kṣamasvamantranāthāya nityānandamayāya ca // dharmārtha kāmamokṣāya punarāgamanāya ca //
analyzed: kṣamasva a mantra nāthāya nitya ānanda mayāya ca  dharma artha kāma mokṣāya punarāgamanāya ca
translated: Forgive me, O Lord of Mantras, who are full of eternal bliss, for the sake of Dharma, Artha, Kama, and Moksha, and for your return.

original: kṣamasvanyūnādhika bhāvayuktaṃ mayākṛtaṃ darśaya viśvamūrte // prasīda deveśa namostu tubhyaṃ prayāhi
analyzed: kṣamasva anyūna adhika bhāva yuktam mayā akṛtam darśaya viśvamūrte prasīda deveśa namaḥ astu tubhyam prayāhi
translated: Forgive me for any deficiency or excess in what I have done, O Universal Form. Be gracious, O Lord of Gods, salutations to you. Go forth

original: tuṣṭaḥ punarāgamāya //
analyzed: tuṣṭaḥ punarāgamāya
translated: to return when pleased.

original: ya ekaḥ sarvaviddevaḥ sākṣī viśvasya karmaṇaḥ // brahmādyairapyagamyoyaḥ samayā pūjito makhe //
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ sarva vid devaḥ sākṣī viśvasya karmaṇaḥ  brahma ādyaiḥ api agamyaḥ yaḥ samayā pūjitaḥ makhe
translated: He who is the one all-knowing God, the witness of the world's actions, who is unapproachable even by Brahma and others, is worshipped in the sacrifice with Samaya.

original: sakalo niṣkalo devo dvādaśānta padasthitaḥ // sa devo bhagavāñśambhuḥ kheditosminkriyā vidhau //
analyzed: sakalaḥ niṣkalaḥ devaḥ dvādaśānta pada sthitaḥ sa devaḥ bhagavān śambhuḥ kheditaḥ smin kriyā vidhau
translated: The complete and incomplete God, abiding in the state beyond the twelve, that God, the Lord Shambhu, is fatigued in this ritual procedure.

original: ya eva sṛṣṭi saṃrakṣāsaṃhārakaraṇakṣamaḥ // trirūpastriguṇaḥ śambhuḥ samayā pūjito śvakhe //
analyzed: yaḥ eva sṛṣṭi saṃrakṣā saṃhāra karaṇa kṣamaḥ trirūpaḥ triguṇaḥ śambhuḥ samayā śva khe
translated: He alone who is capable of creation, preservation, and dissolution, Shambhu with three forms and three qualities, is worshipped in the sacrifice with Samaya.

original: anena devadevena nirguṇenātsūrūpiṇā // sā śaktistrividhopāntā samayā pūjito dhvare //
analyzed: anena devadevena sā śaktiḥ trividha upāntā samayā pūjitaḥ dhvare
translated: By this God of gods, of the form of the Supreme Self, devoid of attributes, that Śakti, having three ends, is worshipped in the sacrifice.

original: adya me saphalaṃ janma adya me saphalāḥ kriyāḥ // evaṃ prabhāvo yacchambhuḥ kheditosmiñśivādhvare //
analyzed: adya me sa phalam janma adya me sa phalāḥ kriyāḥ evam prabhāvaḥ yat śambhuḥ kheditaḥ asmin śiva adhvare
translated: Today my birth is fruitful, today my actions are fruitful, Śaṃbhu, who has such power, is pleased in this Śiva sacrifice.

original: anātha madhyamāṃ devarakṣāsmātpāpa saṅkaṭām // siddhimṛddhiṃ tathā buddhiṃ śuddhiṃ mānasi kīṃ mayi //
analyzed: anātha madhyamām deva rakṣa asmāt pāpa saṅkaṭām  siddhim ṛddhim tathā buddhim śuddhim mānasi kīm mayi
translated: Protect me, helpless, in the midst of this dangerous sin, give me success, prosperity, intellect, and purity of mind.

original: dehi bhogaṃ ca mokṣaṃ ca manobhilaṣitaṃ mama // sarvatrātha maheśāna dehi siddhiṃ ca śaśvatīm //
analyzed: dehi bhogam ca mokṣam ca manaḥ bhilaṣitam mama sarvatra atha maheśāna dehi siddhim ca śaśvatīm
translated: Give me enjoyment and liberation, and what my mind desires, O Maheśāna, always give me success in everything.

original: anāmayaṃ padaṃ śambho dehi me parameśvara // idānīṃ paramīśāna kṣamyatāṃ kṣamyatāṃ prabho //
analyzed: anāmayam padam śambho dehi me parameśvara idānīm param īśāna kṣamyatām kṣamyatām prabho
translated: O Śaṃbhu, O Supreme Lord, give me the state of being free from disease, now, O Supreme Lord, be pleased, be pleased.

original: āyāsitosi yajñesmiṃstuṣṭo yā hi svakaṃ padam // gaṇeśādyāḥ smṛtā yetra dvārapālanakarmaṇi //
analyzed: yajñe smin tuṣṭaḥ yā hi svakam padam gaṇeśa ādyāḥ smṛtāḥ dvāra pālana karmaṇi
translated: You are tired in this sacrifice, being satisfied, go to your own place, Gaṇeśa and others are remembered here for the work of guarding the door.

original: indrādyālokapālāśca hyādityādyāstathā grahāḥ // kapāle śādayo yetra bhairavā bhairavyāśritāḥ //
analyzed: indra ādyāḥ lokapālāḥ ca hi āditya ādyāḥ tathā grahāḥ kapāle śa ādayaḥ bhairavāḥ bhairavī āśritāḥ
translated: Indra and other Lokapālas, and the Ādityas and other planets, and the Bhairavas beginning with Kapāla, who are dependent on Bhairavī,

original: saptāvaraṇamantrāśca tathā vastrādi devatāḥ // tathā ṣaḍadhvasandoho gāyatryādyāśca devatāḥ //
analyzed: sapta āvaraṇa mantrāḥ ca tathā vastra ādi devatāḥ tathā ṣaḍadhva sandohaḥ gāyatrī ādyāḥ ca devatāḥ
translated: The mantras of the seven coverings, the deities of the cloth and so on,🔽The collection of the six paths, the deities beginning with Gayatri,🔽The deities beginning with Vastospati, the deities of the planets and so on,

original: vāstoṣpati prabhṛtayo grahadevādi devatāḥ // vaṭukā herukādyāśca kṣettrapālāśca śāśvatāḥ //
analyzed: vāstoṣpati prabhṛtayaḥ grahadeva ādi devatāḥ vaṭukāḥ heruka ādyāḥ ca kṣettrapālāḥ ca śāśvatāḥ
translated: The eternal Kshetrapala deities such as Vatuka and Heruka,

original: te sarve vividhānkamāndatvāyāntu svakaṃ padam // āhvānaṃ naiva jānāmi naiva jānāmi pūjanam //
analyzed: te sarve vividhān kamān da tvā āyāntu svakam padam āhvānam nā eva jānāmi nā eva jānāmi pūjanam
translated: May they all grant various desires and return to their own places. I do not know the invocation, I do not know the worship,

original: visarjanaṃ na jānāmi kṣamyatāṃ parameśvara //
analyzed: visarjanam na jānāmi kṣamyatām parameśvara
translated: I do not know the dismissal, may the Supreme Lord forgive me.

original: ubhābhyāṃ jānubhyāṃ pāṇibhyāṃ śirasā corasā namaskāraṃ karomi namaḥ // namo brahmaṇetyādi //
analyzed: ubhābhyām jānubhyām pāṇibhyām śirasā ca urasā namaskāram karomi namaḥ namaḥ brahmaṇā ityādi
translated: I offer salutations with both knees, both hands, the head and the chest. I bow down. Salutations to Brahman, and so on.

original: yatprāṅniveśitaṃ tejastasmiṃstejasi nānāvidhā mantrāḥ sphuliṅgā iva mantrakalaśāntaḥ praviṣṭā
analyzed: yat prāc niveśitam tejaḥ tasmin tejasi nānāvidhāḥ mantrāḥ sphuliṅgāḥ iva mantra kalaśa antar praviṣṭā
translated: The mantras of various kinds, like sparks, that were placed in the east, are entered into the pot of mantras in that light.

original: dhyātavyāḥ // tatkalaśagataṃ tejaḥ puñjaṃ saṃhāriṇya sakalabhairava bhaṭṭāraka rūpaṃ niṣkalanāthe
analyzed: dhyātavyāḥ tad kalaśa gatam tejaḥ puñjam saṃhāriṇya sakala bhairava bhaṭṭāraka rūpam niṣkala nāthe
translated: They should be contemplated. The mass of light in that pot, the universal dissolution, in the form of the Lord of all Bhairavas, in the formless Lord,

original: sopyuścāra krameṇa bindau binduśca nāde nādaṃ ca śaktau sāpyardhacandra nirodhinyāṃ praśama yuktyā vyāpaka🔽svarūpe līneti mantralaya krameṇa vibhāvyataṃ vyāpaka cidrūpaṃ oṃ juṃ saḥ paramaṃ mantra tejaḥ saḥ juṃ oṃ
analyzed: bindau binduḥ ca nāde nādam ca śaktau sā api ardhacandra nirodhinyām praśama yuktyā  svarūpe līna iti mantra laya krameṇa om juṃ saḥ paramam mantra tejaḥ saḥ juṃ om
translated: That also dissolves in the sequence of withdrawal into the bindu, the bindu into the nada, the nada into the shakti, and the shakti into the ardha-chandra, which is united with the nirodhini through the yoga of tranquility, and dissolves into the all-pervading

original: svātmanyatpayāmi namaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ
translated: self-nature. Having visualized the all-pervading consciousness-form in the sequence of mantra dissolution, the supreme mantra radiance ॐ जुं सः, I merge it into my own self. Salutations.

original: iti bhogadvādaśāntena gṛhītvā pūrakena hṛtsthaṃ kṛtvā yathā vandana sā tatra pūjayediti guravaḥ //
analyzed: iti bhoga dvādaśāntena gṛhītvā pūrakena hṛd stham kṛtvā yathā sā tatra pūjayet iti guravaḥ
translated: Thus, having received it with the enjoyment up to the end of the twelve, and placing it in the heart with the filling breath, the teachers say that one should worship there as in the salutation.

original: atha melāpa vidyāṃ triḥ paṭhet //
analyzed: atha melāpa vidyām tris paṭhet
translated: Then, one should recite the vidya of union three times.

original: oṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ saḥ saḥ sukhasaubhāgyadāyini haṃsa vāgīśvari🔽p /
analyzed: om   śrīṃ saḥ saḥ sukha saubhāgya dāyini haṃsa vāgīśvari  p
translated: ॐ ह्रीं श्रीं सः सः, O giver of happiness and good fortune, O goddess of speech in the form of a swan,

original: ehye hi hama sannidhānaṃ kuru sarvasampatpradāyini sarvaduṣṭa nivāraṇi sarvajagadvasīkartri vibhaktānāṃ
analyzed: ehye hi hama sannidhānam kuru sarva sampad pradāyini sarva duṣṭa nivāraṇi sarva jagat vasīkartri vibhaktānām
translated: come, come, O Ham, make your presence here, O giver of all wealth, O repeller of all evil, O maker of all the world subject,

original: mantrāṇāṃ melāpaṃ kuru prasādo bhavatu me hrīṃ śrīṃ saḥ saḥ hūṃ hūṃ //
analyzed: mantrāṇām melāpam kuru prasādaḥ bhavatu me hrīṃ śrīṃ saḥ saḥ hūm hūm
translated: unite the divided mantras for me, be gracious to me, Hrim Shrim S S Hum Hum.

original: atha kṣamāmantraḥ //
analyzed: atha kṣamā mantraḥ
translated: Now, the mantra of forgiveness.

original: oṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ śrīṃ strīṃ prīṃ jyaṃ parameśvaraṣaḍrasādhipate sarva samayaśuddhāmṛtaveśana
analyzed: om hrīṃ śrīṃ śrīṃ strīṃ prīṃ jyaṃ parameśvara ṣaṣ rasa adhipate sarva samaya śuddha amṛta veśana
translated: Om Hrim Shrim Shrim Srim Plim Jyam Parama Ishvara Shadra Rasa Adhipate Sarva Samaya Shuddha Amrita Veshana

original: praviṣṭāṃ vahasannidhānaṃ kuru kāyika vācika mānasapāpaṃ śoṣaya hṛdaya sphītimutpādaya hṛdaya
analyzed: praviṣṭām vaha sannidhānam kuru kāyika vācika mānasa pāpam śoṣaya hṛdaya sphītim utpādaya hṛdaya
translated: Enter, be present in the body, speech and mind, dry up the sins of body, speech and mind, produce swelling in the heart,

original: śuddhiṃ bhedaya surārcāvalepaṃ nivāraya maddehe tiṣṭha sthūlasūkṣmavahana saptapātāla nāgavāsine
analyzed: śuddhim bhedaya sura arcā avalepam nivāraya mad dehe tiṣṭha sthūla sūkṣma vahana sapta pātāla nāga vāsine
translated: pierce the heart with purity, ward off the attachment to the worship of gods, remain in my body, O bearer of the gross and subtle, to the serpent-dweller of the seven netherworlds,

original: hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā //
analyzed: hūm hūm phaṭ svāhā
translated: Hum Hum Phat Svaha.

original: uttiṣṭhottiṣṭha deveśatvaṃ maṇḍalasuraiḥ saha // rakṣāsmān pūrvato nityaṃ dhṛtāstatpuruṣābhidhāḥ //
analyzed: uttiṣṭha uttiṣṭha deva īśa tvam maṇḍala suraiḥ saha rakṣa asmān pūrvatas nityam dhṛtāḥ tatpuruṣa abhidhāḥ
translated: Rise, rise, O Lord of gods, with the gods of the mandala, always protect us from the east, those known as Tatpurusha,

original: tathā dakṣiṇato rakṣa devadevosi śaṅkaraḥ // varuṇāśāgato nityaṃ sadyo jāto sirakṣamām //
analyzed: tathā dakṣiṇatas rakṣa śaṅkaraḥ  varuṇa āśā gataḥ nityam sadyas sira kṣamām
translated: Similarly, protect from the south, you are Shankara, the god of gods, always present in the west, born instantly, protect from the north.

original: ūrdhvaṃ rakṣa maheśānatvamīśānosi devatā // sarvathā sarvadā deva sarvatrāsmin bhavādhvani //
analyzed: ūrdhvam rakṣa maheśāna tvam īśānaḥ asi devatā sarvathā sarvadā deva sarvatra asmin bhava adhvani
translated: Protect from above, O Maheshana, you are Ishana, the deity, in every way, at all times, O god, in this entire path of existence,

original: pāhimāṃ yā hi deveśa nityānandamayaṃ padam //
analyzed: pāhi imām yā hi deveśa nitya ānanda mayam padam
translated: Protect me, O Lord of gods, the state full of eternal bliss.

original: brahmādi stotraṃ paṭhitvā mantrakalaśodakena vā'rghya pātrodakena yajamānaṃ saparivāraṃ snapayet //
analyzed: brahma ādi stotram paṭhitvā mantra kalaśa udakena vā arghya pātra udakena yajamānam sa parivāram snapayet
translated: Having recited the hymn of praise to Brahma and others, he should bathe the sacrificer along with his attendants with the water from the mantra-filled pot or the water from the arghya vessel.

original: surāstvābhiṣiñcantu brahmaviṣṇumaheśvarāḥ // vāsudevo jagannāthastathā saṅkarṣaṇaḥ prabhuḥ //
analyzed: surāḥ tvā abhiṣiñcantu brahma viṣṇu maheśvarāḥ vāsudevaḥ jagannāthaḥ tathā saṅkarṣaṇaḥ prabhuḥ
translated: May the gods Brahma, Vishnu, and Maheshvara consecrate you. May Vasudeva, the lord of the world, and the powerful Sankarshana,

original: pradyumnaścāniruddhaśca bhavantu jayāyate // ākhaṇḍalognirbhagavānyamo vai nairṛtastathā //
analyzed: pradyumnaḥ ca aniruddhaḥ ca bhavantu jayāyate ākhaṇḍala ugniḥ bhagavān yamaḥ vai nairṛtaḥ tathā
translated: May Pradyumna and Aniruddha be for your victory. May Indra, Agni, the illustrious Yama, and Nairrita,

original: varuṇaḥ pavanaśca vadhanādhikṣastathā śivaḥ //🔽p /
analyzed: varuṇaḥ pavanaḥ ca vadhanādhikṣaḥ tathā śivaḥ  p
translated: May Varuna, Pavana, the lord of wealth, and Shiva,

original: brahmaṇā sahitaśśeṣo dikpālāḥ santute sadā //
analyzed: brahmaṇā sahitaḥ śeṣaḥ dikpālāḥ santu te sadā
translated: May Sesha along with Brahma, and the guardians of the directions always be with you.

original: kīrtirlakṣmīrvṛtirmedhā puṣṭiḥ śraddhākṣamāmatiḥ / buddhirlajāvapuḥ śāntiḥ stutiḥ kāntiśca🔽mātaraḥ //
analyzed: kīrtiḥ lakṣmīḥ vṛtiḥ medhā puṣṭiḥ śraddhā kṣamā matiḥ buddhiḥ lajā vapuḥ śāntiḥ stutiḥ kāntiḥ ca  mātaraḥ
translated: May fame, fortune, memory, intelligence, nourishment, faith, forbearance, understanding, modesty, body, peace, praise, and radiance,

original: etāstvāmabhiṣiñcantu dharmapatnyāḥ samāgatāḥ // ādityaścandrabhomābhaumo budhajīvasitārkajāḥ //
analyzed: etāḥ tvām abhiṣiñcantu dharmapatnyāḥ samāgatāḥ ādityaḥ candra bhoma ābhaumaḥ budha jīva sita arka jāḥ
translated: The mothers who have assembled as the wives of Dharma, consecrate you. May the planets born from the sun, moon, Mars, Mercury, Jupiter, Venus, and Saturn,

original: grahāstvāmabhiṣiñcantu rāhuḥ ketuśca tarpitaḥ / devadānavagandharvā yakṣarākṣasapannagāḥ //
analyzed: grahāḥ tvām abhiṣiñcantu rāhuḥ ketuḥ ca tarpitaḥ deva dānava gandharvāḥ yakṣa rākṣasa pannagāḥ
translated: May Rahu and Ketu, when satisfied, consecrate you. May the gods, demons, gandharvas, yakshas, rakshasas, and serpents,

original: ṛṣayo munayogāvo devamātara eva ca // deva patnyo dhrūvānāgā daityāścāpsarasāṃ gaṇāḥ //
analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ munayaḥ gāvaḥ deva mātaraḥ eva ca deva patnyaḥ dhrūvā nāgāḥ daityāḥ ca apsarasām gaṇāḥ
translated: The sages, the ascetics, the mothers of the gods, the wives of the gods, the Dhruvas, the Nagas, the Daityas, the groups of celestial nymphs,🔽The weapons, all the implements, the kings, the vehicles,

original: astrāṇi sarvaśastrāṇi rājāno vāhanāni ca // auṣadhāni ca ratnāni kailāsaḥ vāyavāścaye //
analyzed: astrāṇi sarva śastrāṇi rājānaḥ vāhanāni ca auṣadhāni ca ratnāni kailāsaḥ vāyavāścaye
translated: The medicines, the jewels, the Kailasa mountain, the winds,

original: saritaḥ śāgarāḥ śailāstīrthāni jaladāni ca // etāstvāmabhiṣiñcantu sarvakāmārtha siddhaye //
analyzed: saritaḥ śāgarāḥ śailāḥ tīrthāni jaladāni ca etāḥ tvām abhiṣiñcantu sarva kāma artha siddhaye
translated: The rivers, the oceans, the mountains, the holy places, and the clouds, may these consecrate you for the accomplishment of all desires.

original: mantrārthāḥ saphalāssantu pūrṇāssantu manorathāḥ // śatrūṇāṃ buddhi nāśostu mittrāṇāmudasbhuyo stume
analyzed: mantra arthāḥ saphalāḥ santu pūrṇāḥ santu manorathāḥ  śatrūṇām buddhi nāśoḥ tu mittrāṇām udasbhuyoḥ stume
translated: May the meanings of the mantras be fruitful, may the wishes be fulfilled, may the intellect of the enemies be destroyed, and may there be prosperity for the friends.

original: iti laghuparipāṭyā agnikāryā samaptā // savat śrāśuti dvitīyasyāṃ gurau //
analyzed: iti laghu paripāṭyā agni kāryā samaptā dvitīyasyām gurau
translated: Thus ends the fire ritual in a concise manner. On the second day, in the teacher's house.

original: oṃ athātaḥ saṃpravakṣyāmi paśulakṣaṇamuttamam / uttamau sitakṛṣṇau ca madhyamau citrapāṇḍurau //
analyzed: om atha atas saṃpravakṣyāmi paśu lakṣaṇam uttamam uttamau sita kṛṣṇau ca madhyamau citra pāṇḍurau
translated: Om. Now I shall explain the excellent characteristics of animals. The best are white and black, the middling are variegated and pale,

original: lohitaḥ kapilaścaiva kaniṣṭhaḥ parikīrtitaḥ / kṛṣṇavarṇo baliḥ pucchaḥ śvetavarṇo yadā bhavet //
analyzed: lohitaḥ kapilaḥ ca eva kaniṣṭhaḥ parikīrtitaḥ kṛṣṇa varṇaḥ baliḥ pucchaḥ śveta varṇaḥ yadā bhavet
translated: The reddish and tawny are declared to be the lowest. If the tail of the sacrificial animal is black in color and becomes white,

original: tādṛśaṃ cchāgalaṃ dṛṣṭvā dūrataḥ parivarjayet / evaṃ sitaṃ kṛṣṇapucchaṃ matimānvarjayet sadā //
analyzed: tādṛśam chāgalam dṛṣṭvā dūratas parivarjayet evam sitam kṛṣṇa puccham matimān varjayet sadā
translated: Seeing such a goat, one should avoid it from a distance. Similarly, the wise one should always avoid the one with a white body and a black tail.

original: jalābhilāṣī nṛpatirnṛpaśuṃ parikalpayet / sarvalakṣaṇasaṃpūrṇaṃ sundaraṃ paśumarpayet //🔽vayovṛddhaṃ vṛhatkarṇaṃ sarvāṅgaparipūritam / puṣṭyarthaṃ chāgalaṃ deyaṃ śāntyarthaṃ meṣameva ca //
analyzed: jala abhilāṣī nṛpatiḥ nṛ paśum parikalpayet sarva lakṣaṇa saṃpūrṇam sundaram paśum arpayet  vayaḥ vṛddham vṛhat karṇam sarva aṅga paripūritam puṣṭi artham chāgalam deyam śānti artham meṣam eva ca
translated: A king who desires water should consider an animal as a sacrificial animal. One should offer an animal that is complete in all characteristics and beautiful.🔽For nourishment, a goat should be given, and for peace, a ram.

original: hīnāṅgamadhikāṅgaṃ ca kṛṣaṃ bālaṃ vivarjayet / aṅgahīne ca dāridryamadhike śatrūvardhanam //🔽kṛṣe ca vyādhipīḍā syādbāle balau balaṃ haret / śvetapuccho hareddravyaṃ kṛṣṇapuccho haret prajāḥ //
analyzed: hīna aṅgam adhika aṅgam ca kṛṣam bālam vivarjayet aṅga hīne ca dāridryam adhike śatru vardhanam  kṛṣe ca vyādhi pīḍā syāt bāle balau balam haret  śveta pucchaḥ haret dravyam kṛṣṇa pucchaḥ haret prajāḥ
translated: One should avoid an animal that is deficient in limbs, has extra limbs, is emaciated, or is a child. In the case of a deficient limb, there is poverty, and in the case of an extra limb, there is an increase in enemies.🔽In the case of emaciation, there is affliction by disease, and in the case of a child, it would take away strength. One with a white tail would take away wealth, and one with a black tail would take away offspring.

original: śṛṅgahīnoharedbandhuṃ karṇahīno śriyaṃ haret / netra hīno haredāyurvyādhito duḥkhadaurbalāt //
analyzed: śṛṅga hīnaḥ haret bandhum śriyam haret  netra hīnaḥ haret āyuḥ vyādhitaḥ duḥkha daurbalāt
translated: One without horns would take away relatives, and one without ears would take away prosperity. One without eyes would take away life, and one that is sick would take away happiness and weakness.

original: tasmādvicārya yatnena paśurgrāhyaḥ sureśvari / brāhmī mantraṃ nyaset pūrvaṃ karṇamūle ca dakṣiṇe //
analyzed: tasmāt vicārya yatnena paśuḥ grāhyaḥ sureśvari brāhmī mantram nyaset pūrvam karṇa mūle ca dakṣiṇe
translated: Therefore, O Goddess of gods, an animal should be taken after careful consideration. First, one should place the mantra of Brahma at the root of the right ear.

original: pañcopacārapūjāṃ tu maṇḍalāgre tu kārayet /
analyzed: pañca upacāra pūjām tu maṇḍala agre tu kārayet
translated: The five-fold worship should be performed in front of the mandala.

original: īśvaraḥ //
analyzed: īśvaraḥ
translated: The Lord

original: ajā vikairbaligaṇairarcayedvīramuttamam / baliṃ datvā tu vidhivatprāpyate siddhimuttamām //
analyzed: ajā vikaiḥ bali gaṇaiḥ arcayet vīram uttamam balim da tvā tu vidhivat prāpyate siddhim uttamām
translated: The best hero should be worshipped with the offerings of goats, buffaloes, and groups of oblations. Having offered the oblation according to the rules, the supreme accomplishment is attained.

original: arghaiḥ kusumasindhurairarcayedbalimuttamām / prāṇaṃ ca dāpayed devi balimajamaviṃ tathā //
analyzed: arghaiḥ kusuma sindhuraiḥ arcayet balim uttamām prāṇam ca dāpayet devi balim ajam avim tathā
translated: One should worship the excellent oblation with the ocean of flowers and offerings. O Goddess, one should offer one's life, and also the goat and buffalo as oblations.

original: na strī śaṇṭhairbalirdeyo datvā vighnamavāpnuyāt / siddhimāpnoti manujaḥ sadyodhūnanato baleḥ //
analyzed: na strī śaṇṭhaiḥ baliḥ deyaḥ da tvā vighnam avāpnuyāt siddhim āpnoti manujaḥ sadyas dhūnanataḥ baleḥ
translated: The oblation should not be offered by women or Śūdras. Having offered, one would get obstacles. A man attains accomplishment immediately by shaking the oblation.

original: bhūmau tiṣṭhanvighna cayaṃ śirodhūnanatopi ca / tasmāt sarvaprayatnena vidhinā balimarcayet //
analyzed: bhūmau tiṣṭhan vighna cayam śiraḥ dhūnana taḥ api ca tasmāt sarva prayatnena vidhinā balim arcayet
translated: By standing on the ground and shaking the head, one accumulates obstacles. Therefore, one should worship the oblation with all efforts according to the rules.

original: mantrayet paśumantreṇa veda tantrodbhavena ca / rudraḥ khunteti mantreṇa yaḥ paśuṃ cārpayet sadā //
analyzed: mantrayet paśu mantreṇa veda tantra udbhavena ca  rudraḥ khunta iti mantreṇa yaḥ paśum ca arpayet sadā
translated: One should consecrate the animal with the mantra of the animal, and with the mantra arising from the Vedas and Tantras. One who always offers the animal with the mantra Rudra kṣamā

original: saḥ paśuḥ svargamāpnoti yaḥ paśuṃ cārpayet sadā //
analyzed: saḥ paśuḥ svargam āpnoti yaḥ paśum ca arpayet sadā
translated: That animal always attains heaven, and one who always offers the animal

original: sapaśuḥ svargamāpnoti🔽p /
analyzed: sa paśuḥ svargam āpnoti  p
translated: The animal with the sacrificer attains heaven.

original: oṃ kalaśamaṇḍalasthaṃ bhagavantaṃ kṣamāpayet / ya ekaḥ sarvaviddevaḥ sākṣī viśvasya karmaṇaḥ //
analyzed: om kalaśa maṇḍala stham bhagavantam kṣamāpayet yaḥ ekaḥ sarva vid devaḥ sākṣī viśvasya karmaṇaḥ
translated: Om. One should request forgiveness from the Lord residing in the pot and mandala, who is the one omniscient God, the witness of the world's actions.

original: brahmādyairapya gamyoyasmamayā pūjito dhvare / sakalo niṣkalo devo dvādaśānta padaṃ sthitaḥ //
analyzed: brahma ādyaiḥ api pūjitaḥ dhvare sakalaḥ niṣkalaḥ devaḥ dvādaśānta padam sthitaḥ
translated: He who is not to be attained even by Brahma and others, who is worshipped in the sacrificial altar, the complete and incomplete god, resides in the state beyond the twelve.

original: sa devo bhagavāñśambhuḥ kheditosmin kriyā vidhau / ya eva sṛṣṭi saṃrakṣā saṃhārakaraṇa kṣamaḥ //
analyzed: sa devaḥ bhagavān śambhuḥ kheditaḥ asmin kriyā vidhau yaḥ eva sṛṣṭi saṃrakṣā saṃhāra karaṇa kṣamaḥ
translated: That god, Lord Shambhu, is tired in this ritual, who is capable of creation, protection and dissolution.

original: trirūpastriguṇaśśambhussamayā pūjito dhvare / ye neva devadevena nirguṇenātmarūpiṇā //
analyzed: tri rūpaḥ triguṇaḥ śambhuḥ samayā pūjitaḥ dhvare ye nā iva devadevena nirguṇena ātma rūpiṇā
translated: Shambhu, of three forms and three qualities, is worshipped in the sacrificial altar by the one who is not the god of gods, who is of the nature of the formless self.

original: sāśaktistrīvidho pāttā samayā pūjito dhvare / asya me saphalaṃ janma adya me saphalāḥ kriyāḥ //
analyzed: sa aśakti strīvidhaḥ samayā pūjitaḥ dhvare asya me sa phalam janma adya me sa phalāḥ kriyāḥ
translated: Endowed with power, of three kinds, attained, worshipped in the sacrificial altar. Today my birth is fruitful, today my actions are fruitful.

original: evaṃ prabhāvo yacchambhuḥ pūjitosminmayā dhvare / tvamevabhagavānsākṣādekaḥ saṃsāratārakaḥ //
analyzed: evam prabhāvaḥ yat śambhuḥ pūjitaḥ asmin mayā dhvare tvam eva bhagavān sākṣāt ekaḥ saṃsāra tārakaḥ
translated: Such is the Shambhu who is worshipped by me in this sacrificial altar. You alone are the Lord, the only one who liberates from worldly existence.

original: bhuktimukti pradaścaika eka evākhilāśrayaḥ / anāthamadyamāṃ devarakṣāsmātpāpasaṅkaṭāt //
analyzed: bhukti mukti pradaḥ ca ekaḥ ekaḥ eva akhila āśrayaḥ anātha madyamām deva rakṣā asmāt pāpa saṅkaṭāt
translated: You alone grant enjoyment and liberation, you alone are the support of all. O Lord, today I am helpless, protect me from this danger of sin.

original: siddhimṛddhiṃ tathā buddhiṃ śuddhiṃ mānasikīṃ mayi / dehi bhogaṃ ca mokṣaṃ ca manobhilaṣitaṃ dhrūvam //
analyzed: siddhim ṛddhim tathā buddhim śuddhim mānasikīm mayi dehi bhogam ca mokṣam ca manaḥ bhilaṣitam dhrūvam
translated: Give me success, prosperity, intellect, and mental purity, enjoyment and liberation, which is certainly desired by the mind.

original: sarvathātra maheśāna dehi siddhiṃ ca śāśvatīm / anāmaya padaṃ śambho dehi me parameśvara //
analyzed: sarvathā atra maheśāna dehi siddhim ca śāśvatīm anāmaya padam śambho dehi me parameśvara
translated: O Maheshvara, grant me eternal perfection in every way. O Shambhu, O supreme Lord, give me the state free from disease.

original: idānīṃ parameśāna kṣamyatāṃ kṣamyatāṃ prabho / āyāsitosi yajñesmiṃstuṣṭo yā hi svakaṃ padam //
analyzed: idānīm parameśāna kṣamyatām kṣamyatām prabho yajñe smin tuṣṭaḥ yā hi svakam padam
translated: Now, O supreme Lord, please forgive, forgive, O Lord. You have been fatigued in this sacrifice, but being satisfied, go to Your own abode.

original: sarvadā sarvathā śambho sarvasmiñjanmakarmaṇi / yasyāsti śāśvatī bhaktiḥ sa naro muktibhāgbhavet //
analyzed: sarvadā sarvathā śambho sarvasmin janma karmaṇi yasya asti śāśvatī bhaktiḥ sa naraḥ mukti bhāj bhavet
translated: O Shambhu, a person who always has eternal devotion towards You in all births and actions, he will attain liberation.

original: yatpūrvajanmani mayāvarta māne ca janmani / pāpaṃ kṛtaṃ karomyatra tasmāttāḥ yame prabho //🔽saṃsārasāgarāntasthaṃ komāmuddhartu marhati / nṛte madvacanasyāsya karṇadhārācchivātprabho //
analyzed: yat pūrva janmani mayā āvarta māne ca janmani pāpam kṛtam karomi atra tasmāt tāḥ yame prabho  saṃsāra sāgara antastham komām uddhartu marhati mad vacanasya asya karṇadhārāt śivāt prabho
translated: O Lord, whatever sins I have committed in my previous birth, in this birth, or will commit in the future, I seek refuge in You.🔽Who else but You, O Lord, can deliver me from the ocean of worldly existence, except the stream of my own words, O Lord?

original: aghoraghorasaṃsāra /rāpaharaṇodyataḥ / paramānandadātāsau bhūyājjanmani janmani //
translated: May He, who is ready to remove the terrible worldly existence, the giver of supreme bliss, be present in every birth.

original: athavā janmaśaṅkāpi na me śiva prasādataḥ / dīkṣānirdagdha pāśasya bandhanaṃ me kutaḥ prabho //🔽sc
analyzed: athavā janma śaṅkā api na me śiva prasādataḥ dīkṣā nirdagdha pāśasya bandhanam me kutas prabho 🔽sc
translated: Or, O Shiva, due to Your grace, I do not even suspect rebirth. O Lord, how can there be bondage for me whose fetters have been burnt by initiation?

original: saṃsārayantra paratantritavāsanohaṃ mantraṃ srayetavavibho śaraṇaṃ sa tantram / buddhirna me vividha
analyzed: mantram sa tantram
translated: I, whose desires are controlled by the machine of worldly existence, take refuge in the mantra, O Lord, which is the means to liberation. My intellect is not able to understand the various means.

original: śāstravibodhasārā tattatsukarmakaraṇena manaḥ prasādi / iti devaṃ kṣamāpya / gaṇeśvarādīṃśca visarjayet
analyzed: śāstra vibodha sārā tad tad su karma karaṇena manaḥ prasādi iti devam kṣamāpya gaṇeśvara ādīn ca visarjayet
translated: I, whose desires are controlled by the machine of worldly existence, take refuge in the mantra, O Lord, which is the means to liberation. My intellect is not enlightened by the essence of various scriptures. My mind is pleased by performing various good deeds. Having thus apologized to the god and Ganesha and others, one should bid them farewell.

original: yathā / gaṇeśādyā smṛtāyetra dvārapālana karmaṇi / indrādyā lokapālāśca hyādityādvā navagrahāḥ /
analyzed: yathā dvāra pālana karmaṇi indra ādyāḥ lokapālāḥ ca hi ādityāt vā nava grahāḥ
translated: As it is said: Ganesha and others are remembered here for the task of guarding the door. Indra and other Lokapalas, and the nine planets starting from the sun,
