original: kapāleśādayo ye ca bhairavā bhairavyāśritāḥ //
analyzed: kapāla īśa ādayaḥ ye ca bhairavāḥ bhairavī āśritāḥ
translated: And those Bhairavas who are dependent on Bhairavi, starting with Kapalesha,

original: saptāvaraṇa mantrāśca tathā vaktrādi devatāḥ / vaṭukādyā herukādyāḥ kṣetrapālāśca śāsvatāḥ //
analyzed: sapta āvaraṇa mantrāḥ ca tathā vaktra ādi devatāḥ vaṭuka ādyāḥ heruka ādyāḥ kṣetrapālāḥ ca śāsvatāḥ
translated: The mantras of the seven coverings, and the deities of the face and other parts, the eternal Kshetrapala deities starting with Vatuka and Heruka,

original: te sarve vividhānbhogāndatvāyāntu svakaṃ padam / gaṇeśvara mahācaṇḍa vighnaugha dhvaṃsa kāraka //
analyzed: te sarve vividhān bhogān datvā āyāntu svakam padam
translated: May they all give various enjoyments and return to their own places. O Ganesha, the great fierce one, the destroyer of the multitude of obstacles,

original: pūjāṃ gṛhāṇa me deva gaṇavaktra namostute / ṣaḍānanasya sarvasya priya mudrāmarārcita //
analyzed: pūjām gṛhāṇa me deva gaṇa vaktra namaḥ stute  ṣaḍānanasya sarvasya priya mudrā amara arcita
translated: O god, accept my worship, O one with the face of the Ganas, salutations to you. O beloved of the six-faced one, worshipped by the immortal gods with gestures,

original: pūjāṃ gṛhāṇa me deva kārtikeya namostute / mātarlakṣmī trilokeśi khyātāmala svarūpiṇi //🔽pūjāṃ gṛhāṇa me devi siddhiṃ dehi sanātanam / bhagavandeva rājatvaṃ mayāsaṃ khedito makhe //🔽pūjāṃ gṛhāṇa deveśa kṣamyatāṃ kṣamyatāṃ prabho / bhagavanbhagavanvahne tvaṃ mayā khedito makhe //
analyzed: pūjām gṛhāṇa me deva kārtikeya namaḥ stute mātar lakṣmī triloka īśi khyāta amala svarūpiṇi  pūjām gṛhāṇa me devi siddhim dehi sanātanam bhagavan deva rāja tvam mayā āsam kheditaḥ makhe  pūjām gṛhāṇa deveśa kṣamyatām kṣamyatām prabho bhagavan bhagavan vahne tvam mayā kheditaḥ makhe
translated: O God, accept my worship, O Kartikeya, salutations to you. O Mother Lakshmi, the ruler of the three worlds, renowned, pure, and of stainless form,🔽Accept my worship, O Goddess, grant me eternal success. O Lord, I have troubled you in the sacrifice.🔽Accept the worship, O Lord of gods, forgive, forgive, O Lord. O Blessed One, O God of fire, you have been troubled by me in the sacrifice.

original: pūjāṃ gṛhāṇa deveśa kṣamyatāṃ prabho bhagavandharmarājatvaṃ mayā saṃkhedito makhe // śiva pūjāṃ🔽gṛhāṇatvaṃ kṣamyatāṃ prabho bhagavannirṛte rakṣa ghorātsaṃsārasāgarāt // saṃkheditosi samaye yā hi🔽dhāmasvakaṃ prabho bhagavanvaruṇādyatvaṃ yajñe śrī śivadaivate //
analyzed: pūjām gṛhāṇa deveśa kṣamyatām prabho bhagavan dharmarāja tvam mayā saṃkheditaḥ makhe śiva pūjām  gṛhāṇa tvam kṣamyatām prabho bhagavan nirṛte rakṣa ghorāt saṃsāra sāgarāt saṃkheditaḥ asi samaye yā hi  dhāma svakam prabho bhagavan varuṇa ādya tvam yajñe śrī śiva daivate
translated: Accept the worship, O Lord of gods, forgive, O Lord. O Blessed One, O Yama, the king of righteousness, I have troubled you in the sacrifice.🔽O Shiva, accept the worship, forgive, O Lord. O Blessed One, O Nirriti, protect me from the terrible ocean of worldly existence.🔽You have been troubled in the agreement, O Lord, to your own abode. O Blessed One, O Varuna, the lord of water, I have troubled you in the sacrifice.

original: kheditosi mayādeva yā hi svadhāma pāvanam / bhagavanbhagavanvāyo kheditaḥ śāmbhave makhe //
analyzed: kheditaḥ asi mayādeva yā hi sva dhāma pāvanam bhagavan bhagavan vāyo kheditaḥ śāmbhave makhe
translated: You have been troubled by me, O God, to your own purifying abode. O Blessed One, O Vayu, the wind god, you have been troubled in the Shambhava sacrifice.

original: tvaṃ mayārcāṃ gṛhītve māyā🔽sc
analyzed: tvam mayā arcām gṛhītvā e māyā 🔽sc
translated: Accept my worship, O Vayu, forgive, O Lord, to your own abode.

original: oṃ śrī gurubhyo namaḥ / oṃ namāmi satguruṃ śāntaṃ pratyakṣaṃ śivarūpiṇam / śirasāyogapīṭhasthaṃ
analyzed: om śrī gurubhyaḥ namaḥ om namāmi sat gurum śāntam pratyakṣam śiva rūpiṇam
translated: seated on the yogic seat of the head,

original: muktikāmārtha siddhaye //
analyzed: mukti kāma artha siddhaye
translated: for the sake of attaining liberation and the desired accomplishments.🔽We bow to the glorious guru, the embodiment of bliss, by whose mere presence, the supreme bliss of consciousness arises.

original: śrīguruṃ paramānandaṃ vandāmyānandavigraham // yasya sānnidhimātreṇa cidānandāyate param / ajñāna
translated: For one blinded by the darkness of ignorance,

original: timirāndhasya jñānāñjanaśalākayā //
analyzed: timira andhasya jñāna añjana śalākayā
translated: by the ointment of knowledge,🔽the eye is opened; to that glorious guru, I bow.

original: cakṣurunmīlitaṃ yena tasmai śrīgurave namaḥ // akhaṇḍamaṇḍalākāraṃ vyāptaṃ yena carācaram //
analyzed: cakṣuḥ unmīlitam yena tasmai śrī gurave namaḥ akhaṇḍa maṇḍala ākāram vyāptam yena carācaram
translated: The form of the unbroken orb, by which the moving and unmoving is pervaded,

original: tatpadaṃ darśitaṃ yena tasmai śrīgurave namaḥ // gurureva paromantro gurureva parāgatiḥ //
analyzed: tad padam darśitam yena tasmai śrī gurave namaḥ guruḥ eva paraḥ mantraḥ guruḥ eva parā gatiḥ
translated: by whom that state is shown; to that glorious guru, I bow. The guru alone is the supreme mantra, the guru alone is the supreme refuge,

original: gurureva parāṃ vidyāṃ nāstikiñcidguruṃ vinā / gururbrahmā gururviṣṇurguruḥ sākṣānmaheśvaraḥ //
analyzed: guruḥ eva parām vidyām na asti kiñcid gurum vinā guruḥ brahmā guruḥ viṣṇuḥ guruḥ sākṣāt maheśvaraḥ
translated: the guru alone is the supreme knowledge; nothing exists without the guru. The guru is Brahma, the guru is Vishnu, the guru is Maheshvara himself,

original: gurureva jagatsarvaṃ tasmai śrīgurave namaḥ / ajñāna duḥkhaśamanaṃ narakārṇa śoṣaṇam //
analyzed: guruḥ eva jagat sarvam tasmai śrī gurave namaḥ ajñāna duḥkha śamanam naraka arṇa śoṣaṇam
translated: the guru is the entire universe; to that glorious guru, I bow. The remover of the suffering of ignorance, the drying up of the ocean of hell,

original: muktidvārasya sopānaṃ tasmai śrī /
analyzed: mukti dvārasya sopānam tasmai śrī
translated: the staircase to the door of liberation; to that glorious guru, I bow.

original: gururdevi paro mantro gurureva parāgatiḥ / gurumabhyarcayennityaṃ yena devi prasīdati //
analyzed: guruḥ devi paraḥ mantraḥ guruḥ eva parā gatiḥ gurum abhyarcayet nityam yena devi prasīdati
translated: O Goddess, the Guru is the supreme Mantra, the Guru is the supreme goal. One should always worship the Guru, by whom, O Goddess, one becomes pleased.

original: namaste nātha bhagavañchivāya gururūpiṇe / vidyāvatārasaṃsiddhyai svīkṛtāneka vigraha //
analyzed: namaḥ te nātha bhagavan śivāya guru rūpiṇe vidyā avatāra saṃsiddhyai svīkṛta aneka vigraha
translated: Salutations to you, O Lord, O Blessed One, to Shiva in the form of the Guru, who has assumed many forms for the accomplishment of the descent of knowledge.

original: navāya navarūpāya paramārthaika rūpiṇe / sarvāñāna tamo bheda bhāvavecidghanāyate //
analyzed: navāya nava rūpāya paramārtha eka rūpiṇe
translated: To the new one, having nine forms, having the form of the supreme truth alone, to the one who is the mass of consciousness that destroys the darkness of ignorance.

original: svatantrāya dayātkḷptavigrahāya parātmane / paratantrāya bhaktānāṃ bhavyānāṃ bhavyarūpiṇe //
analyzed: svatantrāya dayāt kṷpta vigrahāya parātmane paratantrāya bhaktānām bhavyānām bhavya rūpiṇe
translated: To the independent one, whose form is established by compassion, to the supreme Self, to the one who is dependent on others, to the one who has an auspicious form for the fortunate devotees.

original: jñānināṃ jñānarūpāya prakāśāya prakāśinām / vivekināṃ vivekāya vimarśāya vimarśinām //
analyzed: jñāninām jñāna rūpāya prakāśāya prakāśinām vivekinām vivekāya vimarśāya vimarśinām
translated: To the one who is in the form of knowledge for the wise, to the light for the luminous ones, to the discernment for the discerning ones, to the reflection for the reflective ones.

original: purasthātpārśvayoḥ pṛṣṭhe namaskuryāmuparyadhaḥ / sadā saścittarūpeṇa vidhe hi bhavadāsanam //
analyzed: pura sthāt pārśvayoḥ pṛṣṭhe namaskuryām upari adhas sadā saḥ citta rūpeṇa vidhe hi bhavat āsanam
translated: I bow to you in front, on the sides, behind, above and below. Always meditate on you in the form of the mind, O Lord, I offer you my salutations.

original: oṃ śrī devyuvāca //
analyzed: om śrī devī uvāca
translated: Om. The Goddess said:

original: prāyaścitta vihīnasya phalaṃ bhogāya kevalam / sarvasākṣī mahādevo narakānarakā na sṛjatpurā /🔽sc
analyzed: prāyaścitta vihīnasya phalam bhogāya kevalam sarva sākṣī mahādevaḥ naraka anarakāḥ na sṛjat purā 🔽sc
translated: The fruit of one who is devoid of expiation is only for enjoyment. The great god who is the witness of all, does not create hells for those who are not hellish.

original: tasmātsarvaprayatnena prāyaścittamihaiva tu kṛtasya karmaṇaḥ kuryādanulopo bhavedyadi /
analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena prāyaścittam iha eva tu kṛtasya karmaṇaḥ kuryāt anulopaḥ bhavet yadi
translated: Therefore, with all effort, one should perform expiation here itself, if one has committed a sin.

original: pramādādi mahādoṣa pravilāpana kāraṇam / prāyaścittaṃ paraṃ satyaṃ śrī guroḥ pādukā smṛtiḥ //
analyzed: pramāda ādi mahā doṣa pravilāpana kāraṇam prāyaścittam param satyam śrī guroḥ pādukā smṛtiḥ
translated: The supreme expiation is the remembrance of the guru's sandals, which is the true cause for dispelling the great faults of negligence and so on.

original: tvayaivoktaṃ maheśāna kathaṃ smartavyamīśvara / vadame kṛpayā deva śrīguroḥ pādukā smṛtiḥ //
analyzed: tvayā eva uktam maheśāna katham smartavyam īśvara vadame kṛpayā deva śrī guroḥ pādukā smṛtiḥ
translated: O Mahesha, you have said - How should the Lord be remembered? Please tell me with compassion, O Lord, the remembrance of the guru's sandals.

original: oṃ śrī bhairava uvāca //
analyzed: om śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: Om. Shri Bhairava said:

original: śṛṇu devi pravakṣyāmi śrīguroḥ pādukāstutim / prāyaścitta vihīnānāṃ sarvapāpaharaṃ kalau //
analyzed: śṛṇu devi pravakṣyāmi śrī guroḥ pādukā stutim prāyaścitta vihīnānām sarva pāpa haram kalau
translated: Listen, O Goddess, I will tell you the praise of the guru's sandals, which removes all sins in the Kali Yuga of those devoid of expiation.

original: oṃ yasya śrīpādaraja sārañjate mastake śivaḥ / ramate saha pārvatyā tasya śrīpādukā stutiḥ //
analyzed: om yasya mastake śivaḥ ramate saha pārvatyā tasya śrī pādukā stutiḥ
translated: Om. On whose head Shiva, along with Parvati, delights in the essence of the dust of his feet, his praise of the sandals.

original: homohatamasākrāntamuddharatyandha kūpataḥ /
analyzed: homa ūha tamasā ākrāntam uddharati andha kūpataḥ
translated: The fire offering lifts one from the blind well overwhelmed by the darkness of ignorance.

original: kevalaṃ kṛpayā nātha tasya /
analyzed: kevalam kṛpayā nātha tasya śrī
translated: Only out of compassion, O Lord, of him

original: yasya trailokyamakhilaṃ saścidānanda lakṣaṇam // pūryate svaguṇaiḥ śaktyā tasya
analyzed: yasya trailokyam akhilam saḥ cit ānanda lakṣaṇam pūryate sva guṇaiḥ śaktyā tasya śrī
translated: Whose entire three worlds are filled with his own qualities, characterized by consciousness and bliss, by his Shakti.🔽Of him

original: yasya trailokyamakhilaṃ vaśītiṣṭhatya śeṣata /
analyzed: yasya trailokyam akhilam śeṣata
translated: Whose entire three worlds remain under control without exception,

original: svadṛṣṭipātamātreṇa tasya /
analyzed: sva dṛṣṭipāta mātreṇa tasya śrī
translated: By the mere glance of his own vision.

original: yasmai sarvasva mātmānamekī kṛtyāpi bhaktitaḥ /
analyzed: yasmai mā ātmānam ekī kṛtyā api bhaktitaḥ
translated: To whom, even by dedicating his entire self with devotion,

original: samarpayati tacchiṣyaḥ tasya /
analyzed: samarpayati tad śiṣyaḥ tasya śrī
translated: That disciple.

original: yamāśratyātma vijñānaṃ savide mṛgayā mahe /
analyzed: yam āśratya ātma vijñānam savide mṛgayā mahe
translated: Relying on whom, the great search for self-knowledge,

original: haitukairmūṣitaṃ doṣaistasya /🔽yasmin sṛṣṭi sthiti dhvaṃsa pidhānānugrahātmakam /
analyzed: haitukaiḥ mūṣitam doṣaiḥ tasya śrī  yasmin sṛṣṭi sthiti dhvaṃsa pidhāna anugraha ātmakam
translated: Is obstructed by the faults of logicians,🔽In whom, the five-fold activity consisting of creation, sustenance, destruction, concealment and grace,

original: prakāśate pañcakṛtyaṃ tasya /
analyzed: prakāśate pañcakṛtyam tasya śrī
translated: Shines forth, of him.

original: hṛdi mūle lalāṭe ca dvādaśānte parā śivaḥ /
analyzed: hṛdi mūle lalāṭe ca dvādaśānte parā śivaḥ
translated: In the heart, at the root, on the forehead, and at the end of the twelve, is the supreme Shiva.

original: yasyājñāṃ pālayannāste tasya /
analyzed: yasya ājñām pālayan āste tasya śrīḥ
translated: Whose command he obeys, of him.

original: ādyante dṛḍhabhedasya paśoḥ pāśavimocanam /
analyzed: ādi ante dṛḍhabhedasya paśoḥ pāśa vimocanam
translated: The liberation of the fettered one, who is firmly divided at the beginning and end, from the bonds,

original: yamāhuḥ śāmbhavī vācastasya //
analyzed: yam āhuḥ śāmbhavī vācaḥ tasya śrī
translated: They call it the speech of Shambhu, of him.

original: yasya pādatale sindhuḥ pādāgre kulapa hi dhāma svake cchayā /🔽sc 🔽bhagabandhanadādyatvaṃ kheditaḥ śāṅkare kṛtau / gṛhītvārcāṃ mayādattāṃ kṣamyatāṃ prabho //
analyzed: yasya pāda tale sindhuḥ pāda agre kulapa hi dhāma svake cchayā  / sc  bhaga bandhana da ādya tvam kheditaḥ śāṅkare kṛtau  gṛhītvā arcām mayā ādattām kṣamyatām prabho
translated: In whose foot is the ocean, at the tip of the foot is the abode, and in his own shadow,🔽The bondage of the Lord, the beginning of the gift, being afflicted in the creation of Shankara, having accepted the worship given by me, O Lord, be pleased.

original: bhagavandevadevatvamīśānārcāṃ svake makhe / gṛhītvā dehi me sarva puruṣārthaṃ prathā hi ca //
analyzed: bhagavan deva deva tvam īśāna arcām svake makhe gṛhītvā dehi me sarva puruṣa artham prathā hi ca
translated: O Lord, the god of gods, having accepted the worship of Ishana in your own sacrifice, give me all the human goals and fame.

original: bhagavaṃstri jagatpūjya sarvaloka pitāmaha / śaive dhvare kṛtārakṣā tvayā tatkṣamyatāṃ prabho //
analyzed: bhagavan tri jagat pūjya sarva loka pitāmaha śaive dhvare kṛta ārakṣā tvayā tat kṣamyatām prabho
translated: O Lord, worshipped by the three worlds, grandfather of all people, you have protected the Shaiva temple. O Lord, please forgive that.

original: bhagavanbhagavanviṣṇo kṛtadānavanāśana / śaive dhvare kṛtārakṣā tvayā tat kṣamyatāṃ prabho //
analyzed: bhagavan bhagavan viṣṇo kṛta dānava nāśana śaive dhvare kṛta ārakṣā tvayā tat kṣamyatām prabho
translated: O Lord, O Lord Vishnu, destroyer of the demons, you have protected the Shaiva temple. O Lord, please forgive that.

original: bhagavanto grahāḥ sarve yenye copagrahā matāḥ / grahṇīta pūjāṃ maddattāṃ tuṣṭāyāta svakaṃ padam //🔽kapāleśādya bhagavankheditaḥ śakra pūjita / śaive dhvare mayā tyarthaṃ bhairavendra namostute // //
analyzed: bhagavantaḥ grahāḥ sarve yena ye ca upagrahāḥ matāḥ grahṇīta pūjām mad dattām tuṣṭā āyāta svakam padam  kapāla īśa adya bhagavan kheditaḥ śakra pūjita śaive dhvare mayā tyartham bhairava indra namaḥ stute
translated: O Lords, all the planets and others considered as secondary planets, accept the worship offered by me. Being pleased, go to your own abode.🔽O Lord, beginning with Kapalesh, you have been worshipped by Shakra. In the Shaiva temple, O Bhairava, I have worshipped you for the sake of the sacrifice. Salutations to you, O Bhairava.

original: śāṅkaredya mayā yajñe bhagavañśikhi vāhana pūjitaḥ / kheditosi tvāṃ tuṣṭo yā hi svakaṃ padam // //
analyzed: śāṅkara idya mayā yajñe bhagavan śikhi vāhana pūjitaḥ kheditaḥ asi tvām tuṣṭaḥ yā hi svakam padam
translated: O Lord, O peacock-vehicled one, in the Shaiva sacrifice, you have been worshipped by me. Being pleased, go to your own abode.

original: bhagavankrodharājatvaṃ dharmarājaprapūjita / kṛtārakṣā makhe śaive yā hi svaṃ vimalaṃ padam // //
analyzed: bhagavan krodha rāja tvam dharmarāja prapūjita  kṛta ārakṣā makhe śaive yā hi svam vimalam padam
translated: O Lord, O King of Wrath, you have been worshipped by Dharmaraja. In the Shaiva sacrifice, I have offered protection. Go to your own pure abode.

original: bhagavanvikarālatvaṃ sadānirṛta pūjita / śaivīṃ pūjāṃ gṛhāṇatvaṃ yā hi svaṃ vimalaṃ padam // //
analyzed: bhagavan vikarāla tvam sadā nirṛta pūjita śaivīm pūjām gṛhāṇa tvam yā hi svam vimalam padam
translated: O Lord, O Vikarala, you have always been worshipped by Nirrita. Accept the Shaiva worship. Go to your own pure abode.

original: bhagavanmanmathe satvaṃ varuṇena kṛtārcana / kheditaḥ śivayajñesya kṣamyatāṃ prabho // //
analyzed: bhagavat manmathe sattvam varuṇena kṛta arcana kheditaḥ kṣamyatām prabho
translated: O Lord, your essence was in Manmatha, worshipped by Varuna. You were afflicted in this Shiva sacrifice. Please forgive, O Lord.

original: bhagavanmeghanādatvaṃ vāyunā pūjitānagha / śaive yajñe kheditastvaṃ kṣamyatāṃ prabho // //
analyzed: bhagavat megha nāda tvam vāyunā pūjitā anagha śaive yajñe kheditaḥ tvam kṣamyatām prabho
translated: O Lord, your essence was in Megha, worshipped by Vayu, O sinless one. You were afflicted in the Shiva sacrifice. Please forgive, O Lord.

original: bhagavansomarājādya kheditodanadārcita / śaive dhvare kṛtārakṣākṣamyatāṃ prabho // //
analyzed: bhagavan soma rāja adya khedita udanada arcita śaive dhvare kṛta ārakṣā kṣamyatām prabho
translated: O Lord, your essence was in Soma and others, worshipped by Indra. You were protected in the Shiva sacrifice. Please forgive, O Lord.

original: vidyārājādya bhagavañśaivesmin makha karmaṇi / āyāsitosi devatvaṃ kṣamyatāṃ kṣamyatāṃ prabho // //
analyzed: vidyārāja adya bhagavan śaiva ismin makha karmaṇi āyāsitaḥ asi deva tvam kṣamyatām kṣamyatām prabho
translated: O Lord, your essence was in Vidyadhara and others in this Shiva sacrifice. You were afflicted, O God. Please forgive, O Lord.

original: saptāvaraṇake muṣminnanantādyāḥ sthitāścaye / te sarve pūjitāstuṣṭā yāntu śaivaṃ paraṃ padam //
analyzed: sapta āvaraṇake muṣmin ananta ādyāḥ sthitāḥ caye te sarve pūjitāḥ tuṣṭāḥ yāntu śaivam param padam
translated: In this seven-layered sacrifice, those who are established beginning with Ananta, all of them are worshipped and satisfied. May they go to the supreme state of Shiva.

original: ityāvaraṇakṣamā puṣpāṇi /
analyzed: iti āvaraṇa kṣamā puṣpāṇi
translated: Thus the forgiveness of the coverings is the flowers.

original: śambho śiva jagannātha bhagavan khedito mayā / tvaṃ devo devadevānāṃ tvameva paramāgatiḥ //
analyzed: śambho śiva jagannātha bhagavan kheditaḥ mayā tvam devaḥ devadevānām tvam eva parama āgatiḥ
translated: O Shambhu, Shiva, Lord of the universe, O Lord, I have afflicted you. You are the God of the gods, you alone are the supreme refuge.

original: tvaṃ bhuktimuktikodātā kāraṇānāṃ ca kāraṇam / tvayi tuṣṭe surā tuṣṭāḥ sakalāḥ santi nityaśaḥ //
analyzed: tvam bhukti mukti kodātā kāraṇānām ca kāraṇam tvayi tuṣṭe surā tuṣṭāḥ sakalāḥ santi nityaśas
translated: You are the giver of enjoyment and liberation, the cause of causes. When you are pleased, all the gods are always satisfied.

original: bhavatprasādato deva yajñoyaṃ śiva daivataḥ / ṣadudhvadīkṣā saṃjñāśca sampannaḥ śiṣya hetukaḥ //
analyzed: bhavat prasādataḥ deva yajñaḥ yam śiva daivataḥ ṣadudhvadīkṣā saṃjñāḥ ca sampannaḥ śiṣya hetukaḥ
translated: O Lord, by your grace, this sacrifice, which is divine and auspicious, and which is named after the initiation of the six paths, has been accomplished for the sake of the disciples.

original: idānīṃ noparoddhavyaṃ gaccha deva svaviṣṭapam /
analyzed: idānīm na uparoddhavyam gaccha deva sva viṣṭapam
translated: Now it should not be obstructed. Go, O Lord, to your own abode.

original: agnerapi kṣamā puṣpāṇi /
analyzed: agneḥ api kṣamā puṣpāṇi
translated: Even for Agni, the flowers are forgiveness.

original: bhagavanbhagavanvahnetvaṃ surāṇāṃ mukhaṃ param / pratyakṣa devo bhūloke sarvakarma pratārakaḥ //
analyzed: bhagavan bhagavan vahne tvam surāṇām mukham param pratyakṣa devaḥ bhū loke sarva karma pratārakaḥ
translated: O Lord, O Lord of Fire, you are the supreme face of the gods, the directly perceptible god in the mortal world, the guide of all actions.

original: antarbahiśca lokānāṃ tvameva kṛta sannidhiḥ / tvayi tuṣṭe surāstuṣṭā ityāhussanakādayaḥ / kheditosi mayā
analyzed: antar bahis ca lokānām tvam eva kṛta sannidhiḥ tvayi tuṣṭe surāḥ tuṣṭāḥ iti āhuḥ sanaka ādayaḥ kheditaḥ asi mayā
translated: You alone are present within and without the worlds. Sanaka and others say that when you are pleased, the gods are pleased. You are tired by me

original: yajñe dīkṣākarmaṇi sāmpratam //
analyzed: yajñe dīkṣā karmaṇi sāmpratam
translated: in the initiation rite of the sacrifice at present.

original: dharmaṃ dānaṃ sutāṃścaiva datvāyā hi svakaṃ padam /
analyzed: dharmam dānam sutān ca eva da tvāyāḥ hi svakam padam
translated: Having given dharma, charity, and your own position, go to your own abode.

original: iti vahneḥ kṣamāpanam //
analyzed: iti vahneḥ kṣamāpanam
translated: Thus ends the forgiveness of Agni.

original: atha kalaśadvayotthāpana mantraḥ /
analyzed: atha kalaśa dvaya utthāpana mantraḥ
translated: Now the mantra for raising the two pitchers.

original: uttiṣṭha devadevaśa tvaṃ maṇḍala suraiḥ saha / rakṣāsmānpūrvato nityaṃ dhṛta tatpuruṣābhidhaḥ //
analyzed: uttiṣṭha deva devaśa tvam maṇḍala suraiḥ saha rakṣa asmān pūrvatas nityam dhṛta tatpuruṣa abhidhaḥ
translated: Rise up, O Lord of gods, along with the gods in the mandala. Always protect us from the east, you who are known as Tatpurusha.

original: tathā dakṣiṇato rakṣa dhṛtāghorātma bhairavaḥ / tathaivottarato rakṣa vāmadevosi śaṅkara //
analyzed: tathā dakṣiṇatas rakṣa dhṛta aghora ātma bhairavaḥ tathā eva uttaratas rakṣa vāmadevaḥ asi śaṅkara
translated: Similarly, protect from the south, you who are Aghora, the fearful Bhairava. In the same way, protect from the north, you are Vamadeva, O Shankara.

original: varuṇāśāgato nityaṃ sadyo jātāsirakṣamām / ūrdhvaṃ rakṣamaheśāna tvamīśānosi devatā //
analyzed: varuṇa āśā gataḥ nityam sadyas jāta asiḥ akṣamām ūrdhvam rakṣa maheśāna tvam īśānaḥ asi devatā
translated: O Lord, you are always present in the direction of Varuna, you are the protector of the newly born, you are the protector above, you are the Lord Isana, you are the deity.

original: sarvataḥ sarvathā deva sarvatrāsmin bhavādhvani / pāhimāṃ yā hi deveśa nityānandamayaṃ param //
analyzed: sarvatas sarvathā deva sarvatra asmin bhava adhvani pāhi imām yā hi deveśa nitya ānanda mayam param
translated: O God, in every way, in every manner, in this entire path of existence, protect me, O Lord of gods, who are the supreme bliss.

original: iti mantrakaśāstra kalajalaiḥ svātmānaṃ śiṣyaṃścābhiṣiñcet /🔽tataḥ śrī paramaśivaśakti pātasu kṛto palabdha śrīmadaghoramantra sā samāṃsaḥ śāka ucyate /
analyzed: iti sva ātmānam śiṣyan ca abhiṣiñcet  tatas sa māṃsaḥ śākaḥ ucyate
translated: Thus, with the water of the mantra scriptures, one should consecrate oneself and the disciple.

original: sc
analyzed: sc
translated: Then, the offering of oblations to the supreme Lord Shiva and Shakti, having obtained the auspicious mantra of Aghora, is said to be the vegetarian offering.

original: sādhakorcana sā dadyāt suprasannena cetasā / baliṃ saṅkalpya manasā yo varṣāntaṃ na dāsyati //
analyzed: sādhakā ūrcana sā dadyāt su prasannena cetasā balim saṅkalpya manasā yaḥ varṣa antam na dāsyati
translated: The practitioner should offer the oblation with a very pleased mind. If one, having mentally resolved, does not offer it till the end of the year,

original: tasya vighnakarā devāḥ paśunputrānharantite / tasmātsaṅkalpitaṃ dadyād devebhyo balimuttamām //
analyzed: tasya vighna karāḥ devāḥ paśūn putrān haranti te  tasmāt saṅkalpitam dadyāt devebhyaḥ balim uttamām
translated: the gods who cause obstacles will take away his cattle and sons. Therefore, one should offer the excellent oblation to the gods, having mentally resolved.

original: śīghrameva na dadyādvai vighnairantarito yadi / balidānādavāpnoti siddhimiṣṭāṃ ca satvaram //
analyzed: śīghram eva na dadyāt vai vighnaiḥ antaritaḥ yadi bali dānāt avāpnoti siddhim iṣṭām ca satvaram
translated: If one is interrupted by obstacles and cannot offer it quickly, by offering the oblation, one quickly attains the desired accomplishment.

original: tasmāt sarva prayatnena na vilambaṃ hi kārayet / saṅkalpita vilambāddhi prāpyate vighna sañcayam //
analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena na vilambam hi kārayet saṅkalpita vilambāt hi prāpyate vighna sañcayam
translated: Therefore, with all effort, one should not delay. By delaying what is intended, a multitude of obstacles is encountered.

original: jayaṃ siddhiṃ ca ṛddhiṃ ca śīghraṃ pūrvamukho baliḥ / dhūnanaṃ cenmahādevi tadā sarvaṃ vinirdiśet //
analyzed: jayam siddhim ca ṛddhim ca śīghram pūrva mukhaḥ baliḥ dhūnanam ced mahādevi tadā sarvam vinirdiśet
translated: If the offering is made facing east, it brings victory, success, and prosperity quickly. If there is shaking, O Great Goddess, then everything should be predicted.

original: aiśānyāṃ mantrasiddhisyādāgneyāṃ vijayastathā / dhūnanāśca baleryāsyāṃ mṛtyumantakamādiśet //🔽nairṛtyāṃ tu samaṃ jñeyaṃ vāruṇyāṃ vighnanāśanam / vāyavyāṃ dhanavṛddhiḥ syāduttarasyāṃ dhrūvo
analyzed: aiśānyām mantra siddhiḥ syāt āgneyām vijayaḥ tathā dhūnanāḥ ca baleḥ yā asyām mṛtyum antakam ādiśet  nairṛtyām tu samam jñeyam vāruṇyām vighna nāśanam vāyavyām dhana vṛddhiḥ syāt uttarasyām
translated: In the northeast, there is success in mantra; in the southeast, victory. If the offering shakes, one should predict death.

original: jayaḥ //
analyzed: jayaḥ
translated: In the southwest, it should be known as neutral; in the west, it destroys obstacles. In the northwest, there will be increase in wealth; in the north, victory is certain.

original: anyatrāpi tuṣṭāstu devatāḥ pūrve hyāgne ye bahumaṅgalam / dakṣiṇe mṛtyumāpnoti vāyāvuścāṭanaṃ bhavet
analyzed: anyatra api tuṣṭāḥ tu devatāḥ pūrve hi āgne ye bahu maṅgalam dakṣiṇe mṛtyum āpnoti vāyau uśca aṭanam bhavet
translated: If the deities are pleased elsewhere, in the east, there is much auspiciousness; in the southeast, one attains death; in the west, there will be expulsion.

original: kauvīryāṃ tu śriyo nityamaiśānyāṃ jñānameva ca / nairṛtye jñātimaraṇaṃ vāruṇe tu mahāphalam //
analyzed: kauvīryām tu śriyaḥ nityam aiśānyām jñānam eva ca nairṛtye jñāti maraṇam vāruṇe tu mahā phalam
translated: In the southwest, there is always prosperity; in the northeast, there is knowledge. In the southwest, there is death of a relative; in the west, there is great fruit.

original: evaṃ lakṣaṇamālakṣya paśucchedaṃ samārabhet / yāvanna kampate dehaṃ tāvannaivopa ghātayet //
analyzed: evam lakṣaṇam ālakṣya paśu chedam samārabhet yāvat na kampate deham tāvat na eva upa ghātayet
translated: Having observed these characteristics, one should begin the animal sacrifice. One should not strike as long as the body does not tremble.

original: paśuśca svargatiṃ yāti ghātīpāpaṃ na vindati / raktaṃ ca kṣetrapālebhyaḥ savyahastayutaṃ śiraḥ //
analyzed: paśuḥ ca svar gatim yāti ghātī pāpam na vindati raktam ca kṣetrapālebhyaḥ savya hasta yutam śiraḥ
translated: The animal goes to heaven and the killer does not incur sin. The blood and the head with the right hand should be offered to the Kshetrapālas.

original: iṣṭāya kalpayeddevi yaddhṛtkhaṇḍaṃ tu cakrake / hṛtpadmaṃ yoginībhyaśca datvā prītimavāpnuyāt //
analyzed: iṣṭāya kalpayet devi yat hṛd khaṇḍam tu cakrake hṛd padmam yoginībhyaḥ ca da tvā prītim avāpnuyāt
translated: O Goddess, one should dedicate the heart-piece to the desired one in the wheel. Having given the heart-lotus to the Yoginīs, one would attain delight.

original: baliṃ datvā tu devīśi yo vidhiṃ na samācaret / paśuhatyāmavāpnoti ceti satyena teśape //
analyzed: balim da tvā tu devī īśi yaḥ vidhim na samācaret paśu hatyām avāpnoti ca iti satyena teśape
translated: O Goddess, he who offers oblations but does not follow the prescribed procedure, would incur the sin of animal slaughter. This is the truth, I swear by it.

original: adatvā vighnasaṅghāśca prāpnuyāśca pade pade / paśuhatyāmapīśāni siddhindhāniṃ ca sundari //
analyzed: a datvā vighna saṅghāḥ ca prāpnuyāḥ ca pade pade paśu hatyām api īśāni siddhindhānim ca sundari
translated: Without offering, the groups of obstacles would obtain animal slaughter at every step, O Goddess, and the Siddhis would be destroyed, O beautiful one.

original: svārthe paśubadho hiṃsā yajñe paśuṃ vadho baliḥ / itthaṃ paśubadhaḥ prokto veda tantrānu śāsanam //🔽sc
analyzed: sva arthe paśu badhaḥ hiṃsā yajñe paśum vadhaḥ baliḥ ittham paśu badhaḥ proktaḥ veda tantra anu śāsanam  sc
translated: Animal slaughter for one's own sake is violence, but animal slaughter in a sacrifice is an offering. Thus, animal slaughter is spoken of in accordance with the Vedas and Tantras.

original: yajñārthaṃ paśavaḥ sṛṣṭā yajñārthaṃ paśughātanam / atastvāṃ ghātayiṣyāmi tasmādyajña vidho vadhaḥ
analyzed: yajña artham paśavaḥ sṛṣṭāḥ yajña artham paśu ghātanam atas tvām ghātayiṣyāmi tasmāt yajña vidho vadhaḥ
translated: Animals were created for sacrifices, animals are to be slaughtered for sacrifices. Therefore, I will kill you, O sacrifice, for the sake of the sacrificial rite.

original: hastā deva samucchidya yasya tadyoginī haret / tasya sarvatra siddhisyājjayaścaiva na saṃśayaḥ //
analyzed: hastāḥ deva samucchidya yasya tat yoginī haret tasya sarvatra siddhiḥ syāt jayaḥ ca eva na saṃśayaḥ
translated: If one's hand is cut off, the Yoginīs will take it away. For him, there will be success everywhere and victory, there is no doubt.

original: avaśiṣṭabaliṃ kuryuryoginyo vāsā api / sādhakasya maheśāni vighnasaṅghāḥ pade pade //
analyzed: avaśiṣṭa balim kuryuḥ yoginyaḥ vāsāḥ api sādhakasya maheśāni vighna saṅghāḥ pade pade
translated: The remaining oblations should be offered by the yoginis and the residents. O Mahesani, the groups of obstacles at every step of the adept,

original: vāyasā api deveśi śīghraṃ yadbalimāharet / tasyāpi sādhakasyāśujaya eva na saṃśayaḥ //
analyzed: vāyasāḥ api deveśi śīghram yat balim āharet tasya api sādhakasya āśu jayaḥ eva na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Even the crows, O Goddess of gods, should quickly bring the oblation. There is no doubt that even for that adept, victory is imminent.

original: asantarpya tu kṣettreśānyoginyabhyoya ādadet / baliṃ mahānimāpnoti sādhakaḥ śubhalakṣaṇe //
analyzed: a santarpya tu ādadet balim sādhakaḥ śubha lakṣaṇe
translated: O Goddess of auspicious characteristics, the adept who takes the oblation without satisfying the Kshetrapati and the yoginis, obtains great misfortune.

original: tasmātsarva prayatnena bhairavamarcayet sadā /
analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena bhairavam arcayet sadā
translated: Therefore, one should always worship Bhairava with all effort.

original: atha paśupahāralakṣ'nam /
analyzed: atha paśu upahāra lakṣnam
translated: Now, the characteristics of animal offerings.

original: upahāraṃ pravakṣyāmi vākyena surasundari / yajñe vivāha kāleṣu devyarcāyāṃ surārcane //
analyzed: upahāram pravakṣyāmi vākyena surasundari yajñe vivāha kāleṣu devī arcāyām sura arcane
translated: O beautiful goddess, I will explain the offerings by words, in sacrifices, at marriage times, in the worship of the Goddess and in the worship of the gods.

original: ajāvikamahiṣaśca vapuḥ saṃpūrito bhavet / karṇaṃ suparṇa śṛṅgīnāṃ hīnāṅgādi tuṣṭau /dim //
analyzed: ajāvika mahiṣaḥ ca vapuḥ saṃpūritaḥ bhavet karṇam suparṇa śṛṅgīnām hīna aṅga ādi tuṣṭaudim
translated: The goat, sheep and buffalo should be filled with flesh. The ears of the birds and horned animals, and the deficient limbs etc. should be offered in the worship.

original: gāyatryā cābhimantreṇa paṭhet karṇe tu dakṣiṇe / devatāgre paśuṃ prāpyāsnāpayet parito jalaiḥ //
analyzed: gāyatryā ca abhimantreṇa paṭhet karṇe tu dakṣiṇe devatā agre paśum prāpya āsnāpayet paritas jalaiḥ
translated: And with the Gayatri mantra, one should recite in the right ear. Having obtained the animal in front of the deity, one should bathe it with water all around.

original: anena tu vidhānena mucyate janmanaḥ paśuḥ / śubhaṃ vātra / śubhaṃ vāpi lakṣaṇaṃ tu parīkṣayet //
analyzed: anena tu vidhānena mucyate janmanaḥ paśuḥ śubham vā atra śubham vā api lakṣaṇam tu parīkṣayet
translated: By this method, the animal is freed from birth. One should examine the auspicious or inauspicious characteristics here.

original: śiraścāle svāmi bhayaṃ prārambhe tu yadā bhavet / niṣaddhe tu bhayaṃ vindyād deva doṣo bhaviṣyati //
analyzed: śiraḥ cāle svāmi bhayam prārambhe tu yadā bhavet niṣaddhe tu bhayam vindyāt deva doṣaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: If the head shakes at the beginning of the work, there is danger from the master. If it is forbidden, one should know there is danger, and there will be a fault of the deity.

original: mūrdhni vyādhisu / bāhulyaṃ kampite ca hyupaddhrūvam / mūtreṇa tvagni dāhaḥ syādviṣṭipāte dhanakṣayaḥ //
analyzed: mūrdhni bāhulyam kampite ca mūtreṇa tu agni dāhaḥ syāt viṣṭi pāte dhana kṣayaḥ
translated: If the head shakes frequently, there will be many diseases. If it trembles, there will be constant danger. If there is urine, there will be burning. If there is a fall, there will be loss of wealth.

original: paścādrāja kulāddhānijayastamagrato bhavet / vāhane nityaduḥkhāni bhrāmaṇe caḥ kulakṣaya / evaṃ cihnaṃ
analyzed: paścāt rāja kulāt hāni jayaḥ tam agratas bhavet vāhane nitya duḥkhāni bhrāmaṇe caḥ kula kṣayaḥ evam cihnam
translated: If there is victory from the rear of the royal family, it will be at the front. If there is riding, there will always be suffering. If there is whirling, there will be destruction of the family. Thus the signs

original: parīkṣyaṃ sulakṣaṇe lakṣaṇaṃ mahat //
analyzed: parīkṣyam su lakṣaṇe lakṣaṇam mahat
translated: should be examined. In a good sign, the sign is great.

original: na hīnaṃte na jātvaivaṃ devatāgre niyojayet / dātako ghātako bhogī tribhirvadyaṃ prakalpayet //
analyzed: na na jātvā evam devatā agre niyojayet dātakaḥ ghātakaḥ bhogī tribhiḥ vadyam prakalpayet
translated: One should never employ it in front of deities. The giver, the killer, and the enjoyer should be considered guilty of three things.

original: anaivedyaṃ na bhoktavyaṃ manarpitaṃ na ghātayet / deyaṃ sarvatra māṃsādi asurāsura kṣetrapān //
analyzed: anaivedyam na bhoktavyam na ghātayet deyam sarvatra māṃsa ādi asura asura kṣetrapān
translated: One should not eat what is not offered as food, nor should one kill what is not offered. Meat and other things should be given everywhere to the Asuras, Asuras, and Kshetrapans.

original: śirastu sarvadevānāmādī bhairava tarpaṇe / tvakṣeva gaṇanāthasya mahākālagaṇḍaram //
analyzed: śiraḥ tu sarva devānām ādī bhairava tarpaṇe tvakṣā iva gaṇanāthasya mahā kāla gaṇḍaram
translated: The head is the best of all gods in the offering to Bhairava. The skin is like the Ganapati, and the cheek is like Mahakalaganda.

original: antraivaikṣetrapālānāṃ kāla māṃsaṃ tukṣe carīm viṣṭirya
analyzed: kāla māṃsam tukṣe carīm
translated: The entrails are like the Kshetrapala, and the meat of Kala is like the Charri. The fall of the planet
